Although I didn’t watch the recap episodes so it is a little less than that, but it was a long a heartfelt journey that I did not expect to be graced with. Most sports anime these days last around twenty five or fifty episodes so if a show is this long it had better be good and for the most part Ace of the Diamond is. This show has some of the highest highs I have ever gotten in sports anime and I can honestly say I actually enjoy watching baseball now where before I found it tedious and dreary. It does a great job of teaching the viewer the necessary information and then slowly adding layers of complexity. Making you appreciate every good pitch and clutch fielding play. There is also an assortment of matches that don’t involve the main team and that leads to some truly nail biting moments as I couldn’t guess who was going to pull out on top in those games, even the main team isn’t safe! This unpredictability helps to raise the stakes and build tension where other sports shows can feel like they have a pre-determined outcome. One of the shows greatest strengths is in how it makes the opposing teams feel real, and that they are people working together even though there are some stars. I found myself rooting for the opposing team after hearing some of their backstories. It makes you appreciate that everyone is giving it their all and I felt heartbroken a few times when the main team won because I had gotten so invested in the other team. While this could be seen as a weakness, as it takes quite awhile for the main team to be fleshed out, I really enjoyed the ride and the second season does a great job of making up for lost time. Now the show isn’t perfect, and the time between games can really drag the show to a less than stellar pace. I found myself setting the show down a few times when I was following it week to week because of those slower sections. They do have some touching character moments and build up drama for the upcoming games, but it can sometimes feel more like an excuse to give the animators a break than intentional pacing. If you are unsure as to whether you want to dive into the show, the first two episodes do a great job of building up excitement so I would watch those two and make your judgement. I’m sure this show isn’t for everyone but as a sports anime aficionado myself I found Ace of the Diamond to be a long ride worth taking.

For a few years now, I've heard others talking about Ace of Diamond. I couldn't get over my bias towards sports anime and avoided watching it. Man was I ever wrong. What can I say about this anime? Not only is it one of the best shounen I have ever seen, but in actuality, it is one of the best anime I have ever seen.Not only is the main character fleshed out, but all of his teammates (also the coach and mgmt. as well) are given an individual story that is fleshed out throughout the course of the series. Even the ancillary characters belonging to different schools are given their own unique personalities that really shine through both on and off the field. The attention to detail is very in depth and one of the best things about this show.It has all the best qualities of a very good shounen (a MC that never gives up, strong supporting characters, an emphasis on teamwork) that complement a sports series in the best possible way. A subtlety that really helps this anime is the music (score) that goes along with it. In addition, the opening theme through the first part of season 1 (even the last part) and the theme for season 2 (especially the last one) are both really well done. If I had one gripe it's that the main character is made to look weak at times and is overshadowed by his rival quite often. Though, I have to say this is a nice parallel to a genuine real life sports' story due to that fact. I have no hesitation in thinking that this will be resolved as the series goes on if/when it is renewed (hinging on how far the manga gets since it is only about 40 chapters in to the second Act)Bottom line: watch this anime. It's not only an awesome sports series, but a touching slice of life type as well. You will get caught up in the development of the first and second years, but also extremely touched by the relationship between the team/coach and the third years. The ending 10 minutes of Act 1 (season 2) are some of the most touching scenes I have seen in any form of media. I personally cannot wait for a season 3 whenever that may come. Do yourself a favor and find out why.

I love sport anime but I have my own preference. If Slam Dunk is the best basketball anime, Prince of Tennis is best tennis anime, Hungry Heart or Giant Killings is the best soccer anime, then Ace of the Diamond is the best baseball one. I have watched several baseball animes but none like Ace of Diamond can draw my attention throughout series and make me re-watch episodes. I even follow the manga. Hopefully, TokyoOne will continue Season 3 for this series after mangaka produces more chapters. I'm anxiously waiting for the official announcement.

Okay I'm gonna keep this review short by doing list of pros and cons:+Amazing animation+Great main character+Great soundtrack+Great characters+ Some intense and interesting games- Furyua- Some annoying characters- Some games keep dragging on- Kind of repetitive sometimes- This show should focus more on SawamuraTo sum it all up, this show has great MC, Sawamura, and you keep cheering for him through his hardships and failures. Animation is also great and I'm glad this series has been running this long and hope it will cover all of the manga. I prefer anime over manga when it's sports anime/manga.

Let me start this off by saying I am not a baseball fan at all. I only know the basics and this anime really teaches you about the sport. With the different types of pitches, callouts, plays, hand signs etc. I got hookedIt follows Sawamura as he gets recruited to join the Seidou high school baseball team, Sawamura has a southpaw pitching style and he wants to be the Ace of the team. Which is the number one pitcher on the team. I gotta say the struggle has never been more realer than in this anime. The amount of loss and heartbreak is staggering. They really don't pull any punches for Sawamura in this anime.He hardly ever shines in this and when he does shine its only for a few moments before the next episode where something bad happens. He has a rival pitcher on his team who throws really fast balls. There are times when you think he is the main character and not Sawamura because he's almost always shining. It gets frustrating at times because they do the main character so petty sometimes, but I guess they wanted to do a underdog story who has a lot of potential but will take a long time to reach his potential.All I can say is this isn't your typical good guy wins and gets awesome overnight anime. It kinda slaps you in the face with reality but I think Sawamura will be Ace one day. Its just a long journey. One thing though Sawamura has heart

The anime ace of diamond has a interesting depiction on high school baseball I could go on about how great this anime is but my favorite part of this anime is sawamura yes yes he's a lovable knuckle head but rather then that you watch and feel what he has been through , The coach said it well "step by step" this is true as sawamura has to endure all the challenges to get where he is he is not the incredibly cool super fast growing Mc but takes it slowly stating that hard work and motivation is all you need for your foundation

I wanna kiss this anime and all the cute boys in it. I've sold my soul to previous sports animes but the dark lord lucifer has worked his magic in this 75 episode curse. I want to get off this ride but I can't. Have I mention I hate baseball bc I do but I love a good dang. I am converted. I love baseball. I feel my pants tightening every time I watch this anime. It's so good and I wanna kiss every hot tater tot in this show. Please end me.

Fun light entertainment to watch when stuck at home with a cold, but with so many episodes available to watch back to back on Crunchy Roll its clear this could be edited down a lot into something more impactful. Plenty of repeated scenes (e.g. original advert breaks) and overuse of basic effects for demonstrating character emotion like resolve or smouldering anger (look its the blue/red flame thing again, or glowing eyes!).Probably best enjoyed if you can ration yourself to one episode at a time?

Great characters and great story makes this a great show.  I love the enthusiasm of the main character Eijun Sawamura.  I love his relation ship with his team mates and his rivalry with Furuya.  It's never been a petty rivalry where the would do things to make the other look bad but instead drive each other to become better.  Seeing this team climb the ranks has been more enjoyable than teams like seirin (Kuroko's basketball) or Deimon (Eyeshield 21).  And what makes it better is so far there is no impossible techniques or things that wouldn't actually work in the real world.  Such as the Vanishing Drive (Kuroko), Kick Serve/ a third of Prince of Tennis's special hits, or the Devil Bat Ghost (Eyeshield 21) etc.

this show had potential...  i really want to liek it.. but the writers have over done it for me. sure we all like the story of the underdog growing into something great... but he started pretty good...and the writers ground him to crap.... its been too long into this for him to recover IMO. even if they wait for the last moment for hime to shine... thier pace is waaay off... theres plenty of characters to like... and you wait for something to happen with this characters that have been built up only to be let down... I personally dont watch theese shows to think this is real life or I see how this could happen... I watch them to feel hgappy or excited and the writers have robbed me of that. Def has been put on the backburner for me

What the hell have the writers done to Sawamura? He is a shell of whatever pitcher/Man he used to be. He has gone from being (arguably) the main character to becoming one of the biggest side characters in Anime - earning himself a position next to Krillin and Yamcha from DBZ. If the writers were hoping to take Sawamura through some sort of rough patch in order to make it twice as epic when he finally does excel on the pitch - they have left it too long. Too long have i waited for Sawamura to step up to the plate both physically and mentally but to my utmost dissatisfaction no such moment has arrived. Is this the same guy who at the start of this anime roared out to the coach and the whole team that he would be the ace!? When was the last time you even heard him mention the word Ace since the start of the new season. Writers, I am disappointed and let down by how you have managed to turn a main character with so much potential into a pathetic and disappointing nervous wreck

I've really enjoyed watching AOD and put it firmly up there with my favorites! Why? It has a degree of balance that is lacking in other vocational/sport series that I've watched. The story and plot is underpinned by competition training and progress, so when there are moments of humor or confrontation it's sudden and potent. A strong lead character that isn't at the focus of everything is a nice touch, as we get to know around 70% of the first string in depth throughout. If you are an anime fan and didn't understand baseball before hand, but were curious, I can't think of a better way to learn the game!

I've never been a fan of baseball, but this show is more about the characters than the sport. The games they play are little more than a vehicle to drive personal and team development.That said, it is easy to get sucked into the action scenes. A few times I have gasped, or had my jaw drop when the players do something awesome. It does move a little slow at times, but I am usually excited for next week's episode as soon as the ED starts. I have kept up with it weekly, and will definitely continue to watch.

This is a great shounen sports anime that is really good. At first look it might not seem to exciting but the story and character development is phenonemal and this show has the potential to be something great. One thing for sure is that it is always interesting and sucks you right in from the very first episode. This is one of the animes that has a lot of feels and emotions when it comes to passionate sports anime. Go watch now!

This is one of the best anime shows I have seen - and trust me - I have binged many, many shows. Character development that makes you love all of the characters, even the ones you initially hate. A story line that genuinely follows a story, one that is far more realistic than many Sports anime. It's comedic (and does it well) but focuses on the love of a sport I knew little about beforehand. Give it a chance, it really is a Home Run of a show.

I have never watched sports animes before until I tried Haikyuu. I loved Haikyuu so much that when I found this and it was simulcasting (plus the fact it had long seasons for 1 and 2) I immediately picked it up. It's so entertaining. Sometimes it can be frustrating watching the protagonist seem like a side character, but all the work he puts in and all the times his rival outshone him really make the moments he stands out in season 3 worth the entire wait. I can't wait for it to continue updating

I have been watching anime for the past for years and this is by far one of the best sports anime i have ever seen the only ones that come close are ALL OUT and The Knight In The Area. and all those are very good shows. This is just a cut above the rest and has been one of my favourite anime for a long time would recommend for anyone who is new to anime or has been watching for years just good all around.

This show has a bit more realism to sports than other animes. In many instances, the team fails or does bad in games but it shows that it's a lot harder to build a great team that will always succed. It takes its time building the characters especially the main one but that's what makes you so proud when they finally succed after all that growth and struggle. I really didn't need to know baseball to be hooked on this show for it was and still is a wild ride that brings joy at every turn.

The ACE OF DIAMOND is one the best anime where you could watch and wait on the excitement where the story process in a really cool way plus not rushing the main character to reach his goal in the slowest time yet the best way to build him up.its really good material plus not super hero pitches and the drama is there and the laough is there and the sadness there too.at6 the end its really super good and funny and excited to always watch and wait...

Spring 2018 I decided to finally follow a sport and fell in love with the NBA.  I decided to watch Kuroko and discovered that sports anime are an excellent portal into learning and loving a new sport.  Ace of the Diamond is no different.  It took about 2 episodes for me to be hooked.  I like the art style, the voice actors are great and the comedic relief made me actually laugh out loud.  I love this anime!

This anime is one of the best that are currently airing, and if you are looking for a sport anime that has the same thrilling, exciting, funny and sad effect like Ippo, then this is it!!!   I enjoy every chapter which is full of joy, you will learn a lot about baseball and all their technical details.  I truly recommend this anime to anyone who love sports, i am pretty sure you will enjoy it till the end.

Pros:-Good Baseball Anime with different storyline than your Major or Major 2nd.-Sawamura is a beast! Furuya too!- Lot of great baseball theory has well.- Teenager with manly voice ; For me this is a plus! I need me some weird 40 yo looking 16 yo in those Baseball anime!- Lots of character at first are basically their 3 liners with their distincts joke but at one point 2nd Arc, the newest season it became more a show about the team rather than the initial protagonist SawamuraIn my opinion and reading others opinions at the time it was arriving, it was taken with a certain understandable WTF? So in the sense, I feel it was part of a necessary  evolution if you're talking about how Team Work prevails.Also, may I add that this anime has very low amount of evil characters, in fact, this is something that I appreciated.For me there's only one big Elephant in the closet for this Anime and anybody binging this show can confirm it; The animation feels very great or extremely cheap.The short cut are little annoying visually speaking watching this anime feels like somebody is reading the Manga to you. I don't know if it's the CGI, the sequence length of those sometimes minutes wihout a single animation of character "talking to themselves in the attendance and then back on a playing sitting and nobody, nothing moving thinking of the pitcher's who's about to pitch, then Still of face of Sawamura with internal dialog, then face of  Miyuki thinking and presenting to us what is the best call with a Suspense...So basically this scene is 1 minutes and this is 4 peoples talking to themselves and nothing but 5 to 6 still images are the scene, Then semi-focus, no-face Sawamura is pitching - Small cheap animation, Zoom on the ball with cool sound effect with ball in the glove with sometime batting animation, something just the zoom on where the ball is and the missed batting.So you went from having 1 minutes of No animation to that poorly executed cut corner Animation sequence. Then some locker, same things, juste still images after still images!MIX has nothing like that, I felt in opposition to AotD what little less traditional drawing style for 2019 but overall the animation sequence are super well executed, the flashy is less flashy, but I guess the abundance of amazing Baseball Anime gave us a lot of room to complain because they are easily in my  top 10 anime, period! Ace of the Diamond storyline is refreshing in the shounen style, and this particular sport, it makes sense to see more defeats so that type of Serie has lot of room for good Win/Lose Arcs with some rival team or new powerhouse etc...

I'm a pretty huge sports fan. My 2 hobbies are anime and sports. Baseball is probably one of my least favorites, especially to watch. However, this anime will most likely reign the best sports anime ever made.The story has been written absolutely wonderfully. I watch the games with so much passion. The connection I have with the players and the coaches is real. I recommend this anime to anyone who has an interest in sports. I killed 5 episodes a day at a minimum until now being caught up to the release episode each week.Hope they keep it going for a long time to follow the various characters "careers".

Love this show. Its not just a sports anime. It has that feel you get when you watch any other anime where they face one villain and take on the next. Every new team they face seems like a new story arc. What really draws me to this anime though is the character development you see taking place. It is fun to watch them grow with all the choices they make. I love that it is unpredictable. Usually an anime will signify when the hero is about to do something inspirational with some theme music, but in this show they do that..... and then break your heart lol. I also love the fact that when the pitchers learn a new pitch, it is used throughout the series. Not just some ultimate unique move that takes forever for the main character to learn and they only use once like in other anime. This show definitely needs more love and even if you are not a fan of sports anime I highly recommend you give it a try.

This show not only captures the essence of character development but does a good job of doing it. After having watched other sports anime I came across an issue that was prevalent in all of them, a poor MC. Ace of Diamond from the get go decides to avoid this by going down the path of proper and well flushed out character development. From early on Eijun's hidden ability is made clear however, it is not a godsend that enables him to be op from the beginning as seen in other sports anime. After declaring that he will become the best in typical shonen fashion, he is woken up by seeing not only how weak he is compared to the rest of his team but how strong others from around the region are as well. This sets him down the path of starting from zero and learning how to hone his ability to catch up to the others, his catch up is not done simply through a 3 episode training arc but rather throughout all of season 1, 2 and act 2. Learning valuable lessons through losses and from his teammates he is brought up in the best way possible as the creator has clearly taken his time in making Eijun a reliable and better player as the series goes on. While some rant about certain events that caused them to drop the show and complaining about his state in a certain part of the series, I doubt that they have even watched season 2 as all of the things holding him back as a character are resolved in season 2. This show also does not solely focus on the MC being the one to carry the team to victory but also allows the side characters to even be main characters at certain times. This allows for an overall well used cast followed by a nice story.

This series is one of a few different baseball anime series, but this one takes the cake as the most interesting and really tells the watcher what baseball is all about. I am not a baseball hype monster but I do really enjoy the characters and atmosphere that this show brings to the plate (pun intended). Each character in the show whether it be an enemy pitcher or another teammate, they all have a purpose. Just all in all, Ace of the Diamond is an amazing series with action at every corner and insane characters who will interest even the people who don't like baseball.

I'm not a fan of baseball, and watching the majors is pretty boring to me here in the states, but for some reason this anime makes baseball interesting. Not even the many movies we have on baseball here in the states make it as interesting as this anime did.Kudos to the writers for this anime. I feel like I have more of an appreciation for the game now and why so many people are fans of it. Funny how it took an anime for me to see that.I only knocked off one star because it could be "Ace of Cliffhangers" instead of "Ace of Diamond" and some parts did feel like they were stretched out longer than they should've been, but all in all it was good pacing and well written.I also have to give this anime credit for not going the usual route of making the main character over powered like we see in so many other anime. He literally starts from the absolute bottom and as he moves forward, we learn more about the other characters and also the characters from the other teams. There's a ton of world building with all the people around the main character and it feels the world keeps getting bigger the more the main character progresses.This is definitely worth a watch even if you don't like baseball.

This show is actually why I ended up paying for Crunchyroll! The characters in this highschool baseball anime are all so well rounded and written. The 2 ace pitchers Sawamura & Furuya are so different from one another (one a hardworking athlete, the other a naturally gifted one) yet their want to be the ace is played to great effect over the course of the series.As an example of how deep this anime is, the 2 titular pitchers aren't even the main character of the show! It's the catcher Miyuki! (watch it again if you didn't catch it!)This is one of my favorite animes of all time, and I can't speak enough about how great it is. This show had me on edge of my seat during the high tension moments, and had me rooting for a group of highschoolers trying to be the best team in Japan!

I first picked this series up two years ago when I was trying to get into the sports anime genre and I was quickly addicted. I stopped watching because the series wasn't complete and now with s2 at some 50 episodes, I've picked it up again. As a refresher I did re-pick up s1 starting at the game against Inashiro and it still made my heart pound, it still made me cry and scream and hold onto the edge of my seat, and I still love Sawamura, Miyuki, Haruichi, and really all our main players like I did thenCompared to other sports anime like Haikyuu and Kuroko, Daiya is really "real time". We see the players practice, all their games last a couple episodes but never feel drawn out, and we experience many roadblocks along the way. Things that are more technique oriented and sometimes things that are mentally exhausting (yips). The show does a good job at pacing things, but GOD the writing always has me thinking, will this be Sawamura's time to shine?I also feel like Daiya shows us some of those things that other sports anime don't. For example, what happens when the third years leave and trying to get a whole new team together while also moving directly into fall tournaments. Or the fact that some people may be on the team for so long and never get to play even when they try their best. The struggles that pitchers (in particular) face, especially during big competitionsI'm exciting to start watching s2 and picking up the manga (and fangirling on my blog)

I really went into this with little expectations but it far exceeded any ideas I had to be a great sports anime. Its all about struggle and hard work to discover your potential and to push your limits or expand your views. Sawamura plays sincerely and always tries to be better than before eventhough he falters sometimes, he pushes through to move forward one step at a time. I really enjoyed his journey especially with Miyuki. I think their battery was the best. Eventhough Furuya became ACE because of his natural talent (which kinda pissed me off), I think that he realized that he can't slack off because there is always someone right behind to take his place. Seeing other teams struggle and win or lose and how they grow was really exciting and intense. I often felt myself shaking with anticipation of what would happen. MORE MORE MORE! I could cry out for more. I felt the ending was ok but I am really hoping to see another season where Sawamura becomes ACE and improves even more! I absolutely love how he is honest and cheers for everyone, eventhough he is often he comic relief in the anime, he is obviously giving his all so you must cheer for him more. All the characters on Seido's team make you root for them so loud that it becomes deafening. I am so glad to have watched this I just want more! Call me greedy.

This show is really good at making you like and care about the characters, even ones who just appear in one game. There were a few arcs I wasn't expecting to care about, but within an episode they pulled me in. It's also light for the most part, with the most drama being a character getting injured (not seriously, just enough to call into question whether they can give 100%). Explains enough about the game so non-fans like me can follow. So the show is fun, like real baseball is supposed to be but isn't. Lots of cute boys, too

Yes Haikyuu has all the love and hype (and rightly deserves it), but AoD and Baby Steps imo are the best sports anime of recent.The characters in this series are so good and unlike almost every sports series ever, the main character is NOT vital to the success of the team right away, so he has to himself vital, and the process and story of that is part of what makes AoD so great.The characters are also amazing. They start of mundane and pretty normal, no outstanding designs with the exception of the Kominato bros and their pink hair, but as you get to know them, you love them for every ounce of their being.This series is so fricking grand man, please watch and love it.

This is really fun to watch but it's still way way way w...'flashback scene to me wishing I could see how a game would conclude before needing to leave for class but not having enough time'...ay too drawn out. Also I wish it didn't have so many recaps (though personally, I'll never get recaps. to me they're only used either because the writer doesn't have enough content to fill the allotted number of episodes or as an insult to the viewers intelligence). Both of those issues are particularly bad during actual games. I'm still extremely glad I found this anime. I only started it because I enjoyed Haikyu and wondered if I only liked that anime because I never followed or played organized volleyball. Not a huge shock but I love this even though I'm already a big fan of baseball (go Cubs) and have played it myself for a really long time.Pros:-huge number of quality character (takes a lot of time to develop teammates and opponents)-generally a blast to watch-extremely motivated and funny MC (his commentary on the games and players may be my favorite part of this anime)Cons:-drawn out during games (I started skipping some bits of games in the second season)-recaps for days (cut them out and I don't think this would even make it to the 100 episode mark)-the writer, to the point of becoming predictable, loves to crush the MC (gives lots of room for character growth but it had me cursing the writer at times. also, the MC almost seems like a side character often)

When I first started watching this anime, my knowledge of the sport was that it was boring and takes forever. This anime has taught me the rules and positions of Baseball as well as why its so exciting! I have been a fan of baseball since! It is also just a great story of a young pitcher with so much potential and motivation to succeed but not much training. The further I got along the more I learned about baseball and the more I fell in love with all the characters. I feel like as my love for the sport grew, so did Sawamura and his team. Just great great stuff.Favorite quote "nice ball" lol

Ace of diamond is a must watch anime who really catches your eye with its great graphical image along with exciting music. Although the reason for why it is such a great anime is the reason that expresses real life baseball and real life obstacles in which we have to overcome. For example Sawamura the main character had to develop a strong fighting spirit in order to make the 1st string team and become the future ace. Also teamwork and friendship is a big part of this anime as in every sport you can't win by yourself just in Ace of Diamond everyone contributes for the teams success like the Sawamura-Miyuki. Ace of diamond also gives a message that you must be mentally tough and should never give up into going to the next level. This reflects and benefits each individual who dreams to be the best as competition is fierce in this growing world where we all want to be the ace or the best, or the king or anything where we dream. Especially in the sports world you must be prepared to fight it all out. In conclusion I would like to state that this anime really motivates you to chase your dream and live your life through tough times and also to work hard.

I honestly started watching this show on a whim. At first I didn't like it but stuck through the first episode since I love baseball. As the anime progress I fell more and more in love with it!! The characters and the story plot is amazing! Literally watched it all within a month (would take me a shorter time if I was not in school xD). Overall, I loved it!!! It was so amazing!! Was sad to find out it ended. I hope they continue the story in the future. Now time to read the manga lol

I've never really got interested in baseball at all...that is until I clicked the first episode of Diamond no Ace. The main character is very unique and so are all the other characters which made me love all of them...well with the exception of a few. The games are super intense and I fangirl quite a lot as well as screaming and yelling so loud while watching this making my mom question me. I've never been a fan of baseball but because of this anime, I can say I'm quite a genius on the rules of baseball. I swear you won't get bored of this anime LOL XD

Even baseball is not the most popular sport on the globe,Ace of the Diamond has the power to make you embrace it.It is a story that show us that dreams come true,but with a little luck and only with a lot of hard-work.It has characters that are permanently in development,but remain in realistic plain,none of the characters is perfect so everyone must trust the others to overcome their flows.A simple,but beautiful show that teaches us about baseball,sportsmanship,dedication,teamwork combining action with a bit of comedy.P.S. Sawamura is the best

http://www.rokthereaper.com/2015/04/ace-of-diamond-season-1-anime-review.htmlClick the above link to view the full, detailed anime review for Ace of Diamond: Season 1 on RoKtheReaper.com.  You will, however, find my verdict below."Ace of Diamond is one of my favorite anime of 2014.  I absolutely loved every aspect of this series and how they go so in-depth with what baseball is all about.  I loved the character development, the diversity in the characters, and the levels of baseball they portrayed as far as how teams played comparatively.  They do their best to make every interaction exciting and that every match-up would present its own challenges, and each team that Seido faces boasts its own strengths.  While I felt like somethings were dragged out longer than they needed to, nothing really felt like much of a filler (Seido's final game kind of did in some parts, however).  I feel like everything flowed pretty smoothly until the end, and I feel like everyone, opponents included, were represented well.This anime also gives out enough knowledge that those who do not know anything about baseball would be able to learn along the way in order to truly enjoy the plays made in the anime and could transfer that into the real world.  By the end of the anime you know exactly what they meant as far as positions, such as the "Three-Hole", "Clean Up", or "Lead Off", you even know what different pictures are, such as the "Cutter", "Change-Up", or "Knuckle Ball".This anime is something I would recommend for anyone who likes sports anime, but also likes anime that focuses upon friendship, growth, and adaptation to harsh situations.  I think anyone who gave this anime a chance would be instantly drawn into it, and that they would find each of the characters enjoyable in their own ways.  I am anxiously awaiting for season 2!"

I was seventeen when I first discovered this anime; I wasn't a baseball fan and didn't know anything about the sport other than the pitcher and bases. It was about March of 2014, my Junior year of high school, and I was browsing anime to watch and this came up. I love sports anime and so I gave it a chance and fell in love with Sawamura Eijun's character; hot-headed, determined, and those eyes! *_* I stuck around because I liked this kid and knew he was gonna go far in this anime. I watched as many episodes as I could, when I came home from school, and was so upset when I found out I had reached the end of all the episodes they had out so far. I didn't want to pick up the manga yet because I was still getting to know everyone and getting attached to them and had a feeling the spoilers would hurt my heart. I learned so much from watching this anime from the positions, scoring, innings, types of pitchers, batters...etc...and i'm so glad I found this anime. I recommend this anime to everyone looking for a new sports anime to watch. The characters are all so likable   and differ from one another drastically. 10/10 would marathon this all over again.

Whether you're a fan of the sport or not, this is a great series. Fans of the game will nod in appreciation as they keep the sport as close to reality as possible, all the while non-fans will learn the basics of the game quite easily. The character development is fantastic albeit sometimes slow to process. Same goes with the story as one game can take up several episodes, but that is to be expected in most animes. However, you won't be able to deny the emotional attachment you will feel to some of the characters. All in all, this is a breath of fresh air and allows you to step away from the worlds of magic and fantasy. This is as close to real life as it gets...and it'll get you hooked in no time!

This series combines everything thats great about sports anime and everything thats great about watching baseball as a fan. It has overpowered sempais, a main character with a specific skill, and winning through teamwork/friendship. It is very accurate and technical to actual baseball. I can't speak to how well it explains the sport to a layperson, but as a fan it has the same drama of watching the sport with the clutch hitting opportunities or extremely high pressure pitching situations. this anime got me back into watching professional baseball (go dodgers!). I highly recommend this to anyone who likes sport anime or is a fan of baseball in general

I don't watch sports anime too often, one because they tend to drag things on forever, two because everything seems so cliché... but with this show there are realistic expectations of every player a coach who is wicked at his job and believes in his players, and a great support system going. It is sad to know he's quitting on his team but that can't be helped it is how harsh the world is if you don't produce wins you just leave that or they fire you....anyway far as sports anime goes I was interested enough to watch the first season and intend to watch the second season so for me it is quality work. The characters aren't too strong or too weak everyone has room to grow and lessons to learn, it truly depicts the struggles athletes face without going over the top. I haven't seen an anime like this in a while one that has me invested in the players abilities and wanting to see how they conquer each obstacle in their way. Definitely worth my time!

I can't write big paragraph but i'll tell you why I love this show. I love how the main character, Eijun, is trying his hardest to become the ace of the baseball team. The anime shows friendship, determination, how they deal with when they lose a match. Ugh, I just really love how this story is portrayed and how the pace it's going because it feels like I'm watching the whole team (and the others school teams) grow.

I read the manga up to 265 (its up to like 380 but chapters 266-current have a lot of skips-still waiting on the new scanlation team to fill in the gaps!) and was delighted to see that this anime was so successful and season 1 ended pretty close to chapter 265. I feared that it would just get 25 episodes but not only did it go up to 75 episodes but season 2 is up and coming?? MUST WATCH NOW!!! There is just something special about baseball anime/manga that make me prefer it to other sports, and this does not disappoint!

IIRC, I remember reading somewhere that Funimation has streaming rights for a month(?), so it probably wont get released to Crunchyroll until then. Funimation releases the episodes weekly anyways, though you'll be an episode behind the premium users(nothing new). In terms of content and animation though, I can only say this: I now know where the money whales spend went.  Honestly really good animation(bit excessive on fanservice, but whatever) and I'm really excited to see a certain blonde Rin face show up soon.

Note: To avoid confusion, there is a short one hour movie that serves as a prequel to this anime, Fate Grand Order: First Order; it's available on Crunchyroll. While episode 0 of this anime is a prequel to the movie. Episode 0 -> Movie -> Episode 2 onwards of this anime, that's the chronological order of this Fate route. Also, keep in mind that Fumination has streaming rights of this anime for a month, so non-fumination users have to wait like a month or so for a new episode. With that out of the way, Fate Babylonia is an anime adaption of the mobile phone game Fate Grand Order. In the year 2017 CE a destructive singularity fully developed due to a strange turn of events that happened during the Holy Grail War in 2004. The Chaldea organization is tasked to develop new masters so they, along with their servants, can destroy the singularity that will bring the extinction of mankind. It is not completely necessary to play the game to understand this plot but it will help you understand more about the lore, character backgrounds, etc. The game is divided into 7 chapters/routes so to speak and this anime follows the 7th chapter exclusively but with some light references to the other 6. As for how it holds up as a entry to this franchise, it's a worthy one. Every element you expect from the Fate series is here: Flashy and high octane action fights with dazzling effects, smooth animation, enjoyable characters, easy to follow plot, appropriate pacing, great art style, gender swapping of historical figures, light waifu material, and so on. As a fan of this series, I wholeheartedly recommend any followers of the Fate franchise to give this anime a watch; and of course to those that aren't to use this one as a starting point to a series regarded as one of the best action anime out there.

I'm afraid that I didn't like this particular series.Gilgamesh spends his time doing nothing, recruiting people that he easily defeats, and saying that he can't defeat people that he seems to have no trouble against. At least in Fate/Zero there was the excuse that he was a servant so he had to obey commands from idiots.The main character is annoying, as it has been in almost every series apart from Fate/Zero. He spends his time shocked at some display of power, and is completely useless.The villains purposefully don't attack the hero's, it's only in episode 8 that a main villain decides to attack the wall and she destroys it in one hit. There's no reason given for why it wasn't done before.And finally this feels like they are trying to be kid friendly by making everything bloodless (or close enough), and nobody dying. I mean in the 8th episode a villain gets a hero in her jaws, and just drops it on the floor by the other hero's when she's clearly still alive. I've finished 8th episode now, and only one person has died, when the 3 deities could have probably killed everyone who opposed them by now (they should have killed the main character in episode 1, would have made it much better).It all feels pointless in this show.

I have the books for this, I own all of them and have the next pre-ordered so when i saw this on the roster for the anime season I was excited.  My expectations are completely trashed. Whatever this crap is this is not the same story that was in the book. The story does not begin when she is Mile, that little episode of kids being kidnapped did not happen. She did not meet her party members in this way and they completely wrote out her entire experience as Adele and her first set of friends. The entire reason she is running as "Mile" and became a hunter if the first place is just not there. So at best they will have maybe a 15 second flashback of what is the entirety of book 1.  I'm just so completely shocked at how completely and utterly off base they are. And the little nano cat? Seriously that character does not exist at all in the book.  If I was the author I would of red lighted this crap from the start.

With the Isekai boom, a lot Isekai's can fall into several categories. Some Isekais like That Time I got Reincarnated as a Slime or Konosuba are incredibly memorable and hilarious shows. Some Isekais have an awesome twist to them like Overlord and Re:Zero. And then there's some Isekai's which are... pretty average. I typically like these average Isekais, but they're not on the top of my recommendation list. Unfortunately, this anime is one of those average Isekais. After watching the first episode, I can say that it's not a bad anime by far, but it's not up there either. Thankfully after watching Isekai Cheat Magician (the most painfully average Isekai I've ever watched), I get a better impression of every other Isekai. This one thankfully stands out a little more than some of the other Isekai's because it's one of the first Isekai's that has an all-female team - and that's finally including the protagonist (about time). The Isekai is definitely self-aware by going through the reincarnation backstory quite quickly, and the main character even called her own death experience a typical "Isekai Trope". One of the aspects of this anime that makes this slightly "meh" is its pacing. It's not awful, but there are times where I go "that could have been done differently". For example, near the end of the episode during the climax of the protagonist's power, the typical "magical invisible pet" character suddenly interrupts and gives an explanation, which completely destroys the mood of the overall scene. I usually expect overpowered-explanations in the second episode of an anime. When it's explained too soon in the first episode, there's not much to look forward to in the second episode because most of us can sort of see where the show is going from here now despite knowing nothing about the plot. Also... I CANNOT write this review without mentioning that magical-cat character's voice. It completely caught me off guard in a negative way honestly. I saw the cat and was like "Oo it's another high-pitched fun magical pet character like Puck in Re:Zero!" but NOPE! The cat has a male-baritone-level voice that did not fit his overall design at all in my personal opinion. There were some parts where the background looked painted and I honestly respected that. I'm not much of an analyzer of images, art styles, animation styles and such, so I don't have much to say about that. Overall, I'm looking forward to this and hope that it goes somewhere more. It's definitely not on the top of my list, but it's just one of those Isekai's that you can just enjoy every week. I'm glad they're going for an all-female cast in an Isekai, as most of the time, every Isekai nowadays is just a harem, which has gotten quite old, so this is a nice change of pace!

Hadn't heard or read anything about it and each episode I find fun and humorous. I don't take anime as seriously as most, so I can get a kick out of shows more than those that have to compare every new show to one from the past or having to break it down to complain about minute details. Fun for me, might not be for you, but you won't know until you give it a shot. Don't let anyone else's review keep you from trying new things.

Basically a cute girls doing cute things anime got isekai-ed and some fourth wall breaks were thrown in. A breath of fresh air when compared with all the generic isekai anime from the same year. It might not be what the fans of the LN wanted, but it’s still worth a look. My enjoyment has increased with each new episode, so my score might go up.Edit: dang, the show definitely got dark at times, but on the whole its core cute/funness remained intact. Bit cheeky that they saved all of the main character’s growth for he season finale, but it got me excited about the idea of a second season... so mission accomplished? You can feel the budget constraints, but it doesn’t suffer for it as much as some other shows do.I stand by the 3 stars I gave this initially. If I could give it a more granular rating I’d say it’s a 7/10 for the enjoyment it gave me.

This show seems to nail the average, but if you like Yuri and moe, this could be one of your favorites this season. Reading some other reviews it seems some people did give it 5 stars simply for having female leads. If you're one of those people, cool, disregard the following and enjoy the show!The usual premise of an isekai is; an outcast in our world *hand waving accident/portal/thing/truck happens* gets transported or reborn in another world. They gain massive power or popularity, or both, and set out to fix something in that world only their power or character can fix.In contrast this show is all about the selfish desire of the protagonist Mile. She apparently had perfect As in high school so she felt her peers shy away from her. But, her life was cut short, so a god granted her a do-over in another world. The thing is, gods don't listen well, so when she demanded to be average as her boon, the god thought average among all, not only mere humans. So the god made her average, but way overpowered for a human.That's the sort of humor you can expect from the show. Also the supossedly extremely busty friend has some very weird size changing boobs, but I'll chalk that one up to bad animation. Yes, the animation is inconsistent so the joke fell flat. Honestly I'm cutting the show a break since it's the first episode, but that animation will probably sink the show for me. I will be back editing this review if the animation is still inconsistent. Also I am not happy they made me spend so much time thinking about an underage girl's bust size. The layered CGI looks on point, and I like the colors. As far as premise and animation, I think the show needs more. I'm staying hopeful because I see a lot of fans of the LNs being enthusiastic. Some are dissatisfied with the anime having skipped book one, but I think that's why we get a narration cat! I like animal characters done right, and this one is. No annoying voice here! And he sticks to one scene for explanations, rather than having to pause at every other scene for background. The story can really pick up, or be a complete let down. I hope the theme of this being about Mile finding a normal life evolves to something substantial.The backstory and motive of Mile is very boring, literally a Mary Sue complaining about being a Mary Sue. "First world problems," sums up her character. Sad really, it kills my interest in the show. If the rest of the episodes are of her crying over being powerful, I'll take off all stars. I don't need to hear the whining of a person who literally has everything at her fingertips.

Alright people, yes I have read the light novel, no that is not why I think this is a horrible anime but I will compare the two since the novel is the source of this adaptation. (made it to episode 5 before giving up feel free to message me in the event you get further than I did and think these things got fixed)Characters  They use the same four characters, and don't introduce any other reoccurring characters in the arcs, "well it's kinda short and it episodic, not arc based." It never should have been episodic this had more than enough material for at least 24 episodes, maybe fifty depending on creative liberties. This is just before taking a break or maybe introducing some filler arcs. So why are there only four characters? The only thing I can think of is that they wanted to pay as few voice actors as possible so they sat down and said these four are the main group so that's all we need. I also think this is why they skipped Mile's entire first arc. Which is a real shame cause even though they only stick around for an arc or two there we some interesting and likable characters that popped up.Speaking of Mile they turned her into a standard trope character I don't know why they also did it, it's note like they even had to write in depth, she already had some from the novel not anything ground breaking but enough to make her feel like a character as opposed to this..... thing. (they also simplified the others and dulled down the interactions between all 3 as well)Art It's bad, Mile laser is the only thing I have seen that looked remotely nice,everything else is just average or below, the flames in episode 3 are a joke and I am not even going to talk about fight calligraphy, they clearly didn't. I'm not expecting unlimited blade works here or anything this is just sloppy it's sad. The art is literally described by the backgrounds, you will know what I mean.Music honestly, nothing stood out, In the half hour or so between watching 5 epiosdes and writing this I have forgotten the opening and endings tracks and cannot think of a nice  OST that played not saying they are bad, literally mind is blank I remember dialogue, no music.On it's own? As a stand alone comedy it barely passes. if you want references/parody Combat Butler does that type of humor way better. In terms of raw comedy take your pick Snafu, reincarnated as a slime, I could make a list but just pick a anime and you can feel safe that it is probably better than this. As for an Isekai this is bad, like really bad even for an isekai, no discovery, not even anything for the power trip since the art is so bad, no real shock to observe since Mile unlike her light novel self has some real issues holding back at all.and if you were looking for story well, they sadly scrapped or ignored almost all of it. No feels here either. Ending statement (my god I am a nerd) Hopefully you can see why I believe they cheaped out on this anime in terms of costs but hey if it gets better or if you feel like you can convince me to give it another shot, feel free. I like seeing what people have to say even if they don't agree. Just keep in mind Mile being cute isn't a good reason, I have the novel for that haha.P.s they rushed it so fast, I have no idea why, yes there are some cool things that happen later on but with things as they are I would't care about them by the time they got around to it.

What can I say? I barely write reviews for anime unless I know they deserve an extra 5 stars. On the comedy level of Konosuba with tons of references from different anime, this show has sparked an interest which I don't think will die down easily. For one, you barely see isekai anime with a female lead, so this is 100% refreshing. Great character development as well!As I've read other reviews I've noticed that this anime adaptation is not the same as the light novel. The anime has added in plot points and characters, even involving the pre-story to the anime. But for someone who usually exposes themselves to stories like these anime only, I don't find any problems with this. I find the added material adds to the comedy. People should overlook the fact that this is not a 1 for 1, but instead a completely different recreation which probably works better video wise compared to book wise.

This anime is as average as it can be, with some fourth wall breaking elements, where the main character is kinda self aware of isekai tropes,she's basically over powered, because in the world she's  "average" which  is equal to that of a dragon or something like that, soo, yeah, basically she got the opposite of what she asked for, such as Ascendance for a bookworm when they wanted to read books in their next life  but got the opposite instead, theirs some comedy too this show as well, but it kinda gives off a Konosuba vibe, sort of with its quacky situations, and events that happen, by the way, the fourth wall is broken like multiple times. Too many times in my opinion, but it is what it is, anyways the show is an alright average Isekai anime where you can just turn your brain off and watch it for fun, this is the kind of anime you go to watch when you have nothing else to watch, the main character also appears to get excited when certain isekai "stuff" happens etc, but she's basically in a fantasy medieval world but yeah, the shows alright for what it is. Nothing to crazy either.

Yeah, so I’ve only seen episode one at the time of writing this review, and I’d say as someone who has never had any other experience with this story in any other medium that it was good enough to watch for what it was. Nothing amazing, and nothing awful. I will say that the soundtrack goes pretty hard and there’s a lot of extra frames that you usually wouldn’t see in something more low-budget. The only colossal no no that I saw was when they STOPPED WHAT WAS GOING ON TO HAVE A SIDE CHARACTER MONOLOGUE. You just can’t do that. So yeah 3/5 is where it stands for now, if it looks interesting to you then give it a try, if not I’d move on because I don’t expect it to change from the fluff that it presents itself as. I will update this after I finish watching the entirety of season 1. Thanks for reading.

Alright boys and girls, you ready? My rating isn't based on story, art, character design, none of that. Now, I understand that it's more original to have an all female cast for an anime, especially nowadays, but the yip yappin' of the little Japanese female chihuahua voices induced a headache not even half way through the first episode. That's my problem with all female casts--there's no balance between mid-high female to low-mid male voices, so now it's just 25 minutes of constant,  and I mean constant, high-pitched ear blasting that sounds like the continuous yap yap yapping of a pack of chihuahuas. For me, the headache I get halfway through kind of takes away any ability for me to judge anything else, so this is my rating.

so many people are giving this a bad review because its a 'trash adaption' which i think is ridiculous. i have never read the novels but i found this anime so to be very amusing and cute. its different and quirky, if you like that kind of stuff i highly recommend thisdon't listen to the novel readers trying to put this down. its funny and the animation is well done! give it a chance i promise you'll like it <3

This review is from a pure anime perspective!Did I enjoy watching this show? YesWould I watch a Season 2 if one were to come out? YesWould I recommend this show to anyone? Probably notWhile it took me more episodes then I usually give shows to interest me (So few shows I'm watching this season has lead me to give slow shows more episodes then I normally would), I found some enjoyment in the show in the end. It is a little silly at times and could take itself more seriously, but those moments of seriousness and backstory and character development made this not a waste to watch.If it got a second season, I would watch it, but I would not particularly recommend this show to anyone. Give it a try if this is your type of show. Otherwise, pass it up.

I have enjoyed this show very much. I have liked Mile  the QT, MC (also known as Kurihara Misato <3), from the start. She has a good mix of OP Stats, Overall Cuteness & Good Sense of Humor. Has everything Isekai needs. Mages, Cute Girls & Good Laughs. Not to mention a pretty decent story. Which seems pretty unique for a Isekai type imo. Not that I'm saying every other Isekai is the same. (Fun-Police will state otherwise). Also... The expressions the MC's make in this show are always great too. Side note:Picked up the manga pretty recently, and it is somewhat different but still just as enjoyable. I feel like I have gotten more insight on the story overall by watching the anime & reading manga (Still have more of both). I see others saying its not like the LN, not really my concern there either way. It's a source I haven't tapped into yet. Anyway. Point being, I have enjoyed this very much. It has supplied me with many laughs without fail. Looking forward to next Monday :)Recommended

I dont really see any problem with the story. Some people are mad at it for not following the light novel, but I think that is the main theme of this story. And, either way it is actually a pretty good anime.Yes, it is a generic isekai OP MC. But, really its just a show you can sit down and watch and enjoy some fluff. But, to each their own. Really, if your thinking about watching this I say only watch it if you are into cutesy stuff.

I fell in love with the type of animation/art style and the comedy of it. The first episode began slow but really picked up. At that time, I either didn’t like the characters or didn’t care much for them but after the first one or two episodes I warmed up to the group of characters a bit more and began to like them. It’s definitely worth the try if you hadn’t already and if you watch the first one or two episodes and hate it, then at least you tried to watch it.

The problem with these animes and the stories that make them up is always some character that is reincarnated that is apparently SO stupid they can't even use their skills in the most obvious of ways. With her level of magic, she could have easily done a TON of things more efficiently. Considering she can make up magic on the spot of "create this stupid spikey thing" why not "place a strong, long-lasting barrier on the entire carriage/s so that no on dies while I'm off being a stupid tourist." It just makes the story fall flat when you realize how purposefully dumb the author makes their characters.

As someone who has read the source material this is hard to review.   I can actually see why many people reviewed it so poorly.   It completely deviates from the source material in a massive way to the point where outside of the basic premise and the character names there is very little in common.  It literally ignored the entire first book.    That said it also captures the spirit of the source material perfectly.    If I rate it as a stand alone anime I would have to give it 5 stars because the show itself is great.   If I had to rate it based off the source material I would have to give it a 1 at best.   The initial 3 episode arc and the graduation battle was not nearly as good as the book though but still one of the best shows of the season.

so I don't care that it's not faithful to the series. Aside from the moe-ness of the characters, I love the show. If you've watched any other isekai you'll see just about every trope (mostly to be made fun of).The MC is easily my favorite part of the show. Shes's basically what would happen if you took Aqua and gave her the powers of Rimuru. Anyway, I've watched every episode there is right now, which is only 3, and I'm in love with the show. Can't wait to watch what happens next.

Thought I would chime in since this is getting such negative reviews. I actually find this series to be a lot of fun. It is very tongue in cheek about the fact that it is an isekai in the golden age of way too many isekai.  Our MC Misato constantly finds unique ways to parody & pay homage to all kinds of OG characters ranging from Dragon Ball's Master Roshi to everyone's favorite isekai waifu Truck-kun. This show might not be out winning awards for best animation any time soon, but if you are feeling like sitting down for some chill fun & wholesome vibes. This is a good show to watch.

This has potential as an anime, and it’s not all that bad on its own. If you haven’t read the manga/light novels then it’s not that bad. Cliche, yes but not too bad. If you’ve read the manga or light novels, I’m truly sorry. Keep expectations veeeery low, and watch it as it’s own story, because it really failed adaptation-wise. I really love the LNs of this series, and greatly anticipated an anime. I hate leaving a bad review especially so early on but it really is more like an AU of the LN or fanfiction with so much missing. It completely skips basically the entire first book, and feels rushed and hastily put together with arcs not even canon to the LNs, removing important characters, almost none of Mile’s backstory except for the thirty-second recap that didn’t clear much up if the viewer didn’t read the LNs and misses absolutely crucial moments and plot points in the story, and doesn’t capture the character’s personalities well. It does have funny gags and memes, which makes it a bit funnier, but characters that were originally unique and funny are now just cardboard cutouts of other isekai protagonists that are just kinda dumb jokes. This is shown in things like the Nanobots. In the books, Nanobots are incredibly robotic but still have emotion and are just a funny character similar to the great sage in That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime, and they have rare but hilarious interactions with Mile. That got replaced with a Puck-like cat thing that follows Mile around constantly as a sort of way to explain what’s happening because there was no backstory or original explanation. It just feels like someone skimmed the Wikipedia page at 2 AM and scribbled down a couple things and gave it to the development team. I am, essentially, disappointed in the adaptation. It’s a classic rendition of a book into a film; It should really just be it’s own story and not hold the name of a series that it’s not following the plot of. Otherwise, it’s an alright fanfic that people who are new to the series can enjoy. Just if viewers that watch this want to read the LNs, be prepared for a VERY different story off the bat.

Most of the negativity comes from the crowd of people who think it needs to be a straight adaption so I would suggest ignoring them. As the story currently is its going great 2 episodes Its a relaxer anime really something to give you a smile. Its not a as action packed as some series like this and despite my first thought about this being a pandering to girls series well I was wrong its not going for anything it just wants to be its own thing.

The light novels are some of my favorites, and this certainly is being told in a different way, but from all the reviews they didn't pay attention to the end credits. It clearly shows the trio that she bonded with early in the novels, I am assuming they are going to consistently have flashbacks filling in the story up to the hunter school. I am so looking forward to this as I love the novels. Hopefully they don't wonder to far outside of the novels cause there is really great story there. People should really give it some time, it's got a lot they need to cover if they are starting at the hunter school. I am sure people will fall in love as it goes on as there is a ton of story in this series that that haven't even started to share in this first episode.

Honestly, there have been other reviewers to post this as well.  This adaptation from the Light Novels is barely comparable. The whole plot that you get from the light novels doesn't even exist here.  Yes, it is an actual story, with actual plot, actual threat, real situations that would make you wonder about your choice.  I don't like where they chose to Start with episode 1, they skipped so much, even with the flash back, you don't know anything.  They should have start with volume 1 page 1, instead of volume 3 (or 4) at page 50.  I really like the author and support their work, but this animation of said novels is not even a homage. *sadface*

Very unexpectedly fun series. It starts out very quick to where the joke timings are off. However, around episode 3, it's like they figured out how to pace everything and the anime picks up steam. I thought it was going to be a gag anime, but later starts getting serious.I might not find quite a few of the jokes they make that funny, and there are tons of Japanese cultural references, however, the story is good to where it stands by itself without the jokes. The story is pretty solid and it's been very fun. It's also a 12 series, so has the pros and cons of one (I just finished episode 8 before writing this review)

As can be seen in the comments of the videos and numerous other reviews, it's clear that this anime does not follow the source material. However! Despite that, what we get here is still an endlessly funny, likable and enjoyable anime that had me laughing and smiling every episode single episode. There's solid character development, great jokes, a fun, laid back story and lots of fun to be had! The art is bright and colorful, the music is fantastic and this show easily is one of the best of the season!If you're looking for a straight adaptation of books you've read, maybe give this a pass - judging from others' reactions. But if you haven't read the books, like me, you're in for a fun ride! Enjoy four goofball girls going on an adventure!Pros:Great musicFun charactersLovely 4th wall breaking humorWahoo-wahaa!Cons:Disloyal to source materialAction is secondary and it shows

Sad day, anime started off well and had a decent story (this anime isn't meant to have much of a plot). Seemed to jump around a lot to the point there was no real clear way to end the anime. Good example of what to do with anime like this is look at "Welcome to Demon School! Iruma-kun" that anime is not meant to be serious in anyway and still has a clear and surprisingly good flow of a plot. Even background stories are well done in that oneGood up to episode 7-ish.

Fun show geared for a younger audience. If you have read the novels, this becomes apparant pretty quickly. Its a fun , lighthearted show  with some serious bits within it. Characters are fun and have interesting/intense background stories. As mentioned earlier, the show feels made for a younger crowd so i can understand some things being changed and downplayed. I like this show. If you are interested in more development, check out the novels.

Misato Kurihara was an exceptional youth, standing above her peers in school, yet she never had friends nor her idea of a regular life. That all changed when she died though, in more ways than one. After dying, she actually awoke again, reincarnated in another world as Adele von Ascham. A chance at another life, a chance at an average life, this is what she dreamed of. However, her dying wish to be a girl with average abilities in the next life was taken a little too literally. Instead of being "average" she was reborn to have average abilities of all the living beings in her new world. In other worlds, she is in the middle of the food chain, in a fantasy world where humanity at its best could only dream to be in the middle of a food chain involving magical beasts. Misato under the alias "Mile" will continue to chase her simple dreams, even in the face of crazy situations.Didn't I Say to Make My Abilities Average in the Next Life?! is an isekai adventure comedy, with very "average" entertainment value. While the anime itself is incredibly similar to an anime like this year's (2019) Endro, Endro had a distinctly cute moe style, and a charming playfulness to it's comedy and script. Not to say that it's fall season counterpart (this anime) doesn't have it's own tricks up it's sleeve as a comedy adventure. Average in the Next Life's best comedy came from Mile's inability to be discrete about her reincarnation, constantly quoting or making references to otaku culture. On its own that probably doesn't sound stand out, but when Mile ends up getting her traveling companions mixed up in her otaku shenanigans is where it gets good. Seeing people who wouldn't normally be able to comprehend the idea of a television, get inspired and hyped up by their party member telling them about the power rangers is kinda great. The earlier episodes of this anime wear that shameless otaku pride on their sleeve, and it works. However, as the show went on I noticed a slow divert back into a generic (or average you might say) isekai adventure that we have all experienced before. That's not to say it wasn't entertaining to watch, I personally was just disappointed that the shameless otaku bits we're too far and few between. In all honesty it's a solid isekai anime, but as an anime in general, it's OK at best. I guess on that note if you're to ask me if you I would recommend it, I probably would tell you to instead watch Endro, THEN come back to Average in the Next Life if you want more of this moe comedy adventure style of isekai.

At the time of writing this review I'm gonna guess that I have one episode left. That being said, nothing can happen in that last episode that will change my opinion of what this show is.What we have here is an isekai fantasy anime that is trying to be very self-aware. Like my title says, it is a lot like Endro! but unlike Endro!, this show is desperate to be in on the joke with you. The story does a lot of dumb things, and then the characters kind of laugh and mention how dumb it is.Being in on the joke can be done well, but if you're looking for a fantasy isekai where things are ridiculous and it is in on the joke, you should watch KONOSUBA instead.As just a story, this is really just kind of bland. The characters don't really leave an impression. It's a real shame because I know that there is stuff there in the source material. In the end, this one promises a lot of potential that it never delivers on.In the end it just felt like an all female version of Wise Man's Grandchild (which I still think is the ultimate bland anime of the decade) and the cast being all female wasn't really enough to make this any more memorable...or any less bland...

Most people here are angry that this doesn't follow the manga or light novel or whatever it is (i only watched the anime) and are pretty angry about that. Most of the time i dont write reviews but im doing a short one here cause this needs (in my opinion) a better rating :/.So its another isekai, you get those alot nowadays but i liked this one.The story might be a bit confusing and it might be a bit cringy at times but looking over those things you can see its atleast average. (except for me cause i liked it)Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideIm looking forward to episode 12, even though i know this overpowered child will survive im still very curious of whats going to happen.epic fight will 100% go down and im calling that she will just stand up and walk to them after the fight is over, we'll have to see!

Your not gonna find anything special with this anime. I guess she is overpowered but she literally never shows any of it. I had no problem with a female protagonist but isn't this just weird to anyone else. she doesn't give any vibes that she's crazy OP or anything of the sort. I would love just a bit of fan service where she takes out something in one swoop but no I can't have that ig. It's an ok anime for a Monday morning nothing ground breaking. The side characters are interesting but honestly it feels as though they get more depth than the damn MC like wth is that all about but I digress. Give it a watch if you have time I'm a sucker for isekai so I can't really judge.

TL;DRWorth a watch, but read the source material after watching it if you can, if you already read it, turn your brain off and don't compare it. Just think of it as a parody of the series. Its average and I want to think that was the point lol.I am one of those that likes the source material, so my opinion may be a bit biased. While I admit I do enjoy it to some extent, its hindering its own potential.First, its a bit to quick to rush into the action, world building is important and especially in this series. The world is very well established in the source material and really draws you in unlike some other isekai. This adaptation only really fills in the blanks needed to understand the current situation, but kind of as an afterthought.Also this is its own series, the plot is barely associated with the source material (that I have seen so far). The main characters are the same, but that is about it. So long story short, you won't get a continuation of the series if you read the source material afterwards.The source material does a better job at making an engaging story, but this makes an entertaining one that will make you laugh here and there. Perfect in my mind if they have no plans for a season 2 to just make it a fun little series that does not take itself seriously. However that does not mean its a great series, likely once its over there won't be much reason to look back or reason to hope for a season 2.

I guess with average in the title it isn't that hard to expect anything but average from the anime. Mostly, there doesn't seem to be any sort of main focus for this anime. The main character just seems to go along with no real long term goal in mind; other then to try to have an 'average' life which she can enjoy.In a way this is a very 'comedic' approach to 'in another world' anime's that references a lot of other titles from time to time (Fist of the North Star and Dragon Ball to mention a couple); but so far that is about the only thing that makes this anime stand out. Really, with so many of these 'another world' animes coming out, I have to say this is probably something you should skip.

As may be obvious by now, when reading the other reviews, this anime is based off of a series of light novels. Supposedly.I say "supposedly" because it's a rather loose adaptation. Much of the early buildup gets glossed over entirely. We're giving a flying rodent as a narrator and mahou shoujo style sidekick (which supposedly represents the actual system in place; you can read more about that in the light novels). The magic systems in place aren't really expounded upon. All you need to know is that our main character is amazing at it, as expected.So if I had to give my marks on the adaptation aspect, this gets maybe 2 stars at the absolute most...Because it's pretty much a parallel--but ultimate disconnected--story. Too many things changed and too much depth was lost compared to the light novel to really call it a good adaptation. The tone is entirely different, and its aim is entirely different. The pivotal point in this regard is how much Reina's side story will be glossed over in this, and that will come next episode (5).So what does this leave us with? Basically OP cute girls cutely killing things in another world. That's more or less what's left of this.  In its own right, it actually isn't horrible. The production values are alright, the tone is kept fairly consistent, and the girls and their designs are cute. Their personalities also tick most otaku boxes. You have a (modernized) tsundere, tomboy, and kind-and-caring-but-scary-and-has-big-breasts for the companion cast. Fairly wide net. The main character is essentially just beyond a loli and is extremely intelligent but lacks common sense and is clumsy. A somewhat unique mixture that really doesn't make sense, considering how she was in her past life, but at least it's true to the LN.So judged on its own merits, it's okay. But kind of empty. Some arguments have been made that the author went into too much technobabble in their novel to begin with, but I didn't really see that. I read a few volumes myself, and IMO they kept it concise enough... unlike, say, Mahouka. The Mahouka light novels at times had more technobabble than actual development. In fact perhaps this was most of the time. The pacing in this is also too fast, but that's kind of expected. This likely isn't going to run beyond 12 episodes, and there is only so much that can be packed into that.I'm rambling a bit. TL;DR, it's a 2.5-3 star work that's passable in its own right, but as an adaptation it basically throws many of its roots and core content away.

When I first saw that this was getting an anime, I was super siked for it. Once the first couple of episodes dropped, It started showing me that this show does not follow the original story from the Light Novel nor the Manga of this series. Do yourself a favor and read the books instead, it's much better than this flaming garbageRevision: I originally made this review after watching the first episode because, in all honesty, the first episode is actually terrible. After cringing through the first 30 minutes of this show, it started to grow on me a tiny bit. The character's personalities stayed fairly close to the Light Novel, other than the reoccurring troupes, and I found myself enjoying the characters. I do feel that this is a massive downgrade to the Manga and Light Novel versions, but as a stand-alone, I can see why people like it.
