A hero exiled,dishonored and hated by everyone left to grow from the depth all by himself with satisfying fights and comebacks...Now if you'll excuse me I shall be waiting in a corner demanding a next season

Naofumi Iwatani is yet another victim of isekai selection, jokingly and literally speaking. He and three other young adult boys from modern-day Japan have been summoned to a fantasy world, the kingdom of Melromarc, they are to become its saviors. Every generation or so there is a cataclysmic collection of events known as the "waves", these hellish storms in the sky signal the end of the world, and bring along creatures of chaos and mass destruction. It is up to Naofumi and the other three to take up sacred weapons bound to the "four cardinal heroes" and push back the waves, saving the world. However, Naofumi's cardinal weapon is a shield, forcing him to be reliant on a party to do most of the fighting for him. When no one came to his side, a woman by the name of Malty Melromarc offered her service. Only a day later though, Malty falsely accuses Naofumi of sexual assault. Naofumi, severely punished, discriminated by the whole country,no one wishing to aid him, his fellow heroes abhorred by him, and only a shield bound to him as his only weapon. he is desperate. Fueled with anger and hatred, he works by himself and threatens biased merchants, up until he discovers his only chance left, a slave to fight for him. He manages to find one suited for his needs, a demi-human slave on the verge of death named Raphtalia, this is where the rise of the shield hero begins!It's a long description I know, but the first episode is a whole forty minutes long, context is necessary for anyone reading reviews before watching.The Rising of the Shield Hero has reached critical mass in the anime community, if it can keep it's hot streak going with say future anime seasons or consistent promising releases of manga/novel's for new readers of it's written material. Then we may have the next if not best isekai on our hands. That is if they can keep the fans happy, and the content consistent in the future, but what about the specifics of what we have now? Well straight away I can tell you if you wanna watch an isekai about a calculated cold-hearted badass, than Naofumi  is your protagonist! Hell I'd say he might even give Overlord's Ainz Ooal Gown a run for his money on the badass scale. The Saga of Tanya the Evil's Tanya Degurechaff is much more of a badass devil than both of them, but that's me getting off topic. Naofumi early on takes a mental and physical beating, the events around him shape him quickly into a great character for the fans themselves to flow their frustrations and angers through. Which makes all the payoffs in the anime that much better! Only to then have both Naofumi and the fans cool down when his party members Raphtalia and Filo come on screen. Kinda self-insert like when I say it out loud, but it is and isn't at the same time. Just like the title of my review, Naofumi is essentially an underdog, a damn good one that's awesome to watch to say the least. The world of the anime also feels very lively, making very clear statements and showcasing dilemmas that reinforce that the world is alive, and much more than a video game fantasy. The world feels alive, with the hero's actions affecting it, and Naofumi's journey is a hard fought one because of that. The fighting is intense and strategic, Naofumi's dialogue and actions always have a purpose or goal behind them, and everything he does is important to the progression of the narrative. It's all very exciting and got me hyped up each week. With this review though, marks the end of what we have currently in this anime adaptation, and I'm very excited to become a manga reader! With that I bid you adieu, and ask ya kindly to not let this one slip out of your mind. Add this to your queue today, you will not be disappointed.

The author forces it a bit too hard with the "Woe is me, everyone sucks and is trying to screw me over just because I have a Shield" and "All the other heroes are stupidSpoiler Alert! Click to show or hide(Except the rare moments I need them to not be stupid to move the story the way I want it to go, such as investigating the church and not getting killed in their trap)" sides of the story, but at least it creates a story more interesting than most in the genre.It would be a 5 star show if the author had written the same basic story without making it feel so forced at times, but it's still a good show/manga.

Refreshingly amazing anime with Beautiful aesthetic design. It has a different story than the typical anime. It tells the story of Naofumi (the protagonist) initially being unfairly treated, used and framed, all due to the fact that most of the country he was transported to wrongly believed the lies and manipulation of an organization that hate the legend of the shield hero. Without spoiling anything else, the rich history, the character development and interactions; the anime's intrinsic storytelling, and insanely cool animation easily rank it - in my humble opinion- amongst the best anime of this year.

The Rising of the Shield Hero is not an anime that I would usually enjoy. Ordinary boy transported into fantasy realm has never been interesting just because the characters almost never feel real. They have no connections or flashbacks to their homes or loved ones that got left behind during whatever incident has sealed them within an alternate realm.  To be honest, this one still has those same problems. But the inclusion of a world that is constantly out to demonize the shield hero and the myriad of interesting relationships, powers, and lore make it far easier to forget about the problems that I see. 4 out of 5 stars for me.  P.S. I do have to say that the other heroes' propensity to believe ludicrous lies with proof of the opposite laid bare in front of them is quite annoying. Especially in the most recent episode as of this review (Ep. 13).

ok so i was baked when i watched this show and accidentally watched the second episode first and it made sense, not sure what went down in the first but hey who knows. its got some adorable things in it. birds and the like. but lemme be real with you right quick im knew to this seasonal anime thing ive got a few under this belt but man one of them episodes had me so pumped for the next that i was dying until it came out. id imagine this show as the brunette sorority chick for the first few episode and then it becomes a big TT goth GF for the rest its dang poppin. imma be hitting this site with some mad reviews right quick. my friend said hes never seen the show but he gotta thing for Coons so im guessing hell give it 5 stars too

I can easily say that I look forward to this anime more than most anime that I am watching at the moment, nine in particular. The plot and characters are interesting and bring a roller-coaster ride vibe. What's going to happen next? Another well thought-out cliffhanger...The love for some characters and the hate for a specific character. (The hated character is on par with Sugou from SAO, hint hint*)As much as I enjoy Reincarnation as a Slime this season, I am always more excited to watch the new episode of The Rising of the Shield Hero every week. And Raphtalia...Oof! <3

When you normally think of an Isekai you probably think back to SAO or Log Horizon, but for The Rising of The Shield Hero it's a completely different take on the genre. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideNot only is the main character clueless to this type of world, but he's being put up against all odds by every other character that only want to see him fail This is 100% a must watch if you enjoy the Isekai genre!

This is the first review I have written. This is not the norm for me. It starts out very cliche with the first episode. But if you have enough patience to get through at least 3 episodes you will have found a real Gem! A real diamond in the rough. The genre is cluttered with a lot of anime that never really pulls at your emotions. Not in the way that this one does. I felt real frustration on behave of the Shield Hero, for how he was treated.

i'm a little late, but just binge watched what's available.. the lead up to "thrown into a fantasy land" wasn't horrible.. he's an otaku, but an average otaku so that's pretty cool.. he acts more relatable than the other heroes.. the contempt toward the shield hero seems a bit overdone to the point i was immediately suspicious of the swindler. although, to be fair, he was one of four summoned and he had Nothing else to go on. i particularly liked when he threw the last few silvers away, it completely set the stage and showed his integrity. i'm hoping we get an explanation later aside from "shields are less limelight in mmorpgs" lol.. as for just how horribly he is treated, it seems like a plot device but in honesty i appreciate how well it reflects the less than ideal aspects of human society.. i like the dynamic of his partner, but the 12 to 20 in 2 episodes thing is just kind of obnoxious.. i know they wrapped it up a bit cheaply with that leveling explanation and also tied that down to a demi-human characteristic.. it's just not working for me.. the timeline of impending doom every month is also a big load to swallow.. the battle at lute village was great to watch, but honestly i feel the cast of konsuba would be better equipped against the impending swarms of devastation..i do however enjoy the main character and his approach to surviving.. i don't mind the game interface during the skills, crafting, and battles because inserting mmorpg structure into a fantasy story adds more than it takes away.. i'm curious if he will outlevel the other heroes and at what point they'll need to cooperate.. i got the impression that the "waves" are going to get worse and they aren't the solitary problem.. as for the spear hero, i feel his character can go in any direction at this point.. he could be comedic rival, or it can go to a really, really bad place with the influence of the horrible people on his side. it doesn't seem likely though because naofumi's character and good deeds will ultimately outshine harsh rumors and foul play. also i think Motoyasu's character would need to turn into a Complete mindless prick..in any case, the pacing and structure of the show are quite good.. not sure how i feel about randomly bought ostrich turning into a naked cherub girl.. i'm invested enough to watch more episodes.. as long as the direction of the show keeps pace without getting any laziermroarr spice + squirrel girl

If you watch the first episode and you feel like your body feels like its burning with anger,as well as you think why is the story like this why. Then it means this show or plot is in the right place its got your attention now follow it through, as it story will lead you through one heck of a coaster ride!Animation is crisp and main character voice acting is on point he really gets the mood and feeling of the shield hero from the manga, hence this Shield hero will grow on you.Well if you this show has made you go through a roller coaster of emotions I doubt I need to say much more, just follow it through the coaster just began!

OH MY GOD I have not been this excited about a new anime since, well overlord first premiered, and even that didnt compare to this. this is an isekai that is like none i've seen so far and i am already in love on episode 1 this is the FIRST ANIME  since i started watching anime 8 years ago that has me so hooked from ep 1 not only that it is the VERY FIRST anime in 8 years that i have decided i will read the manga for, i have not read a single other animes manga... out of the hundreds i've seen and loved, this anime here has reminded me of why i fell in love with anime, and makes me feel like im watching my first and till now favorite non-mainstream anime Jyu-Oh-Sei all over again

I became a fan of the series when I started reading the manga adaptation of the novels, and was thoroughly impressed by both the manga and the first episode of this anime adaptation. I like isekai as a genre, but at the same time I'm disappointed with the number of isekai's that are more poorly written (your "In Another World with my Smartphone"s and the like).  My two favorite ways to handle isekai are explorations of the true absurdity of the genre (a la Konosuba) and the truly horrific/dramatic (like Re: Zero).While we still get some comedic entries for isekai, Rising of the Shield Hero scratches the same itch that Re: Zero did. After an initial twenty minutes of "oh this is your generic isekai," Shield Hero throws a massive wrench into the gears before flipping the table. I enjoy this series and look forward to the rest of the anime. If the quality and faithfulness of the adaptation is the same for the rest of the series as it was for episode 1, then you can bet I'll be watching weekly.

I will update the review at the end of the series.Much like School-life Comedy/Romance was the most popular genre among Anime adapted from light novels of the 2000s, issekai has become the dominant genre of 2010s. Each story is crafted with a main character summoned to another world, which usually resembles an MMO or is an MMO, and each story has their own stick to differentiate them from what would be arguably the most stale genre at this point and the story ends with a main character getting a harem.  Most of the time the Main character is gifted in a way that earns the immediate acceptance from most of the world or at least commands respect.  This ones seems to begin with a very different stick. The Main character  is summoned as a loser, over the course of the first episode for reasons comes to hate the world he lives in. Giving this series probably the a dark and gritty tone that I have not seen since say the Saga of Tanya Evil.

This is a very interesting start. Just like "That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime", this one takes a spin on the trope. There is this man, who isn't anti-social, but just a nobody; perfect for Isekai.Opening a book, he is summoned along with 3 others. The only problem is that he is the butt monkey, having a shield and not allowed to use a weapon. The other 3 have their weapons, but are arrogant or jerks.When it comes time to gain an ally, the Shield Hero, gets nobody.Then the formula begins to change, and he begins to adapt, taking on more of an anti-hero. Also this title doesn't seem to be a permanent-isekai, rather, he has to complete his mission before he can go back home.I think this title won't be about trying to rule the world, but rather develop himself into a person with confidence, growing up in a way in a new world, that really isn't meant for people excited to arrive in a new world.

honestly with every isekai anime i tend to go into them expecting the worst since alot of them usually follow the format where the MC is op af and has a huge harem of girls however with this one it's different. The MC at first was living a good life until he was betrayed and lost everything and to top things off he has the "weakest" legendary item out of the 4 legendary heroes. looking forward to seeing future episodes and might even read ahead in the manga when i can.

This, so far, managed to have good twists and plot points that did not feel to obvious, it has amazing and simple world building, and manages to keep the edgy main character, while giving them a good personality as well. the animation and sound are really well done, the bits and pieces of 3d animation are hard to pick up on. it gets nearly full marks in almost every way you can judge an anime. as long as it does not go south, we are in for an awesome ride.

I think we have all seen plenty of "sucked into another world" anime, and they tend to follow a similar tale of the hero being summoned, and exalted, and either they're working to get back to their own world, or they were so miserable in their own world that they are glad to be here. Usually the plot goes no where aside from that, and it's slapstick-y. Or you can predict how the whole thing will go because there isn't much depth to it.This anime is not that. There are some weird video game-esq items that crop up, but it kind of adds a certain charm to this anime. Instead of having a hero that's exalted, we watch the struggle of someone who cannot catch a break, and how those struggles really shape him and help him grow in the ways needed. Plus, there's a lot of enjoyable moments, the characters are pretty fleshed out, and you truly end up on the ride of this plot. I also really appreciated that the reverse-harem-girls-fawning-everywhere or over-the-top-love-interest was non-existent. There's definitely an undercurrent of emotions, but it is not the forefront of this anime. It's so refreshing.Overall it's incredible, and totally worth the watch. I don't want to say too much else because I don't want to spoil it. Definitely will be keeping my eyes peeled for season two!

Isekai. Traveling to another world from ours. The genre has been very popular in recent years thanks to light novels, but its been a genre used for quite a long time in anime.If you google Isekai you'll see a picture of this anime in the first post. Its there for a reason. The Rising of the Shield Hero is definitely one of the best animes out there and probably the best Isekai (or at least among the best) and this series isn't even done yet (season 2 and 3 are already confirmed which isn't a big surprise after its been such a hit).Without spoiling the story I'll just say this anime features an amazing cast of characters with an also amazingly done isekai storyline. The MC and his companions drive the show though and watching them change over the course of the series is quite a ride from the start of the show to the end. There are no fillers. Every episode leads the plot forwards and develops the characters. The animations, voice acting, music...its just all so good. Expect a good amount of character development/plot development episodes with some good battles and big decision moments done correctly.I've watched the show twice already and will likely be watching it again. Its just that darn good.TLDR list:Harem? No. Cover can be misleading, but No.Romance? There isn't really a "romance", but the are a good amount of feelings throughout the series.Comedy? Some, but not much.Action? A good amount.Maturity? Tailored towards adults/teens. It can get pretty darkCharacter development? Tons.Fan Service? Very little.Completed? No.More seasons Coming? Yes and Confirmed for at least 2 more seasons.

I just have to say, this anime might start off a little slow. But, if you give it a chance you will not be disappointed. It has an amazing story and the characters and their bonds are really well developed. Not going to give anything away but I know I am not alone when I say that we have to get a season 2 & even more. I will learn to become fluent in Japanese just to speak to whoever it takes to convince them to keep on producing and making more of this series.

As a person who read the manga first, I am completely disgusted at how badly they ruined Naofumi's character as well as the Queen's.  What happened to the Naofumi that was seething with hatred and vengeance? Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideWhy the hell did he STOP the execution later on?  Why did the Queen hesitate to exact capital punishment on her family for their high treason?  Are these events supposed to make them seem more 'human'?  Bull.  The Queen is just that, a QUEEN.  She is supposed to have an indomitable will to perform any task for the betterment of her kingdom.  Naofumi is a man wronged by a nation, wrongfully ostracized by its people, had his pride destroyed, and was left for dead.  He wants revenge for the hell that he was put through, but at the end of the show he turns out to be a pathetic man that just gives in to his weak morality.Take a quick look over to the same scene in the manga when the Queen indicts her family and it plays out entirely different. The Queen asks Naofumi what he would like to do with them and he yells out, without hesitation, to execute them.  She then explains that she cannot do that, not because of petty personal reasons or emotions, but because that would show weakness to enemy nations and might invite war.  As a compromise, the Queen then suggests extreme torture of her own daughter and husband. Flaying them alive, tearing off their limbs, giving them a world where they'll wish for death. She says this coldly and unflinchingly.  This shocks everyone in the room and leaves Naofumi looking at them in pure hate, imagining their suffering.While Naofumi does still go with the rename of the princess and king, he still maintained that pure anger and loathing he had up until that point. In the show, that anger becomes a pale shadow of what it started as very quickly. To this point in the manga, he is still extremely reluctant to fight alongside the other heroes, only doing so because Fittoria requests he do so or they will all fail. He does not make friends with them and barely tolerates them only after they were put in their place by the Queen.  While his anger is mostly sated, it has left deep scars on his personality, making him a very rough and jaded individual. It's a shame his anime counterpart is such a pathetic meek pushover and in comparison. There are a few other points that I have complaints about, but they are nothing in comparison to the bastardization of Naofumi and the Queen's characters.

This anime was just amazing to watch and is a nice refresher to what i normally watch. It's been some time since I've been looking for anime that gets me into the story. The story is well written along with great animation plus the character development is just on another level. It reminds me of how the older anime were where they would develop the character and not just do small one offs like the newer anime seem to be doing. The problems that Naofumi faces are relatable to actual real life situations in the sense of how he is feeling and how it affects him not just internally but how he see's things around him. If you haven't seen this yet better get on it and hopefully when they announce season 2 it will be just as amazing to watch as season 1

While on the surface this seems like your run of the mill fantasy Anime through the first couple of episodes the situation changes dramatically. Without giving away too much our 'Hero' is soon vilified and turns mean. 10/10 it got me angry seeing what happens to him and it is very rare for any show let alone an anime to elicit such an emotional response from me. Highly recommend just for that, but the general story arc is also very compelling and fun to watch.

Just, take a moment of your time to watch the first episode. You will then be immersed by the story line, a man has a decent life, nothing to do but go to the library when he's broke. (Fair enough) Then he picks up this particular book, and gets sucked into this world that he has no idea where he is at. However, he's not alone. Along with him is three other different people from different dimensions. However, I shall not spoil it any further. Enjoy my friends, have a lovely day.

This show started off amazing. I thought it was going to become on of my favorite isekais. I liked the conflict and the characters to an extent. But, the driving force of conflict in the show (the lies about naofumi) gets resolved. Awkwardly though, the conflict still exists after even though they cleared his name. The bow hero and sword hero are supposed to be smart, but now they are stubborn boneheads? The social interactions seem a bit harem/forced after. I enjoyed the show though overall. It had a lot more potential than it showed in the second half. We will see how season 2 goes.

Overview:A brilliant take on the Isekai genre that delivers heavy punches in the first half, but softens out to a more average, if still well produced, character driven story. Definitely worth a watch, with great visuals, but don't expect to have the same emotional impact as the LN/ Manga does as the story progresses.I would recommend giving this series a watch.Full Review:For me, this series came out of nowhere, and the first episode was such a whiplash of emotions that I was instantly hooked. Within the first 3 episodes, I went to check out the companion Manga, and then the Light Novels as well to catch up on the story. It takes the Isekai genre and tweaks it into something new and different which is always refreshing in a deluge of power fantasies and overpowered LN protagonists.It does stay fairly close to the LN and companion Manga, which is certainly nice to see, and adds enough visuals to really make this a great series. There are some drawbacks to how they adapted the series, however. Most notably is the filing down of the edginess of Naofumi, and the environment in general. A strong start, but I feel almost as if the writers and animators lost their drive to hit as hard as the Manga/ LN does which is the main charm of the source material.As such, the anime starts out spectacularly, but slowly falls into being a high quality but not-as-unique story by the end of the series. By softening the blows the main character both gives and takes emotionally, it winds down to an end after the second major arc completes, and leaves the series wonderfully closed but without the drive that continues the story forward in the LN/ Manga.Some of this drift can even be felt in the two OPs, as the first OP hits hard, gives emotional context, but doesn't reveal too much. The second OP is more of a collection of events that will be happening in the second part of the series, and the emotional context is lost in a future slideshow of sorts. The fluidity of the animation likewise changes between the first and second halves, as does the main method of character interaction. In the first half, a lot of the interaction is done in combat, and the non-combat is montage'd except for important events. The second half focuses more on the inter-character relationships, but loses a lot of the pacing to do so, although it finds its feet again towards the end.Overall, I like how they adapted the series, but think that it does put a cap on the story that continues on in the LN/ Manga which may make any future installments take a different path. I'm not a fan of how much they softened Naofumi up, and downplayed just how much crap he takes, but it did make the anime much less of a continual gut punch, and even gives it a happy ending in what the LN/ Manga have as a small interlude before the next emotional hit.

I have never became captivated by an anime so quickly. Many animes have a long build up period that take quite of bit of episodes/story building before I become fully engrossed. This was not the case with shield hero, within the first few episodes I was hooked. Great plot-line and extensive character development, despite being a relatively short anime (25 episodes, although the story will undoubtedly continue). If you are looking for an anime that will captivate your interest quickly and doesn't require an extensive time investment (100+ episodes), then do yourself a favor and watch The Rising of the Shield Hero.

In my opinion this is one of the finer animes in circulation right now being a hit and spot on depiction of the isekai genre it features many characters that you can relate too and is by far a all around performer when it comes to plot, presentation, quality, and character development. The story is progressing at a moderate pace to the manga and it shows great promise.  Now to just pray they make a game adaptation online or for consoles Like naruto Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideAlso this anime is very detailed and the info screens are not viewed a lot by the anime so do not blame the show if you get confused by some of the terms.

Absolutely loved the main character and his friends.  Animation is great, however there is some rough CGI parts throughout.  Voice acting is fantastic.  Started off really strong but started to seem kind of rushed towards the end but didn't ruin the show for me.  Overall one of my favorite shows I've watched recently, here's to hoping for season 2!  Also must reiterate how much I love the characters!

The creators struck the right balance between showing the slow growth of the characters, as well as pacing the larger story arcs.  Some of the events are out of the order from the novels, which if you've read them, made it kind of confusing, but overall they kept the essence of the conflicts, betrayals, and resolutions together.   I did miss seeing the mountain sized turtle disaster though.Not sure that we'll see any more anime adaptions in this series (which is still on-going), but its a great introduction into this universe.

Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideIn most shows they sometimes follow the cliche of having characters that are ultimately accepted and always reach their designated goals, however this show is different as our main character starts off as an outcast who isn't accepted by any of his pears, it shows the struggles he had to deal with and the experiences he had and is truly a wonderful anime.Hopefully there will be a season 2!

As a first review from me, I can't promise to go into extreme detail, nor can I promise to write a good review.That said, this one shocked me. The character development was astounding to say the least, with a near complete turnaround that wasn't too fast nor too slow, and staying believable the entire time. Naofumi certainly holds top ranking for a character in my eyes because of that. Raphtalia went from a small scared child to a fighter capable of taking on anything else, and certainly plays the part of the Hero's Sword, as well as being a comfort to Naofumi when it is most needed. Heroine of the year for sure with her own development over the course of the season. Filo got the short end of the stick, but still had development worth noting, while retaining the child-like innocence within that growth. There is certainly much more to be done with her.Without getting too far into spoilers, this is a must watch for anyone that enjoys development and world building. The show has it's highs and lows much like any other but the lows are seldom and last for mere minutes at a time. The highs are constant and not always the same. Victories are hard won, with the cliché overpowered heroic boost only seen once the entire run. But even that one unforeseen boost took it's toll, leaving little doubt that the use of such power is to be used only as an absolute last resort.   There is definitely more to be done, but for 25 episodes much more was accomplished than I thought could be done within the first season, assuming a second season is coming at time of writing.

I feel the best way to describe something of this nature is with a 1-10 scale, which I'd give this one a 9.5  (cause nothing is perfect...). I have 4 things I look for: (1) Overall Animation - 9.0. There are very animated feats shy of Final Fantasy that I'd give a 10.0 to, a 9.0 still means it is great, just always something to be desired (due to budget restraints, etc).(2) Action Animation - 9.5, darn near perfect in my opinion. I wish the fights were longer (They are decently long, I'm just greedy because they are awesome). (3) Story/Drama - 10.0. I'm not going to ruin it for you, but man, the drama is real and very powerful. Very well crafted and balanced, you may find tears in your eyes one moment and the next, feel burning rage. This is the sign of a good story I feel. (4) Character development - 10.0. Characters are solid yet flexible enough to flow with the events around them (they are capable of growth and regression). Characters you hate one day may simmer to a more neutral feeling later due to growth. Watching Naofumi's personal growth from the start to the end was quite a journey. I took extra time to write this because the anime is worth it. Truly an anime to watch.

This is honestly one of the most enjoyable anime I've watched recently. From start till the end everything such as the animations, fights, character, and the story feel really well done and super interesting. I recommend watching this to anyone who loves Isekai where MC enters a game-world. I would say this that this is nothing like others and has its own uniqueness. Can't wait for season 2.

There are anime, where hype is bigger than actual quality of the show... and then there are shows like The Rising of the Shield Hero.Honestly, i was geniuenly and very positively suprised about quality. You can see how much work was put into it- animation is great, art is stellar, story, while having some tropes, is interesting and relatively unique. And characters... honestly, one of best parts of the show. Everyone goes trough more or less character development- now, not exactly on MHA level, but still. Seeing Naofumi, Raphtalia, Filo and others develop troughout the course of the story is real treat to behold!I should probably warn that there are some pretty dark themes in anime, such as false accusation of rape or slavery. First half of season one is definetly more dark. But dont worry, it still has lighter momentsOverall, i have to say this is definetly one of my favourite animes of all time.Cant wait for season 2! Hope it will be announced soon.

There are a lot of positives with this series. The art is great, the characters are interesting (well, most of them), the voice acting is good, and the RPG theme (similar to that of Goblin Slayer) works out great.I'd recommend that any anime fan atleast check it out.Then we have the negatives. 1. The story is good in general, but it is driven in large part by the main characters being temporarily stupid. It's like the writers (much like a certain pair of writers that GoT fans are familiar with) can't write a story with consistently intelligent characters. At several points you'll see characters become uncharacteristically stupid simply because it's needed to start a conflict or push the story forward.2. You don't get to know the main character well enough. His inner monologue isn't always available when it's needed. Many of his reasons will be hidden, and not in a way that makes him more endearing.3. Not enough character exposure. There's probably a fancier way to say it. Like I said, the characters are interesting, and you will probably want to learn more about them. The series doesn't give you enough. It's as if the writers are skipping past a bunch of interesting dialogue and character background just to get to the action.

well, i was not expecting this. i open my Facebook feed and crunchyroll is advertising this show. OK, i mean its been a while. I'll give it a shot, last thing i saw was Jojo. starting from the first episode i became entranced by this show, i needed more, way more. at the time of writing episodes up to 23 are out. and man, OH MAN does this one deliver. you've got some tropes, some 'usual anime' stuff, but this show is so character driven it amazes me. each one plays off each other in a meaningful way, everyone has distinct motives, unique personalities that are not overplayed for edgy or kawaii reasons, and the dynamic is so fluid it felt like some of my best D&D sessions. im like 25 and i cried with the characters. that is weird for me. im stoic at best, but somehow this show caught me by the heartstrings.without spoiling anything, i adore the shield hero, his arc, his journey, i mean they don't call it rise of the shield hero for nothing. he has a relatable character. i found myself so involved with figuring out how he faced his obstacles, showed mercy to those who wronged him, and came out on top of it all. i will patiently wait for more episodes, i am sure they will deliver more of this incredible plot line.

I didn't know what to expect when I began to see this new anime get so much popularity in such a short time span.So upon arrival it came to a shock to me how good it is, leading me to crave for more. After school everyday I would binge watch this with an everlasting curiosity, sparking my imagination even further with this more modern take of an MMO more so a human being trapped in this world and having to beat the levels to escape.On instinct you would compare this to SAO in that world of beauty and a powerful protagonist. That being said these 2 animes are NOTHING A LIKE.The first episode is a shock wave, to me so revolutionary yet so realistic in this day and age as the beginning of this anime is so meticulously put together making you crave more.The animation is really impressive for me in particular.Unpopular opinion; but it makes me want to refrain from reading the manga and YouTube lore videos and savor myself up each week for a new episode

I finally watched the shield hero up to episode 21 on Crunchyroll and I really enjoyed this anime so now I am waiting for the rest of the episodes to air on Crunchyroll and now I am really hoping for a second season to the rising of the shield hero. When I watched this anime I really felt sad for the character Naofumi because no matter who you are a men or a woman lies do hurt good people in some cases. Lately I started losing interest in some anime's when they are about the main character being super strong/overpowered like with dragon ball z it is still a good anime but now I am just not interested that kind of anime right know I would like to see more anime where they start of weak but then become strong later. It is sad that some people just can't get passed the first episode of the series but some people have anime's that they like or don't like with me I wish more people would like this anime Seisen Cerberus and I am hoping it gets dubbed in English some day.

I am super hyper-critical of anything in the media pertaining to my sports. I played volleyball for about 8 years as a Middle Blocker and occasionally an Outside Hitter (Wing Spiker left side aka Asahi and Tanaka) but Haikyu!! wins everything and probably the sole reason I want to play so badly againThe sequences when they're playing are absolutely gorgeous. True to form and technique it looks like they're really playing. The matches themselves are intense, and I get the same feelings watching them as I did when I played in similar scenarios.I love that each character has a set of defining strengths and weaknesses in regards to how they play. And I love that this is a team that stops the bs at the door and that they can come together as a team and communicate with each other and win.The only thing that kinda irks me is some of the translations on the terminology. I can live with that

Haikyu!! is entertaining, thrilling, and is ideal as a sports anime. It has minor flaws, but I'M IN LOVE.  ITS AMAZINGx100001. Characters The characters are different. Unlike what we'd imagine, the main character isn't a complete idiot who "works hard" and makes it happen, nor is he an amazing talent. He's just athletic and a giant ball of energy compressed into a boy. He has the right amount of flaws, but is, I guess, the right amount of 'awesome' to make up for it. The thing I like about this character, and all the characters in this anime, is that they're very easy to empathize with. The side characters have hilarious personalities, and weren't just created as generic trash because they weren't the main characters. Thankfully. (My favorite side character is Tsukishima. Man, he's great.) Almost all the characters develop in some way. The changes may seem a little quick to come, but it makes sense. Why did they change like that? It's never some dumb reason, you can understand why and how they develop throughout the anime. Thumbs up for that. 2. Plot In retrospect, the plot is similar to most sports animes. (Joining a club, training to win. Win.) However, instead of just making the goal something cliche like beating a long time rival, there's a small twist! The thrilling arcs and interesting episodes, characters, and games keep the plot from falling flat into a spiral of bore. I also want to cry in happiness and kiss this anime because THE PACE IS AMAZING. The fillers (if they were even counted as fillers) were short, to the point, and wasn't unnecessarily long *coughnarutocough*. They didn't even take up half of an episode. The anime also doesn't drag out the games for 3 episodes; the games are the perfect length to get the thrill, the suspense, and the relief while managing to still keep us on our toes for the next episode. Gawd, it's great. As you might have read from the other animes, this anime is also hilarious. It's not overpowering the overall anime, but there's just enough to keep you laughing throughout the episodes and actually enjoy watching. 3. Art/ProductionThe art is very, very pretty. It doesn't look half-done at all (which was the problem I had with a lot of sports animes) and the characters actually look different, instead of having all the same face but with different hair and eye color. (...) Some have sharp features, some have soft, and they're all built differently so they actually seem like a group of real people. 4. SoundtrackThe opening is not bad, but it's not good. It kind of lacks the hype you actually get from the anime, but no matter, it doesn't hurt to listen to at all. The rest of the soundtracks are well-fit for each scenario as well. The seiyuus (I watched the sub-version) are well fit for the characters. None of their voices are annoying. Yay. SO BADA55. IT'S AMAZING. HAVE TO WATCH THIS GUYS. SDKJHFGFKJH

To be honest I didn't find it interesting at all. Volleyball is not exciting to me. Then one day I ran out of anime to watch. Then I was like 'what the heck' and tried out this anime. I  totally regret calling it uninteresting. I wish I would of watched it sooner. This sports anime really keeps you on your toes with excitement, suspense, and anticipation. Let me just say if you think this anime will be a snooze fest well think again, and watch the damn thing. (excuse my language.)

Truly in a league of its own, Haikyu!!, with its solid plot, interesting, makes-you-genuinely-care-for-them characters and heart-pounding matches, is what all Sports anime should be, or at least strive to be.A petite, un-athletic girl, I never cared about sports, or competitions for that matter...let alone volleyball. After watching this series, not only did I gain knowledge about the sport and its technicalities, but I also got "converted" into caring for the sport itself! It made me see volleyball (and sports in general) in a whole new light that I actually want to try it for myself. For an anime to be able to inspire and spark you into action is pretty amazing, don't you think?Lastly, if there was a standout reason why I enjoyed the series so much, it has to be  the MC, Hinata Shouyou, who is an absolute joy to watch and truly an inspiration worth emanating. He embodies what holds true for most successful athletes: unbreakable will, fierce determination, and the mindset to overcome his physical limitations (his lack of height) and not letting them hold him back from pursuing his dream of becoming Japan's best.

From a sports anime fan's point of view, I can say that I really enjoy this anime and find it awesome. Based on watching 8 Episodes, the feels, the action, the pacing, the laughter and the character development are especially there! Needless to say, it compares well to the likes of Kuroko's Basketball and Ace of the Diamond. Where it is going right now seems in the total right direction! Almost every character has a likable side as well! A very good anime to watch and is a must for any sports anime fan!

For those of you who don't understand the idiom or think it's a grammar mistake, it's not. In my opinion, the 2nd season should have been announced like 10 episodes in. I've watched Kuroko no Basket's 1st season and enjoyed it, and though I haven't watched the 2nd season yet, I'm glad that its series has been successful enough to warrant a 3rd season next year. I can only hope that Haikyu!! follows in Kuroko's positive reception, and have the production company spit out as many seasons as possible. The characters are lovable, hilarious, and admirable. For those who haven't read the manga, you need to go ahead and do that right now!

I was never the biggest sports anime fan, but many people had told me about this series so i decided to give it a shot. Deep down I wondered how a volleyball show would be any good. Immediately I got a certain feel from the show that I hadn't felt before and it keep growing on me after every episode. The cast of characters are brilliant and have enough meat behind them to feel really fleshed out. I didn't know much about volleyball at all, but the show does an excellent job explaining the rules or describing what happened without it feeling drawn out. I played basketball and football in high school and the characters and situations were very relateable. There were actually many moments were I stood and applauded with the team and there were also many emotional moments as well. Lastly I want to point out that the show does a brilliant job showing the opposing side's point of view and even makes you feel a little bad when they lose, even though they're the enemy! I was very pleasantly surprised with this show and I'm very glad I gave it a shot! 5/5 for sure!

The characters are all vivid and distinct, with perfect voice acting. It's not a comedy, but the writers slip in small gags with perfect timing. The animation style is clean and always well-executed. I also like that the show shows the team beginning to get along well and that there's some strife at the beginning. This is probably one of my favorite anime in the last few years, along with Chihayafuru. I love this show, watch it now!

I love this show! I love the way it keeps you waiting, the way it excites you, the way you feel like you are part of the team. I am a girl so I am not keen to sport shows but, I always check them out. When I checked this out I thought it was okay but, the real addiction came later when I couldn't stop thinking about it. I love wanting to watch a show but only one a day to keep the anticipation going, to keep it interesting. The character evolution is amazing. For example how well they started to warm up to each other in the matches. This show made volleyball more exciting.To be so BLUNT I F______ LOVE THIS SHOW!Please don't delete, it is the best way to express  it....

First of all i'm a HUGE sports anime fan and therefore i have watched a lot of shows of the genre.That said, Haikyuu!! is easily one of the best ever created. We have amazing character design, great animation, awesome characters, heart-warming moments, scnes that will make you laugh out loud...Everything is put together perfectly.Is not as good as Slam Dunk because it lacks its sense of "coming of age", but it's simply entertaining.

A lovely animation of the characters' motivation and undying love for Volleyball.  Shows the characters' relationships with each other and their developments along with the moderate pacing of the show. The bromance and rivalry between Hinata and Kageyama was something as a viewer to look forward too. It is a must watch for people who are new to sports anime or have a growing interest for sports anime in general.  Makes you appreciate what the anime has to offer!

I am not a fan of the anime for Eyeshield21 and Kuroku basketball. But sports anime always have an exciting appeal. But volleyball? I played volleyball in high school. I must see this! Volleyball isn't nearly as mainstream as soccer or rugby or other big sports but it is a sport to be taken seriously. And the main character radiates his passion right away! The characters in this title are not afraid to show a little more emotion. Expect great things from each character as they develop in character and in strength. The animation is pretty fitting in that it gives you that feeling of intense movement and dynamicity.

Pros:- Easily one of the best sports titles out- Not a single character is unlikable- No one is a prick this time around- Ending is surprisingly good for what it does- Females are few and far between, but are definitely cute when on screen- Chemistry between the cast of characters one of the best I've seen in recent memory- Surprisingly Realistic for a sports anime, there is never a time when a team is completely destroying another team *cough cough* Eyeshield 21 *cough cough* every game that is played is close and every character minus a few freshmen are utilized.- Bench is actually a factor unlike shows like Kuroko's Basketball where it is not used at all- None of the players feel superhuman. The idea that they are talented stays, but unlike how some other sports titles attempts to show you their awesomeness through super human feats, this stays to the realistic side of things for the most part. If anything is done that seems like it is OP, more often than not it was just luck.Cons:- Ending is not the ending, there is going to be a Season 2, which is nice, but not an ending.- Very little time is made up over the 25 episodes, making this feel like it will be a slow paced show in terms of the timeline- not sure how volleyball is, but this show uses alot of the same animations over and over again to the point where it can wear on you. Spikes are all the same, and usually the setups are the same as well.- Music is sub par this time aroundHaikyu!! in the nutshell: Arguably one of the best sports titles ever to be created, there is no denying it's a fun watch for any anime fan.

I really shouldn't be writing a review, because the last episode hasn't even aired yet (I think Sunday is the seasons last episode), but I couldn't wait. I started this anime for the giggles, not thinking much of it. The only other sports anime I have watched is Free!!, so I was expecting Haikyuu to be like that. Boy, was I wrong. At first, I actually REALLY didn't like this anime. I found Hinata and Kageyama to be unbearable, and I remember only liking about 3 characters at first out of the many. However, over time the characters grew on me. Why? CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT. It was incredible to see how the love of a sport is what got these kids to break old habits and form new bonds. While Kageyama still struggles with his past struggles, the fact that he's trying and is WILLING to trust his team mates is a refresher. Hinata's character at first bothered me just because he was so obnoxious. But his seriousness about what he loves to do and his fighting spirit is what finally led me to enjoy his character. I finally realized that my frustrations with these characters were BECAUSE they were good characters. Good characters are supposed to make you FEEL something, whether it's irritation, happiness, motivated. Let me tell you, this show had me on the edge of my seat. I was rooting for Karasuno Volleyball team the whole way, and just WANTED them to win! It was like I was part of the team. They motivated me. This show makes me want to pick up a sport again. And finally, the scene that got me the most:((SPOILER))Episode 24, after credit scene. The fact that this show got me to feel like I was part of the team, and felt like //I// lost the game as well, is something to be applauded. I've BEEN there. I used to play softball, and after a tough game (and losing) we'd all remain quiet, even while we ate. And while we didn't necessarily cry, we sure wanted to. Haikyuu portrayed that feeling phenomenally, and the fact that a sports anime (that some would think is a stupid show about boys hitting a ball), can convey such a raw emotion is something that baffles me. It really is a work of art. ((END OF SPOILERS))There were a few aspects that had me rate it around a 4 out of 5 instead of giving it a full rating. Some parts would get a bit repetitive and boring, and the fact that it took a while for me to finally be enthralled with the show. Anything else I found "wrong" would be because of my personal preference of things.

I've got to say that Haikyu!! has proven itself a highly character driven show with each new team member having their own unique personality and hang-ups. Some of them do fall into clichéd roles, but hey, no group can be all original. The main character duo in many aspects actually remind me of another main character duo I was cheering for a few years ago - the boys from Ookiku Furikabutte (Big Windup!) and I've gotta say, I loved that show. So if Haikyu!! keeps on course it's got a lot of potential to hang a trophy right next to Ookiku Furikabutte as one of my favorite sports show.My biggest endorsement for the show? I'm not big into sports - any sports - not by a long shot, but I'm big into Haikyu!!Side notes: Even though all the main volleyball players showcased on the team are experienced players Haikyu!! does a good job of explaining aspects of the game to viewers who haven't ever really followed the sport. The team's teacher/advisor plays that "clueless" role, but he wants to learn and is enthusiastically dedicated to getting the guys practice matches, a coach, and gives them all devoted encouragement. Some of the characters...well...I still haven't really figured out what role they'll ultimately play; like their female manager who has yet to provide more than an occasional distraction, but overall the team is well rounded, if not a little odd. The boys' personalities at first glance wouldn't seem to mesh at all in places and they clash sometimes, but how they bond as a team is totally believable. The show has also kept adding key players, in believable ways, up until episode ten when all members are re/accounted for and everyone in the opening credits has now been identified. lol Episodes pacing is also swift and seems longer than it's actual 22 minutes.Highly recommended.UPDATE: Now that the season has ended and I've seen all the episodes, I've got to say that I was totally caught up in the anticipation of Karasuno's matches. Especially near the latter part of the season. I love it so much I turned around and binge-watched the entire series again from start to finish. There are so many nuisances that I missed on the first watch through because I was getting know the characters. I honestly can't believe how similar Hinata and Kageyama actually are at the beginning of the show! Their approach to life is so different that their similarities and their want to win volleyball games just doesn't shine through as much as their vastly different personalities. Watching them grow into their roles as players, and not to mention unexpected teammates/friends) has so much more meaning on the second watch through. Now that I've seen all of Haikyu!! I have to say that I thoroughly enjoyed the presentation of the games. The show spends just the right amount of time with each opposing school and doesn't ever drag things out for the sake of time. (Spoilers follow!) Deep down I knew that the storyline wouldn't have them winning their final match set against Aoba Jousai, but I was still just as disappointed as the team members! However, the ending is very, very well done and the show lets you down slowly from the climax in a most satisfying way. The final episode is gearing things up for the spring tournament and I really hope to see the story continue with a second season. *crosses fingers*

I can't wait until the next episode comes out!  This is a very well done sport anime.  The clash and dynamic personalities, how they come together slowly as a team.  Clever use of the unknowledgeable 'coach' to explain the basics of the game. I always like ones that fully acknowledges weaknesses and how a team comes together to make each other stronger. Reminds me of Ace of the Diamond in a way but more humor in this one. The animation is different but works well with the type of action scenes it has. Yeah it's simple but if you are looking for something sincere and not over the top sport anime it's fun to watch and get to know the characters.

...but this has got me going even stronger than Kuroko no Basket!!!!! ~ Hyuu, I'm just loving every second of this series!! If you weren't all too sure about giving this anime a chance, drop that doubt IMMEDIATELY! I'm actually really upset that I started watching this while it's still ongoing because I ran out of episodes way too quickly.The characters are strong in personality and they fit together like wacky pieces of a puzzle! Their interactions are so interesting and diverse that it's hilarious. I was literally laughing so hard at scenes that I couldn't breathe ALSO! I don't think I've ever seen a cuter main character and I mean that personality wise. You seriously get attached way too quickly <3 I cannot wait to see where this goes!

I can't help but be addicted to sports novels and manga. So when I finally discovered one about volleyball, I was bound to be hooked-- but this series sure did surpass my expectations! I play volleyball myself, and even though I'm not a guy, I can relate to some of Hinata's insecurities in himself in skills other than spiking. I too have an undying will to get better, so watching this anime gives me reassurance as well as confidence to become a better player by honing my skills. I've only been able to watch the first 3 episodes and 2 minutes of the 4th, but I'm willing to wait! This is the first time I've been this dedicated to watch an anime in so long. Hinata gives me hope to become a better player! This is what anime is all about!

I've been looking for good sports animes, but this has gone beyond my expectations. Never in a game was I bored, and for the whole entire show, I was on the edge of my seat, wanting more! As the show progresses, you see how the characters grow and develop, and you fall in love with all the characters, even the rivals. When they played, I wanted both teams to win, and when the crowds were cheering, I chanted along! I was crying and laughing throughout the show. 11/10 would recommend. Can't wait for more!!

I don't even know where to begin with this, awesome is not even enough to describe this anime really. I have watched sports anime before, even as a kid. I grew up watching Slam dunk, but after that no sport anime ever came close to being worth watching, not until I gave this anime a try. It didn't just came close to it, It surpasses all sports anime ever made. The main guy? Hinata Shoyo, is just amazing. Two thumbs up for the mangaka for incredible work. All the characters were all well made. No boring episode. Shoyo still gives me chills every time.

Memorable characters, realistic struggles (but with the epic thrills expected of a shounen), and amazing sound + visuals. Do yourself a favor and watch it right now.I was always really put off by sports anime for some reason, probably because I thought that any anime about such an ordinary topic was bound to be stupid and over-dramatic. But recently, I was running out of anime that fit all the narrow-minded criteria I had in mind, so I was scrolling down the list of anime on Crunchyroll and decided to give Haikyuu!! a go. I laughed my way through the first episode because it felt over-the-top as I predicted, and I only clicked on the next episode because of the cliffhanger they set up at the end (eternal rivalry denied). I'm so glad I decided to start watching, because once I did I couldn't stop. Haikyuu!! shattered any preconceptions I had about sports anime, because it's so realistic and unpredictable, but also uplifting and epic like any other standard battle shounen. I actually came to appreciate Haikyuu!! even more than those, because it realistically showed moments when the protagonists messed up. It set up its stakes properly, so that the main characters aren't always in a do-or-die situation and protected in 1000 layers of plot armor. Because its a sports anime, and because it's realistic, Haikyuu!! is stunning.

And here I thought that I'd never like a sports anime in my life, but I was proven wrong. This show has everything going for it. Intense volleyball action, interesting and likable characters, even ones that are meant to be complete douche canoes can't be hated, what more could you ask for. Also the fact that there's actual tension when they play and don't automatically know if they'll win is quite nice to see. Hoping for that fourth season to be announced soon.Overall, I highly recommend it, even if you don't think you'll like sports anime, like I did. This show might just change your mind.

To keep it short, Haikyu!! is an amazing show. It is so good at keeping you engaged if you care about the characters. Notice how I didn't say that you need to care about the sport to like it. If you're an athlete or love a good story with action that can give you the same vibes as a fictional shonen fight can, then you will appreciate this show. The themes and life lessons in this show can hit home for many people as well. After the 1st episode, you will know if you like it or not.

Excellent artwork; intense, continuous action scenes where you're swept up in the moment; solid music/soundtrack. Good quantity and quality of humor/comedic relief. Many of the issues I have with shōnen are not a problem here. Screenwriting is solid; there aren't filler episodes; in-episode recap/flashbacks aren't excessively repetitive, lengthy, or unnecessary; plotline moves at a good clip. Main character is energetic/excited but gratifyingly endearing, not obnoxious (a hard balance to find), and all characters are developed at a solid pace and portrayed as three-dimensional. Context and backstories are sufficient enough to add dimension and audience comprehension/sympathy, but brief enough (and timed well enough) to avoid detracting from/interrupting the flow of the main story. My one suggestion for improvement would be additional proofreading for the subtitles, as the grammar often contained errors, particularly towards the end of the seasons. It's been awhile that I've been so emotionally involved in an anime; I binge-watched all three seasons in about three days.

I've been MIA when it comes to watching anime for the past 2-3 years. Nothing seemed interesting enough to watch so I would always put whatever anime is popular at the time on my mental "watch list," knowing that I may never bother to actually see it. Anime Expo 2015 comes around and a good majority of the con is covered with Haikyuu cosplayers. Once the con was over, I decided to suck up my unwillingness and watch Haikyu. I don't know how to truly describe my undying love for this series. It not only managed to revive that old flame of watching anime I used to have, but it also made me a diehard fan. The characters are all fantastic with amazing growth + development issues throughout the series. The animation of it is smooth and clean. Nothing's too harsh on the eyes. What I appreciate about Haikyuu the most is that it makes it hard to hate the rivals of Karasuno. Yeah, some rivals are strong, but not enough where you think they're some outer worldly being, bent on destroying anyone and everyone. Some may be cocky or a bit rude, but Haikyuu reminds you that they're just high schoolers with a desire to win at the end of the day. Nothing criminal about it. This is the first series where I can say that I genuinely like or love each and every character, whether they're from Karasuno, Aoba Johsai, or even Shiratorizawa.10/10Will buy all the DVD collections to support this amazing series ♥

I instantly related myself to the Guardian of Karasuno, I was great at spiking, however I lacked endurance to block in the front, I'm 5,7 and back in high school I would be that short kid who jumped hella high and spiked with ferocity. However, my legs couldn't keep up with jumping high to spike while being able to block so... with that said I was the main digger for my varsity team, spikes, tips, intense jump serves, you name it I dug them all. Even dug against the mvp for my team during practice who is insanely tall and is definitely considered a powerhouse (mind you I felt the bone in my forearm want to bend backwards...). Even got a kill from a dig where the ball flew back to the opponent's side and hit right on the corner within the bounds.This anime has believable characters, the different personalities and clashes keep things interesting. Just watch it and you'll have a good time for sure.

235 five, 11 four, 0 three, 0 two and 0 one-star reviews. At one point it had a 1-star review literally saying "Why are you reading this 1-star review? Go watch the anime!You can't go wrong with this guys. Haikyu is just one of those series. The pacing is just great, the animation is top-notch, and the comedy is on point, even though the anime takes itself seriously. I really love when they nail that balance.The characters are awesome. Both their personalities, where they all have their own charms, and also their ablilities and playertypes on the court are really interesting. Love Nishinoya,  The Guardian Deity of Karasuno. love Kageyama, The Genious Setter. It's great :DReally, with season 3 coming up soon there's only one more thing I can say:If you're into sports anime just check it out for your self. If you're not into sports anime...You might just fall in love with volleyball, as I did.

Quite possibly the best sports anime of all time.You will watch this show.It will move you.You'll feel excited.You'll watch the new episode 2, maybe 3, times in a week.  When it's about to be the weekend you'll watch the first half of the match or training sequence in anticipation of the episode airing.You'll wait, patiently or not, for the simulcast to start.  When the screen starts moving you'll do a little fist bump.  Then you'll notice that crunchyrolls subs don't turn on if you leave the countdown clock running.  DAMNIT CRUNCYROLL!!!!  So you'll refresh and be happily on your way.Then you'll see something kickass, you'll read a neat bit of dialogue, or think of something funny to say, and you'll scroll down to be the first to comment on it!  You're probably not going to be the first to do so, but it's so kickass when you get those 300+ upvotes :DPersonally, I've started skipping the otherwise awesome intros so I can watch the episode uninterrupted and still have a minute or two ahead of people to be the first to comment :DHaikuu!! deserves everyone one of it's exclamation points, hurry up and watch!

This is my first sports anime.And I dont even like sportsI tried KNB but, to put it in kinder terms, it seemed kinda ridiculous (laser shooting a basketball is apparently "totes normal" in a non-fantasy genre but okay) so I quit halfway the first ep lol but BUTI decided to give Haikyuu a try.ONE OF THE BEST DECISIONS IVE MADE IN MY LIFEThe characters. The plot. All of it is just great. You will FEEL so much. I've watched it 4 times already. You won't regret it. 13/10 would recommend with rice.

4.5/5 starsThis anime got me bursting out loud in laughter, to getting teary-eyed, to feeling inspired, to feeling all heart-warmed. It's not only animated beautifully and uniquely, but also wonderfully done: in terms of plot, character development, and balance (such as its ups and downs: motivation, devastation, winning, losing, etc). Not only this is my favorite sports anime (currently, and probably will stay as so), it's also one of my favorite anime overall. I'm not only excited, but thrilled for the sequel to come out! After finishing this anime, I immediately went onto reading the manga (starting from where the anime left off--at chapter 71). And I got to say, it's definitely worth checking out, especially if you enjoy the anime. Edited on: 2/7/15***

Excellent characters and a surprising (especially for it's genre) story make this a pretty damn good anime. While it is indeed a "sports" anime, the characters aren't the "I have to win this game to save my family farm" type or any of that bullsh*t, they really just enjoy playing volleyball. While the main character's team IS the underdog team, it doesn't mean that they've tried and trained the hardest, and that's why they're gonna win; EVERYONE trains their hardest to win, including the opposing teams. Everyone, including the opposing teams, are portrayed as the same: an intense, hardworking team that tries to do their best at volleyball, not some big bad team who only win by cheating. Definitely different in that regard. Sadly, it didn't get renewed for a second season, which is awful.

3 Words to describe it: Genuine, Action-filled, HilariousIn all honestly I only watched this anime because I was playing volleyball at the time and though  "p'eople seem to like it- i guess i could check it out- if i don't like it I can always stop BUT NO this anime turned out to be one of my favorite animes ever! The animation in this is fabulous!  It builds drama in the moments in needs to and underlines notes of humor other times.  The action scenes are exciting and played up/executed extremely well with the animation.The characters are genuine, likable, and are well developed throughout the season.  Their designs are fantastic- Hinata and Kageyama are the perfect pair to lead the show and every supporting character behind them is fantastic as well! Haikyu!! starts out a bit slow (giving backstory and such) but a few episodes in becomes incredibly captivating!  The protagonists are extremely lovable and  - the antagonists are interesting and still have a great level of character development.  Not to mention this show is HILARIOUS! When Haikyu!! isn't building up drama or developing a character it is hard to not be laughing or at least smiling.  I have watched a lot of anime and this one remains as one of the most hilarious ones i've seen! I am super excited for season 2!!!- Delaney

Before I watched this I always thought sports anime was completely overrated. People that hated sports but loved sports anime made me think the fanbase was just a bunch of girls (even though I am one) that wanted to pick out a husbando from an attractive all male cast. I never believed it when people said they actually enjoyed these for the series. Then one day I was bored and decided 'oh might as well watch an episode' and clicked on Haikyu!! because the cover was interesting. Then after that episode I watched another and another. The characters are interesting and the actual games are suspenseful and I need to always see what happens next. If you are hesitant to watch it please just give it a chance. I now know not to judge anime like this again because If I just skipped over it I would not have gotten the chance to ]enjoy one of the most amazing series I have ever watched.

This series is perhaps one of the most thrilling, well-done sports anime I have ever seen. The characters are well fleshed out within the first few episodes after their appearances, have a realistic amount of depth, and surprises from episode to episode occur with great timing. The anime is very humorous when it really counts and surprisingly serious during appropriate times. That said, it was very short.Hoping for more! ~~ Maelstrom

The author must really love Volleyball, because they conveyed that across to me and I really love It now. From the beginning I enjoyed their antics, nothing more than normal high school kids that love their sport. Then WAM!!! Like that I was pulled in and treated to a complete series that ran like a,  GOD LIKE QUICK SPIKE!!!! I was, and am, totally and emotionally involved in each aspect of the series.  BROVO!!!!! ENCORE!  ENCORE!   You can almost feel the vibration, from the running and jumping, and of course the slam of the ball hitting the court.    The wave of WOW!! That hits you when you witness a plan come together!You want to cheer for them and pat them on their back, while giving them a towel, a drink and yelling encouragements to them!!!!!!What else could I say about this series, but, WOW!!!! I loved this series.

I played Volleyball for about 9 years, including all through high school and man have i got to say that this show is AMAZING! I played wing spiker for all the years that i played the sport and every single thing about this show brings back so many fantastic and vivid memories, every experience of the game is depicted soooooo god damn well that it's almost hard for me to explain it. Watching Haikyu!! is a somewhat surreal experience, it almost feels like I'm playing again and it definitely makes me want to get up and play. This may just be my passion and love for the sport talking but this is just a fantastic anime. If you like bro feels, hilarious moments, and sports then this is definitely for you. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT.Did i mention its amazing? Because...well yeah, it is.

My sister told me to watch it, and I who had never once watched a sports anime before had little hopes for this anime. I mean, sports was something I personally thought I would never enjoy, being the couch potato I am. However, after the first episode, I was stunned and amazed at how breathtaking the show was just from the beginning, and I thought that maybe after that it would probably get boring. How wrong I was. This anime kept delivering and delivering, and soon I was out of available episodes to watch; yet, I craved more, so I went and read the entirety of all the manga so far, and I still can't satiate my craving for Haikyuu!!. I even read the RAWs, and I'm someone who has always had the patience to wait for translations. Haikyuu!! is the only manga I have looked at RAWs for because there's just a constant need for more Haikyuu!!Anyway, with my obvious obsession aside, let the actual review begin!Plot 5/5The basic gist of the plot of Haikyuu!! is just like with any other sports anime: to win. Though, there's a sort of unique charm with this anime in that it has a smooth flow between volleyball life and their life off the court. Most of the intensity happens on the court and during a match, while the laughs happen off the court, but sometimes (like with the case of Asahi) there will be serious moments that aren't matches. It helps keep the anime "real". Also, another thing is that this anime seems to get likened to Kuroko no Basket a lot, especially because of the Light/Dark dynamic between the two main characters (which will be expanded on later) but what Haikyuu!! has--or rather, doesn't have--that Kuroko no Basket does is the lack of "superhuman" abilities that's very present in Kuroko no Basket, especially among the Generation of Miracles. In this way, it's a nice breath of fresh air and it makes the anime more believable. Yet, even without the "superhuman" abilities, Haikyuu!! still doesn't fail to deliver (or should I say toss, haha) a clutch-to-your-seats match.Characters 5/5Now, here's the aspect where Haikyuu!! particularly shines in compared to most other sports anime, or anime in general: its characters. Everyone is realistic and nonuniform. Hinata Shouyou, who would naturally seem like the never give up and naturally gifted character, is actually just a young boy who's really passionate about volleyball but has only subpar abilities (barring speed and jumping). Kageyama Tobio has exceptional characterization in that one would think he was the cold and aloof kind of person, especially with the rumors of being the "King of the Court". And yes, he did seem like a jerk in the beginning, but he turned out to just be someone who was merely misunderstood. He wasn't at all kingly. A little bit selfish, yes, but overall just an awkward, socially inept guy who's a genius at volleyball and just as passionate about it as Hinata. And no, he's not quiet and aloof at all. Far from it, actually. Naturally, these two end up meeting as rivals, and eventually they form a duo. It's at the formation of this duo, where Hinata is the "light" and Kageyama is the "shadow," where Kageyama's characterization really develops, because you see him actually making an eventual effort to think of someone else (ie. Hinata) instead of himself.Now, I could talk about these two dorks forever as well as the other amazing characters of Haikyuu, but in general, everyone is basically three dimensional and even the smallest background characters get backstories of some sort. It's hard to hate anyone because there isn't a reason to hate them. They're all just like people; they have their bad sides, but they have their good sides too. There isn't an "evil" team, and that's what's so amazing about it. Everyone just really wants to play volleyball, and sometimes, because all the characters are so lovable, it's surprisingly hard to pick who to root for sometimes!Art 5/5Very high quality animation. The art style is nice and simple, yet easily distinguishable. The anime did the manga justice by perfectly mimicking the style and feel of the mangaka's art, and they even managed to polish the mangaka's style to make it nicer. Because of the art style, all of the characters can be considered nice and "appealing," but there is still a huge range of characters while keeping them beneath the boundary of being too over the top. The animation is smooth and oftentimes breathtaking, especially when they're playing matches. The action scenes are especially very nice because they perfectly capture moments in what feels like real time, fast and quick-paced much like how real life volleyball is, but during critical moments, it will get slowed down a bit to build up tension and anticipation. Everything flows well together and I still haven't seen one scene that is of bad quality.Overall, this is a very nice and polished anime and is true to the manga. Highly recommended, even to viewers who aren't inclined to watch something about sports.

At first when i saw this anime i was putting it off for awhile because i thought it was just another sports anime (which it is but its MUCH MORE). I decided to watch it two days ago and i finished it in one night! Its amazing, the story line and the characters are great, and the adrenaline i get when watching this anime feels great! usually when i watch an anime i take awhile to watch because the first couple episodes move the story way to slow. but right when i watched the first episode of haikyuu I WAS HOOKED! i definitely recommend this to everyone!

If you like Kuroko no Basuke, FREE!, or Prince of Tennis, then this is perfect for you. If you're looking for something funny and something to just watch for fun, then this anime is also for you!I love this anime and manga so much because it's just quirky. It has the right touch of bromance that's not cheesy or overwhelming like Free! but it does have the same ambition and quirk like Kuroko no Basuke. The main characters are awesome and it's about time we had a good volleyball anime happen! Give it a try for yourself!

Honestly, where every other anime of the season disappoints, Haikyuu excels. Maybe it's just because I already have a love for sports anime, but even where anime like Kuroko start to bug me because of the "super powers" Haikyuu keeps the powers out of the show. It's so refreshing!All of the characters are so strong and rounded, I'm having a hard time picking a favorite! I know I'm going to be dropping a lot of money on character merch because of that, aha!

This isn't a great review but all I want to say is that this anime is great!! I was reluctant to watch it since I was recommended it because it was about volleyball but it's more than that. It's one of those anime that leave you agitated after an episode because you have to wait one more week for the next episode to come out.
