It would be fine if these filler stories were good, but a majority of the time they are not. The bount saga felt very out of place, like it was taken from a failed anime and just put in with bleach characters. The arc about the swords coming to life brings up major plot holes that are in the show. These filler arcs just ruin it for me, and the last arc of bleach is also really lack luster. If you love bleach and you watch it all the way through please go read the manga. The Manga is still going and its getting really good. If anything I hope they bring bleach and animate this true final arc.

this is going to be very concise, Bleach as an overall anime deserves 2 stars, 3 at most in my opinion. This is just because of the lengthy, boring, and plot pointless filler 'arcs', I actually watched Bleach without watching most of these fillers because they are completely pointless to the plot, and most of them are absurd and a waste of time to watch. That being said, without watching the bad fillers, or without all the fillers completely, Bleach gets the 4 star rating. Now not all fillers are bad, just the lengthy ones. A good example of a good filler is whenever they show Ichigo's 2 sisters, Kon, and the old dude (forgot his name) fighting hollows as a sort of Kaman rider homage. But to be fair though all of these long running anime's like Bleach, Naruto, and One Piece tend to have a ridiculous amount of uninteresting fillers. I recommend Bleach to anyone who will just skip the fillers, and to people who don't mind them.

Bleach had such promise for me, interesting powers, plots, characters. I dove into it headfirst watching until I had caught up, it was after I caught up a few years back that I realized the series was doomed. I loved up to episode 64, that's when things started to go bad. So I am going to review this show as if it is two separate shows. Before episode 64:  The beginning of the series was really awesome, the plot that a shinigami saved a normal boy and made him a substitute shinigami, a whole world of spirits and beings separate from ours in a different light. All the powers and characters you met were interesting, the fight with Kenpachi, everything was brilliant. I only had good memories up until this point, which is why I recommend people pretend the following episodes don't exist. Because even if they introduced cool characters it all went downhill, I've heard the manga is better, so if you want to continue past this point I recommend going to the manga.After episode 64:  It showed promise at first, there were bigger scarier hollows, more powers, cool new characters. The Arrancars, espadas, it looked so promising. But fillers, and lack of character growth, along with other faults made the series become a bother to watch, but I powered through, that is until there was about 30 or more episodes of filler at a time. Only to have one real episode and then continue filler. After that I gave up. This isn't really one of my best reviews, but more or less a warning and a recommendation. Bleach is a good anime only to episode 63. So if you like Shonen, go watch it, but either stop at 64 or go to the manga.

Summary:Ichigo Kurosaki is a highschooler who is turned into a Substitute Death God and helps protect is little town called Karakura. Over the course of the show new more powerful enemies appear and he trains and grows in strength in order to protect those he cares for. Overall Score: 9/10Bleach is the best anime I have seen so far, but I won't give a show a 10/10 unless it has absolutely no flaws.Anime 10/10The anime in this show is gorgeous. I love the character design, colors, effects, scenes, everything. Nothing to add here.Plot: 8/10If the show had ended when *Spoiler Alert* Ichigo defeats Aizen around episodes 305-310, and there weren't so many fillers, it would have received a 10/10. I feel everything after was extra and unnecessary. The plot is well developed I love how the story progresses, the introduction of new characters, the plot twists, the increase in powers throughout the series, the enemies, pretty much everything.Characters: 10/10There are many loveable characters. Even the enemies had something that keeps the viewer entranced and wanting to know what happens to them. There are many filler characters that aren't necessary to the overall show, but each character has a unique place. The characters can be related to and have parts we wish we had or wish we didn't have. They are well structured and the feel of each character stays pretty much the same throughout the show. Fillers: 8/10There are A LOT of fillers in this show. Even some of the major arcs in the show seem to be fillers. However, compared to other shows I've watched (*Cough* Naruto), these fillers are relatively entertaining. This is one of the few animes I've watched all the way through twice, so I mean it when I say, they are obnoxious, but not unbearable. Final Thoughts:Would recommend this show 100%. While it is not the perfect anime, it is the closest  I have experienced so far. It has a lot of fillers, but some are entertaining, and some fill in plot holes later on in the show. It is complete so don't be expecting anymore episodes.*Hint* If you love swords, WATCH THIS SHOW! There are too many epic sword fights to count, and it is all animated beautifully to boot!

Bleach starts off great continues along great, and is an all around a really good anime. The only problem I found when watching, is the constant interruptions. Here you are watching some really epic battle, it's lasting multiple episodes. You finish one episode, at a key moment in the battle so you quickly leap to the next episode. Well there's the problem. The creators seemed to have a bunch of ideas but are too lazy to give them their own seperate part in the show. So they shove a few random episodes in the middle of the series. This anime would be much better with a simple plot line, instead of multiple complex ones. If you insist on watching the interrupting episodes,well, I warned you. Happy watching!

I haven't actually watched anything beyond the whole arrancar saga end, but that's because I felt like Bleach ended so perfectly right then and there that I didn't need to watch any more. Personally, I felt that Bleach started off really strong, then totally lost it's value through the whole ending stages of rescuing Rukia and then picked up pace by the time he fought Grimmjow. After that, it climaxed beautifully and ended perfectly. Props to Bleach, it's definitely my favorite out of the "big anime" that's out there right now. I <3 you Bleach! You've been so great! Here's to 6 great years!

This is a very good anime with a great story line all the way through, excluding fillers, and i think it may be one of my favorite anime. The only problem is that it has quite a few filler arcs but that is not a problem if you have a guide to avoid the fillers but some of the fillers are not bad. It is action packed, funny tense and emotional and all round a great anime with everything to be expected.

The development for the protagonist ''Kurosaki Ichigo'' ,a shinigami/teenage male, never bores me. The intensity is well built up making me gush out excitement. The only problem would be how the author ended the anime and didnt continue it. Made me kinda pissed off but I overall enjoyed Bleach. The manga is still ongoing but I still haven't had a chance to read it ( too busy ) but I would highly recommend Bleach. It focuses on the struggles and sacrifices a teenage boy has to go through. Very well done! The art is great and the fighting scenes make me fall off my chair! I did not regret taking my time to watch Bleach! Go ahead and watch it! You will probably find it hard to not click on the next episode.

I don't even know where to begin! This anime is truly amazing. It has so many twists and turns and will keep you wanting more. As long as it is, it is not surprising if some find it slow to begin with but it picks up speed and fast. Many, many people complained about the fillers it had but I enjoyed all of them. The character development is the best I've seen yet. The plot as well, seeing the characters face and overcome so many obstacles was a real joy. With 366 episodes and 4 movies, I've never seen an anime as good as this. I hope others enjoy it as enthusiastically as I did.

This is what they should put in front of the manga and anime of Bleach~WARNING: The following anime is extremely addictive and can/will cause lost of sleep, obsession and procrastination. Viewer Discretion is STRONGLY advised Lots of fight scenes, beautiful art and a good overall plot... ^o^I started watching it and after three days of 2-hours of sleep each day, I finished reading the manga and watching the anime. Remember,  once you start, you CAN'T stop. (Unless of course, you have inhuman mental strength to control yourself)

If you grew up with shows like Dragon Ball Z, Rurouni Kenshin, and Yu Yu Hakusho and enjoy a series with an intricate story, interesting characters, and just downright awesome explosive fight scenes, then Bleach is the series that's made for you!  The pacing is admittedly pretty bad though (especially during the Arrancar arc) and there's a ton of filler episodes strewn throughout the series (the Zanpakuto Materialization and Reigai filler arcs are worth watching though), but the source material is great. Overall, Bleach is a series that once you start it, it grabs you and refuses to let you go!Just be sure to avoid the filler episodes as those are not based on the canon story from the original manga. Use this for reference:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bleach_episodesAlso, be sure to read the manga after the final episode of the anime since the story continues in the manga. After episode 366 of the anime, start at chapter 480 of the manga.

I love, love, love this anime. I am not very far but I am so glad to have found it. A friend recommended it to me and I never in a million years thought I would end up liking the scary looking Ichigo and shounen genre.The characters all have amazing qualities, to make you love or hate them and the development is really worth the watch.  Never a dull moment and even in the height of battle there is a line that has me on the floor laughing.I really cannot wait to get to the end, but I hope there are more episodes to come and that the ending will live up to the story.Rokia x Ichigo.

Before saying anything, let me note that after my original posting of this review, I read a review by CrimsonTrickster on Aug 7, 2011 which was along the same lines as my review, but perhaps better stated, actually. Without further ado...If you like shounen anime as a genre, then the first several seasons of this show (basically, the "Soul Society arc") are just awesome. (So a lot of my scoring above reflects the entire anime to this point; the storyline numbers would probably be more like 4/5 for the first several seasons of the show.) Good points of the anime include:1. Pretty good plotting through the first part of the anime and well-conceived characters2. A nicely crafted world (i.e. an expansive, imaginative, and interesting world is created in which the story takes place) which is slowly revealed in increasing detail to the watcher and keeps you hooked3. Excellent animation overall4. A fair number of epic battlesMore recently (particularly since the beginning of the fake Karakura town arc, with the notable exception of Ichigo's battles with Grimmjow and Ulquiorra), however, the show's negative points have begun to overwhelm the positive ones, in my opinion. Some of these were problems from the beginning, but you live with them because of the good points. They include:1. A very large number of characters are tracked, and though it's nice to actually learn something about them, it often becomes tedious to spend multiple episodes focusing on each in turn.2. Outcomes of battles are woefully predictable, for the most part, and the show does not seem to operate under a unified notion of how strong different characters are (i.e. the winner of the battle tends to be whoever is convenient for the writer rather than the one the show hsa previously indicated is stronger).3. Very strong tendency to get lost in fillers.4. Characters and plotting become increasingly flat (even boring) in later episodes.In the early days, Bleach was the anime that got me hooked on anime generally speaking. I kept watching it for some time out of pure momentum, and every once in a while was rewarded (e.g. Ichigo vs. Ulquiorra--I can hardly stress enough how epic that was). If you're a shounen die-hard and live for those epic battles, Bleach may yet reward you if you stick with it. But if you're not, well...it might be worth checking out, but don't torture yourself searching for more if it starts to feel tedious for you, like it did for me. (At the very least, go away from it for several months to a year and then check back in to see if anything looks interesting.) This show is being milked, hard.One final note: In my opinion, the overall quality of the opening and ending music for this show is very high. I've found several J-pop artists that I like from the songs.

i love bleach and all but then there were to many fillers at some point and i started getting bored with it. then i stopped watching it altogether but i said to my self (i should watch it again) so i did and it didn't turn out as bad as i thought. thats the good thing bad thing is that bleach is getting to a point where ichigo wins every fight i understand how powerful is  and all but still let him lose alittle bit. plus the more ep they make the more ppl r going to get sick of it thats what i think.

It was a great series but it could get boring at many points. The reason I thought it wasn't the greatest anime was because like many other large anime the producers only think of ways to make as many episodes as possible. This of course is the reason many episodes lack action and can not entrance the viewer like many other animes can. But overall the series is unique ,and had many suspenseful parts. Even though i had complaints i think it is a great action anime for all viewers.

I was a bit skeptical with bleach i was just getting into anime and has so far only watched Naruto and when i first started watching that  i wasn't sure how i felt until about episode 40 i just kept watching them so realised i liked it but with bleach from the first episode i knew that i loved it and i have been watching it up to this day i started watching bleach about two - three years ago and have ever looked back while i will admit sometimes the side stories go on forever and it takes a long time to get to the episode you want because of the fillers i love this anime and would reccomend it to anyone =D

Bleach, despite its name, is a fairly good shonen anime. It has gained much popularity and has a uniqueness to it. As my review title shows, it has met my expectations but barely exceeds them. I will describe why.Storyline The main storyline is well thought out and does have some interesting parts to it, but overall the entire storyline lacks unity and is greatly inconsistent. The anime starts off with the main storyline but is abruptly disturbed by fillers. The majority of the anime is consisted of fillers that ruin the main storyline of  Bleach . The fillers of  Bleach do contain  some character development and introduces other powers in the  Bleach world. However, these new developments and introductions do little to help the actual main storyline. The main storyline and the fillers do not transition well and therefore I give the storyline a 3 star rating.Music There is never any "bad" music so I will not give any rating lower than a 5 star rating.Characters There is character development among the main characters of  Bleach , be it the protagonists or the antagonists. However, character development greatly lacks in other characters. No major protagonists have died, making  Bleach seem like an anime that shows that good guys always win and takes away from the realism. There are also slight inconsistencies within the characters. 3.5 star ratingAnimation The animation of  Bleach is not the best of them all. It lacks some detail and has some poor animations as well. The animation makes a slight change after the first few episodes of the anime. 4 star rating for OK animation.Overall there are inconsistencies and has very little phsycological impact. The characters in this anime are very particular with one on one combat and they follow the shonen type where they talk a lot during battle and drags the episodes on. They reveal their abilities to one another which makes the action less appealing. All in all, 3.5 star rating. Not the best anime despite what other says.

I have been waiting for CR to make a debut for Bleach. I have been a fan of Bleach but due to the lack of episode promotions....I couldnt find a good site to watch it on....until I heard something crazy. CR just first start a poll what would people think if they would put Bleach on CR. Then when everyone made their staggering votes, it turned into a petition highering the voices of the CR nation. Once the creators got enough signatures (oversignatures is more like it), they turned it to TokyoPOP and all the other Anime producers....finally....CR was hosting Bleach...and when I heard, I was friggin stoked. I see new heights for BLEACH.

Storyline - 3/5I admit, this number would be a lot higher if I had just stopped watching after Season 3.  The story for the first few seasons flow beautifully into the next part.   Combat can bog down and one fight can drag on for far too long.  Music - 3/5Not really a big factor for me but the music seems decent overall but has suffered from some really bad opening themes.Characters - 4.5/5This is where Bleach sets itself apart from the common anime.  The characters are about the best you will find in any anime.  From the main protagonist, Ichigo, to the comic relief of Kon, this is my favorite part of the whole series.  They go into detail about the daily life and past of the main cast, for the most part, and have a little bit for everybody.  However, after the first season, they start introducing more characters and pretty much never stop introducing new characters.  It is clear that Tite Kubo has a great feel for design but sometimes you just need to sit down and stop.Animation - 4/5About as good as you can expect from a series with 250+ episodes with no end in sight.  Some very nice combat sequences.Overall - 3.5/5As stated previously, I absolutely love the designs of the characters and the setting seems very strongly defined.  The animation is better than most would expect for such a long series.  However, the combats, while intense and well drawn, go on for several episodes sometimes and it just seems like Jump! and Kubo are milking the series for everything they can get out of it.  The series got so far way from the original feel and characters that it is like watching a completely different series at times.  If I could recommend just watching through the conclusion of the Soul Society arc and stopping before the Bount arc, it would be  fantastic series. Usually when anime gets too long you can pick up the manga and continue the story with that, but as Bleach is now I would strongly advise against the manga and only watch the first 3 seasons of the anime.  The series and the manga should have ended a year ago or at least concluded this story arc.

I love this anime. This is by far the greatest anime I have seen, sorry Naruto S.But my main reason for writing this is not really for a review of the entire show, just one arc.Everybody says how great the show is except for the fillers. While for the most part I agree with their opinions, the Zanpakuto Tales arc(not sword fiends, that part sucked)was the best arc I have seen in any anime I have watched.Not only were the new characters awesome(some of them more so than there counterparts), the storyline was excellent.It gives more incite into the relationships between Shinigami and Zanpakuto. I also gained mad respect for, and understood Byakuyamuch better.

Kurosaki Ichigo is a 15 year old student, with the ability to see ghosts. His life was forever changed when he met Kuchiki Rukia, a Death God, who is charged with sending lost souls to the afterlife, known as Soul Society.Whilst saving Ichigo from the attack of a malevolent ghost known as a Hollow, Rukia sustained serious injuries. Unable to finish the battle, she offers to share her powers, and responsibilities, with Ichigo

Bleach is about a fifteen year old Ichigo Kurosaki, who after one fateful night finds himself in a world of  Shinigami and  Hollows. He must now use the powers of the shinigami to protect his home town from these hollows, as well as the numerous enemies he will come to face as the storyline progresses.......  Bleach is full of action packed fighting, but has that dash of humor. I hope you come to enjoy bleach as much as I have.....  Enjoy!!!!!!

Otherwise, it's a great anime with bad-ass characters and actions. I highly recommend it to anyone who hasn't seen it.

*THE FOLLOWING REVIEW CONTAINS SPOILERS*When I decided to watch Bleach because my friends said it was good, it was one of the best decisions of my life. I loved the story, the characters, the emotion, the action, and the humor. The music and animation was nice as well, it was all amazing. However, I started to notice common plot devices in the series after the Soul Society Arc, which made me consider if I should still watch the series or not. This includes Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideOrihime being captured and having to be rescued, just like Rukia was in the previous arc, plusSpoiler Alert! Click to show or hide a conspiracy about whether the person wanted to be saved or not. Also, Ichigo constantly got healed after he lost a fight, only to have a rematch and win, and then repeat the process. I couldn't really get a gauge on Ichigo's power, and it didn't really make sense to me that his power would increase that much after one fight, it's not like he had a Zenkai from Dragon Ball Z (If you don't get the reference, it's a power boost after recovering from a near death experience)! Additionally, the fillers are horrible. Just HORRIBLE. Be sure to find out which episodes are filler and skip them. On top of that, I foundSpoiler Alert! Click to show or hide the released Zanpakuto to be really repetitive after a while, since almost every Arrancar+Visored+Soul Reaper had this. Add them together and it's nearly 30 releases in the same arc. This last one is kind of a minor nitpick, but I don't really enjoy sword fights unless there is something super interesting about them. SinceSpoiler Alert! Click to show or hide there are nearly over 30 released Bankais in the Fake Karakura Town Arc, I quickly became uninterested in these fights. So, should you continue watching? If you don't agree with little to none of my reasons of not enjoying it as much after the first 2 arcs, you should still watch. However, if you agree with almost all to all of my points, I suggest watching another anime that will suit to your liking. I am actually going to continue watching the manga/anime past the Fake Karakura Town Arc (The arc that I'm currently on), but I honestly don't enjoy it as much as I did with the first 2 arcs.~My review: 4 out of 5 stars.

I won't waste time with a synopsis you should know it by the time you get to this review. The characters are a bit older than the norm and that helps with the dire situations they face. The fate of the world is a heavy burden for a 12 year old.  Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hidethis review just saved you the trouble of watching neon genesis evangelion  It was good to see it handled by an older hero. Another good point is that it's co-ed. Neither gender is side lined into a role nor treated as naturally superior or inferior in any way. But that's not the question you want answered. The question is IS IT WORTH MY TIME TO INVEST IN A SERIES THIS LONG? And the answer is yes! The filler is bad but only so bad as to make one wish for the filler to end, rather than making the show unwatchable. What saves this show is the large and varied cast of unique characters. Each character has their individuality and a unique power to match, but all are trained in the same basic arts. This is why I found the series superior to Naruto in the fact that in Naruto, it seemed as though some characters could learn new and different jutsu while others could only modify their existing jutsu. Bleach solves this problem by making everyone’s zanpakuto different, yet all the basic abilities are the same. It's almost perfect a clever mix of humor and action that doesn't beat you over the head with things you already know.    But I felt the last season was a waste. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThey could have ended with Ichigo losing his powers and called it quits rather than spend a season giving Ichigo his powers back then ending the series. Those few more episodes aren't worth the finale. Also most of the supporting cast is missing from the final series So yes it's worth the watch, and I demand more, but only of Bleach at it's best please, and not at it's worst...

Well, in the beginning I enjoyed the anime and it was pretty interesting. I loved watching bleach but now, I lost all interest in the show. After they saved Rukia  I got bored. I guess I lost interest when it was Orihime in trouble not sure , but somewhere along the line I was disappointed in the anime. This series has it's moments when it is truly fantastic, the characters, the action, the development is truly top knotch, but then... It fails at times..It saddens me that this series got split up by fillers, the main plot is good, great even and the first story-arc was truly the peak of this series, but as you get further, you start to notice the fillers... oh lord, the fillers. As other shows ususally try to go a bit easy on the fillers, somehow blend it into the story a little.. bleach pulls out a completely random filler arc which can last 20 episodes+, leaving you scratching your head for what really happened and what is supposed to be going on as this random story is spewed out..The anime is truly one I can reccomend, but I have to think twice as this anime feels somewhat parted, the fillers are of generally high quality, it's not that, but they are so long and tedious when you simply want the main story... In the end a great anime which deserves the brand "Must watch" but also is an example of how fillers should not be done

Alot of people i know that watched this either stopped in a filler arc or got tired of the aizen/arrancar arc jumping around.With that said it is worth sticking to the end, even though the bount (filler) arc got extremely boring it didnt intrude on any other arc. the amagai arc was good but that one and the zanpaktu arc where fillers to give TK time to release more content. and it happens in transition from one arrancar part to another, its slightly annoying but understandable. the aizen arc came to a satisfying and mysterious end, which makes it 100% worth the wait. i would have like to see the rumored episode 367 and a continuation but i was overall satisfied with the way it all wound up

I began watching Bleach when the first episode aired back in 2004. I was young at the time and I had yet to discover the beauty of subtitles so I watched it in English. It was intriguing, even to my young mind, and I thought that the English version was about as good as the show could get...until I found the internet. I have been watching Bleach religiously now for almost ten years and I have to say, I have yet to grow tired of this show. Although I am very upset that the anime has stopped, I can at least get my fix by reading the manga. I was very disappointed when the show was cancelled right before everything sort of blew up in the manga and I am still praying for a sudden return out of nowhere for this show. I love every single character (which rarely happens for me when it comes to any kind of television) and I simply love the music in this anime. The soundtracks are all amazing and I have most of the opening themes downloaded to my iPod. I would highly recommend this show to just about anyone who is looking for some good action and comedy all rolled into one brilliant bundle. Ichigo is one of my favorite characters and the development of his character is simply amazing. Renji also holds a spot in my heart not only because of that wonderful red hair but also because of his personality and even though I wouldn't consider him one of the main characters his character still develops nicely throughout the series. Every single character within this show, whether main or minor, has grown and changed throughout the series which not many shows can brag they've accomplished. I would honestly say that this show rivals Naruto and I am most definitely a Naruto fanatic. I have been with both shows since the very first episode and I'll be with them until the very end (which I hope never comes for either). I hope more people can find this show/manga just as enjoyable as I did!

I'm going to start off by saying that I have not finished this anime yet. I am up to episode 178 (I believe), however, from what I've seen so far I know I can give this show a five star rating. Long story short, I always thought shows like Bleach and Naruto were overrated and just way too popular for what they are. In some ways, I still think they are, but in others, I disagree.This anime really caught my attention after Ichigo gained his substitute soul reaper powers and Rukia was sort of like his teacher. I love the drive that Ichigo has to do anything. He doesn't seem to give up no matter what! I love the character chemistry and bantering between him and Rukia, it's funny to say the least. This show constantly has fights and action and there are plenty upon plenty of plot twists. I especially love the characters in this show, because each and every one of them is their own (despite there being 13 guard squads in the Soul Society). Every Soul Reaper seems to have their own distinct powers and uses with their swords, which keeps the show interesting and fresh. I also enjoy the inclusion of the Quincy powers and Ichigo's friends having powers (though I'm not very fond of Orihime). They all have their own personalities too, which is nice. This show has humor, drama and intense action. I can say the only thing I haven't liked so much has been the filler plots and twists that just didn't do anything for me. After watching quite a few episodes, I can also say that the first three seasons were pretty much my favorite. Watching Ichigo go through all the fights with the Squad leaders was by far more interesting than where I am at now in the show. I enjoyed seeing Ichigo grow as a person but also as a Soul Reaper, and I think it's interesting that he is also part hollow. The show tends to have deep stories and rich visuals as well as entertaining characters which is always a plus. I think after watching this show for a while now, it's hard to see any reason why someone wouldn't like Bleach.

This anime's part of the big three that's being serialized in Weekly Shounen Jump. The reason why this has a 4-star rating is due to the filler arcs it has-the Bout arc, the Shusuke Amagai arc (my favorite of the filler arcs), the Zanpaku-to rebellion arc, and the the Regiai arc. Other than that, the plot is good and Aizen as the villian for most of the series (SPOILERS!!) is actually a pretty good villian (in my opinion). If you like intense action scenes (mainly with Ichigo) and good character development (not the best anime with character development), then you'll enjoy this anime. If you want more after watching all 366 episodes, then go read the manga, since it'll be a few years before the anime continues.

I fell in love with this series from the very beginning when it first came out. I personally have recommended this series to many friends of mine, and so far they are all really loving the storyline. Its action packed, yet not always serious at the same time which makes a perfect blend in my opinion. A highly recommended series.

As the title suggest, this show will make you smile, laugh and feel romantic. It is almost rare to find such amazing art, animation, bgm, characters, story and plot all in 1 package these days. I am sick of watching cliched Rom-Com but this one will break the barrier and go beyond. The use of ad-lib and repetition is super effective. Commendable. The author did a really good job!   SynopsisAmatsuyu "Jouro" Kisaragi is a completely average second-year high school student who has two dates over one weekend⁠—with the student council president Sakura "Cosmos" Akino on Saturday, then with his childhood friend Aoi "Himawari" Hinata on Sunday. Sadly for Jouro, both girls proclaim their love for his best friend Taiyou "Sun-chan" Ooga, the ace of the baseball team. Accepting each of their requests for advice and guidance, he is now responsible for helping the two girls win the heart of the same guy.Unbeknownst to his friends, Jouro's friendly, obtuse image is all but a ruse designed to cast himself as the clueless protagonist of a textbook romantic comedy. A schemer under his cheery facade, he makes the best of this unexpected turn of events with a new plan: get Sun-chan to fall for either Cosmos or Himawari and take the other as his own prize. But Jouro's last-ditch effort is threatened by the gloomy, four-eyed Sumireko "Pansy" Sanshokuin, who surprises Jouro with not only her knowledge of his secret personality but also a confession to the true self he hid for all this time.I recommend watching this. 9/10 ENJOY!

Going into a new anime like this one can honestly make me just feel meh. Starts off so generic its hard to watch for more than a few minutes. And until 9 episodes were out I wasn't able to. The first episode is just so dang slow at first it hurts.Then the actual show starts. At first bench I thought ok finally something is happening. A bench later it got amusing. The next bench made me laugh. The following bench killed me.I was entertained immensely. Its funny. The jokes aren't insanely immature like a lot of harems. Power through the first part of the first episode and you'll be fine. Oh and this is a harem. Just not your typical one. It does a little of everything. Probably the only anime I've ever laughed at 4th wall breaks. If you need some comedy give it a shot.

This anime is so much more than the troupes it looks like from the cover picture. It has you going back and forth as the audience and it is an adorably hilarious rom com. Understanding the meaning of Jekyll and Hyde might also help with understanding the references they use sometimes. I get excited to see this one each week and I hope it continues to live up to the fun it has brought so far!edit: It does keep getting more cliché as it goes on, but I think it's fun and I still watch every week! And my bf and I definitely have couples that we are rooting for haha.

I say this series is so good! Know why? Well let me tell u, it has excellent characters! It is pretty funny. Also this series moves at a comfortable pace, I'd like to say. When new series start their run, a lot of info is placed in the 1st episode, which can be a tad overwhelming. But not this series, by the first 3 episodes u have a good understanding as to what's going on. It allows for a really fun romantic comedy :). So check it out

I'm writing this as the 4th episode has just released, but I've only watched up to ep3. I gotta say I really like the way this story keeps shifting around as the protagonists personality and life unfolds before you to make sure you truly know who he is. This goes for all the other characters as well, they all have their own unique personalities and it makes the story very interesting seeing those personalities clash.

Okay so you know a show has potential when someone decides to create an account just so they can write a review on it. I felt compelled to do so after reading some of the reviews and here is the rundown. Someone rated this show two stars because they found it to be generic and sort of a cut and paste type show. Im sorry but they clearly did not understand the context nor direction the show was shooting for. It's not supposed to be Toradora or Golden time. It's not trying to be a serious rom-com. So if you are looking for something more melodramatic then yes I do recommend those but the show is clearly poking fun at rom-coms in the most genius and hilarious way. I guarantee you are going to laugh. So with that in mind lets get to it:ANIMATION: Okay not gonna lie. The animation and artstyle is nothing to gawk at. Its pretty generic and has nothing that really helps it to stand out as a series. However the series makes up for this in other ways.CHARACTERS: Look I know the person below said that everyone seems like they were cut and paste from a template BUT THATS THE POINT! And I'll just tell you this much. Not everyone is as they seem.  But don't take my word for it. Go watch. In the end there are two specific characters that helps this show do a complete one eighty and at a certain point you will find yourself smiling and laughing a lot more. STORY: So the story is that a guy is asked out on a date by both the energetic youthful childhood best friend and the beautiful student council president. Both atypical roles that you tend to find in a lot AND I MEAN ALOT of rom coms. And our protagonist is horrified to find that not only do neither of these girls actually love him but the whole point in them asking him out in the first place was to ask for his help in getting together with his other best friend, Sun-chan. To make matters worse, when he does finally get the confession he's always wanted its from the bespectacled, sharp-tongued, stalker girl. Honestly when I first watched the PV I was incredibly intrigued by stalker girl. She actually comes off more authentic (imo) than the other two girls. To some, that synopsis might not be intriguing enough but I highly recommend watching because there is more to this story. I'll say it in three words: I Love Joro.CONCLUSION: The artstyle isn't top notch nor unique and you might be a little turned off in the beginning because everyone is just soooo generic but once you make it to a certain part of the episode there is a bit of a shift and you will realize that you've suddenly stumbled upon something that holds a lot of potential. I definitely wasn't expecting the twist. Is it perfect? No. But if you are looking for a romantic comedy that goes against the grain, has an interesting plot, and makes you laugh. Highly recommend this.

Imagine a typical Rom-com with the same old "I have no life or interests" main character we can all relate to. That's everything you see in first place but after an episode or two all the things that make it unique and great start.Things like making great rolling jokes, self awareness of the characters, and as the cherry at the top the final episode combines two things that I thought were uncombinable. Well done ending and the "we're back at the beginning see you in the next season“ ending.Some of you that survived my poor and awkward grammar and read it to this point may think " so why you say it's the best of this year only? ". That's just because I have really bad memory and I could watch something better in the past, but wouldn't I remember it if it was so good?... Anyway I highly recommend it and can't wait for second season. Wow. This was long.

This is a fun show to watch, but it's too... unrealistic for me. Now I know this is anime so that should be obvious, but any good story has things a viewer can relate to. For example, I loved Rascal ... Bunny Senpai, which on the surface is way extremely more unrealistic than this one. But at its core, Bunny Senpai dealt with the insecurities of adolescence, something everyone in the world can relate to. Oresuki has a touch of that, but is way overshadowed by the silly harem antics and the protagonist's obsession with being recognized as a protagonist. Rarely, it has glimmers of hope thanks to Pansy and her perceptiveness. Besides her though, this show is actually pretty hopeless.

First off, I am not really into this genre of anime.  However, the writing and humor had me hooked in the first episode! The running gag with the bench had me in chocking on my water (especially with the Vader reference). The “singularity” joke was getting a little old, but it was still funny. I love how they break the 4th wall often! I didn’t expect for Pansy to totally steal the show, but her character had my attention from her intro. Sorry, but I love geeky women.  As the show progresses she comes out of her shell more and more and by the end of the series, she has become a big part of the group.  I was a little unsure if I could trust her since was pretty manipulative, but I got over it.  Let’s be real, if Pansy told me she loved me, this would’ve been a single episode anime.  They better be working on season 2!

I don't really mind the tropes and "predictably" of most shows in the romantic, comedy, etc genre. They're fun, relaxing, and simple, they do what they're supposed to. Oresuki has the charm and fun of the others, but adds a level of sadism and meta humor to the mix. The characters and animation are beautiful and expressive, and it's a great show to watch if you are bored of the genre, or have a friend who is. Definitely worth your time.

This is a great series to watch. I love it so much. Incredibly hilarious,  and completely ridiculous, and I couldn't stop watching! If you love harem anime, then this is definitely a series you don't want to miss. I don't want to spoil anything, so I'm not going to say anything at all about the characters or the plot. I will say though, that the stoy arc of this anime is great I really hope we get a 2nd season, I really think it deserves to!

Amatsuyu Kisaragi, who goes by Joro, is just your average high school student. Nothing special, aside from two of his female friends in high school. The first is his cute playful childhood friend Aoi Hinata, also known as Himawari. The second is the beautiful student council president Sakura Akino, also known as Cosmos. During one week, both ask Joro to go on a date with him, Cosmos on Saturday, and Himawari on Sunday. On his date with Cosmos she suddenly confesses her love! Not for him though, but for his friend Taiyou Ooga, known as Sun-chan, the baseball team's ace. Cosmos asks Joro to help her get Sun-chan's attention, sad for Joro, but thankfully he still has his date with Himawari the next day. No, wait, Himawari ends up asking the same exact thing. Okay, let's start this again from the beginning.Amatsuyu Kisaragi, who goes by Joro, is a high school incel, now hellbent to help both of his female friends to try and date his best friend, expecting the loser to crawl into his arms. Although his plans are in grave danger when Sumireko Sanshokuin, who he refers to as Pansy reveals to him she knows what he's up to. How you may ask? She is his stalker, and is truly the only one who loves him.Oresuki is a fine example of character depth, and a great comedy about high schoolers and their seemingly petty conflicts. Every character in Oresuki has clearly defined motivations, and its those motivations that cause the positive or negative responses that push the cast forward as people. Joro and everyone else's actions reveal the type of person they are, but it is because of their shitty behavior that they are able to grow closer, not in spite of it. Because of that, the anime feels a lot more relatable to true friends in real life. Myself and many friends of mine all agree Oresuki's writing is fantastic, and I can strongly recommend it as one of 2019's must watch anime. The art is pretty and compliments the girls to make them even cuter, every personality is believable, and a harem relationship dynamic that's built from the ground up! There is plenty to laugh at, too much to pity, and even something to tear up about. As much as I want to talk more about it, you'll just have to take my word for it and watch it yourself, it's just that good!To those curious, I can highly recommend Oresuki. To those who already finished it, I bet you are anticipating it's finale next year in the summer just as much as I am!

It's been said already, but I was dubious about this show at first glance. However I was hooked from the first moment the mind-boggling bench was introduced. Throw in a healthy mix of outrageous 4th wall breaks, running gags(bench-kun), and a curveball at literally every freakin' corner and you have quite possibly one of the best if not the best, romcoms of all time and certainly of this year. My only regret is that it seems like there only be one more chance to savor this masterful mix one more time in the form of an OVA sometime next year. I absolutely love Oresuki.I'm not a reviewer tho.

I don't even know where to start. I love the art style, it makes the girls look attractive unlike "we never learn Bokuben"' which gives its characters a plain generic look. The plot is excellent. It always leaves you wondering, and thinking with its cliffhangers and crazy twists. The MC is amazing. He's got that Harem vision and can call a bitch, a bitch. This show knows how to pull the emotion strings. I keep getting flashbacks of my old highschool relationships and drama, and those old feelings just make this show even more relatable. I love Pansy and her character's use. Somehow everything always works in her favor and she's 3 steps ahead. And there are many things about her that I'm interested in regarding her backstory. I love their use of Symbolism. Sun-chan is the Sun, and all the girls are always looking to him. Joro means Water pot. And he's always helping each girl grow and learn. One thing a good show always has is a cliffhanger, or a unpredictable plot. Oresuki will send you to the moon and even to a bench.

I normally hate shows like this. but... it adds enough to it and flips EVERYTHING on it's head and removes the cookie cutter ways people work in anime. everyone is not 1 dimensional they have multiple aspects to themselves. the Mc for example will acts like a nice guy but he has a Hyde style to him and inside his head he acts like a lot of guys, (me included at times sadly) a total prick. i love that about this series. everyone is completely messed up in some way or another. pansy is a bit of a sadist and loves the MC for it. his best friend and student council members use him to get to sun-chan. he helps them to get in the one that loses pants. sun-chan a lot of people hate but, if you have ever been cornered and said stuff just to get a reaction, just to get them to back down. that's what he does to pansy. least that's how i read it. and that is a VERY HUMAN reaction. I highly recommend this show and it might be the best show for fall 2019. next to cautious hero anyway.bench-kun is antagonist of the year!

I had a slightly marred experience with this title at first simply because of the crunchyroll app video player not working with me despite everything else. However, I had a second chance to watch this as it is currently, I am only at episode 6. That being said, this show is amazingly easy to get into once you're in the setting. It was naturally hard to like the main character at first, simply because of what was learned of his personality. In fact I'd say it was bordering on Incel levels of cringe. However that was only the surface level impressions gained. Looking at how the story is written, and the scenes how well drawn they are, it wasn't hard to start to notice better parts of a character you could actually relate to. While rough around the edges, a steadfast loyalty to ones friends, even knowing the potential consequences; and seeing each of the other characters go from shallow, one dimensional beings to more realized and likable people. Very quickly each became their own people, flaws, quirks, and all.As an anime I never once found myself bored, it wasn't hard to see the symbolism behind the various hints the show throws, but it didn't need to be. Sometimes it is overt, and yes there is a bit of the typical pandering, but never after the initial episode did it feel intrusive. If anything it just helped cement what kind of person the main character is, being a bit delusional if anything. Every scene was paced well, all shots presented with purpose or underlying tone. The music accompanied while on the nose, never felt bothersome. Some scenes lacked punch, but those were few and far in-between, it even goes as far as to reference such lacking of its own accord.This anime is not perfect, doubtfully many are, but it makes it very easy to love because of it. The story treats its viewer with an intellect that is not needed, but if it is there, is easy to go and appreciate. It never messes around with it's own pace, and dispenses little details that go beyond the norm in anime. Above all, I can't wait to see how well the remainder of this show goes, and that should say it all along with the title.

So, memes regarding a certain piece of dark manga aside, this show is actually pretty good. As a comedy, the jokes land squarely, almost especially the ones that have repetition. What's a harem protagonist to do when the cute girls...all actually want to date his best friend? The characters are amusing, but everyone is also a terrible human being in their own way. Definitely would recommend as a seasonal anime. If you like harems, but would prefer something a little different, Oresuki is an excellent choice this fall.

This show goes from being one of the best things I've ever watched to umm... Wat.Our Protag Joro is not an innocent "Im average and I get all the girls" Hes two faced perverted and overall a huge jerk in my opinion. Which is good a fresh start for once... But this guy apparently has a nice heart and good intentions said by the prettiest girl in the school who covers herself and binds her tities. The one who likes him is her because the girls he wanted to get with like his equally jerky bestfriend. He tries to help them it fails because the girl that his best friend wants is the the girl he supposedly calls ugly even though she is actually the prettiest girl in the school(Only Best Friend kun Knows). Best friend kun sets up Joro and he set is the outcast. Girl he hates and calls ugly helps him resolve the whole problem. But then JORO has to apologize to them after they used him and made him an outcast????! Its Outrageous that he still wants to be friends, they didn't do anything to deserve that friendship again. Once he shows his true nature he does something totally out of character. He still calls the Pretty girl ugly insisting he could never date her with her personality but calls those other girls bitches which they totally were but, still would date them. She has a way better personality than them. But then again protag just wants to get in a pretty girls panta. Basically the protag is fake and everyone is fake. So this is a fucked up romance comedy that shows the audience just how fake the characters are. It's really good but if you can't stand fake characters I wouldn't watch it.

So this series was a wild card for me so far. I like to pick random anime to watch at times and took a risk.The cover of the series made me questionable, I thought that this show would be just another cheesy slice of life.Nope.This series so far, just 3 episodes in have been very fun to watch for me at least. Episode two is a wildcard in my opinion,but a wildcard im so grateful for viewing. I recommend this to anyone who enjoys a certain level of humor, seriousness, emotion and mystery. Most anime dont leave me guessing the next outcome or plot. Most series I watch just leave me feeling bland or refreshed, no inbetween. This series so far has given me a new refreshing and original vibe. Id recommend this for anyone who hasnt entered into the world of Slice of Life.

I would give it closer to 4.5 stars but I think its that good that i lean more towards a 5, among all the other sea of isekai coming out 2019, this anime is a funny drama about a boy and a love shape thing that I wont spoil for reasons. Its fairly relatable and extremely funny when it comes to the plot, its a very fun watch that i searched and read the entire manga and now considering buying my first light novel series. If you like comedies or dramas, or even slice of life type animes, definitely give this one a shot!

Starting right off the bat with the Fall season's arrival, we get a new anime, Oresuki. When stepping into the first episode, I expected the usual generic harem trash of a show we get every season, but the first episode proved me and probably many others wrong. This next section will contain spoilers.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideWe meet two people whom our main character likes. Cosmos, the beautiful, mature Student Council President, and Himawari, Joro's cheerful childhood friend. After being asked to go on a date with them, they both confess to liking Joro's best friend, Sun-chan. When I realized this, I just awed. It's a new take on the worthless Harem genre. Instead of the harem being on the protagonist, their friend gets the harem, and now Joro has to help Himawari and Cosmos be their "cupid."

Yea, this is another rom-com, so if you hate the genre, it can be hard to watch, but if you're here, this anime won't disappoint.Like hensuki, this anime gives a good twist to the regular "popular protagonist character loved by all of his cute, beautiful, smart and amazing girl friends"This anime at least is quite "original" in the recent anime series. Although the main concept itself is not exactly original, the use of that concept is quite refreshing in this anime. In an era of "Crappy Isekai Invensted" anime industry, this kind of series is greatly welcomed.

A high school romcom (sort of) in love with satirical romance. All signs point to this being a bold comedy, so don't hold your breath on expectations of heart throbbing romance that will make you fangirl out loud. It's a highly generic setup in many ways, but that doesn't mean it isn't something special. If I had to say something bad about OreSuki it would be the characters. Though they play out well in scenes, many characters lack depth and can feel highly generic to the point that they remind you of every other romcom out there. There are a few favorites, but many feel like cookies on a baking sheet, only a select few feel irreplaceable. Voice acting has a few stars and some bland performances. It's hard to tell if this is a result of the lines themselves or purely talent so far. If I had to say something good about OreSuki it would easily be the art. A vibrant, colorful setting has a delightful use of color schemes you might only rarely see in any genre of anime. Beautiful art adorns backgrounds and characters alike that make anything and everything the screen shows pleasing to the eye. Excellent attention to detail to all aspects of the visuals down to the little accessories. Comedy is a sticking point in the show, with clever writing that delivers with great consistency. The soundtracks are masterfully used. Though they might seem very ordinary and bland on their own, the use and timing of tracks is effective and adds impact consistently across diverse scenes. Animation is well done.Overall it's a comedy intent on showing the horrors of young love, an anti-harem if you want to define the genre. There isn't much the show has to offer outside of comedy and nice visuals. It does fall short of being truly great, but scenes are delivered with excellence again and again, unexpectedly turning what seems like a generic show into a moderate success. I give it a 7.8/10. Favorite character: Bench-kun.TLDR Version: Anti-romcom with stunning visuals. Not perfect, but very consistent. Cast is very weak. Repetitive but fun, for now.

As of writing this I have seen episode 2 and no further. I have also not interacted with this story in any other medium so I know diddly squat about where this is going to go. First off, I absolutely love the MC and his inner monologue. It’s hilarious and completely contradicts the nice guy attitude everyone else sees. The girls representing flowers and the popular guy being named “sun” is unique and fresh, I really like it. The rule of three in comedy is also present and frequently shows up (aka the bench and confession scenes) and having people lay out their feelings at the first episode of the show therefore avoiding the “keep it in nobody shall know” attitude that these kinds of shows tend to lean towards is enough to keep me watching. If you’re on the fence, give it a shot. I know I’ll be sticking with this one.Review will be updated at the end of the season.

I like this anime, because the main character is not the bland character you meet in the first minute (no spoiler).  I also like how he gets himself pretty deep in trouble even within the first two episodes... I'm looking forward to how deep in crap he gets, and how he gets himself out of it, or what happens in the end.I've watched to the end of the 2nd episode, and it ended on a huge cliffhanger.  I expect the whole series will be this way...

You might watch the first episode and think that it is basically every other generic romantic comedy anime. BUT, keep watching this one and you might just find yourself completely amused with all its unexpected twists. Yes, I read the manga so I can guarantee it's gonna be good and now I am regretting it since the animation is so good and I want to be surprised again.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideIncentive to watch: Yandere/Stalker-Main Girl

He's your typical clueless MC...Girl #1 is his best friend in love with... Girl #2 is the one he has a crush on who's in love with...You know this story, but this is not that story. Don't read further if you don't want to know the twist... Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideWhat happens next is not what you expect.  This is not your typical romance comedy but a Shakespearean romance/dark-comedy.  He's the MC who works his way through high-school with a purpose, just like a proper villain should.  Not that he's the villain, but maybe just maybe he actually is.  The show surprised me with a twist I did not expect, it was a pleasant surprise, finally a character who knows better and is not some clueless dullard stumbling over his own two feet.  Love it, oh yes I love this one!

This anime may be one of the smartest takes on a classic harem anime I've seen in a while. It does a great job of both refining the common slice of life romance while also expertly subverting those. Story 4/5: You have your generic male protagonist that looks exactly like Kirito from Sword Art Online. In his harem, the childhood friend, the student council president, the bookish girl, the journalist, the tsundere, and then a random girl who just got introduced so I don't know what trope she is yet. BUT, it starts off with the student council president and the childhood friend having a crush on this guy's best friend instead of him. And then the bookish girl turns out to actually be stalking the MC. The basic plot is the same as any other harem anime but where it gets good is in how the characters subvert the traditional archetypes they portray.Characters 4/5: The characters here are what make this anime actually interesting. Moreover, the MC isn't the impossibly dense harem protagonist we've all become accustom to. He's actually a conniving manipulative main character who beneath his layer of selfishness actually has a heart of gold. The bookish girl is similarly intelligent and manipulative and she's also ridiculously hot. The student council president is incredibly awkward and speaks like a samurai whenever she is flustered but is also intelligent and able to see through people instantly. This is what a harem anime looks like if people aren't idiots.Art/Animation 3/5: Pretty well animated. The girls are cute. THE BENCHES. The benches are OMINOUS. There's nothing amazing about the animation, but it is pretty standard and there's nothing to complain about.Sound 3/5: The sound works well with the anime. It can switch from a light-hearted tone to something ominous in a drop of a hat which also fits the comedic theme really well. OP is very skippable, the typical upbeat intro song. ED is pretty solid, but nothing to write home about.Enjoyment 5/5: This anime is hilarious. It does a great job of subverting the tropes and at the same time tells a compelling narrative filled with betrayal, manipulation, and hidden agendas. Characters are actually intelligent not stupidly dense. The characters aren't aloof and clueless as they typically would be and that is rare enough and an interesting enough that it got me hooked. Overall: Solid anime, great take on the usual slice of life harem. It's absolutely hilarious. I probably wouldn't recommend this for a first time anime viewer, but if you're familiar with how these stories usually go, the ways that this anime takes it in a different direction are refreshing take and well worth the watch.

This comedy starts out slow, but it is very similar to My Teen Romantic Comedy Snafu. At the beginning I missed why Joro is mean to Pansy, but I rewatched her introduction sequence and I got it. She was especially rude to him at all times, maybe trying to coax out his Mr. Hyde. But later, her feelings for him get in the way, his frank side has fangs and venom she wasn't ready for. It made me feel bad for her, but I guess she really did get to him with her insults in the past, we weren't shown those.That's the relationship I'm least confused about, we have an obsessive girl who has become a pain in the neck, and a guy who's fed up with being nice. The rest seems to be done for laughs or to set up the comedy. The confessions seem to have been simply for the gag to happen.The panty shots seem to be out of place. Nothing wrong with a bit of fs, but why? Anyway. The art is nice, I like this style and I even search out shows which use it. The music is in the show, I didn't notice quality or lack there of. The comedy is nice, some people have more sensitive funny bone than I, reading the reviews it seems some were absolutely tickled pink; I laughed. Sometimes. The samurai bit got me.All in all I can't give it 5 stars in its genre, or as an overall with Demon Slayer out there. DS seriously rose the bar for quality, and I don't think this show comes close. In the food industry 5 stars use to mean something, now it means the restaurant has cloth napkins and you get to sit and eat, I don't want that to happen to Anime. This is a standard summer comedy with panty shots and outlandish situations, watch and enjoy, but let's not pretend this is a blockbuster please.

You can be forgiven for thinking that this looks like another romantic comedy or harem anime. In fact, it is that, but it gets dark, fast, as our protagonist's dark side is revealed. The good news is that he has a capable, and apparently just as dark, nemesis. And so the first episode sets the stage for what could be one of the best anime of the year.I'm not gonna lie: if you identify with the protagonist by the end of the first episode, then you probably need some help with your anger and/or entitlement issues. Don't let that stop you from enjoying this journey of the antihero.

Pansy is incredibly selfish, cowardly, and constantly manipulates the people around her to the point where I highly question whether or not she is a sociopath.  Joro is a spineless white knight mangina cuck narcissist who constantly gets controlled by the would be-female overlords around him - and is unable to see the blatant bullcrap and needless female drama around him which he can easily shut down at any moment's notice by merely no longer giving a crap about what they do - and for him to just focus on his studies and just simply ignore all those females who do nothing but give him needless headaches and waste his precious time which can be better spent elsewhere.  This series is a GIANT cringe-fest for anyone who does not measure their success in life by the standards of female acceptance.  Good riddance.

After all the Isekai and shitty cliche rip offs of the rip offs we get something of actual substance. This anime should all be in your top 10 list just by the virtue of the first episode alone. This anime is the Shakespeare of modern times. Just watching this anime I can sense the Aristotelian aura that radiates from this anime. This anime will save anime as a whole just like how Aristotle's influence brought us out of the dark ages. It will revolutionize anime as we know it. Anyone who rates this under 5 stars is an idiot and we should all flag their posts. Edit: This anime is officially trash. The next episode after his "best" friend tries to destroy his relationships with everybody he knows out of envy he tries to be befriend when he has done nothing to redeem himself besides admit what he did. He didn't even apologize directly to the MC and him admitting it blatantly is so unrealistic and does not understand the motive behind people acting immorally. In every criminal's mind, they try to justify their actions as an act against the people who wronged them. If you want a full comprehension on this check out Lenoard Peikoff's lecture on what to do about crime. The first 2 episodes where good but this anime keeps getting worse and worse and I can not continue to consume this garbage. Minds that change especially ones of moral degenerates who act of spite and try to destroy everything the MC has built out of spite.

So its not your typical meme-y harem, but that doesn't make it better. They introduce the protagonist Joro as a manipulative "every-guy" who figures that at least one of his two love interests will get rejected if he feigns matchmaker. He's slimey. In the end it turns out Joro was the one being manipulated and Pansy played all the players who were all out to humiliate Joro. Except if Pansy is so good, why didn't she ask Joro out earlier? Or put him in a spot where he wanted to ask Pansy out? And the further you pull on the threads the less these characters make sense. There are too many 'whose the real victim' twists and not a lot of real characters.

I was just an five year old boy when I first had the pleasure of witnessing Dragon Ball on TV. Though I was perhaps too young to understand it, the image of Son Goku's distinct spiky yet relaxed black hair and infectious smile was ingrained into my brain forever. As I got older, I'd eventually move onto Dragon Ball Z at the age of eight after reading the first manga volume in the library of my Intermediate School classroom. The more I'd aged, the more I grew to love Dragon Ball. I was hooked, and my knowledge of the series was immense: Dragon Ball. The dreaded GT. Toriyama's Interviews. Daizenshuu. The movies. Everything and more. This isn't going to be a long review about my history with the series, but I include it so that the thesis of this review gets through:Dragon Ball Super is the sequel to DBZ we have been waiting for. It breathes new life into the franchise and is quintessential Dragon Ball. Elements from Dragon Ball Z as well as the original Dragon Ball seamlessly mesh into this new series. With the addition of new characters, such as Beerus the Destroyer and his charismatic (and-- I might add-- fabulous) attendant Whis. Along the way stronger and stronger foes are met and the stakes are raised to newer heights. Akira Toriyama has proven WHY Dragon Ball works: the characters, story, spectacle and world-building-- all of which are important facets of Dragon Ball Super that are immensely expanded and grown upon. New elements of the world-- such as the Gods-- have been introduced, and it not only makes the Dragon Ball Universe bigger, but gives it far more diversity and makes it far more interesting than previously thought. Even long-time characters like Goku, Vegeta, Piccolo and even Future Trunks are given careful, concise time to be developed. The series is able to inject effective drama and light-hearted, genuinely hilarious comedy into its narrative at the turn of the dime.While the animation can occasionally dip into the inexcusably category (I'm looking at you, Episode 5 and over half of the Golden Frieza arc), the show is never able to dissuade you from watching it. It helps that just about every episode ends on a cliffhanger, but it's more than that. It speaks volumes about the characters and story when, even though we know Goku is going to live since he's still alive during the last chapter of the manga (even though I-- for the record-- think will be series arc) and everything turns out fine, the series can still threaten the audience with the possibility of it all being destroyed. The sense of urgency is still felt, and that's what's most important in a series like this. To those who complain about the fact that we know everything will turn out fine: where have you been? Of course everything will turn out fine, this is a continuation of the definitive SHONEN JUMP manga. Even though, yes, the good guys will ultimately triumph, it is their character and personality that allows us to worry for their well-being. Dragon Ball has always been a series in which each character seemed to have a distinct personality and still fit the tone and world of the series, and Dragon Ball Super expands upon that. It's genuinely one of my favorite current Anime and I'd highly recommend it-- ESPECIALLY for Dragon Ball fans!

Ever since Super aired in Japan in July 2015 Ive been watching every episode a day after it aired in Japan with English subs from random sites because they never had a Legal legit source. Now that Crunchyroll is gonna be subbing Dragonball Super episodes and get them on here AN HOUR AFTER AIR TIME IN JAPAN. Holy shit thats amazing I personally unsubscribed because Fairytail ended but now I got another show + Naruto to watch and more on this amazing site THANK YOU FOR FINALLY GETTING DRAGONBALL SUPER !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I've watched most of DB, re-watched DBZ numerous times, GT a few times and don't specifically hate on it like many fans, and have now been following DBS...I knew going in, that it wasn't going to be a new DBZ, the style / humor / pacing / animation etc. would all be different.And while it took me a while to get used to the new animation style, I thought the show started strong in terms of story and to a lesser degree character development, but the recent arch and episodes is starting to get boring.I know that the DBZ power scale went out the window long time ago, but one important side effect of this is that for those of us who grew up with DBZ there's no longer any stakes in the fights. When you start the series with such a high power level that it was a danger to the existence of the universe, while episodes later, they're struggling against foes that make potholes with attacks that should destroy the planet, there is no investment into the characters anymore.

Dragon Ball Super was a huge disappointment for me, I love both DB and DBZ but when it comes to Super I just see it as another excuse for Toei to make money out of Dragon Ball once again. The characters are dumb, all of them. Even at times where you would think that the characters would take it seriously, they don't.There are no stakes, like... never, all of the plots or arcs are extremely predictable and the characters don't grow in any way, shape or form. Though if we are talking about power-ups God they have a lot of those. The series way of saying that a character grew is by Power-Ups, that they get by doing ... a lot of training? Losing a fight? NOPE, they get them because PLOT NEEDS FIGHT TO ENTERTAIN AUDIENCE. Talking about fights, the overall animation is MEDIOCRE. Yes, they improved just a bit in the newest episodes but it is still godawful compared to the much superior animation from DB and DBZ (even DBGT). They overuse still images and reuse the same scene more than twice in one episode. For some reason, the director had the brilliant idea of using Long Shots, leading to disfigured and disproportional drawings. There is also they ugly filter used in the last arc that made things even worse. DB Super is for the fans who just want to see Goku, Vegeta, and Freeza on screen once again. If you are looking for an actual plot with developing characters, moments of seriousness, stakes and an actual development of a narrative then DB Super is not for you. One Piece, Naruto, Bleach, and DBZ are all far better shows that deserve their fame, Super is just another cash grab just like GT.

Nostalgia. It's an incredibly powerful tool used to engage viewers and fans. For Dragon Ball, it offers a wonderful sense of nostalgia, growing up with Toonami  and classic anime like Sailor Moon. In that respect I'm almost more fond of the dub and it's wonderful throwbacks and appreciation for those early 90's dubs.Super is a difficult beast to review, it's still ongoing and whether or not it succeeds depends greatly on the fan and their perspective when watching. If this is your introduction to Dragon Ball then you'll find plenty of engaging moments, but also unnecessary filler and exposition. And, frankly at this point, even the casual anime fan is familiar with the tropes and pitfalls that have befallen every iteration of this iconic series. The question is if you're comfortable with that. I imagine that largely depends on the awareness and nostalgic grip the franchise has on you.It would be insulting to review this series without acknowledging its impact on Western audiences, and comparison is unavoidable. While I feel Super has yet to reach the heights of its predecessors, I also admit it would have been difficult to live up to years of expectation. Nostalgia can be greedy that way.The action is over the top and visceral, while the characters are exactly what we've come to expect. It's like coming home again. And there's nothing wrong with a reunion, you just don't want to overstay your welcome.

Dragon Ball is one of the all time classics of shonen anime and manga, and Dragon Ball Super, the latest addition to the franchise is no exception. However, it's worth noting that the first two arcs of this new series are watered down remakes of the films "Battle of Gods" and "Resurrection 'F'".I would suggest watching this new series in the following manner:Episodes 1-2, Battle of Gods film, episodes 15-18, Resurrection 'F' film, episodes 28+(Feel free to watch the Resurrection 'F' arc in the show as it does add a few interesting extra details, but the TV version of Battle of Gods pales in comparison to the director's cut of the film.)I'd also recommend watching the previous installments in the series, Dragon Ball and Dragon Ball Z (or Dragon Ball Z Kai, the filler free cut of DBZ), prior to this series if you haven't already seen them. (Although most people probably have by now, right?)

One of the greatest Anime series of ALL TIME. Picks up after Dragon Ball Z and invalidates the terrible Dragon Ball GT. Best action comedy anime of our lifetimes! All of the old DBZ characters are there but only Goku and Vegeta are relevant so far. The rest are more fan service than anything. Follow the story of Goku and Vegeta becoming gods, travelling through time, exploring the universe, and more. Very silly but compelling story. A true homage to the glory of DBZ.

It's exciting to hear Dragon Ball Super is officially getting subbed. They, also, created a department specifically for Dragon Ball, which is where they will brain storm new ideas for Dragon Ball Super, so it must be getting big. With many big anime shows out of the way, like Naruto, no surprise there. Looking forward to hearing more news on Dragon Ball Super. Maybe uploading the chapters of Dragon Ball Super is next. I'm sure it could be if the anime garners attention on here.

Don't get me wrong. I'm one of the biggest DBZ fans you could ever find. I was jumping with excitement when I heard the series was going to continue where it left off after the Buu saga. (I REALLY did not like Dragonball GT)DBZ is known for it's fast action, crazy power ceilings, and hyper masculine screaming to reach new pinnacles of strength. It's not known for having much thought behind the process of it. We gave it a pass when we were younger. But as we've grown older, we've expected some degree of finesse to be added to the story. The franchise's biggest fans are all adults now, of course. But the series began to disappoint me. The fighting animation didn't look as clean compared to DBZ. Some things just went off to where I didn't expect them to go, and in a bad way. New power ups beyond SS3, which already seemed godly in DBZ, is now just an afterthought in DBS. Future Trunks' saga, which I was really looking forward to, was marred by a lackluster villain and quite literal deus ex machina. And of course, a tournament supposedly timed under an hour is stretched out through SEVERAL episodes, revealing another badly paced production by Toei. I'm still watching the show. But at the moment, it feels like I'm watching it more out of homage as a DBZ fan instead of enjoying the show as it is. And as it is, it is a subpar show that takes too many creative liberties that it makes even a crazy, off the wall anime like DBZ seem ludicrous. I think Toriyama and Toei would benefit more from having a 13-26 episode production like more recent shows, as well as some editors to keep them grounded.

Dragon Ball has always been an extremely influential franchise, but after the Cell Saga in Dragon Ball Z, there really hasn't been a 'great' arc to really get behind and say 'yea, this anime is awesome'.In many ways, Dragon Ball Super is a good anime. Of the arcs within it I personally liked the Future Trunks/Zamatsu Saga and the Universal 6 Saga (in order of the two arcs I liked the most); they weren't perfect mind you, but they were good. However, the other arcs were a bit.... meh. Battle of the Gods and Golden Frieza each had movies covering their arcs so if you watched them, the anime arcs were a downgrade - not necessarily bad if you didn't watch the movies but a rehash if you did. Copy-Vegeta Saga didn't really offer anything new really - I would have rather had Trunks and Goten go off on some adventure and actually show some growth. The last one, The Universal Survival Saga, was ultimately a let down for me, and part of the reason I give this a 3 star review. The main antagonist, Jiren, was essentially Broly all over again (not the new Broly Saga, the older non-canon one) in that he wasn't interesting. I don't think he was necessarily a bad character to have but I don't think he should have been what the series ended with.Heck, Toppo was more interesting to me, and it likely would have been better to have Jiren get knocked out. One could even level the playing field so to speak by having Vegeta and Goku be eliminated with Jiren - Frieza was still around and I don't think anyone would mind seeing some character development done with him.Overall I'll end this by saying that if you were interested in Dragon Ball Z, Super is worth checking out. Ignore it though perhaps if you weren't interested in Dragon Balls though.

Love all DragonBall content.
