Super has yet to let me down looking forward to the new arch.Only thing I'm really hoping for is more of Gohan, Trunks, and Goten.As far as why you should watch it all the way through, it has everything you loved about DragonBall z. With more of the DragonBall world or world's to be more exact unfolding  in these new sagas. With returning favorites. The tournament of power really keeps you wanting more.

The story is often far-fetched with lots of cliches. Power levels are as b******t as they've been throughout the entirety of DBZ. The stakes get so high they become meaningless in the end. The supporting cast is pretty much useless throughout 90% of the series. It's not like there could be any non-godly threats to Earth that Goku and Vegeta wouldn't even bother fighting. Nah, that would require (gasp) character development and (terrified gasp) less screentime for Goku.Characters are mostly likeable or at least passable. The only character I ended up hating with all my strength was Goku. He seems to have lost all his charm and now I just find him obnoxious and dumb. The "getting a boner everytime someone strong appears" routine got very stale at this point and is just annoying. I'd so much love to get a mini saga just with the supporting cast kicking some a** for a change instead of having to see Goku get excited for no reason over and over again. Enough is enough!The art is ok most of the time, although I still don't get it how slimming down characters to the point they look almost anorexic (looking at you, Saiyan girls) fits the overall tone of the fighting-oriented story. Too much muscle was bad but too little is just pushing it too far in the opposite direction.Bulma looks like she not only didn't age after the Buu saga but she seems to have regressed to her late twenties/early thirties. It's not particularly bad, just weird. Kinda ruins the cohesiveness of the timeline and overall world building.Future Trunks also comes back with a different hair color and suddenly everyone is like "yeah, he always looked like that". Why force such a change when fans clearly remember a different look?Series also includes lots of fanservice: an obligatory Future Trunks saga, Broly (well, kinda), Roshi using the Mafuuba and many more.All in all, it's an enjoyable watch for diehard Dragon Ball fans but not necessarily a great one for everybody else.

dis chet right is the best work of anime of ALL time. ya heard? period. dont @ me pls. i grew up watching this chet and let me you something, let me tell you something. i am glad i did. if it wasn't for dbz i dont think the anime community would of been as big as it is today. dbz got me interested enough to watch other anime shows. and gotdam i praise baby jesus i did. but but but... yall really need to tie "GT" together. gt was quality.

With the end of the show and the upcoming movie in December, catch up and binge on Dragon Ball Super! If you enjoy non-stop action with a sprinkle of comedy Dragon Ball Super is just for you!Dragon Ball is a favorite anime of mine. I cannot express my love for it in a few words, seriously.  SPOILERS If you have watched Dragon Ball Z already, you know that the ending episode cuts to Uub (the reincarnation of Buu) fighting against Goku, now in Dragon Ball Super we see the amazing characters back in actions fighting through enemies between the time frame before Uub has grown up. With the Dub coming along its way, there is not a better time to watch Dragon Ball Super!  WITH THIS NEW REVIEW WILL YOU WATCH DRAGON BALL SUPER? FIND OUT NEXT TIME ON CRUNCHYROLL.COM!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FJavs8ZFBqsi honestly hope next series is going to take its lot more serious and takes less of a focus on fan service and being just a Goku Show (Actual character diversity is needed). So, where to start Super starts out with adapting first two movies in TV-format bit more stretched out in actual episodes and mostly not reaching same level as movies, there isn’t any real amazing fights or plot in the first two arcs. The real stuff pretty much starts in the 3rd arc where the universe is expanded and followed by god awful Future Trunks saga.The last Arc Universal Survival Saga is where the good stuff is – even though its just fighting and has little to nothing terms of story & lore. There is some background stories revealed for certain characters and then you obviously know they are gonna get knocked off.Overall super has shit ton of potential but it failed to meet standards of DBZ and thats the real shame here, perhaps toriyama and his crew were aiming a less serious series and more bit of a mixture between original DB & DBZ.

While it is indeed the very same Dragonball we all know and love, it's becoming clear that they're running out of ideas. I mean, Frieza's back for like what, the third time, and they just won't stop creating practically duplicate characters and reusing worn out scenarios. However, I do appreciate the refreshed visuals as compared to Z, and I can definitely get behind the music. But I mean really? I thought SSJ4 from GT was bad, but Super Saiyan Blue? Also I miss DBZ Vegeta, he's too goofy now ;-;

If you enjoyed DBZ before, you will love this one. The enemies are stronger, the abilities more irrational. Goku more oblivious, Vegeta more loveable. It is literally like riding a humour filled, action rollercoaster. The new abilities are cool and our heroes don't seem as invincible as before. Makes you just want to see what insane enemy they are fighting next. Its no Dragon Ball GT, but heck its Great Anime!

I am writing this review in the middle of the fifth story arc aka the Tournament of Power. The beginning is of the series is very slow starting. Essentially a mixture of filler, bad production and the two movies released before super Battle of Gods and Resurrection of F. The series doesn't really pick up till the end of the third story arc and beyond that. The fourth and fifth arcs are very interesting with lots of action and new/interesting characters. Essentially if you have not watched super and have seen the two movies mentioned above skip to Universe 6 tournament arc.

As someone who only recently became a fan of Dragon Ball, Dragon Ball Super is pretty interesting. I haven't seen any of the other Dragon Ball anime, but I've read the Dragon Ball manga and I really enjoyed it. I got the feeling while reading the Buu Saga that Toriyama was getting tired and that there weren't any stakes anymore. This problem of not having any stakes get fixed, eventually. And that is the most important part I want to get at. Dragon Ball Super gets good and finds interesting ways to raise the stakes, but you have to sit through at least one sub par saga. I also really love the new art style because when it's good, it's really good. But there are some moment where the art looks really sloppy. Some animation just looks wrong, but most of the fight scenes look really good with proper weight in every punch, something you can't say for other fighting anime. One big change, or what you could call a return to form, is the characterization of Goku. In Super Goku just wants to fight the strongest people, no matter the cost and with out regard for his own or other peoples life's. In my opinion this is when Goku is the most fun and  the most interesting, not when he a boring hero type, but when he just wants to fight.Is Dragon Ball Super the best anime ever? No. Does it need to be? No. Dragon Ball has always been about being fun as its number one goal and Dragon Ball Super definitely delivers. After some time that is.

Don't get me wrong I love Dragon Ball (Yes I am aware I am using the Term Dragon Ball just to describe  all of Dragon Ball universe not just Super or  Z or GT (lol some will be like wth GT) or the original but anyway) but I think their jumping too fast into arch and rushing passed it tad bit to fast just to progress the story further, its good but feels like little fast. EX: they jumped from point A to multi universe tournament under 100 episodes, but then again they are continuing from Z.

It has been a long time since a TV has made me jump out of my chair in excitement. I'm a grown adult and I found myself on the edge of my seat and audibly cheering. Don't get me wrong, as a fan, it's rough going at first. However, the Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideTournament of Power arc brought me back to the days of my youth. The fights were thrilling. I highly recommend this anime. If you are new the Dragon Ball Saga, honestly, this wouldn't be a bad place to jump in. You'd miss out on a ton of references and some context, but it's still just as thrilling. It's a story with a TON of amazing action. Try it out!

This series is a great watch, It starts off slow mainly because the first 20+ episodes are just retellings of the stories that the movies (Battle of Gods/Resurrection F) told. After that, the series really picks up. The only cons I can give it are that there are some really bad animation moments and its slow to start but other than that its a great watch. I think people who have watched the recent dragon ball z movies will like this series. I highly recommend this show.

Being a huge fan of Dragon ball and Dragon Ball Z, I found this show to be a little disappointing. It still kinda feels like the series I grew up watching as a kid, but not nearly as well written and has even less appealing animation than the shows that were made in the 80's and 90's.The story for the first two arcs I think was done a little better in the movies than it was in the show and the arcs after didn't seem that well written either. So far, the only arc I really liked was the tournament arc between Universe 6 and Universe 7. The show's incredibly slow too, even slower than the original could get. And of course, the animation isn't that great either when you compare it to the movies and the classic animation from the original show.It's not a terrible show, but the main reason why I'm still watching it is because I love the original series. And that's pretty much all I should say about this, I recommend this to Dragon Ball fans only.

I’d have to say dragon ball super is mediocre. I love the fight scenes they make up for the lack of great story line. I understand that Dragon Ball has been mostly about fighting, but it’d be fun to see new martial art style's to be included, more in depth story line. I just hate hearing Naruto fans honestly comparing DBZS to that anime. I would just like the writers to come up  with better story lines… IDK maybe train some new humans of earth to help defend the planet … I mean they need to start helping the humans become stronger to…

I grew up watching Dragon Ball Z, then late Dragon Ball, and a little of GT.While Super has its flaws I do love the series for its characters. I like seeing how they have changed over time and the new ones are a joy. The show starts off with a re-hash of the last two dragon ball films, while I prefer the Super versions due to the build up and characterization I will admit they do drag on a little longer than I'd have liked. If you have not seen the films yet then you might not have a problem with this. After episode 29 or so, new content for the series comes out and its best described as a mish-mash of classic dragonball flair and Z for the rest of the series. Newcomers should really start with either dragonball of Z but fans of the series as a while will find plenty to love.

Dragonball Super has been written to appeal with both the kids and the grown up fans. The comedy is enjoyable and many throwbacks to old school Dragonball is a delight to see. The little bits of character development are a treat.However, the writing is too childish at times, throwing the limits of the show right out the window. The shiny animation and the lack of blood are also a turn off. We all know what we think of the movie recaps.

Let me begin this review by saying that I've seen and read everything there is about Dragonball, Dragonball Z and even Dragonball GT. I'm also reading the manga for DBChou at the same time that I'm watching the anime and let me tell you that the mange is 10 times better from an art as well as a story point of view.We've all seen the terrible frames of animation shown on the first few episodes, and you can also say that most of the fight scenes are dull and abuse of Ki attacks to make it easier on the animators.But, with all that said, DBChou definitely carries over the same spirit that DBZ had. So much so that you could say that it has the same story all over again. Somebody strong rises up looking for a fight, the good guys lose, they train and acquire new powers, they fight again and good guys win. Rinse and repeat as much as you need...Also the 1st two arcs are the last movies that came out, "Battle of the Gods" and "Resurrection F" with slightly different story but not enough.If you feel that you need more DBZ in your life, look no further and enjoy the show, but please make yourself a favor and don't look for an amazing story. Just enjoy it for what it is.

I grew up on DBZ, and I found the original DB series to be even more enjoyable. And Dragon Ball Super? Way better than DBZ, in my opinion. DBS takes the characters we love and just has fun with it. The problem with DBZ was the intensely uninteresting fight sequences. Oh, there's a new big bad? And he's going to destroy the earth? And only Goku can save us?  Again? Sigh...I'll just check in every six episodes or so to see if they're done yet. DBS understands this. DBS even pokes fun at this, with Vegeta once commenting on Goku's tendency to never start at full power. If you are not familiar with the characters, I'd probably change my review to 3/5 stars. As is, it's thoroughly enjoyable and not as forcefully serious and tedious as DBZ.

Dragon ball Super is one of my favorite continuations of a story. At first I thought the animation studious had some flaws in Resurrection of F, but after that in the following arcs after Dragon ball super had the most realistic fights.In Dragon Ball Super, my three favorite fights were between Hit and Goku, Vegito and Zamasu, and Goku and Vegeta. In my opinion, these to fights marked the beginning of one great show.

Dragon Ball Super carries the emotion, action, and gorgeous art style that Z had, but adapts to a new audience at the same time. The show is funnier than Z was, which sometimes takes a not from more recent shows and their background gag visual humor, but other times just takes the characters we know and love and shows them struggling to do everyday tasks due to their ridiculous strength/lack of social skills. In some ways, it both keeps up with the times and returns to its Dragon Ball roots, where the show inherently was a parody; Goku, often unintentionally, makes fun of himself and Vegeta quite a bit, much to Vegeta's annoyance. This has nothing to do with anything, but I swear Goku gets dumber every year. Especially in the most recent arcs, we could very easily call this show "The Chronicles of the Many Fuckups Of Goku." Anyway, overall 5/5 - this most recent arc is amazing. Watch it before the internet spoils the good stuff!

Dragon Ball Super is a pretty good show...no, it's a great show. The story line is very cool and I am at episode four. I know I'm not far but far it's great can't wait 'till episode 21-46 come in two saturdays. So far Buu and Mr.Satan are my favorite I just love their little moments. They're not main characters but they bring a smile to my face.   I like Vegeta, Bulma, and Kid Trunks's relationship as well but Mr.Satan and Buu take the cake.

Dragonball Z was a guilty pleasure or your first introduction to anime depending on how old you are.  The story was repetitive, but heck, I liked it and I even played the Trading Card Game (ECP if anyone from the regionals circuit reads this)Now though?  Now we get to see Dragonball Z go off script.  This isn't a story designed to let Toriyama pump out a weekly issue.No real filler, how could there be?  Instead, these are just inconsequential comedy arcs that, for all we know, could play a role later on.  The action is just beautiful.  As we've all learned watching DBZ: Abridged, 1996 was 20 years ago and it shows.The storylines are complex.  Like we saw in the two movies, the world is just soooooo much bigger and the show turns DBZ tropes and lore on their ear.  The Tournament Saga is AMAZING.  Vegeta will, and this is not really a spoiler, literally mentor someone he likes very much by viciously describing murdering the other guys family.  It's a small moment, but it shows where the writing has gone.What happens when a character besides goku gets to have sudden inexplicable boosts?  You'll find out.  How about taking a trip to the literal mirror universe?  How about old school dragonball style fights that were more about puzzles than the next powerups?How about a new Trunks saga where in the first episode he splits a can of catfood with a freedom fighter before, shocker, running back in time for Goku's help and an entire episodes plot is like Beerus and Goku as buddy cops and it WORKS.Dragonball was always fun, but now?  Now dragonball is GOOD

The dragon ball series is back and dragon ball super starts off where DBZ ends. A fantastic and light hearted series that expands the dragon ball universe where Goku and friends go on new adventures. If you've been a fan of the dragon ball series and you dreamed of the DBZ series continuing since when you were a kid then look no further, since it is now here!Plenty of classic action, comedy and interactions between many different characters. Expecting great things to come from this series! If you loved dragonball or you are simply looking for lots of action and some comedy with a sprinkle of mystery then definitely check this series out.

I have highly enjoyed the series so far, and had wished to be able to properly watch it instead of having to rely on illegal subs.  I am thrilled to finally be able to see it legally.Super is different than DBZ and not in a GT way lol. Super is not as much action as DBZ, but does tell more story (more dialouge but not as much as GT) and feels a lot more light heart-ed by putting in alot more comic relief. I can see why there are some hardcore DBZ fans out there that are turned off by super when comparing it to DBZ.If you are looking for a anime of just pure fighting with not much of a story line (DBZ) this show may not be for you. *Spoilers: The first 30 or so episodes are just arcs from the latest two DBZ movies (Battle of Gods, and Resurrection of Frieza).

This show is incredible and a dream to any true fan of Dragonball.The animation is a bit wonky here and there but what mainstream anime doesn't? The first two sagas are the Battle of God's and Resurrection of F movie arcs but done a lot better, and with a lot more detail and character development than the movie's in my opinion. I'm not a huge fan of the 3D animation that the movie's used either. It's a lot like a perfect mix between Dragonball and DBZ. Definitely a lot more chill than DBZ obviously because they're not dealing with something as insane as Buu (until recently obviously). A lot more comedy and non filler slice of life this time around.ONE MORE THING: Every episode is by Akira Toriyama so there's NO filler.I would highly recommend this to any true DB fan.

Poor animation and art style: DB and DBZ put this to shame Boring characters: Name one character that would actually make you watch specific episodes again  Broken power system: I seriously doubt Master Roshi can keep up with the crew. There are many moments I honestly thought that was BS, but whatever SSG: Really? You guys buying this shit? What's next? Give me a rainbow hair The only reason that I am not giving this 1 star is because I get to see some Vegeta's character developments and interactions with his familyDBS really fails to carry on the DB series, stop milking...

This series kicked butt and held my attention from the first to the final episode. It has everything you can ask for including a deeper love for the characters we've known for so long. The character development for the supporting cast is really good as well, they haven't done this as well in the previous series. The pacing was really good in the series compared to GT and DBZ given that there was very little "downtime" in between significant events. If this is your first time watching the series, I do recommend watching the previous series simply to appreciate the characters a bit more. However, this is easily the best iteration of Dragon Ball as I have really enjoyed it as a long time fan.

I have been a fan of the Dragon Ball series for many years with the first one I ever watched being Z on Toonami after school and then shortly after the original and gt started airing on CN. When I heard the series was coming I was excited... maybe too excited lol but let me get to the point, this comeback was simply amazing and I enjoyed it for the most part. I say most part because being that I already saw both Battle of the gods and Ressurection of F, I didn't really enjoy having to re-watch it in the first two arcs even though there were some minor changes to the story but after those two arcs it was smooth smooth sailing with the tournament of power being the highlight of series. If you love the Dragon Ball series, you will love the latest installment. Enjoy!

Watch Battle of Gods movie, then episode 15, the Resurrection of F movie, then pick up the series from episode 28 forward. Returning Dragonball back to it's comedic roots, Super is much more jokey and light hearted like Dragonball before it. That said, there is some wonderful action scenes and true to the Dragonball series, the reason behind the fights is as good as the action itself. Not as screamy as DBZ andBECAUSE OF JAPANESE CENSORSHIPhas almost no blood. Still worth the watch.

Dragon Ball Z has always been in my childhood and when i heard Dragon Ball super came out i was very excited to watch it!! I got into it really fast still into the constant fighting goku and the Z fighters are into and in the last arc made me enjoy it even more!! But it does have some cons. Con #1 is that Goku is a bit careless, yes Goku is known to be a big dummy and all but they make him careless for his family and care more for his training and to get stronger. when in DBZ Goku cared for Chichi, Gohan, and Goten. (I'm still considering the fact he is one of the worst husbands in Anime history or one of the worst XD) Con #2, Many different things changed in DBZ Like Gohan he stopped fighting and went for the life of a teacher or something yes i know this was planned beforehand but it just ruined the Gohan a lot.

Without spoilers, I've been a fan of DB since I watched Dragon Ball as a kid in the late 90s and I have watched about everything except the two (yes two) live action movies. While I am not an expert, I am a major fan and the series does work well with the same formula as the other series/story lines. So if you like the old series, then you may like this series. It does make fun of itself in spots so that's fun and there are comedic spots here and there. If you like the original, I would say enjoy it but don't expect 10/10.

Dragon Ball Super pulled at my heart strings so many times. This was a literal rollercoaster of my existence. Sometimes it is 5 stars, sometimes it is 3 stars so in the end now that the series is either over/on hiatus I feel I can review the sum of all the parts openly.The show is good. It reminded me more of the original Dragon Ball versus Z in that it was more built on comedy than action. That's not to say action is devoid, just that it was more story and plot than just intergalactic fighting. Part of what becomes frustrating about DBS is the fact this identity seems to change at several points which I guess can happen over 130+ episodes but also frustrating if you prefer one versus the other.Now let's get to the point, DBS started off hot, cooled greatly in the middle but I defy anyone to tell me from episodes 114-end wasn't some of the best anime. I'll give everyone any other argument for this show if we all can agree the first 60 or so episodes were great, the Goku Black saga wasn't very good and the first 75% of the tournament was obnoxious at best. The last 15 episodes were tremendous and must watch for any DBS fan. Wikipedia the rest, then watch those.My biggest complaint and I am sure I am not alone in this was it becoming the Goku outlasts everyone in all the galaxies show. Yes, we get it, Goku is the star and always has been but at least at several points in the original DB and DBZ, he wasn't the most powerful in all the known galaxies. This show basically butters the bread by saying "hey everyone is ok, but Goku is the ONLY person that can go next level." It's a shame because Vegeta's character development was absolutely fantastic this entire series but when it came to power/ability, they basically hit us over the head with an iron shovel telling us he will always be second to Goku. In fact, my biggest gripe on Vegeta during DBS is he basically accepts this! It doesn't have to be him but really when you establish a new character in Beerus and then within a few episodes, Goku is matching/surpassing his levels and Beerus is supposedly a god. We need to scale it back.So that is my long winded way of saying, this was great at the beginning, it slogged in the middle and had a fantastic end. Watch up until the Goku Black saga, skip until about episode 110 and watch the end.

Look, if you're a fan of Dragon Ball, then you'll love this plain and simple.If youre a new comer to Dragon ball, then this is a great time to jump on board the Dragon ball express. The introduction of all the new characters is what sets this Dragon Ball apart from all the others. All of the new characters they introduce just shows how the future will be great for Dragon Ball. The animation is great, the action is great, you really couldnt ask for more from a Dragon Ball series. A definite recommend.

Once I saw Dragon Ball Super on Crunchyroll in July 2015, I was very surprised and excited about this one!! I watched it the first episode and it was very good. As always I enjoyed the arcs of Dragon Ball Super, my mind just fully blown away. I really enjoyed this series so much. Also, I love the dragon ball super characters like Goku, Vegeta, Gohan, Trunks, Piccolo, and more. I was so hyped on each every episode that I watched during the entire time. Dragon Ball series takes me on the great journey. I will give 5 stars out of 5.

The good news is it's more DBZ than it is DBGT, so if you love DBZ and want more stop reading this review and just watch it already. There's no need to sing it praises so let's get into why I couldn't give it a five. Remember kids, before you hate on this review I love this series for the most part; but I gotta be fair and objective. Starting with if you saw the last two DBZ movies (Battle of Gods & Resurrection F) then you've seen the first two arcs of DBS. Yes there are subtle differences between the two versions but not enough. Also Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThe future Trunks arc goes nowhere and only serves to explain why there are two Zeno's later. This show also has no mercy for newbies (let's be honest here, how can you call yourself otaku if you haven't seen DBZ?). Nothing is explained except for new characters powers and motivations. I understand that this is the fourth series in the franchise but a 12 year old who got a CR membership for Xmas may not have seen DBZ and might find this series unapproachable. It's a good action show with no depth, no character development and no metaphorical symbolism. For some that's good, for others that's bad. It's about guys (and gals now) punching each other, powering up, and hurling energy blasts at each other. For some that's good, others that's bad. Hence the lack of a middle ground. NOTE: Originally I was gonna give this a three but the addition of female characters who fight is innovative (For a Dragon Ball series) to elevate it to a four from me.

Dragon Ball Super does not go into full blown action packed episodes from the start unlike it's DBZ counterpart. It starts with a more funny and story based start and I like it cause newer fans can get use to the characters. It's been 18 years since the last episode of DBZ and some people didn't get the chance to watch DBZ or know all it's characters but they can now.I use to hate it when people said that DBZ has no story and is all action right off the bat but now DBS shows how the characters are developing before the big battles arrive. The starting is amazing for both old Fans and new ones.The music is enjoyable but I believe Signing Bruce Faulconer as the composer can do wonders to this series.The design is not always perfect but we forgive it as we love it so much.the tournament is pretty good and the fight are great. What a finish. Can't wait for what's next!

DISGRACEFUL, THE PRINCE OF ALL SAIYANS WOULD NEVER TRUST A LOW-CLASS WARRIOR! STUPID STUPID KAKAROT, HIS STUPID FACE MAKES ME SO MAD! ULTRA INSTINCT, MORE LIKE ULTRA CONVENIENCE, JEEZ TOEI WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU! GAAAAAAAAAAH! DAMNIT! TORIYAMA DROPPED THE BALL! JIREN TOOK THE ALL-MIGHTY FINAL FLASH STRAIGHT TO HIS FACE, HE'S DEAD! VEGETA CAN'T POWER UP?! DON'T WORRY ENOUGH POWER FOR GOKU TO GO BLUE AND LOSE AGAAAAAAIN GAAAAH

Overall the series was a massive success, filled with 3 defining story arcs slowly introducing and expanding on each other as the series goes on. Introduces new characters, motivations, and overwhelming odds against the heroes we know today. The art style starts kinda rough in the beginning but improves and looks splendid past the 1/3 mark i would say. Filled with well animated and entertaining fights, some surprise twists here and there, and some good charactering and development for most everyone in the series. There are some characters whom, without being in the show, would not cause any sort of detriment to the overall series, both of which are from a universe introduced in the show, and are stronger than they really deserve to be. Aside from that, good series overall and a must watch for any DB fan.

This series buld upon the awesome franchise most of us grew up with. It's a fantastic following to DBZ. While being quite irregular at the beginning, overall quality has improved to a point where it's hard to find faults. There is the fact that setting the tournament "time" to less than an hour is a bit dumb, and the quite underwhelming end of the Zamasu arc, but the quality of animation and character development towards the end of the series makes up for all of this. I was especially glad that they made Gohan "not useless" again, afther his character hitting rock bottom at Resurrection of F. Also, seeing Goku and Freeza cooperate was a treat.I really hope DBS to continue.By the way, MasakoX and TFS, please make a DBS abridged. It would be so awesome.

I want to start off that in these times of animated shows I've never been always extremely pumped anticipating a new episode of any show mostly because there are little animated shows that I like now in these times but also to me they're few in numbers. Thankfully there's Super, there was Ushio to Tora but it ended but there's still Super! Coming from someone who has watched Dragon Ball Z on the old Toonami (I'm a veteran with the cartoon shows we're not in golden ages of cartoon anymore just about facades and acceptances) this show has that feel regardless of what ppl think of animation, fighting, conversation, soundtrack(huge improvement even over Z not just Super's beginnings) which in my book looks fine and has come a long way since its beginnings. Long story short what the cast of this show has produced is phenomenal and does animated show career proud unlike a lot of this crap out on tv now. All I can say to anyone who looks at this review is just watch the show and see for yourself but I'm confident you won't walk away disappointed. Don't just watch the show but also listen to it.

I've been watching Dragon Ball my entire life and i assure you that i am a huge fan of the series. Dragon Ball Super is no exception, with the introduction of new character and other universes is insaiyan. But its not perfect, for example i wish they didn't rush the universe survival arc so much i feel like they could have done a better job of giving the newer characters better introduction and backstories to improve the character development in the anime. The thing that irritates me the most is the animation, in some episodes the animation is like experiencing orgasms in you eyes in other episodes it feels like your eyes are being gouged out with spoon. I personally don't care how long the episodes take to develop i just want to experience detailed everything. In the episode 130 i was blown away with the animation i could not believe what i was seeing, the fight was absolutely amazing i was speechless. If every episode was animated like this Dragon Ball Super would be the greatest anime of all time hands down with no competition.

I loved dragon ball super honestly, it was very cool seeing more of goku and his friends and that idea got me hyped but THIS? this was more than i could ask for... of course, like any other anime there are some plot holes but it was so fun watching that it didn't really matter to me. Plus the animation towards the beginning of the series wasn't the best but be episode 20 or so it was fixed and the hype was back on!

Although the anime is a little slow going and takes awhile for things to pick up,  Oh boy is it worth it!!! Classic Shounen greatness and very nostalgic of DBZ but with a lot more focus on character development.Of course, the fight scenes are as epic as always, and you see some new faces you thought you wouldn't see again along with battles you thought would never come to fruition.I was very hesitant going into the anime because DBZ was the first anime I ever watched (along with many others), and I was afraid it just wouldn't be able to live up to the expectations. Though it didn't meet my expectations, that's not necessarily a bad thing; because this is honestly a DIFFERENT anime than the ones that came before it. Not in the sense of how it develops, which is very much similar; it's more or less the overall feel of the show itself. It's hard to explain but it's very good at touching new ground while still maintaining those classic Dragonball tropes, both good and bad.Overall I think it's excellent, and I look forward to its conclusion this month. I will update the review of course after I finish the show. But I don't think much will change. I hope this helps. <3

Dragon Ball Super is a great anime continuing dbz . Everywhere i go i hear people saying dbz is better , dbs sucks, dbs is the worst thing to ever happen and etc. which is annoying considering that its not all that bad. I enjoyed watching it and i would definitely watch it again. it has great fights. broken power levels, universal stuff and more. it even has the great and almighty powerful monaka, that is way too strong. Tbh sometimes reviews are completely useless. everyone has their own opinion and like different stuff. I'D suggest instead of reading a review to instead just start watching the anime. if you enjoy it then you can continue on , and if you DONT like it then you can just quietly leave instead of posting some super long review about why dbs is complete trash and doesnt deserve to be popular because of how bad it is

This literally sparked the flame of my interest back into dragon ball, and it's plot is great. The fights are well planned and executed, but there's one problem: It's too drawn out. When I want to watch an episode and find out what's happening, I don't want to watch 3 episodes of talking leading up to the fight, I want the fight just a tad bit sooner. I know it's because japanese animators have heavy workload in a small amount of time but that should be fixed by the company (i.e. more workers and better pay)

This anime is a another take on the "Good student tutors the hot chicks because he needs money" premise. While the characters are certainly likeable enough, they are mostly one-dimensional. The protagonist is also written as the stereotypical universally hard working and nice guy, without much of a personality beyond that. You could check off the cliches as though you had a checklist, with many in the first episode. It's not a bad show, which makes the reliance on standard cliches and impossible coincidences somewhat of a tragedy. The writing is uninspired. The artwork and animation are good, but not amazing. It's a cute show. And it's got some entertainment value. But like a fast food cheeseburger, while it might satisfy you for the time being, it doesn't feel like a memorable experience. Which is an unfortunate case of unrealized potential.It isn't as though I disliked it. 3 stars is a positive rating, and I would watch another season. It just didn't do anything particularly memorable. They are all nice, cute girls. And there's no shortage of anime which offers that.

This show it definitely worth following every week. Especially if you’re a Quintessential Quintuplets fanThus far, I find this show quite similar to Quintessential Quintuplets, but there are some striking differences as to the way this MC communicates with the initial girls. I found the gentle nature of his approach and his desire to understand where these girls are coming from refreshing. The girls are geniuses in their respective subjects but fall flat on their opposite, logic vs creativity, right brained thinker vs left brained thinker, and this week added an athletic student with a crush on the tutor since middle school.I’m going to continue watching and won’t be able to help comparing with the quintuplets but I think this show may have a much more down to earth approach than the over the top style of quintessential quintuplets which I really enjoy. Plus, this tutor is much more approachable and kindhearted than Futaro.

I had a lot of doubt going into this series because I had heard many negative comments having to do with the fact that the animation studios making the show had not done much. But boy was I relieved when the first episode came out and it had quality animation as well as great voice acting.Now the second episode comes out and it's just superb, the manga is being adapted well and you can see all of the character's emotions displayed efficiently.It's definitely a must watch for anyone who likes a goofy harem. It's not the typical harem you see all the time, it's a lot more realistic but the comedy is what really makes it worth the watch.

I've enjoyed what I've seen right now (s2, episode 8), and the girls are all adorable. Although honestly, that's about where it ends. The most I can say is it's very cute and good "soul food" for lack of a better word.So far there's very little for actual progression or development between characters and their relationship, other than Ogata being able to express emotions better. The rest of the series and how the characters react to the generic-main-character-who-works-hard-and-is-nice-to-everybody hardly changes. Most of the girls are overly innocent and miss obvious signs or hints that a viewer will pick up instantly, and make a lot of the scenarios awkward. Compare season 2 of this to the Quints first season, it's obvious which one has more character development and changes in relationships.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideWhat caught be off guard with this series is in s2 ep8. Uruka is offered to study abroad after performing well in nationals. Rather than declining and staying home because she wants to be with Nariyuki, she actually accepts, knowing their relationship might change! Finger's crossed this doesn't go the Oreimo route and Nariyuki goes after her to bring her back home, and we end up back in square one with no changes in the relationship, and Uruka being held back from her career. This show's not that memorable, and I'll probably forget about this one once it's done until I come across some fan art on social media or something. This doesn't mean it's bad, though. I've really enjoyed my experience and would gladly watch a season 3 if it were to ever happen. It's very cliche and generic, but it's executed in such a way that it still works

This show is like watching somebody play a really tedious-but-suggestive dating sim. I'm ok with that. If you like your jokes cheesy and your cliches very cliched, come on in, sempai. Look, this show is basic af, and CR wants me to write longer review. So, let's rate possible ships:1. Nariyuki x Uruka (best girl)2. Nariyuki x Fumino3. Nariyuki x Mafuyu (yes i went there)4. Nariyuki x Asumi-senpai5. Riza x Sawako6. Mafuyu x Asumi7. Nariyuki x the entire maid cafe8. Nariyuki's anonymous friends x the anonymous girls in the public bath9. Nariyuki x Riza (love you Riza but last on this list)

Learning, in and of itself, can be sexy, which is one reason why uncomfortable attraction vibes can easily stir between students and teachers. When that's combined with real established anxiety and a need for affirmation, you have a solution to the "Yeah, right, the girls like him" harem quandary. Yeah, right, they like the tutor because he teaches them to learn in ways they had not been able to before, because he's kind and patient, and because he's acceptably good-looking and quick on the uptake.This show is really good. The girls who the tutor helps are all charming and actually a bit complex, and they form friendships that don't rise or fall on competition for the guy they like in common. All of this takes place in a world sweetly drawn and animated. If your soul is hurting, this show might help ease it. It did mine.

The story is pretty cool, I mean, the genre isnt new, the plot isnt new, the whole "tutor" thing has become a trend, and it's pretty fun and interesting to watch our boring basic main character, have all the girls throw themselves at him, but at the same time it's annoying that somehow he is unaware of these girls having the hots for him... obviously I'm exaggerating with the "throw themselves", the girls like him and that's about it, only one of them throws herself at him... but it's pretty much a guy tutoring 3 girls that have mixed feelings for this dude that has no qualities, other than being selfless and smart. Like seriously, I dont get how people give this a 5 or even 4 star rating. No wonder anime is so condensed with garbage. Theres nothing special about this story, but it is cool and interesting and fun, all female characters are cool and cute, but the MAIN MALE character is so generic like always.. 3 stars is more than enough, if the Male character was interesting, then I'd give it 4, but no..  same stupid generic character like always.

I saw this as one of this seasons new shows and I decided to watch. By looking at the cover art for We Never Learn: Bokuben I expected as slice of life school harem anime. I have thought the the characters were well developed. I watched the first episode and I enjoyed it and continued to binge watch the next five episodes. i have enjoyed watching We Never Learn: Bokuben and I recommend and will continue to watch.

I found the first episode rather exhilarating. It may not be completely original, and by all means most animes are not, but you'd be lying if you said it wasn't good. I was recommended to watch it by a friend who is in the process of reading the manga. A beautiful intro soundtrack followed by presumably strong story and characters with distinguishable, memorable traits. I found myself smiling and by the end of it eager as to what will happen next. Defiantly worth watching and critiquing for yourself.

The show isn't original by it's overall plot, a boy who is good in all subjects has to tutor girls that are amazing in only one, but it's still a fun anime. The show seems full of good humor and has very good artwork throughout the first episode at least.    The opening and closing songs are catchy and upbeat enough that I will likely listen to both every episode.    No one so far seems like a terrible character either. All of them have at least some flaws that give them depth, and will most likely be plot points in later episodes.   I give this anime 5 finished notebooks out of 5.

Honestly this anime was just amazing for the first season, and I loved it and thought that it had very good potential.... and then it literally just goes straight downhill season 2. Not to say that the story itself wasn't good, but you just wouldn't see it coming. If you like anticipation and doubt I would recommend this anime for you, however just know that you were warned before you emotionally invested yourself in this train wreak.

Bokuben is a standard harem anime with a similar concept to Quintessential Quintuplets.  Unfortunately, unlike Quintessential Quintuplets, it never breaks away from the mold or does anything to outshine the tired old harem character tropes.Plot 2/5: Plot-wise its about as standard as it can get. A bunch of girls are idiots in specific ways and want to pursue higher education and career's in exactly the topics that they are weakest at. You have a growing entourage of cute girls that are attracted to the most generic main just because he's a nice guy. He tutors these girls because he wants that coveted college recommendation from his high school. Plot points are just about the same as in any other generic high school harem anime. There's tests they study for, a school festival, a fireworks thing, and some random family drama. Usually for these harem anime, I put it to the test of, if there was no ecchi, would there be any plot. Unfortunately, there isn't really enough character development, drama, or change to really speak of in the anime. It's like 90% fluff. Characters 3/5: Characters are similarly generic, you have your no personality main character and his harem of girls who have frustratingly 2 dimensional personalities and fit exactly in the archetypes you'd expect. There's the kuudere smart girl, a cool beauty teacher, an energetic childhood friend, a petanko senpai and the princess. Each has some level of backstory and character development. My personal favorite is Furuhashi who has probably the most developed backstory and best character development. Everyone else more or less stays the same way as they start off, with minor growth and character development. Art/Animation 3/5: Art is fairly standard, but it does have some decent animation, most notably in the school festival. It's not amazing, and things are usually drawn in a relatively cutsy style rather than a drop dead oh my god this looks amazing type of look, but the animation isn't bad. The most I can really say is that it's standard what you'd expect from an anime created in 2019.Sound 3/5: Season 1 OP and ED's are very skippable. Second season had a catchy OP and ED, but not amazing. There's some decently nice soundtracks that I could see myself listening to outside of the anime. Voice acting is decently good too. Again not anything that really stands out to me as just amazing, but it gets the job done.Enjoyment 3/5: This anime will fill your harem fix. It's not amazing and if you want something that's similar but just better in many different ways, I recommend Quintessential Quintuplets (which I wrote a review for). For a casual viewing it's a cute, feel good story that will keep your attention to the end. Don't read this spoiler if you care who actually ends up with the MC at the end. I don't say explicitly but I hint. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideI like how this anime actually makes a decision at the end. Where most harem anime just ends with like OH ITS ONE OF THESE GIRLS and they just run off into the distance yelling at each other. This anime actually makes a decision. I kind of disagree with who it should be, but at least they have the balls to go for it. Overall 3/5: This is one of those anime where you might not really care about it that much but its pleasant enough to watch to the end. It hits your harem fix and has all the cute girls you want hitting a very diverse set of tropes. I'd recommend Quintessential Quintuplets over this if you want something that is basically the same plot but executed better with more plot.

With it having just finished recently, I'm not sure how long this show is going to linger in my heart, but it was certainly a fun and light adventure that tried to fill the hole in my heart that's been there since Nisekoi finished. That being said, it wasn't what I would call a perfect show.The Art: It's good. The reason I mentioned Nisekoi in my opening statement should become pretty obviously pretty much right away. A lot of this show looks very much like Nisekoi looked. While there aren't any crazy over-the-top action scenes like Nisekoi had, everything here is still pretty nice, and even the obviously computer generated car isn't too intrusive.The Characters: This is usually the home-run in these sweet little who's the hero going to date romantic harem shows, but it's actually the part where I dock this show a tiny little bit. All of the characters have nice designs, and are interesting enough that I want to know a whole lot about them, and that is kind of the problem with this show. When we first start our hero is the tutor for two girls, and you'd think that those two would be the focus. The problem (and it's also present in the manga) is that this show has a terrible case of a wandering eye. It starts introducing other potential romantic rivals before fully fleshing out those first two. Every once in a while it comes back and adds a little bit more to one of them, but then doesn't really do a deep dive into the other until the show is coming in for a landing. When you compare this to something like Nisekoi, where you kind of knew the origin story of every potential romantic rival an episode or two after they showed up, I'm not sure I'd pick this one instead.The Story: Is very beast-of-the week. Thinking back on it now, I remember a lot of the highlights and peak moments, but if you cut them all up and told me to put them in order, I'm not sure that I could. That might sound bad, but it actually isn't. Almost every episode is kind of a self-contained thing (sometimes two self-contained things). You start the episode and they've set up a scenario. Romantic comedy things happen. They resolve the story, and if there was a joke it pays off. It actually makes for a nice relaxing low-stakes watch. It also does a thing that a lot of these shows are afraid to do, and at the end our hero actually picks a girl, which is a surprising development that I can get behind, even if I'm not sure I agree with his choice (come at me fanboys).Final Thoughts: For me this show was the bandage that my heart needed after the end of things like Quintessential Quintuplets and Nisekoi. At no point was it as good as either of those two shows, but it tried, and that effort was appreciated.

seasons 1 is great seasons 2 still great+Fumino Furuhashi is most sad backstory made me cry+Nariyuki Yuiga is awesome dude he try help all this girl reach goal + i like Mafuyu Kirisu most of them she at first very cold after few episode she actually nice +Rizu Ogata she nice and when friend hungry her come to rescuing i like she do  puffy cheeks so cute and she afraid dark+ Asumi Kominami she  like teases  Nariyuki  and is so cute she dont have screen many time but when do is very cute+Uruka Takemoto    have energy girl

All of the other girls look normal, but I feel like a pedophile even LOOKING at the cover art. I don't want to see a harem with a third grader that would use safety scissors. Hi, member of team blue here, just wanted to say this show is FANTASTIC! All of the girls are fantastic though, Asumi with her relentless teasing, Mafuyu and her eccentricities involving bugs and liquor, Rizu's seriousness, Uruka's determination and love for swimming, and Fumino's love for the stars. Loved every second. I love how Nariyuki cares about all of them and wants to help them succeed in what they want to do.

Not going to lie, I started watching Bokuben because of the meme with Furuhashi looking shocked but I was pleasantly surprised. Out of all the animes I have watched slice of life/harem have been far and few between but I have really enjoyed every episode so far.This anime has really nice character progression and intimate relationships that expand into onces you can back and support all the way through. The show also isn't afraid to be lewd to the max but it plays off in a far more comical than creepy fashion, so much so that I found myself laughing out loud unexpectedly at scenes throughout the series. The story branches just enough to keep it interesting but not so much that it starts to be confusing for the audience. It's a fantastic watch that I would highly suggest to slice of life/harem fans and your everyday anime watchers alike! I certainly look forward to what the rest of season two has to offer!

Nariyuki Yuiga is an impoverished third-year high school student, pouring blood, sweat, and tears to receive a VIP nomination scholarship to cover his college tuition fees. One day, the school's headmaster offers him the chance to gain the scholarship, but there is a catch. Rizu Ogata, Fumino Furuhashi, and Uruka Takemoto are some of the best students in his school. However, while each of them are top of their class for their respective strengths, all three of them are working towards dreams that involve their weakest subjects. Except Takemoto, she's working for a sports scholarship, and is terrible at studies in general. The headmaster will give Yuiga his scholarship, if he can help these three girls in their studies. While each of them are fantastic students, they are seemingly hopeless in studies involving their goals. Yuiga, who isn't particularly the best in anything, now has a lot on his plate as a normal student trying to teach the elites in this harem romantic comedy.We Never Learn is so much better than I thought it was going to be, let me say that right now. Back when this show aired in spring 2019 (nearly six months ago) I saw the first episode and wasn't impressed. However, with a second season airing just around the corner, (a week from writing this) I figured that this anime was at least competent. So I decided to give it another go.Long story short, it won me over effortlessly, and all that credit goes directly to all six of the anime's leads. Now I'll admit, it was easy at first to pass over this anime, especially since The Quintessential Quintuplets had just finished airing at the time, but after giving it the time of day I am eating my words like dirt. I will be talking mostly about the characters in this review since it's the strong suit of the anime, I'll talk about Nariyuki Yuiga's character last. Rizu Ogata serves as a sort of tsundere character, although she isn't loud and proud about it like most tsundere characters. She becomes easier to talk to quickly, and shows off a very adorable side while trying to be the most mature one in the room. Fumino Furuhashi is the most normal one of the group. She comes off a bit ditzy at first, yet is able to read everyone like an open book. Most of the characters come to her with their problems too, which is hilarious since she has already read them like a book, and already knows their problem but can't reveal what else she knows for fear of causing more discourse. Uruka Takemoto is already in love with Yuiga from the start, but can't find the courage to tell him. She's full of energy and gets along with everyone, characters like her are not original, but they are always fun to have in harem comedies. Mafuyu Kirisu is the Student Counselor, she's a kuudere through and through. Or more accurately tries to be. Never showing any weakness around the students, while also being generally clumsy or lazy in private. She's actually more of a mayadere, in a slice of life if you can believe that. Finally there's Asumi Kominami, who's a graduate of their school, popping into the story later to tease Yuiga and fight the rest of the girls for the spot of best girl. Which is honestly the main reason you should watch this show, all of the girls are a great candidate for best girl. I honestly Don't know which one was my favorite, so I'm going to sit on the fence and pick all of them! So where does our protagonist Nariyuki Yuiga come in? Well that's where the story really lies, since all of the girls are flawed despite being geniuses in their respective strengths. Nariyuki Yuiga, a normal student with no specific strengths, comes together to help encourage them to keep going. Admiring that they all are struggling just like him to achieve their own goals, he takes it upon himself to keep them from backing down. It's very similar to the anime I mentioned earlier, The Quintessential Quintuplets, except with different character backgrounds, and more of an emphasis on comedy. If you have seen and are a huge fan of Quintuplets like me, I think you'll enjoy this one too. If you haven't seen this seemingly new trend of tutoring focused harem comedies, I'd say you shouldn't make the same mistake I did, and have some fun with We Never Learn!

While it seems that this might be very inspired by Quintessential Quintuplets, I can't say which came out first in the manga for certain so I'll review it on its own as best I can.This is the kind of show that was just a very comfortable and easy watch.  It had some serious moments but in general it just had a ton of heart and feelsgoodman moments.  The characters were all very likable with the male lead being a little underwhelming (but let's face it, who cares about him anyway?) and they all had lead moments.  It was funny, clever, and heartwarming.  I take off a star only for the overused ridiculous art moments that I didn't really feel added to the show.  Too many dumb faces and lines and all those other tropes, I'm just not into it.  Solid show, would recommend a watch.

It's lighthearted for the most part and has enough substance to keep your interest. The manga is great and I love the parts of the show where they have the chibi heads pop up and talk. It is very true to the manga's style and I hope that anyone who loved this show would pick up the manga. It's definitely worth it! Especially because the anime can't cover all of the stuff that has happened in the manga. ENJOY!

This is a really good anime and i wanna tell you it not a heaream even through there are girls in the picture that likes him all of them don't which makes sense. Most people don't have six girls liking them. It also gives the girls true motivation for learning and himself has motivation for helping them other then just wanting to help his friends. They all develop and become better from their friendships and it a pretty good anime because of it. If your looking for a slice of life anime this may be for you.

This is a harem anime, and if you hate harems, then it probably still wont change your mind. But, this is the right way to make a harem anime! You have a main character who is actually likable and easy to relate to. You have a varied and well developed cast of very different girls, all with their own distinct personalities. It's a harem and it knows full well it isn't a serious story and it takes full advantage of that fact to deliver outlandish and amazing scenarios that would almost never happen in real life. I laughed so much throughout this show! This series has jumped right to the top of my list as the best harem anime I have ever seen, and one of the best comedies! An absolute gem and a must watch for fans of either comedy or harem anime!And perhaps the best news upon the end of season 1 is a confirmation of season 2! None of the nonsense where the studio leaves you hanging wondering if the show will ever continue! Pros:Outstanding cast with great character development!Laugh so hard you cry humor!Great music!Colorful and creative visuals!Cons:It's a harem. It's massively unrealistic. (This however could be called a pro too!)

While the anime contains a lot of cliches and all, the character progression in here is absolutely awesome. I never thought that a slice of life romance comedy could be this good. In fact, so good that I read the manga in one go and bought the first 4 volumes that are currently translated.So character progression, pacing and characters all are very well written and the story is very interesting.Normaly not my type of anime but this one is just teriffic. It really fun to watch.

I think I'm like a of reviewers I have read who started watching this show because I loved Quintessential Quintuplets. It is a very different anime from QQ though. I would say the only similarity is that one guy tutors four girls. The characters each have their own querks, but one thing I love about it is how the M.C. supports their dreams and is helping achieve them and not just telling them to "stick to what they are good at" like everyone else. It also has a great deal of heart, which I think makes it even better.

I'm surprised by how many new Anime get 5 stars from so many people. This one is good, but not nearly as good as, for example, "Fruit Basket" or the one about the occult phenomena.The characters on this one seem a bit one dimensional and not very believable; barring some severe learning disability a student can't be excellent in Math and zero in literature. At least in the story with the five sisters the characters were more believable and relatable.

Been really looking forward to this. A great manga series that I am about 3 volumes in. So happy to see this series get an anime. Another of these funny tutor scenarios where the main character is put in a position of having to teach some of the elite girls at the school. The thing that makes this series stand out from the rest though is the writing and characters. The writing I just feel is really well thought out and carried throughout this series. They do a good job of balancing funny situations and romantic segments. When these two elements are well implemented give you a real satisfactory feeling that your actually personally invested in. Not only that but these characters are given an element of realism. This keeps the story grounded and relate able.

I feel like the show still has its fun personality, and the start already shows a lot of promise. The show is obviously not perfect, but let's not pretend like season 1 was either. The animation is a tiny bit uncanny, but I think if we make comparisons to the first season too.. Season 1 didn't have the most perfect animation. Overall, One-Punch Man has fun characters, nice soundtrack and interesting plot. I'm looking forward to more of this show, and have rewatched season 1 several times now.Edit: As I wrote this when it had just started, I feel like I need to add to this later on. My beliefs are still the same. I feel it delivered. One thing I have to critique is that there are too many cliffhangers. Definitely something I will be binging and rewatching later on.

Of course this season is worse than season 1 but compared to other anime it is very good. The only thing that bothered me in the first episode were fights but i think there were so many cuts in them because the animators made new scenes to replace ones that received bad feedback.I think that in the next episodes there will be more fluid fights because the animators have more time to upgrade the quality of them than what time they had to fix episode 1.Opening in my opinion is nearly as good as the last one and I can't wait for the full version of the music video.

Season 1 focused mainly on Saitama, and the supporting cast. Season 2's focus is mainly on Garo. Which makes sense if you ask me, he's this arc's bad-guy, after all. Yes the animation is a bit different than season 1. So what? Can't expect two different companies to produce the exact same product. TL;DR: Not the same animation. Focus is mostly on the bad-guy. People are salty because OPM S2 is mostly about character building, not mostly about Saitama.

The worry about studio was totally overblown.So far this season has been awesome and I'm just loving more OP man to watch.Maybe the animation isn't as top tier as the previous season, but I've sat through countless anime with worse and had a good time. I think that this show had too much exposure to the mainstream who will look for any reason to get a tweet trending, so they ragged on this before it had even debuted.I can't wait to watch more.

The style hasnt changed too much and the show does still retain it's persona however the animation holds it back at times with cuts in place of animation resolving battles without even seeing him throw the punch and in fast fight scenes replacing movement with fast cuts and flashy effects whilst characters remain still.Mostly though I feel though the humour is still there that it doesnt feel as effective as it did before, whether this is because the contrast in detailed animation to lack there of isnt as effective or if the delivery or joke isnt as fresh I cant fully say.

after finishing the last episode of season 2 it felt like nothing really happend compared with season 1. Season 2 focuses more on other heroes and sprinkles in saitama here and there, which is fine and i like getting into the other heroes more but i feel like the story really crams in alot of scenes of random heroes noone really cares about that get offd in minutes and it just makes each episode feel like not much happens overall. from comments it looks like the 12 episodes are the end of season 2 and it ended ok but i feel like it just didnt flow very well and really left me unsatisfied unlike with the end of season 1. I look forward to season 3 but hope the pacing is better.

The One Punch Man series is a masterpiece to me, the 1st anime season was amazing! After I finish watching it, I went straight to continuing the story by reading the manga, one of the few animes I would go and do that. Reading it, it was just as good from first season, lot of times I gone emotional and excited over! When watching this 2nd season which is an adaptation of the story I read from the manga, I notice there is a lack of "emotions and excitement" put into this anime. On top of the lacking/change of animation, J.C. Staff just skims most of the story scenes, making some scenes lacking compared to what was depicted in the manga which would've been a big deal. With a lot of still shot combat, with cut and crammed story in a 12 episode anime, I felt J.C. Staff didn't even try with the show and it breaks my heart.  :"(

i never liked anime. this show got me into anime about 3 years ago. i recall it being on crunchyroll for some time and was then removed. these reviews are so skewed, almost as skewed as how the hero system in is portrayed. if you don't like this show you honestly can't comprehend the concept. it almost makes fun of anime in such an indescribable way BUT the story behind saitama is so much more. ill admit the second season is all over the place due to the studio change, but it gets REALLY good RIGHT at the end of the season. season 2 basically starts at the last episode. i love everything about this show.

One Punch Man does a wonderful job of parodying the Super Hero Genre. It might only have a few jokes in its arsenal, but it is a master at hitting the bullseye every time.The Art: Season 1 delivers on this in spades. They use every cell perfectly. Having read the manga, it really does feel like seeing that only in anime form. Not a lot of anime really deliver on that as much as season one of OPM does.While season 2 took a bit of a dip, it's still as good as most other anime these days. I don't really feel it would be fair to dock this series any points because the second season was just a little bit above average in the animation department.The Characters: This is where this show really shines. All of the characters are amazing. Even though a lot of them are dumb tropes, or parodies of other things, they always feel like they are handled with care. All of the cast of this show is fun and interesting, even the monsters that only show up for a single episode. Like the best written comedies, it feels like everyone gets a chance to be funny and charming. It's hard to have a favourite character given how awesome all of the characters in this show are.The World: The world is excellent parody. Things are wacky and crazy, but the world also has rules. More than that, it doesn't feel like the rules just exist as excuses. While things are dumb and crazy, they are dumb and crazy in a way that feels believable. While My Hero Academia approaches the world of super heroes with the optimistic adventurous soul of adolescence, One Punch Man comes at it with the bitter and jaded outlook of an older generation, while still also being fun and funny. To compare it to other things, I'd say OPM is about halfway between Tiger And Bunny and My Hero Academia.The OP: The OPs for both Season 1 and 2 are amazing. They are as over-the-top as the show, and will get you pumped up and ready to watch the crazy action of every episode. This is one of those shows where I went to amazon to buy myself the album for the OP, it really is that good.Final Verdict: One Punch Man is one of those perfect shows. While Season 2 might have left a little bit desired, it never crushed the pure joy I got from watching the show. This is one of those shows where the show made me feel the same whimsical joy that I had when I read the manga, and that's a hard target to hit. While the story does start to meander a bit from its original thesis in season 2 and starts to become the thing that it's parodying, that is the natural evolution of this kind of parody. Eventually when you do something ironically you just end up doing the thing.Honestly, I'd probably score this 4.5 out of 5 stars, but given how blown away I still feel when I think about watching season 1, I just can't bring myself to dock this any marks.One Punch Man is a good and funny show, and even while it is painting its world with a rather cynical brush, its story still moves me and makes me feel hope.

I think this will be my third time watching it now after writing this review. My brother first mentioned it to me before I saw the anime and from his explanation, I thought it was funny and be cool to watch. Once I actually started watching, I absolutely loved it. It's funny and even if I knew how it would end, I still enjoy watching it because I want to see how it ends. After watching the second season, it wasn't as great as I hoped it would be when I read the manga. I believed it was a little long and dragged out, but I kind of felt that way when I was reading the manga because I just wanted to see Saitama. However, I started enjoying Garou's story later on. Maybe season 2 felt off because of where it ended, but from reading the manga I wouldn't have known where to end season 2 either. I have only been rewatching the first season because it's very satisfying. I'm not interested in sonic and the girl leader in the B rank tho, just my opinion because of their obsessions can be annoying. I did like story/scene with sonic when he was with the little bear tho and the one scene in season 2 where he was deciding to eat the monster food.Sorry I rambled a little.Anyways I still enjoy this anime and I hope season 3 turns out well if they are making another season. I hope they do!

ok so one punch man or op man aka sitama aka the caped baldy. this is probably the top anime for me it takes this superhero op thing to the max the reason im not a fan of superman is becuse he is way to op and and is arogant about it ive, and i think thats whats makes superheroes in general boring when yo make a character thats basiclly invinceble and dont give them any humanity thats what this show does best we have sitama literally the strongest character he is given more power than anyone and with that he feals like he loses his humanity so he faces everyday just trying to go on with his life and have fun so insted of fighting evil all he wants to do is to try to get his humanity back. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hidehe literally is more woried about a sale on the supermarket than fighting an evil doctor  i give this series a 5/5. the animation is worse in the second season but it honestly isnt to bad to look away from the series yes the first season have better animation and greater style, but it still is worth watching season two just for the story and comedy.

Visual point 5/10Story 7/10Characters 8/10Fun 9/10
