I've watched plenty of top quality animes, and Fairy Tail will always rank in the top ten of my favorites.  Fairy Tail is a long running anime that never leaves you disappointed.The story takes place in the region of Fiore.  In this area people use magic for everything.  The story revolves around the people in the guild, Fairy Tail.  Primarily it focuses on Lucy Heartifilia, Natsu Dragneel, Gray Fullbuster, and Erza Scarlet.  Later, other characters are introduced or become more important, but I'm focusing on the original four.  The protagonist is Natsu, when he was a child he was taken in and raised by a dragon, Igneel, and taught how to use Fire Dragon Slayer magic.  This allows him to manifest flames from his body and beat you to death if you piss him off or hurt his friends.  He can be silly at times and quite fierce when upset.  He's not the protagonist that cries and runs off when times get tough.  He fights and never gives up, even if that means he could die.  Lucy is the leading female protagonist.  She plays a bit under the stereotypical damsel in distress role, but she can defend herself against weaker (or stupider) opponents.  She is typically a product of fanservice, usually against her will.  She has the ability to summon Celestial Beings to fight for her because she has made a contract with them.  At the start of the show she is not very strong at all, but she becomes stronger over the course of time.  (Example:  Before she could not call out more than one Celestial Being at a time, nor switch between them.  Eventually she can switch between several and she can have two out at the same time.)  Gray Fullbuster is an Ice Make wizard; so basically he can create weapons out of ice and fight with them.  He has a lot of back story that ties in with the main plot and one of my favorite characters.  He has a fierce rivalry with Natsu, and a bad habit of stripping all of his clothes off unconsciously.  Erza is described as the most powerful female in Fairy Tail  (the guild that is), and has a very stern personality.  She had a past of being enslaved, and having to labor for, worshippers of Zeref, an ancient wizard capable of the most powerful types of evil.  She usually puts Natsu and Gray in their place when they fight.The music is very fitting and powerful.  I recommend looking up a few of the songs.  You won't be disappointed.  The animation was very good even before they smooth it out for the continuation.  As I can see from the preview it looks better than most movie animations.  Fanservice is very obvious in this show, and there is practically cleavage in every episode.  Some people say it is excessive, even to the point of annoying, but I say that it is just a part of the show and I have no complaints.  There is a balanced amount of comedy and comedic foils in the show so you're not over-tensed by the plotline.  Character development is amazing for some characters and a little lacking for others.  Overall, I says you will get your fair share of feels, laughs, cries, and fanservice.  I absolutely recommend watching this.  If you haven't already, you should look around for the previous episodes; hopefully Crunchyroll will pick them up eventually.

Before you fan boys down vote this instantly because I gave 3 stars, please consider reading before you ACTUALLY vote this.I've watched a lot of episodes and I'm glad they're back but it gets boring after awhile.Its the same thing over and over again like"Oh we will never be able to defeat them""Oh no! I can't let Lucy, fairy tail etc. down!""I have to beat them! But they are too strong""maybe If we bond together we can beat them!""We Beat them with the power of Friendship and bond!"Then happy peaceful lives Suddenly...."Oh No a threat appeared...time to repeat process.."and so on and so on, its fun for awhile but it gets boring and repetitive.

This review is meant for the mature crowd.  Those of you whom appreciate over the top slapstick tropes, plot devices and the like will not see the sense in this review.Fairy Tail is at best a mediocre anime.  It provides for a very repetitive and formulaic format for every story arc.  Tropes, cliches, and plot devices are mercilessly used in this anime.  Every time the protagonists encounter resistance they are quickly and easily dispatched as the enemy just leaves them for dead or whatever.  The protagonists just moan a little, lick their wounds, and rebound through some plot device or cliche.  Even the impressively powerful guild master somehow experiences defeat at the beginning of every confrontation only to recover and return later if his brood has not managed to succeed without him.Every adult character in this anime has a serious lack of maturity.  Senior members of the guild are regularly out of the picture as the junior members do most to almost all of the heavy lifting.  At first the senior members only appear to make trouble for their own guild, where they are whipped into shape by their subordinates.This anime has a very incongruous way of dealing with the protagonists powers and abilities. For some reason they are not considered S-Class Wizards despite repeatedly confronting and overcoming several other S-Class Wizards, quests, and guild leaders.  Any powers that are learned or displayed near the end of a story arc are forgotten or weakened again at the beginning of the next where they return to being simpleton protagonists with something to prove.Any Protagonist with a weakness, like Natsu's motion sickness, is overplayed to painful slapstick extremes.  Despite what appears to be limited and formulaic poorly developed story elements, Fair Tail still seems to be able to deliver surprisingly touching moments and some level of satisfaction as they pull through their predicaments.Attack on Titan, Hunter x Hunter, and Log Horizon are superior animes in nearly every respect when compared to this one.

To say i love this show is a understatementI watched the 1st series of this show and i fell in love il be honest the Plot isn't the greatest thing you will see, the Arcs are not the best BUT the feel of this show just gives you the most amazing feeling! This is mostly because of how subversive the world of Fairy Tail is, plus the music! the music is incredible! if you are a fan of good feeling anime THIS IS A MUST WATCH! For this series the animation has increased 10 fold, the overall show just looks darker and grittier and that is what this show needed! one of my personal favourite anime! WATCH IT NOW!

Alright... So.. This series has been in my top 10 for like forever. The characters, the animation, the manga. Everything about it, is perfect. The animation from Series 1 gradually became what this is going to be starting out as. The movie for Fairy Tail, had the same animation style of this.  If you like a ground Shounen/Action anime, Fairy Tail is amazing. Lost of amazing characters, and fight scenes. Everything about this series (Cannon wise) is perfect. (Not the fillers. Meh.)

Fairy Tail is a great fighting series.  With it's explosive battles (from the very start) and   electrifying music,this show will definitely get you fired up! There is also a wide cast of characters each with their own developed backstories. This show has great action and a well developed magic world, so why only 3 stars? It is  very predictable. No matter who they're up against, be it demons or guild masters, the main characters will  always win! This is especially true of Natsu. The battles usually follow a pattern of the villain showing how unbelievably powerful he is, beating our heroes to a pulp, then said heroes thinking about their friends or guild  and promptly one-shotting the villain in an unexplained surge of power and stamina. It gets to the point where you root for the villains because you know they're up against people who literally cannot lose.  I suppose what I'm trying to say is that Fairy Tail is quite asinine and requires one to have a pretty naive view on strength human durability. There is a scene where a normal man walks through  lava  to help two girls and literally comes away with a few scratches, 'cause willpower yo. -_-

Ok, let me start off this review by saying that I personally enjoy Fairy Tail. That doesn't mean I won't be honest and talk about it's bad parts though.STORY:Story is pretty lack luster, I won't lie. The setting is cool, and it has a lot of unique characters, but the plot line in general is not unique, and it is pretty predictable. CHARACTERS:The main character is pretty cookie cutter among anime (his attitude of always wanting to get stronger to protect his friends). Lucy is kind of annoying at times. Reminds me of Orihime from Bleach. The other characters aren't as bad as those  two. Erza is bad-*** and has a strong personality. Happy is there for comedic relief, and he does a pretty good job at it. The bad guys are all pretty lame. They are made out to be very powerful, but of course, they are always beaten by Natsu or his allies. No one ever dies, and they do the annoying "flashback in a fight so I can power up and beat you" thing a lot... A LOT. Also, they like to recruit beaten villains and make them into good guys. This is actually pretty cool, and I don't really mind it, because some of the villains are cooler than the actual heroes.FIGHTS:Fight scenes are generally good. Well animated, but can be drawn out. Also, there is never really any tension in fight scenes, because you can ALWAYS count on the good guys to win. As I stated before, no one is ever in any real danger because no one dies.FAN SERVICE:This is pretty much the biggest reason most people watch Fairy Tail. They do have a lot of fan service, and they do it pretty well. For instance, Lucy is always showing cleavage, and they have multiple episodes where the women of Fairy Tail are in bikinis. Gray being shirtless all the time is fan service for the lady viewers, and they like to show of Natsu's abs a lot too.FINAL SCORE:All in all, Fairy Tail isn't a bad show. It has some annoying qualities, but you should try to ignore them. Don't take it seriously, it isn't meant to be taken seriously. Just watch it for fun.

I am writing from a perspective of someone who has watched a lot of anime and I mean it, so please do trust me here: this is not in any way, shape or form, worth your time. I have watched all of the episodes from the beginning and I can clearly and objectively explain that this isn't it. The only way this show is still afloat is due to those who have only watched one anime in their life, refusing to believe that this is trash and see it for what it is actually worth. So far there have been numerous lazy plotholes which the writers have solved by TIME-TRAVELLING, and its always the same thing. You can have one fight lasting as long as 10 episodes, with useless, plain and emotionless history, inevitably leading any heartfelt moments to a waste. Furthermore, the animations are indescribably weak compared to any modern seasonal anime, I'll even go as far as saying that they are weak compared to old animes; such as the same old Naruto or even Bleach.  Simply put: there isn't anything this show has to offer. It has a weak story, emotionless character development, plot-holes, dragged out/irrelevant situations, repetition of careless escapes from writers mistakes and horrid animation. Also the most generic and uninteresting characters which interact in the most boring way possible.As you can see, I'm genuinely sad to have wasted so much time on this in hopes of the writers pulling themselves together.~peace

Fairy Tail can be an exhausting tromp, but a fun one. I slogged through everything from the beginning, and for the most part I enjoyed everything right up through Fairy Tail Zero. Yeah, there's a lot of filler episodes where people grit their teeth and grunt a bunch and have flashbacks to the previous episode, so much so that there ends up being only around 10 minutes of actual new episode. That's just a fact of the series, you're gonna hit those. But then they'll actually have some content for a few episodes in a row and it's great fun.I was excited for Final Season. Then I started watching it. Everything about it is ... off. Wrong somehow. The art looks cheaper than it ever has before, the voices all sound different. The behavior of the characters is more like a fanfic, doing things that don't make sense, making out-of-character decisions.If you liked Fairy Tail, I'd advise stopping at Zero. Just walk away with some good memories and call it done.

This show is repetitive. Hilariously repetitive. Cliches are beaten to death, fanservice is rampant, and the overall plot is so predictable that it almost destroys the point in watching the show at all. There are no new major developments, no plot twists, and no prevalent changes in characters. At the end of each arc pretty much all the characters are in the same state as they were in before the arc even began, and in fact, many characters haven't changed at all since the very beginning of the anime itself.No one can deny this.That being said, why then do so many people enjoy it? Why does this have a 4.5 rating? Well, it is simply because the blatant repetitiveness is exactly what they like about this show. They know that every week they can turn to this show for their dose of busty fanservice and cheesy banter and never be disappointed. In other words, it appeals to kids. It also gives a sense that the show will never end. With the characters always staying the same, it means that the story can go anywhere, and anything can happen. But if the plot develops too much, and the show starts to mature, then the story is put on a linear order of events eventually leading to the show's permanent end.So basically, this anime serves as a invariable base for weekly viewing. It's not going anywhere soon, nor will it for a long time. That comfort alone is why so many people love this anime, but for casual viewers like me, it just doesn't cut it. This is by no means the "best anime ever", and I implore older audiences to bypass this one and enjoy the more invigorating series that crunchyroll has to offer. Frankly put, this show is the anime equivalent of Spongebob.

Mediocre is definitely the best way to describe Fairy Tail; but I wouldn't say that I would rate it mediocre the entire way through. When I started watching this anime I was quite drawn into it - but as the anime went along and got towards the end it has become an increasingly big chore to continue watching it. Primarily I think the anime has a problem with status quo and that it gets returned too far too often to it. The main characters very much have that feeling of being trapped in amber - which is quite an odd thing to say because 'every' other character seems to show growth and change. In some way or another, things always return to the Guild Hall. Generally in battles the main characters start off being beaten down before licking their wounds and getting back up to continue.I found myself wanting more from the main characters, and more to happen to them. It would have been nice to see Gray pull a Sasuke and go evil or Erza take over leadership of the guild - which is hinted at in the final episode but not really established. Maybe have Lucy pull a Dark Phoenix - in terms of personality and power changing.... But, status quo....Then there are other issues: Too much emphasis was given on 'child/parent' episodes, to the point that every main character had their parents interact with them - and I mean literally every one. The 'Power Levels' of the different characters in the series seem to not matter; where stronger characters seem to be beaten by weaker characters, despite them being weaker. An extreme lack of 'dying' happens in this anime - even in the last season where you would expect the series characters to die left and right; only some of the villains seem to die.Overall I can only recommend watching this anime if you want a long anime to watch. I wouldn't consider it a must watch or anything and if you do watch it, or if you do watch it, consider whether it is worth continuing to watch it if you find yourself losing interest (trust me, it doesn't get better, it is just more of the same).

now, hold on before you hold up your pitchforks.  i say that this is a mediocre anime. i will say that the visuals are really nice to look at, and the soundtrack is by far the greatest thing about this anime. to say that the soundtrack is good, is honestly an understatement. however, what i do have an issue with when it comes to this anime is the repetitive plot. like i have said before, the visuals and soundtrack are very good but this anime has a shallow plot. at first, this anime is pretty hyped up and i liked it at the start even though it was little too fan-service crazy(nowhere near the level it is now though), but after that it really started to go downhill? i mean yeah you felt pretty hyped up during the fights because of the soundtrack, but most of the fights in this show go along the lines of.."oh no, the [insert villain] is too strong, and i can't beat them. i'm sorry, but i can't do this! but wait, i just need to remember my friends, fairy tail, and what i'm fighting for! [insert power up, completely obliterates the enemy]" something like that can be okay the first time around, but to repeat that process over and over again can get a bit irritating. i sometimes find myself cheering on for the enemy, to see if they'll be able to win against our protagonists. now, the next issue i have is the fan-service. now it's okay to have a little bit of fan-service in any show like this, but the amount in this show is god awful. there is WAY too much of it, to the point where it actually could probably sideline the plot. in fact, it has a couple times. so, if you don't like fan-service, i would recommend straying away from this show. and the next issue i have with the anime is the fact that a lot of characters are sidelined. in the show, later on, there's only about a handful of protagonists that actually matter in the show, while the rest are too weak to keep up. even lucy, whom i thought would be the main protagonist alongside natsu, is sidelined a lot and is underestimated. overall, this anime is mediocre and if you're looking for visuals and soundtrack in an anime, you should watch this for sure. but if you're looking for super detailed plot, i would look for a different show. i suppose i am being a little soft since this is one of the first shows that ever made me almost cry, but now that's all kind of hidden behind the amount of fan-service, sidelining, and awful power differences between characters. i'd recommend stopping at fairytail zero.

I've always considered the story of FairyTail very.. "childish"If you are into anime for the visuals and music, then fairytail won't disappoint you. However, this anime is not for you if you care about the story. FairyTail story lacks depth. There are rarely any elements of mystery in the sory. The leveling up of characters doesn't make sense and the reasons why one character would win a fight has no sound logic except that,, well he's the good guy. Very cliche lines of "friendship" and so on..

I have watched a lot of anime, probably dozens of series.  My favorite is Rurouni Kenshin, for its gravitas, depth, themes, tension, drama, and music.  Fairy Tail may not have the same level of gravitas, but it provides characters you grow to love, has emotional moments that can hit you in the gut (and with music to match), a reasonably rich lore with world-building, and a offers a spirit of hope despite the odds.  Can some enemies be defeated by repetitive "friendship power"?  Yes, and this is a negative.  But I am giving my rating by how the show overall made me feel.  It's quite a ride, and now that it is finished, I am dearly going to miss it.  It has easily solidified itself in my personal "Top 5" list of anime I have watched until now.

I love fairy tail. Been into since the very beginning and I'm sad that it's about to end, but all good things must come to an end.All the characters are amazing and I love the art designs of all of them as well. This show has constantly made me laugh, and I've grown very attached to the characters as a whole.  The music is one of my favorite parts of this anime too.I look forward to the glorious ending of fairy tail.

This show is what got me into anime in the first place. The shonen genre is vast and is made up of a multitude of shows, but Fairy Tail is one of the shows that goes above and beyond others. This show is all about overcoming obstacles together and how breaking barriers is possible. Fairy Tail is a show that deserves to be watched and re-watched multiple times. Don't let other reviews hold you back from this show. Try the first episode itself, and you'll find yourself hooked.

Can't articulate how much I love Fairy Tail. My favorite cosplay comes from Fairy Tail. We even have a guild with 20+ people from the show. The bonding between characters; the lasting desire of love for friends and family. Naruto may be my childhood and favorite anime, but Fairy Tail is nearly on par with it. The fillers don't ever feel like fillers either. If I ever need a pick-me up, Fairy Tail is also a perfect choice even if I have watched the episode(s) numerous times. Let's not forget the OVA's like the water park and Fairy Tail Christmas! The final season is doing extremely well and following the manga relatively close. I'm All Fired Up Reviewing This!

Fairy Tail has a rather...unique place in my heart. It was the first anime to bring me close to tears, and yet I find myself cringing at it far too often. This anime is a golden experience buried under a pile of trash. I'm fine with the occasional asspull in anime, but Fairy Tail goes kinda overboard. Crappy power-scaling issues plague this show's later seasons, along with the unnecessary over-sexualization of many of its characters (mostly the females). This anime doesn't need a bunch of half naked ladies to make it a good show. If you strip away most of the erotic fanservice, make the dialogue flow better, and give the characters more motives to fight other than "friends, then you've got an absolute masterpiece of a show before you.

A friend told me about Fairy Tail, so I decided to check it out. I bought the first three books to the manga and hopped initially onto netflix to watch the first episodes. I came over here when I finished those to finish watching the series. I have been unable to stop binging Fairy Tail, it's my new favorite anime. I haven't been this attached to a series in forever. All of the characters are different, special - the bad guys are in depth and detailed. I love the level of emotion this anime has. It's just great.

Out of every anime adaptation to a long running shonen that is currently airing, I think Fairy Tail is consistently of the highest quality it can be with its awesome soundtrack and great voice acting. This series has it all, awesome battles between manly characters, lots of fanservice from some of the sexiest grills in anime/manga and the material is adapted at a good rate with covering more than one chapter per episode and the times they do only cover one chapter its a chapter that deserves more screentime. I will throw my money at this franchise til the end of time. Also its pretty generic but if you like shonen than its no problem.

Original Series was a 4/5 for me. Useless fillers and bad animation.BUT THIS is movie quality Fairy Tail. It has a lot of manga content ahead of it so there should be no filler arcs. Even if you hate fairy tail, watch it for the animation. Smoother than silk (As seen from the trailers)

Which was: let us copy some traits from best at that time - Naruto, One Piece, Bleach - and merge them into one. After some time (one or two arcs) strong foundations were washed out (along with character development and any emotional investment) and all that left is fanservice. Lot of fanservice. And considering how usually female and male staff wears clothing or what kind of situational gags they are performing, this tells a lot about how it sustained that long on the market, and what audience expect from this thrilling experience which is watching Fairy Tail and being charitable enough to compare it to classics like DB, HxH or mentioned above Big Three.Thing that irritated me, after some episodes, and whole manga (including 100 years quest) is that actually every next arc is copy-my-homework-but-change-it-slightly of the previous ones. We have bunch of bad guys, at the beginning they are crushing our good guys, and them magically (no pun intended), with the POWER OF FRIENDSHIP, someone (preferrably Natsu) defeats worst guy in the pack with the power of straight right punch. Rest of the villains from the bunch is taken out in prolonged, grotesque fights that are trying to pretend to the very end that winner of given skirmish was not decided from the start.This show takes these and other most generic features, that in normal, healthy shonen can become irritating (repetitive and boring) in the longer run, and intensifies them. Exponentially. If the title of this show would be "Gintama", i would consider this as satirical take on the whole genre. Actually Fairy Tail tries very hard to be considered "not serious" but in the end it looks as excuse to reuse all cliches and tropes for minimal effort put into developing or changing something.Villains are repetitive, luckily they are mildly redesigned from the outside. In case that would not help distinguish them, some tatoos are added, or hairstyles are recoloured. Between arcs major change is location. Everything else is copied straight from the rich expertise of previous arcs as well as plenty is "borrowed" from strongest players on the field, to which FT pretends to belong. Some characters like Leo are simply redrawn (Kurosaki Ichigo rings a bell?).There are some scenes, which want to be emotional, like laxus coming to town, some backstories are even served for some members of Fairy tail in attempt to give them a purpose other than being display for undersized and too tight and too revealing clothing, but in the end all of this turn out pretentious and bland.There is actually no character developement at all (growing hair, changing clothes and punching harder is not character developement).  So worst character traits will remain with them until the end. For example forced and unfunny "rivalries" that Natsu has with others, Elfman yelling something about manliness, Cana being notoriously drunk. Yes, in cases of the majority of the characters, those will be only traits, that would make them recognizable in this whole jolly bunch. Goku changed more throughout all of DB series and he has FLAT character arc. Gags are not funny and forced, there is minimal or no added value taken out from arc after it closes. So You can watch them selectively with no fear of missing something important.As i mentioned at the beginning. The show could be descendant of Big Three, but in terms of overall quality, the closest it gets to them is: Make ramen with rasengan filler from Naruto, Rebellion of Zanpakuto filler from Bleach, Fishmen kingdom from One Piece.

Everything here is before the final (BS IMO) Season...Animation: 8(Action scenes are good natsu's fire and grey's Ice powers looks the best but overall everything is animated and colorful unlike many parts in Final Season)Story: Good (Really good for each arc The Storys Feel like they could happen in the fairy tail universe though its a lil unrealistic That FairyTail saves the day so much in some arcs that they collaborate with other guilds besides being basic support and not having a major key part. On that note The Final Season makes the least amount of sense as far as arcs in FT. It doesn't seem Zeref has the ability to care about something and make a wave of death appear when its Obvious he cares about natsu WHERE WAS THAT WAVE)Plots and Twists: Novice (Theirs many points in the anime that the creators themselves forget abilities, tricks, and even basic persona can alter how fights go down. Some examples favors the enemies some examples favor the protag the best example arc of this is the season before the FairyTail Zero episodes Curse vs magic)Development: Rarely used/Nonexistent (We watch anime for good animation good story Good well placed twists and plots in which the main characters have to learn new ways to get over obstacles. Here that is technically non-existent Its mostly "We knew how to do that" not "Hey I can absorb other types of magic and use them in combination to mine" <this makes sense for Natsu... He absorbs Laxus's lightning and only used it after the Tenroe arc for the grand magic games ever since he forgot? The fairytail guild also learned that Grey and Juvia can perform a UNISON RAID WHICH IS NOT EXPANDED UPON So that's for development. Well socially the relationships between guild mates fairs way better than Wizard skills on this show. Also Wizard Saints are more like wizard jokes they are supposed to be top tier wizards 5 of them were defeated on the final season guess they didn't develop too huh?)All and all I will say this anime is for watching for fun and not to take seriously clearly it doesn't take it self seriously... I mean if they knew before hand Zeref and his friends were gonna attack maybe just maybe the dragon slayers coulda honed their skills and natsu could have been a Dark fire(with rogues shadow powers in which rogue is boring with) breathing blinding light on contact badass that can still melt anything around him like he did in those two episodes after Zero... but then again he lost that ability too... 3 stars hopefully the game is better :)Best season: Edolas Arc: The vast changes in each main characters based on a separate universe and their culture and way of life was refreshing to say the leastWorst season Tartaros arc: This season all main characters had Naruto style plot armor to the MAX Wendy cutting her hair and becoming OP also not in final season she grew her hair back Development guys she grew her hair back and became weak again...Bye development! Sorry Sakura still just a healer with no spotlight Oops i meant Mercy(with the potg moment never the potg) oops I meant Wendy...

Show starts out decent, but it's easy to see how the author, whatever his name is, ran out of ideas. Then, the show takes what could be a single episode and drags it out into 7. Everything is predictable, there is no sense of anticipation, and never any fear of losing a character, due to the ridiculous amount of plot armor. Characters have no depth: They have a single attribute that is overused, and little else. The animation takes a serious nosedive the further along the show goes, to the point where it looks like you're watching a Powerpoint slideshow. I only watched the entire series because I'm completionist, and it was not worth the hours of my life wasted. If it wasn't for the fan service (the only thing that made sticking around so long slightly bearable), this would be considered a children's show. The story is written for people with the intellect of 8-year-olds, but it's filled with boobs and booty, so I'm not sure who this is intended for. Don't waste your time watching this show. The beginning is alright, but that doesn't make the rest of the series worth investing into.

Wie alle langläufigen Titel hat auch Fairy Tail mit seinen 328 Episoden keine Perfekte Story, keinen durchweg perfekten Spannungsbogen und definitiv seine Durchhänger und Schwächen. Gerade die mangelde Konsequenz bei dramatischen Momenten schadet meiner Meinung nach der Story und "zerstört" jedwede Spannung. So kann man sich sicher sein das selbst in den düsteren Storyabschnitten niemand stirbt und alles ein Happy Ending hat. Aber warum gebe ich dann Trozdem 5 Sterne?Ganz einfach ich liebe Magie und Arbenteuer! Und genau das bietet Fairy Tail in kombination mit einem coolen Cast. Ja die bringen auch die ein oder andere "Eigenheit" mit die einen auch mal nerfen kann! Aber im Grunde macht das auch die in sich stimmig wirkende Welt aus. Ein haufen Quatschköpfe mit denen man seinen Spaß hat.Man könnte so viel über einen so langen Anime schreiben. Aber ich fasse mich an dieser Stelle lieber kurtz: Wenn ich auf magische Abenteuer mit einer coolen Gilde steht schaut einfach rein! Gebt dem Anime ein wenig Zeit und entwerder er gefällt euch oder nicht. Mir hat Fairy Tail im großen und ganzen sehr gefallen und ich hoffe das ihr ebenfalls Spaß mt dem Anime habt

When i first heard of Fairy Tail, I didn't think much of it.  Then one day, i decided to watch and i was hooked from the first episode.  From there the series took me on a journey that was an absolute blast from beginning to end, filled with laughter, happiness, and tears.  I loved the story, lore and fantasy setting. The characters are so lovable and memorable.  The fights are exciting and fast paced.  The music is legendary.  I don't think i had just a fantastic experience watching an anime before.  I will continue to re-watch and support this series for years to come.Long Live Fairy Tail.

Fairy Tail is in the league of Dragon Ball, Naruto, Bleach, One Piece and Detective Conan as one of the "mega-anime". Spanning hundreds of episodes and many story arcs it gives viewers an evolving show that gradually introduces a colorful and mostly kid friendly cast of characters with a wide variety of abilities. Because the show takes place in a world of magic with very few self imposed rules, almost anything goes and this works both in the show's favor and against it. The wide variety of abilities and skills makes most action scenes very interesting. However the lack of consistency makes it difficult to really understand how strong characters are in relation to one another.Despite Natsu appearing to be the main character on most official title pages, the real main character is Lucy. Much of the series is told from her perspective and speaks to one of the strongest parts of the show: awesome female characters. Lucy, Erza and Wendy and a lot of strong supporting characters make Fairy Tail stand out from its rivals. Furthermore the close bonds of friendship the series emphasizes is comparable to One Piece too. Every main character and most of the supporting cast from their guild remains relevant to the story right up until the end. Very much in stark contrast to other similar series where the MC often becomes the only character who can stand up to the antagonists. The sheer length of the show allowed for a wide variety of antagonists as well. From stereotypical evil baddies, to self righteous types doing the wrong things for perhaps the right reasons, to enemies who were simply insane the show has some of each and almost everything in between. Even a few purely as comedic relief. On the other hand the length of the show is also something of a hindrance. It's so massive that committing to watching the show will be a tall order for most viewers. Furthermore the quality of the story and animation varies inconsistently. At times it has rivaled some of the best anime ever and at other times felt like budget series. It was not a start weak and get strong factor either, but an up and down of quality.Another potential drawback is, although the women of the series are very strong, they are often quite sexualized. It's no doubt some viewers will enjoy that, others will also be bothered by it. The men are much the same, ripped idealized bodies of muscle. The music has a wide range as well. Some truly outstanding songs at times and at other times cookie cutter "anime music" that you've heard a dozen other times.In the end however, the show is far more enjoyable than not. Fun action, colorful and interesting characters, strong women, lots of eye candy, and a simple and effective story set in a wonderfully fantastical world that screams of imagination and adventure. This show hands down wins the war of mega-anime for me personally and would get my highest recommendation for anime of its type. Pros:Great cast of charactersWonderful settingStrong women on par with or stronger than menCharacters who remain on par with each other, as opposed to one over-powered MCCons:Every man is ripped and muscled, every women is a bombshell and everyone is sexualized to some extent. Long series is a daunting time commitmentInconsistent production quality, at times superb, at times mediocre

Say what you want about predictability and it being repetitive, this series was nothing short of an explosive adventure.  You will laugh, you will get feels, and you will get fired up through out every story arc. To be fair, the fan service is a little over whelming at times, but the meaning behind what Fairy Tail is what captivated me to the point I got the guild mark tattoo’d on my arm. I highly recommend for anyone who has been going through tough and rough times. This show makes you want to fight anything life throws at you.

Fairy Tail has it all! The fights, The adventure, The many different character designs and plots, but It draws out the Fantasy aspect too much in my opinion. Aside from the Fantasy plot, everything else is perfect! I rate this anime a 4 out of 5 *s

(Remember, this is MY opinion, and you do not have to agree. Also, SPOILER ALERT! Read at your own risk.)I think that Fairy Tail was a fairly well executed anime, and I would give it 4 stars. I mean, I am OBSESSED with the manga, the anime, and the soundtracks. I absolutely LOVE it. But, even with my love for the series, I am aware that there could be some improvements, which is why I gave it 4 stars, not 5. First, I think the characters are just great. The backstories of each character gives them a bit more "character", I guess. Without their past stories, they wouldn't really have a goal which they are wishing to achieve in the future. For example, Natsu Dragneel was raised by a dragon named Igneel, but suddenly disappeared. From then on, he kept on looking for Igneel, which you could call his goal. Gray Fullbuster, his village was attacked by Deliora, the demon of disaster. Of course, he seeks for revenge, and as he discovers more about this demon, he crosses paths with his father (or what was left of him). All the other characters have their history, and we slowly find out more about them throughout the series. Isn't that exciting? But there is one thing which I find somewhat "annoying" about these characters. Fan service. You know what I mean... but after watching more than 200 episodes of it, I guess it just seems "normal" after some time, and doesn't bother me as much. But what really drives me nuts is Lucy's so-called s-e-x appeal. Sure she's pretty and all, but she doesn't have to show it off. Erza (and a lot of other characters) somewhat do it too, but not as much as Lucy. With that aside, Lucy is still a good character, and without her, the story would be very, very... weird. Another thing which I really like about the series are the plot twists. Come on, some evil guy from 7 years in the future visits the past to rule the world with dragons, Natsu's brother (or should I say, creator) is the most evil villain in the series, I think they make the story much more interesting. Now, more of the things for improvement. I'll just say it straight up, too much nakama power. I understand, friends are important and all, but it doesn't have to be the only reason for the wizards to fight. It can be used, but not on every single arc. But, after watching a gazillion of these arcs, I got used to it, and I guess I just have to accept that friends are why everyone moves on. But to argue with my own argument, a lot of people find this nakama power annoying, but who else are these wizards supposed to fight for? They don't have family. All their friends are family. So they fight for them. There's nothing wrong with that. But I will say it again, it's been used so many times. Next, I think that the arcs are interesting in their own way. It does get all over the place at times, but that's what makes it interesting! Traveling to another dimension, meeting your counterpart, and all those great things. Animation is great, and now with technology evolving, it can get even better. I am looking forward to that, especially on the new episodes. It's going to be epic. Themes, openings, endings, awesome. That main theme puts the watchers in the mood. The openings are just... GREAT! I just love them, also the endings. That's all I have to say. I have a lot more great things to say about this series, but of course, its not perfect. Overall, I love the series, and I am looking forward to the new episodes.

I came into it with a bias opinion of what I thought the anime would be, because of the controversy around it.. like Hiro Mashima not having the ending written down or the characters never dying, but I was pleasantly surprised. After the first ten to twenty episodes I really started to warm up to the characters and liked where the story was heading, its pretty much a basic shonen but really entertaining and has nice elements to it.
