At first, it comes off as a straightforward mech anime that really tries very hard to fit in as many innuendos as possible with regard to the duel pilot system. As it continues, though, it smartly moves on from that and really starts to explore the show's central themes, and that's when it blossoms. A love story at its core, it questions the meaning of humanity and what it is that truly makes us human. It stalls out a bit as it approaches its climax (see what I did there?) but ultimately the ending is very poignant and satisfying. The art, animation, mech, and character design are all top-notch, as to be expected from Studio Trigger. This one is well worth sticking with all the way through.

While Darling in the FranXX is certainly advertised as a mecha show and at times mocked for its ecchi piloting poses.  I found it primarily to be a heart warming love story under the bird cage of an Orwellian society that I will forever remember.  Don't get me wrong the mecha action was thrilling, but the real icing of the cake is the tender and tumultuous moments of the teen protagonists dabbling with love. As someone so tired of the romance story cliches that roll the finale credits mere moments after protagonists become an offical couple at the absolute end... I find the opposite direction of this show so refreshing and memorial.   This show really fleshes out the romance story for us to see in entirety to the point where tender kisses, hugs, and shoulder leanings become more fan-service then the cliche ecchi moments.  As corny as it sounds I am always moved to tears by the wholesome life affirming love depicted in this anime and shows don't usually make break down with tears.  However this Darling in the Franxx was such a sweat treat that melted my heart. I am really looking forward to passing this gem down forever to teen relatives and children as one of the best stories of ever lasting love created so far.

This anime is by far the best anime I have seen (In my opinion so don't hate me)100/10 will watch again.Pros:Strong start of seriesVery Emotional (Made me cry{This is the first time in my life I have cried because of a program/video/cartoon/anime or book})Good Character Design (Except Strelizia True Apus which is just Zero Two's face) (Strelizia is quite well designed)Has some real myths applied to it (Like the Jian)Nice SFX and Special EffectsGood Development (Episode 21 was okay, after that it was meh.)Hooks you to watch the next Episode immediatlyCons:Episode 22 , 23 and 24 had messed up a bit but, I enjoyed Hiro and Zero Two's last moments along with what followed.NOT ENOUGH CONTEXT Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideWhat is Hringhorni?? What is Star Entity? who is 001 referring to as 'my child'? what is A Yellow Blood Cell???Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideENDS ON A CLIFFHANGER NOW I WANT SEASON 2PLEASE!!!!!!!!!!!PS:This is now my favourite anime.

The story starts out great. Good depth and enticing it keeps you wanting to see if Zero Two and Hiro can connect. The mech battles are fun to watch but lack real devotion. Other mecha shows will satisfy you more if that is why you are here. After episode 15 the show takes a left turn and seems like it goes down the wrong path. The end is definitely... different, but there is still satisfaction in the conclusion if you make it there. I don't believe the show deserves the hype but it is still worth viewing if you don't have other shows lined up. 3 out of 5

Could've been a 5/5. Darling is funny, has great character interaction without lacking on mech fighting (even though mechs having facial expressions just seems weird to me) and showed great potential. However the plot stopped making sense whatsoever, and the ending was just on a whole different scope than the rest of the series. It felt rushed and quite honestly ruined the series for me. Still an interesting watch.

Positives:Past the first couple of episodes you realize that it isn't going to be like Kill la Kill where the humor and plot was entirely around skimpy clothes and nudity. Theres a reason for the sexual innuendo, and Zero Two is really the only one who bares much at all. They even have a beach episode in which everyone was in nice modest swimsuits for once, and it actually had plot.If you don't like mech anime then you will be satisfied with this show because it focuses more on the relationships of the pilots rather than just the robots. It helps that the Robots look more humanoid than mechanical. There is also a whole metaphor to the boy/girl pair pilots. It has to do with stable relationships. Others explain it much better.The animation can be really great at times but it is noticeable when the quality drops. Refer to the whole meme that was created from the scene where Zero Two and Hiro reunite. That could have been a touching moment if their faces hadn't moved like muppets. Zero Two looked like a completely different character in that moment. I guess this is the perfect segway to the cons.Cons:Where to start with this show. I've seen the entire series and I have to at least start with pacing.3/4ths of this show has just the right speed for introducing characters, "lore", and getting you interested about just what the heck is going on behind the scenes. Like why do these kids know nothing about basic intimacy and the concept of love? All this sexual stuff is forced onto them (piloting positions anyone) and they don't catch the innuendo at all? And where are the adults (until the episode that lets you see a little bit of how they live). Then BAM. Last few episodes of the series are crazy info dumps and stupid plot twists just when you thought things were about to make sense. This series could have done with two seasons to keep things well thought out, but it got so rushed that I just couldn't enjoy the ending. Further detailed below, but spoilers.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThe writing. These kids were so open about their defiance and the people that make up "Papa" were just like "lol k". I was expecting the kids would find out they were going to all be killed off after their usefulness expired and would turn around and fight the system or whatever afterwards. They'd run away with their mechs, find out about/meet the klaxxosaur queen and she'd reveal to them that "Papa" and their society has been using their life energy to power everything in the first place, and then they'd fight alongside the klaxxosaurs to reclaim earth, and go back to a clean way of living w/o using magma energy. It would have made a lot more sense than the whole aliens plot twist, making the team pretty much go "I believe in fairies, I do I do I do" to revive Hiro, and Zero Two and Hiro could have maybe had a happy ending instead of dying in an attempt to fertilize their bomb egg way out in space. I am not kidding. If you missed that symbolism, you might be blind, because that whole sequence was filled with sex lines that bashed you over the head. The hive mind boss didn't even get defeated. It is still out there.The way they handled Zero Two and Hiro. After they realized they were each other's darlings via flashback, Zero Two lost everything about her that made her interesting. She does a complete 180 and loses her personality. I mean, she still has one, its just she gets along with everyone now and is just generally bubbly and cute, and all she does is have cute moments with Hiro. While this was still good, she just felt like a completely different character and only shows her old mischievous side in one scene for like a split second. Zero Two MADE the couple work and after she got boring, the entire relationship got boring. It makes you feel like Kokoro and Mitsuru stole the spotlight of the whole series by being a much more interesting and dynamic couple. And they actually got to do it and have a child. That was the most beautiful birth scene I have ever seen by the way, and pretty brave for an anime.

At the start of this anime, I was a bit like what the heck and raised my brow quite a few times. I honestly didn't think I'd like it as much as I did at the end and didn't think it would live up to all the hype. But after around episode 11, it really started picking up for me and I couldn't put it down. I found myself really enjoying each episode and racing to finish it and see how everything unfolded. It did pass my expectations as a whole and I found myself crying at the end. I went from hating to falling in love with Zero Two as a character as well, and to say it again, I am fond of each character and the show. Please do watch this, it'll make you think about a lot of things differently about our world and I promise it will exceed your expectations and leave you feeling satisfied.

What I liked:- Good animation quality- Pretty likable, interesting characters, including both the main 2 characters as well as all the others in the "squad 13"- Good story progression with good intrigue which keeps you wondering WTF is going on with the world in the show and what will happen with it next, at least until the last couple of episodes- Great soundtrack, especially the intro song- Romance stuff. I like seeing it in any anime, and this one has plenty of it, without going overboard. Well, aside from the sexualized "riding positions" in the Franxx, but that's not really as bad or "lewd" as some people think since the characters themselves don't even think of those positions as something sexual and they don't even know how to have sex until much, much later.What I didn't like:- the last 2 episodes went really, REALLY overboard with some irrational, "werid-for-the-sake-of-being-weird" stuff, including the main villains basically saying Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hide"whatever you did was totally pointless, you cannot defeat us and we will be back" as well as the 2 main characters/protagonists who pointlessly sacrificed themselves, but supposedly become reincarnated in different bodies much later, most likely without any previous memories ... This basically killed off most of the enjoyment I had from all the previous episodes. Oh well, at least I didn't waste any money on it (and I definitely won't be spending any on any merchandise related to this show).

When I first started this show, I have to say that it was one of my favorites. The relationships in this show were beautifully written and presented to the audience, and the plot of the story was slowly revealing itself to us, but ever since the second half of the anime began (aka the Doctor Franxx flashback episode), the story was really going downhill from there. I felt like Trigger was also trying to do this Kill La Kill thing where they give you a really slow story only to throw this really insane plot twist in your face, making the situation for our protagonist more dire. Except, in this instance, it didn't work at all. There was a lot more telling in this show than showing (especialy with the Doctor Franxx episode), and even if we wanted something explained to us like Hiro's sudden klaux. transformation, that is never explained to us or shown how that has happened. We can only speculate that somehow the blood he licked  corrupted his DNA or whatever. Even the plot twist that Trigger gives you is eventually swept under the rug to focus mainly on the more boring story of Earth recovering, which isn't really exciting. A lot of potential story that could have been written for the war against VIRM isn't shown at all, and is mainly overshadowed by overly pretty art to hide the fact that they basically did not develop this half of the story enough. And while I deeply LOVE the relationship between Hiro and Zero Two (I think it's one of the most touching), there's nothing really new that they do with it that makes my love for these two go that extra step. The way they solve the final conflict between VIRM and Hiro/Zero Two is by basically making Zero Two  unrealistically  contact this little girl that was born literally two years ago -- that she never met -- and somehow have the gang know that somethings wrong and that they need to do a magic prayer circle in order to save them. Like.... WHAT? I'm sorry but even in the world that this story takes place, that does not make any sense whatsoever. While I'm happy that this story ended on a happy note, the path there was not a good one, and I'm disappointed that I have to give this show an overall rating of 3.

This anime is one of the best I have ever watched, simply put, its AMAZING. At times it may be a bit rushed but the story and everything about it really is just something else, it sure took the number 1 spot in my list. I just finished watching the very last episode of the anime and I honestly wish there was more.If your looking for a good anime to watch then go straight ahead because it's definitely worth the watch.I Hope there is a season 2 with a Future storyline...Genres: Action, Drama, Mecha, Romance, Sci-Fi

Honestly though... She is just bae, one of my favorite anime heroines to date. The storyline really drew me in as well, its a take on the age old question of what would happen if we did achieve immortality, and albeit some aspects of the anime are unrealistic, that's not to be expected, if you came for realism, try somewhere else. I really enjoyed watching this series, and I can't wait to see what more is to come from it. Definitely on my top anime list, and I recommended it to all my friends, to which they've gotten back to me and also liked it a lot. :DD

The writing in this show just blew my mind.Initially, I thought it was funny to have a doggy-style position system to operate the mechs which I can understand why people would not take this show seriously. But looking beyond that, you get to get attached to the characters in this show and understand why the mechs needed a female and male to operate them and not just because it is metaphor. And as the title of my review implies, it is more then just kids controlling giant mechs to destroy monsters. This is where Studio Trigger really shines..the plot twists. S**t does get real!

At first I was very skeptical for obvious reasons but once I got past my initial judgments of the outlandish visuals, I was able to recognize the stories true depth. The creator does in immaculate job as far as world building is concerned but I can see how many people overlook all the small details. Each episode raises many questions and you aren't presented with clear answers for quite some time. The story is put forth in such a way that really requires you to read in between the lines and it my opinion, that's what makes it so captivating. It creates an atmosphere of deep conflict and in between are some stunning visuals and fight scenes. It is not without faults but it is expertly written and worth the watch.

At first sight it might seem as if this was an ecchi anime, with all the weird pilot positions, BUT THAT'S JUST A FILTER, TO WEED OUT THE WEAK, for only the THOSE OF TRUE FAITH may truly enjoy this masterpiece that Trigger and A-1 Studios have brought upon this world~Character development gets a solid 9, animation style triggers some nostalgia related to Kill la Kill, Gurren Lagann, classic Trigger stuff~Even if you are not  a mecha fan, you are gonna love this show.The facial expressions of these mechas gets a 10, so cute.  Top anime 2k18 candidate.

I'm giving it four stars because I don't think it deserves five but I don't necessarily think it deserves a three star rating either.Things I like about Darling in the Franxx:- The art is beautiful- The animation is stellar- Some of the episodes are really really goodThings I have a problem with about Darling in the Franxx:- Most of the characters are pretty basic (you can basically identify each character's personality from the poster and they don't change much)- The way it's organized feels like it gets in the way of the story- There's a too much time spent covering the same issuesFrom episode one you get introduced to the issue that Hiro's life is in danger if he pilots a franxx with Zero Two. Eventually that problem gets resolved. Or so we were led to believe. Suddenly, there's a new problem they hadn't considered that again puts him in danger of piloting the franxx with Zero Two. I'm not saying it should be taken out of the story, but I don't see the purpose of emphasizing his ability to suddenly pilot a Franxx with Zero Two if he's just going to be in the same position again in a couple episodes. In the middle of this plot line various conflicts occur between the other parasites which seem like a big deal until something new happens with Hiro and Zero Two. This causes those problems to get shelved until the next time there is space. A.K.A. when something isn't happening with Zero Two and Hiro. This makes it feel like a large amount of the show is filler, especially when conflicts suddenly get resolved with very little explanation or effort Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hide(the broken promise between Mitsuru and Hiro, Ichigo taking Hiro to Zero Two in episode 15). That being said, some of the Hiro and Zero Two stuff is really awesome and it's not like watching an anime that isn't always grabbing your attention is going to kill you. This show is definitely worth a watch and I would really like to know how other people feel about this show because I'm kind of lost in my opinion of it.

I'm not kidding, the memes are funny but without a premium account, the memes will spoil everything. If you plan on binge watching this later,  DON'T GO TO r/Animemes!!. For those people who live under a rock, r/Animemes is a subreddit on reddit. Now to the actual review. This show is really good at character development. I feel like this anime is just kind of a slice of life with mecha thrown in, But that doesn't mean the anime doesn't have good mecha battles. I'll try not to spoil some stuff but I really enjoy the battles between Strelizia and the klaxosuars. I don't really know what to write in this review except for not to go onto r/Animemes.

Too be honest, this has to be one of the first anime(s) of all to get me started to watching other genres of anime. This one is the pinnacle and ever since seeing this anime I have strived to watch others.Example; Beat-less,Heavy Object,Clockwork Planet, Etc & etc..I hope the Creator(s) of Darling in the FRANXX strive to continue this series as it's one of a kind of anime that many other Creator(s) cannot do. You have my good luck and thank-you for making such an unbelievable series. Thank-you, thank-you so damn much!

At first glance, DARLING in the FRANXX appears to be a trope-filled anime with tons of fan service. But this fan service has a REASON to exist - and that is where DARLING in the FRANXX shines most - in its slow, methodical and beautiful introduction to the world that our heros, Hiro and Zero Two live in.I am NOT a fan of fan service and I was extremely put off by the odd sexual innuendos indicated by how the FRANXX (the giant mechs) are piloted but as the story begins to unveil discrepancies such as these kids not knowing what any type of affection is - it becomes clear that the tropes that exist start to make sense. These are kids who know no intimacy, no kisses, no education of emotions and love and it is almost an anomaly as to why.It's this type of deep, rooted ideologies in DARLING in the FRANXX that made it stand out to me. I am thoroughly excited to learn more about this world and have begun to understand its intricacies with relationships and how complex they can be.

Thus far the series, to me, is quite compelling and full of personalities.  Being told nothing of Love, growing up, and having 'Partners' of the opposite sex, creates a wonder of how love could grow.  The squad and their interconnections, resembling a class of young high school students; a 'transfer student' of an older age (who may not be human at all) arrives knowing more about the world, and seemingly of relationships between people, and nature.  Throw in another squad that knows the world in a different sense, and knows of 002 and 016, and you have an interesting construction of what it is growing up and understanding the world.  Let alone being told you are the youngsters who are to save the world. As what looks like love triangles build, and life is threatened, I am very much looking forward to seeing how the future of the series unfolds, and the growth of the characters.  It makes me think of something that a mixture of Eva and Gurren Lagann could yield.  Bonus, I love Studio Trigger.

Back when the anime first came out earlier this year I gave it a low rating due to having some overly predictable story but as I stuck around it got better!The story in a nutshell: Kids are paired together to fight in mechs that can only truly function if they're subconsciously compatible with one another. They all serve to protect a bubbled off city that is prone to mech monster alien attacks.Personally, the cast is your typical run-of-mill predictable characters like the kid that eats a lot, the tsundere, the punk brat rival you want to punch in the face, smart glasses guy, etc. The only good one is Zero two; rebellious, unfiltered, ambitious. Her dynamic with the protagonist Hiro works well enough to make the anime alright at best. However! As the anime continues into the double digits character, plot, and story kicks up a notch! You get a much better view of what's going on and why things are the way they are both characters and world alike. It anime to me shies away from being a 5/5 due to repetitive problem-solving solutions but all and all the anime was great!

This anime couldn't trigger me until the episode 4. This reminds me so much on Gundam 00 but yet it is so different. It have original parts of his own. Characters are cool but Zero Two is on another level of personality. I recommend this anime to everyone and I would be sad if for some reason this anime can't see trough the end cause this have massive potential to become my #1 anime if my expectations are made.

Heavy on the sexual metaphors...that's no problem. I think they crouch the language/story into those terms to titillate younger audiences. But, this is more akin to a robot marriage...anime style. It's still very much enjoyable so far; perhaps I'm waiting to see how close the studio can push the limits? What lurks in the minds of these characters (writers/artists)?I'm also sure the series will spark discussions about teenage/adolescent sexuality, but this will reflect basically the social mores that each viewer brings from their culture. However, I believe the show has the controlling metaphors down pat; eg. the "papa" and the council. Who/what could they represent? And the young girl that's a demon? It's not hard to figure out.

Sort of has the same feel as shows like SAO or Log Horizon, though without the meta story running in the background, which to me is a good thing. I never cared much for when the "real world" stuff pored to much into those shows. I'll be perfectly honest and say the title of this show drew me into it, but really got hooked by this first episode. The voice work and the characters were really well done in my opinion, and the animation is pretty solid. I probably would of watched this show anyways just for the pretense that the title creates but now having seen it I will be waiting more than a little impatiently each week for the new episode! Much love.

This somehow manages to be fun, intriguing, titillating, and exciting.While it's not a carbon copy of the manga,It appears some good choices where made when adapting this to the big screen. It's still early on, but I haven't had this much fun with a series in a long time.Update: Episode 8  was one of the most satisfying and best directed fight scenes I've ever seen. Period.... In regular movies and anime alike... I came to tears by the time it ended. Director Yoshiki Yamakawa may have raised the bar a bit with this one.The Remaining 5 episodes have a tough act to follow.

It initially reminds me of Tower of Druaga. Action/comedy DnD that seems as if it may have some harem tendencies but it's to soon to tell. You have the MC who is he'll bent on getting stronger which is pretty par for this type of anime. It's just fun to watch and it he animation is easy on the eyes. Mild fan service. Different Familias will obviously provide plenty of antagonists so there should be a solid and diverse group of characters that will move the story along. Really interested to see where this goes regarding the leveling system and dungeon.

Let's admit it, the title and/or cover art of the anime managed to pique our interest! As a humongous lover of Sword Art Online, Log Horizon, No Game No Life, and gaming personally, it's easy for me to envelop myself in a world that revolves around adventurers, gaming, and goddesses.The idea of "needing to get stronger for a stranger to fall for me" could have definitely been pulled off better. However, the animation was fluid, artwork was well detailed, and music seems to entertain my interest throughout the show! The little bits of comedy and action were definitely what made this show MORE than worth watching again. Overall, I'd personally give it a 4.5/5 and suggest either putting this show on your queue or watching it RIGHT NOW!

Based on first 3 episodesPotential 15/10Action 10/10Sound Effects 10/10Music 8/10Music working with the scenes/feels 11/10Story 9.5/10Feels 10/10Art 10/10God damn i cant get enough of this anime... with only 3 episodes it can do a Sword art online and completely fall on its face, But if it doesnt do that and keeps up what it is doing, then oh my god...   this will be a contender for 2015 top.

I'm sure  everyone is going to think that this is just another MMO style game with the level up system and what not, but there's far more! This is one of the few anime out there that integrates mythology (Greek Gods in this case) into the story. Aside from this, there is also the storyline. Sure people are going to claim "No its just boobs" or "Just another Harem", but don't forget that Bell is strictly trying to get together with Aiz and everything he has done up to this point is towards that goal. This anime is exceptionally well crafted and can become even more amazing than it is already.EDIT: THE TITLE IS CALLED "Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon?". ITS GONNA HAVE HAREM FFS.

The first season was fantastic, truly amazing.  This second season is a bitter disappointment.  I understand that you can't easily put everything contained in the books into an alternate media such as anime.  However, the pacing on this is FAR too aggressive which makes the final product choppy and altogether too compressed. It leaves the story flavorless and uninformed and the battle scenes were decidedly underwhelming when compared to the grandeur described in the light novels.  This is still a favorite series of mine but so far I have been unable to bring myself to continue watching past the wholly unsatisfying episode 4.

Since i saw this anime on LiveChart i had a certain feeling this would be something completely different and enjoyable to watch.I found the story plot to be a twist with Sao for the reason being of dungeons. Sadly Sao got boring half way because of the all berserk healer Asuna love story plot. On the other hand this gave away the feel of an aspiring adventure and a twisted love story between more then one female. Id rate this anime a 10/10 for surpassing my own expectationsGood luck with the chicks Bell Cranel my friend.

This show is spectacular!!! Now i know that in itself isnt a very good opening statement, but it truly describes this show. It is waaaaay better than i thought it was going to be tbh. The action scenes...oh my the action scenes... they show amazing potential, granted it is the beginning of the series so they havent gotten too crazy just yet but it is easy to see how good the action is going to be. The plot, well it is really nice but nothing we havent seen before (in a sense). However the characters are soo well thought out and unique imo and I really see this show being VERY popular soon!! The animation is sickkk as well (in a good way lol) really crisp, clear and smooth and flow really well. I wont be surprised if this show ends up being as popular or (at least almost) as sword art. Imho it started out better than sword art and Bell - Kun  is JUST as awesome as Kirito - Kun  ;]   So all in all this is a great show an would recommend it to all anime fans!!! Enjoy! PS... the fan service isnt bad either :p

Season 2 is some of the worst anime Ive ever seen in my life. The main character is now, all of a sudden for now reason completely useless. Hes worse than when he was saved all the way back in season 1 episode 1. His strength, training, adversities all mean nothing now. Lvl 3, S class stats all maxed... Nope means ZERO. Every random smuck just handles him with complete ease. He also cant take action at all.now. just doesnt. The two times he does, 1st time they make an extremely underwhelming, crappily animated fight. 2nd time he just runs aeound screamong firebolt till some guy in lingerie instantly tackles him to the ground and pins him down. Makes literally ZERO fucking sense. Like holy fuck this show has gone to shit.

i wish there was a way to separate the reviews but to put it bluntly season 1 is a five star show and season 2 is a garbage tier anime. i almost never write a review for a show but ive never seen such a drastic drop in the quality of the story telling from one season to the next. the first season had its cliche harem fantasy aspects but put significant effort into character strengthening only to have him immediately revert to being useless for no reason in season 2 just to boost his strength again.

When i started watching the first episode i instantly recognized the voice actor of Kirito fro SAO. This show definitely has a little SAO feel to it while watching the first episode. But i feel it will be amazing in its own right. The artwork, characters and voices that go along with them are amazing. This show has potential to be good. It kept me wanting another after the credits and stuff was done. I am looking forward to watching this series and glad crunchyroll picked it up. Final thoughts: The show couldnt have been better. As i stated before it felt like SAO when i started watching it but now that ive finished it moved so far away from SAO it became a greater show instead. The characters and voice acting were great. The ending was good in my opinion. I cant wait to see if this show gets picked up for another season of maybe some OVAs. I hope you enjoy this show too

What we loved from the first season, has now diverted from the growth and character-building formula. Bells character was still in this growth phase when season 1 ended.However, Season 2 took a slower pace or nonexistence growth phase, it does show some tid-bits of training but non that actually develops him as a character or the struggle he has to go through to attain higher strength.It is far from its glory days in season one, where we were always eager to know what states or skills or how he has grown in season one. The fighting is lacking, as it doesn’t show the same struggle and tension that the first season had. He doesn’t seem to have grown at all, and we are at episode 9. There have been too many side character and side arcs based on the formula of how he can talk his way out of situation, which you end up not caring about the side characters in the end. Bell is basically useless and indecisive and wont action until he cries about it first, this is backwards character building compared to the first season. Season one, Bell always did something about things that bothered him and although knew he was weak sought to grow stronger, hence the special skill he has in regards to striving to become stronger.I probably wait till the network decides to proceed to a more complex and character-building arc, it just feels like this is cannon fodder.

Rating Summary Composite Rating 4/5Very very solid anime. I would recommend it to people who are fans of pretty much any genre since it has a lot which will appeal to many different demographics. The characters are very likeable for the most part and the main character is not OP as hell so you feel tense watching some of the battles. I wouldn't say this is a "must watch" which is why it does not get 5 stars; however, it is a very good anime that i would have no problem recommending to anyone.SynopsisBell, a new adventurer, is tasked with fighting in a dungeon in order to gain money, and become stronger through leveling up. Additionally, he has to balance multiple love interests (If hestia will let him that is).Plot: 4/5Typical rom-com/harem anime with an oblivious main character and several girls that seem to show very obvious affection. Has all of the tropes including, jealous main female, loli love interest, aloof love interest, and bromance. (3)This formula is combined with the typical RPG like anime that has become popular as of late.(+1) If you liked SAO/Log Horizon, you would probably like this anime.Characters: 4/5Bell, the main character is basically like a white haired kirito. Plays alone for a while, however is very kind to his allies, and people in general. His kindness can be seen as a strength or a weakness.Hestia is a main love interest who cares very much for bell. The two have great chemistry, and i hope to see their relationship develop more should there be a second season.Liliruca is arguably the most defined character in the entire series. She is plagued by a dark backstory which drives many of her early decisions.Aiz is a seemingly aloof, yet caring main love interest. It is unclear why she takes an interest to bell, however the dynamic between the two is very sweet.Animation/Design: 5/5This anime has a color pallete which is easy on the eyes, as well as pleasant arty style. There is a good amount of attention to detail and the "special effects" are pretty cool. It reminded me a lot of Log-horizon.Audio/Soundtrack: 3/5Good, but only that. There was nothing bad, and nothing that really stood out. I will not comment on the OP or ED since i pretty much only watch those once and then skip them forever after. Average soundtrack gets an average score from me.

I thought this would be something fresh due to the obviously unique title. Although a little disappointed that this has a huge SAO feel to it I gradually started to like it more and more. The pace of the show feels slow (in a good way) and relatively well explained even though, the main character is advancing at such a fast pace. To conclude, this is a better version of SAO essentially, except without the virtual reality part of the show, and much better pacing character development is better than SAO. I thoroughly enjoyed the show thus far.

Even though I never liked SAO, I really like this show! It's really awesome so far (up to Episode 3) and I can't wait for more... The Setting is very intriguing with its combination of mythological, comical, romantic, fantasy & arcade/MMO elements without it being too silly or too cheesy for my taste.However it was it's plot which really drew me in, as it is very immersing and has so much potential.

I must say that I'm thrilled to watch this anime! I'm very much into OL game style of anime (Log Horizon, SAO, No Game No Life...) and although it is similar, it has its unique qualities. The basis of this anime is that certain people have gods who have lost some of their power, but the humans still have to "level up" and gain experience to increase in skill. The gods are also capable of reading members of their "familia's" skill level and recording their progress. It has all of the perks of a video game-style of anime but without having to explain how people are trapped in another world. I'm very excited to continue watching this anime and know that after two episodes there is much more intrigue and action to come.

I have only seen the first episode as that is all that has come out for this show, but I already love it. The animation and art are both great and the story will have lots of room to grow and expand. As some others said this is similar to that of SAO or Log Horizon. But it more so has the feel and comedy of Log Horizon with the emotional and romantic aspect of SAO.Overall If you are looking for a great show to watch I would recommend this one as if it continues to deliver like the first episode this could be a great series, that could last a long time.

Just like so many have already said ill finish their thoughts for them.  The First Season is a golden Mana flowing from the heavens not to be missed.The second season is what I would call a steaming pile of runoff, composed of compacted horse excrement. Now dont get me wrong season 2 as a standalone anime would be fine. I would probably enjoy it on its own. The main problem being of coarse, the new season leaves its base. Becoming something new and deformed from the original. Anyway I feel the 2rd season was more of an afterthought or money maker than a true continuation or completion of the story.with all that said i can only hope a season 3 is made and they go back too the 1st formula that made season 1 so great.

Ok, stop right now. If the reason you are not watching this anime is because it's, "a harem," anime, then I beg you give this anime a shot. Yes, it has a trope of most females introduced having an interest in the main character, but it's not really that bad. The hero is likeable, his main goal is to be a hero, save the girl, get a wife, and go on adventures. He isn't trying to assemble a harem, and that's what makes this enjoyable. The action is awesome, Hestia is adorable, and Bell is not a pervert, which makes this really enjoyable to watch.

The title of this anime actually turned me away from watching this at first.Giving the first episode a chance, was caught completely by surprise.Fun with an interesting story line and characters.At first it seemed very light hearted, but by the end of the first episode, you had the feeling of some depth, and you just like the main character(s).At least by the writing of the review, there is a mysterious back story developing that our characters are growing into nicely, where we can root for them to grow and succeed.Very enjoyable and worth a thumbs up review.

I have been watching anime for over 15 years now, and over 200+ shows and movies.  This is quickly making it to my top 10 of all time.  Fujino Ōmori has created an amazing balance between Drama and action with character development that quickly gains your buy in to the main characters.The majority of animes now are great ideas that have not been fleshed out past 4 or 5 episodes.  That result in either all action with no story or tons of fan service to sidetrack you from the fact there is no story.  Fujino has found the formula that works it keeps you on the edge of your seat at times, and will have you emotionally moved at others all packed into 25 minutes.I would highly recommend give this show a watch, and see what this new author has done.  For being his debut manga I cannot wait to see what else is in store for this and any future endeavors he may have.  If he continues on this path I would expect many more great things!

This show is what i imagine most people expected SAO to be like after the first 10 minutes or so of the first episode (before the whole no logging off thing got put into perspective).this show is set in an intriguing fantasy world, and although i find myself drawn into the series, it never seems to take itself too seriously.  while not quite as funny as "no game no life", i love the humor, and (thus far) the fanservice hasn't been terribly obnoxious.TLDR: a greatly entertaining show with all the adventure that sucked me into SAO at the start, without the story getting too serious.  This show is very casual, and i love it

On the surface, this looks like a show that would be very ecchi, loaded with fanservice, and I am not a fan of shows where fanservice takes precedence over story/character development, I find it annoying, unnecessary, cheap.Now I'm not a detractor of fanservice, in moderation it's fine, and this show actually balances it out quite nicely. It's not in your face every 5 seconds with sleazy camera angles distracting you from the story. So if you're going to have fanservice in a show, this is how you do it, with good characters, an interesting story that keeps you coming back for more, and it doesn't hurt to have some great animation too.Also, some people are comparing this to SAO and Log Horizon, and while all three have that fantasy RPG element, Is it Wrong to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon is set a fantasy world, where as the other 2 are set in MMORPG game worlds, and to me thus far there is no connection beyond the fantasy elements.

So this is an AMAZING anime, I'm glad that so far the anime is doing the light novel justice, there is a lot of content for an anime to work off of, it should get much deeper about ep 4-5 when he meets his  Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hidesupporter/pack mule.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThe only part I'm going to hate is if this is only to 13 eps per season then im willing to bet about ep 10 is when he will get his magic FIREBOLT!!!!!!!  And then goes crazy happy with it not thinking of his "mp". Don't click on the spoilers if you don't want to know future plot

The first season was solid enough to make me want to watch season two of this show but I was wrong to believe it would be just as good. Considering that throughout season one the main protagonist is looking to be with one girl, season two is far too much about a selfish goddess who wants her children to be her lover and to finish on that is just so gringy and might as well but thrown into the trash. Granted there's amazing moments within the two-season however the expectations within them just falls so drastically it feels as if the writers just could not have been any more lazy.

Season 2 is stereotypical "hero saves maiden" to the extreme, with a generic plot and a strange fixation on needing to prove that prostitutes need saving too.  Jokes were not very funny and not much actually happens, with the plot moving so slowly. Bell-kun seems to be written as a less intelligent and more gullible person than he was in season 1.Season 2 was disappointing, as I was hoping for more of the exciting action seen in season 1. However, I wonder if I'd feel the same if I go back and watch season 1 again, or if my praise for it came from my past inexperience with anime.

I was a little hesitant to give it a view, as the title implied it would just be a cheesy, boob-festy, goofy anime. But it wasn't, and I really liked it! Don't get me wrong: there was plenty of boob jokes and cartoon-girl jealousy-induced rages, but it wasn't the focus. Similar to Log Horizon, I was pleasantly surprised at the depth it had and the detail the systems within their world contained. Looking forward to season 2! There better be a season 2, and soon.

By far the best anime for me this year! I couldn't wait to watch the next episode, the many painful waits till another week passed.Don't let the name fool you, its not just another harem like anime, Its got action that gets the heart pumping, emotion bits that will pull at you, and a plot thats got me hyped and curious as F**K!They better make another season, and on that note cannot wait for it.

Is it wrong to pick up girls in a dungeon is perfect in my opinion. Now I wasn't sure about watching this anime, the title sort of conveyed a stupid guy full of testosterone running into a dungeon and so on and so forth. However It looked really cool so I thought I'd give it a go. Not only does this show exceed my expectations but it also surpasses it self. What I mean by this is it does get old. When you think It is going to be the same old episode plot over and over again BOOM  you get some character backstory that redefines how the character interacts. I would watch it again (and have).  Hope you enjoy                - Chris

If you are a fan of SAO, this is the show for you. (Same mc voice actor too :D)At first I was hesitant to watch because is seemed different, but after watching the first few episodes I found out that this is one of my favorite anime of the season! The art style and character development is outstanding and each episode gets better and better. Even though the mc is timid he is still very much a badass and everyone knows it. For those who are on the borderline of watching/finishing please do it. You won't regret it.

2018 UPDATE: The anime hasn't changed since my review in 2015. But I have read ahead with the Light Novels (currently finished Book 11), and I will say the story moving forward from the end of the anime is leagues above and beyond what I felt from these 12 episodes. If you read books or Manga. Give this series ago.PS: It still isn't an Isekai show.As the title says, on episode twelve when writing this review and it's great, but not perfect. The main character in the beginning was a weakling getting saved left and right, and he still is currently but he is slowly becoming "overpowered". This is good since in anime with the RPG feel to it, SAO rings a bell, the main characters are usually OP as can be from the start.On that note this is a anime based on an RPG that ISN'T a video game. Or at least they don't give the vibe that it is. No talk about real world, logging out, friends list etc etc.This Anime is a must watch in my books. even if you prefer anime of macho manly characters who know it all, it is still worth watching. Watch Bell-kun become strong to protect the ones he cares about; and have an actual struggle to do so.

A amazing up and coming anime that all fantasy fanatics should watch. The name helps reel watchers in and the story helps keep them there.It is a really cute and funny anime that made me need to see more after the first ten minutes. This anime just might be one of the best fantasy anime I've seen. This anime has an amazing plot and story of how the magical things in the world where the characters are living. It does an amazing job of combining the different genres that this anime has and is a anime which has not failed my expectations yet.

I love the plot. It is so great because it is a mix of Campione! (which integrated Gods into the mix) and Tower of Druaga (where heroes battle in a dungeon to be a hero and be rich. Also, the animation and voice acting are on point and fit with each character perfectly. Only downside is that If there was going to be an english dub I feel like no voice actor would fit the characters, but maybe that is just me.

this is easily my most favorite anime that i have ever seen and it is truly sad to see that there is going to be only 13 episodes (apparently). but i wish this anime to never die off and to hopefully be continued until it dies off (which it wont XP )but other than being unrealistic i reccomend that you watch this right now. you shouldnt even be reading this, you should be watching it instead. inf/10 would watch again -me and alot of other people <3

I can't say much more.Animation style and execution is top notch. Its like when you get to the end of a filler arc in a big series and it looks like a brand new show as soon as it gets back onto the manga story. Except this is every episode.Love Bell and Hestia. As well as Bell's companions. Each add their own special twist to the story and the prose of the dialogue.BELL IS A BADASS. No if ands or buts about it.Watch it, and love it.

From the script, animation, and character choice they have nailed it in this series.If I knew how to send them a donation to keep this series away from ever being canceled I would without a second thought. this series has so far shown a great component that I enjoy which is a video game (RPG) story line. and they even included the weapon and armor shops, but put extra care into how the main character sees them in his perspective. Which is how I see them from my own perspective in an actual RPG (or in some RPG's I would have liked to have seen them shown and used like that). also the stats as morphing (magical) tattoos on the characters backs is a great concept I liked that idea. as well as showing his improvement in certain stats, such as in his agility and maneuvering in the latest episodes on the 11th floor of the dungeon was great. especially liking his hero mentality which is how I go into RPG's in my own mindset, so its nice to see the character have that same mentality.Anyway thanks for the show!! I'll be looking into the author and hopefully find out where to send them some donations, or find a way to show my support so that this series will not die out any time soon!!

When I first saw this anime whilst I was scrolling through crunchyroll looking for a new adventure/action anime, it did not catch my eye. This was because the name was far too long, from my first look at it, I thought it was going to be a romance comedy type of show as all I saw was "Is it wrong to pick up girls". But I was so wrong.This anime is everything that I was looking for. It is very similar to the first arc of SAO (which was the best part of SAO) and has many epic fight scenes already (currently on episode 9). The protagonist is great and interesting along with the other characters in the show. The character development is good, the storyline is currently good, the pace of the anime is good, the art of the anime is good. Everything about it is great so far. I can't wait for the new episodes to be released on Fridays. Every episode finishes making you want to watch more (even if it doesn't end on a cliff hanger).

I'm completely addicted to the story. Can't wait for the episodes to be released each week! The plot sometimes feels a little rushed, but I understand why it moves at the pace it does. While being similar to SAO or Log Horizon, "Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon?"(DanMachi) goes more into depth, such as ability levels, experience, currency & items/equipment in regards to gaming. I enjoy that this story/anime doesn't have its characters "play" a game.

This one is definitely worth the time. The pacing is perfect, not too fast, not to slow, and just the right amount of character development throughout. Indeed, this is anime quite a treat! The story so far has been emotional, humorous, captivating, kinda pervy but not so much that it rouses any disturbing thoughts. . .ANYWAY... This is my first review of any anime and it's solely because i think "Anime name too long" is worth the time to write one. I really hope it continues to a second season although with it's popularity I wouldn't be too surprised if plans are already in the works!(This is me wishfully thinking).

Now i have had my crunchyroll roll account for along time now. I have never wrote a review before. This show actually made me feel like i had to tell everyone about it. Again very similar to Log Horizon, or SOA. But this time there is "real-world" and the virtual world. This time it cuts all that out and just focuses on the lore and story of one character Bell which is trying to become a hero. Due to his kind heart and determination he gets friends which help him along the way. The fact that this anime only has 9 episodes so far from when im writing and you feel so attached to the character, like he is something everyone wants to be. The "Little-Rookie" with big dreams. The only thing bad i can say is, after every episode it kills me the fact i got to wait a week to watch another episode.

I have never really written reviews about shows. But omg, this particular anime forced me to write a review and talk about the show. First of all, the title might draw some people away and some people close to it. But don't judge the book by its cover. It is a beautiful anime with a beautiful story, that will get you hooked from Day 1. I have become more and more impatient every week for each episode, as it is getting more and more intense every time. Im going to be straight with everyone, it is MUST WATCH SHOW!!

The title is very misleading, as the MC has his eyes set on only one girl, thus this is not a harem as many indicate. This is a story about a boy who with determination will make his wishes come true and inspire those around him. It is a great and FUNNY story that can be enjoyed by all with different tastes in anime. The setting is based similar to the old AD&D system (i.e.dungeons, leveling, exp etc) except guild/clans are run by gods. The ecchi is almost nonexistant, to the point it is easily overlooked due to such a great story/plot. I hope this will become a very long running anime as it has a lot to offer, story and plot wise similar to Fairy Tale and Naruto. I hope we get to see Bell Grow up into a fine young man.....and above all else, you will come to love Hestia. Watch for pure fun.

I'll be honest, when I saw the art cover and the name, I set my expectations pretty low. I couldn't have been more wrong. I've waited for half a dozen episodes now to write this review, since I wanted to make sure it would be an accurate look at the anime. The annoying ecchi and harem aspects of the show are so minimal that you forget about them. The art, especially during the big fight scenes, is amazing. The character designs seemed really simple at first, but have grown on me, sometimes simple doesn't have to be bad. The characters are developing with the story in every way I could hope.You will not be disappointed. I know I'm not. Hopefully this review helps clear up some of those things if they are holding you back, as they almost did me.

From the beginning i thought when i read the name "why should i watch this? i mean who names their anime  'is it wrong to try to pick up girls in a dungeon'?. " I left the Crunchy-roll page for this and then looked thru my options again because i was running low on things i was interested in. so i re-read the summary and i decided why not.. it cant hurt right? So, i start watching and about 15 mins in im hooked. next thing i know i look over at the episode list and its only a 1 episode. (-.-)   Then i gave a huge darth vader NUUUUUUUUU!!!!!! and waited every week for this anime. Now i bought all the books and im waiting for the next episode. XP this anime is amazing!!!! 10/10 - IGN

So you wanna know if this is the typical harem anime with giant boobs and completely subservient girls... I can't think of a way to say no so strongly that it sounds like Zeus came down and yelled it in your face, so you think of one. Anyway, the characters are awesome and (most) have convincing back stories/personalities that match what their experiences have been. The main character Bell is an "adventurer" or a person blessed by a god to allow them to fight monsters in a giant tower dungeon. His is Hestia, a fairly weak and unimportant goddess (the black haired girl with the weird ribbon), who is very protective of him. He gets trapped by a much stronger monster in the dungeon and is saved by his main love interest, inspiring him to become stronger. Then we have six episodes of some of the most badass character building I have ever seen. Throughout the time Bell is getting stronger, but it doesn't really sink in until the eighth episode where he has an awesome confrontation. So yeah, freaking watch this and don't let the naysayers dissuade you

I don't usually write reviews on anime shows at least not here.  This is a show you should just watch, if you like MMO, final fantasy type genre, with boy likes girl, girl(s) like boy, boy chases after the wrong girl, boy learns to launch fireballs at monsters, boy starts to grow-up a bit along way, character development everywhere, a sucker for great mythology, and something to turn your brain off while you watch an anime just watch it.

Good stuff story of my life                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   have fun watching it!

NOTE: At the time of this review, only the first 8 episodes of the show have been aired.INTRODUCTION - Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon?          To be honest, when I first read the title, I really didn't know what to expect from this show. The ridiculous title hinted at nothing more than a typical harem with a substanceless plot whose sole purpose is to expose more oversized boobies. Yet, the reviews section seemed to suggest otherwise. Out of pure curiosity I decided to dive in and watch the episodes released up to date. Did I make the right call? Hell yes.STORY - Don't judge a book by its cover...          This expression exists for a reason! Don't get me wrong, this anime is by no means a masterpiece, but boy did its qualities take me by surprise. As many other reviewers have mentioned, the plot of this show is in many aspects similar to Sword Art Online: Bell-kun, a timid and young male hero, must level up to reach the upper levels of a tower-like dungeon in order to prove his worth to his love at first sight. In his attempts to accomplish his quest, he never fails to capture the attention of young ladies which all instantly fall in love with him.          If that all sounds to you like a carbon copy of SAO's plot, that's because it actually is. One may even tag the story of this anime as "unoriginal". But then, why did I keep watching? You see, this show succeeds in areas where SAO has failed while maintaining many of the latter's qualities. For starters, this show's plot exposition stuck me as remarkably elegant and effortless. Due to the simplicity of the story, this may or may not impress you, but this departure from the plot-heavy anime that always has too much on its plate for its short running time is certainly welcome.CHARACTERS - Brace your spleen, laughter is coming...          While it may be true that many of the characters in this show follow the cookie-cutter model of character design, their colorful and upbeat nature, along with the wonderful humor they share on screen kept me begging for the next episode. The characters of this show are completely ridiculous (borderline insane), but the show embraces their foolishness so well that you'll wonder if some sort of divine force is at work to keep this show together.          There is great chemistry between the two lead characters. The young adventurer Bell-kun and his housewife-like goddess Hestia both make tremendous sacrifices to keep marching forward against the incessant tidal waves of harem fangirls and overpowered Minotaurs. Overall, this character-driven narrative features great character development and a more than decent pacing.ARTWORK - Who said that harem should spawn cheap productions?          I must admit, the quality of the artwork surprised me considered the seemingly light-hearted and simplistic nature of the show. Some of the dungeon fight scenes definitely stand out (I'm looking at you, episode 8...) and the quality of the animation is, at times, downright fantastic. Most notably, the show completely avoids the pitfall of cheap-a** computer animated models (thank God...) and presents a surprisingly good production value throughout given the show's genre and demographic. Thus, if you don't set the bar too high, you should be able to enjoy this show's visuals just fine.SOUNDTRACK - Dat soundtrack...          The soundtrack is probably the aspect of this show that surprises the most. I have received a university-level musical education and still, the beautiful orchestral soundtrack composed by Keiji Inai managed to catch me off guard with its inspired melodies. Some beautiful musical symbolism for Bell-kun's determination was at work during some of the score's finest moments. Unfortunately, I didn't care much for the opening and credit themes which, while good, don't stand out as much as the rest of the soundtrack due to their lack of originality. CONCLUSION - This one will be brief...          Have I not said enough? Go watch this show already!? But in all seriousness, your enjoyment of this show will largely depend on how well you respond to the show's humor and lighthearted tone. Cold hearted nitpickers beware: you might want to skip this one...STORY: 3.9/5.0CHARACTERS:4.3/5.0ARTWORK:4.1/5.0SOUNDTRACK:4.7/5.0---------------------------------------------------------------OVERALL SCORE (NOT AN AVERAGE):4.5/5.0 - Rounded up to five stars.

I came thinking this was going to be just another goofy and cheesy anime. Let me tell you after 8 episodes it is far from goofy and cheesy. This show has excellent action, gorgeous animation, amazing voice acting, and a decent soundtrack. The only complaint I have is how unbelievably stupid Bell can be to romantic advances in the show. It dies down after the first couple of episodes, but it was pretty bad at times.

Wow, in honor of this shows brilliant simplicity and immersive story I'm actually writing this one a review...seriously this makes my Fridays so much better. Top show for me this season period.                                                                                                                                If you haven't started watching this show yet then I definitely recommend doing so. Has been worth every second of my time.After watching episode 8: Has literally blown me away, seriously in terms of addiction this show is worse then cigarettes....at least I can go out and have one whenever I want but this I can only have once a week, sweet god let there be second season! The potential is ovER 9000!!!!

The story and the overall idea behind the story is so good, its like watching a real life 'wow' the bottom line is if you have not seen this show then you do not know what your missing out on. This show involves everything you could want in an anime (without overdoing it), the story so far is catchy to where it will keep me watching (hard to do), voice acting is superb, animations are super solid, the characters and how they interact with one another is also solid, they give just the right amount of boobs and butt too. honestly the fanservice and the story and heck even the title is all bomb diggety lol anyways check this out if you have not already and your thinking about it.

As the title states this is a great anime in my opinion it doesn't need even 10 minutes into the anime to get me hooked its idea isn't all that fresh with shows like SAO out already but it brings a totally fresh feeling with it like its a brand new Idea I actually wish I discovered it later so that there would be more episodes out but this is worth waiting for more an im a very impatient person ill be advising all my friends to watch this anime if they haven't already.    Enjoy everyone

Read the negative comments to get an idea about the show's pitfalls. Among them was something about it being like SAO, which is mostly untrue. The adventurer mechanics are quite different & varied due to the character and their goddess as well as the familia members. While there are some common tropes within this anime (I want to see your true strength instead of killing you now, etc ...,) it introduces new ideas and philosophies not common to RPG's (especially with the decline in GOOD RPG's.) A colorful cast, simplistic character building and a true focus on Bell, I am impressed with the storyline. Admittedly, I'm disappointed in how rushed the episodes seem vs their 200+ pg manga counterparts. This series has tremendous potential and could have been extended many many more episodes. Still, it's light-hearted, fun and even endearing at times. For people wanting something to lighten the mood and make them feel good, this is definitely a recommendation.

I was originally looking for an anime similar to Log Horizon and this was a great find. It has an extremely enjoyable story that has enough mystery behind it to keep me excited for the next episode to be released. The action scenes aren't the best as of now, but they show potential for when the show progresses. Also, I don't feel like that is where the show shines. In my opinion, the focus is on what the characters are experiencing, and it's trying to not be another purely action driven show. Although i could go without the ecchi style aspects of the show.

This anime is literally the coolest version of SAO. In Sao there was only talking and literally no action. This version is amazing and I only watched 4 episodes. I highly recommend this anime if you love action, gods, and monsters. However the anime would be better if the title was different because its embarrassing to tell your friends that the anime "Is It Wrong To Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon" is amazing.

Let me preface this review by saying that I have only been into anime for about 2 years. I've done my best to watch all the "Best Anime's" and fill out my arsenal of anime critiques. I thoroughly believe that this will be one of the better anime's I've seen in those entire two years. We're only 3 episodes in and I can't get enough. I have seen every reviewer nitpick and pick apart some of my favorite anime and I am able to see the flaws in what I watch (I mean by God I watch Highschool DxD, which is by no means a masterpiece) but at this point they couldn't pick this apart in any meaningful way because it's just that good. I went into this like most people did; "That title is hilarious, let's see how this goes" and I was blown away. One of my really good friends who HATES fan service and stuff like that LOVES the show so far. I'll be honest, if this show doesn't go into at least a full 25-26 episode arc, I will be incredibly disappointed. Well deserving of many seasons. But why are you still reading this review? GO WATCH IT!!! NOW!!

I'll admit: I'm one of the filthy casuals who got introduced to the manga after the first anime episode. It's ridiculous, but after one chapter, I was ridiculously hooked and blew through all 31 chapters in one sitting. Then I looked up the light novel and read it all.After coming back to the anime, I cannot help but find that this anime suffers from the same problem Game of Thrones has. There's no doubt that the source material is brilliant, and the anime producers have come up with the best reproduction they could within the confines of the anime medium, but too much character development has been lost in anime at the expense of expediency. There are too many plot cues in the anime which are seemingly out of left field and at random times, but make more sense from the perspective of the manga.This would have been a 5 for me, but 1 star has been deducted for the loss of coherence in the narrative.

Saw the first episode, and it was amazing, so I did some research and there are light novels and manga this is based on. I loved the first episode, and based on the novels this story with this animation style will be phenomenal! I am 100% excited to watch the rest of this show and will be waiting as the clock counts down every episode except when im at work, in which case... first thing when I get home every episode release!! This story is that good. Great character development, good action scenes, lovable hero and heroines, and a world manipulated by the gods to make me envious of the adventurers that live there.

If you find this season to be awful I truly ask you to read the light novel. Comparing the animated series and the book series most scenes feel lack luster to what they initially are suppose to be. If you are looking for the training sessions or other details that could give you an idea of how much Bell has trained then you should really read the Light novels. Volumes 6 covers the premise of the war games and volume 7 covers the red light district.

This review is written having seen ep 1, this is going to be such a good title. Dark, cute, and real. Give it a shot, the actual episode itself has a five star rating at 900 votes.I understand being upset and wanting CR to see your circumstances but those negative reviews are placed over people's work. This is someone's creation and those reviews are negatively impacting it without having seen the show at all. It just seems destructive to the show when it doesn't need to be.

Now I usually don't write reviews, but after all the one-star reviews complaining about region restrictions, I felt it was my duty to set this straight. With that out of the way, on to the show:If I had a scale range from cute to terrifying, this show would cover the whole thing. I felt like I was on a rollercoaster for my emotions. At the beginning all I could think was "why are their faces so close to the middle," and then at the middle I thought, "something's wrong, they seem too happy and wow this animation is nice," and finally at the end I didn't think, I just sat there trying to process what I just witnessed. Also I don't get the hate I've seen surrounding the opening, I like it. This show has the makings to be the best of the season so I hope it lives up to its potential, fingers crossed. Sorry for my crummy review, I'm new to writing my opinion.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hidep.s. momma's face is going to haunt my nightmares now, just for that... 11 outta 10

This is a series that I have been reading since it first showed up as on Shonen Jump. It immediately stood out to me as a misfit for the magazine. It feels much more like a Seinen(targeted at young adults) and thats a good thing! I worried that the adaptation wouldn't be able to capture the tense and gritty atmosphere but they nailed it!. The art style and the delivery are actually a step above the manga so far and the Opening/Ending and the soundtrack are absolutely phenomenal. The portion that this anime will likely cover is my favorite in the manga to date so I'm looking forward to seeing even more.

How do I even begin with this. It has a wholesome vibe at first, although you catch on quickly that the setting isn't what it seems to be, even before all the dark plot points begin happening, and this is all in one episode. It definitely made me widen my eyes when it started getting serious. If you have more of a weak stomach then don't watch this, although if you can handle dark and slight edge, this does it well, very well. I don't feel like I'm watching an edgelord anime just cause it's dark. I recommend this to anyone and let's hope it can continue to deliver a dark enjoyable story.

I began watching this with great expectations that were quickly surpassed by an incredible adaptation that combines great voice acting, suspense, top-notch animation and certain psychological thriller elements to tell its amazing story. This is surely one of the best in the season and for clarification, no real children were harmed or exploited in this anime. If you've made it to the end of this review and I've somehow failed to persuade you to watch this now, then I apologize. Watch it anyways. This is not to be missed.(Written after watching episode 4)

NO SPOILERS:This anime reminds me of the intellectual struggle between Light and L from Deathnote – a covert and ever present battle of logic, strategy, creativity, threat calculations and intelligence analysis between the threat(s) and our little baby geniuses. Furthermore this show has an amazing concept/story, is beautifully animated and carefully directed with some great characters.I find myself thinking about the plight of the baby geniuses in this show during the week while waiting for the next episode – exploring ideas for myself of how I would survive and what clues or logical conclusions could be made next.I highly recommend this show.

I have watched a lot of anime in my years, and I can confidently  say that I have not seen an anime quite like this one. Of course, if I was to compare it slightly to any one out there I would say that people who like Attack on Titan will probably be interested in this too. The anime is very pretty and the characters keep getting more and more interesting as we go along. I think what  I really like about it though, is that the plot has a fast pace that keeps the story moving very fluidly while still giving the audience a second to formulate their opinions and understand what's going on. Emma's view on life shows a refreshing innocence in a world that has become so warped and disturbing while the other two boys show a more tactile and logical perspective of the situation which is interesting to think about and compare against each other. Overall, I think the show does a nice job with revolving around an ideological problem that has no straight forward answer: In a life threatening situation, do you save yourself or risk dying trying to save everyone else?

The first episode clearly defines the characters for you, and gives you a glimpse into their world. A world which is relatively peaceful and happy, but something seems a little off. Near the end of the first episode, you learnSpoiler Alert! Click to show or hide the horrible truth about their world, at the same time as the characters. That they are cattle waiting to be slaughtered, and death is coming for them. This will be a dark tale of survival.The drawing is a little unique, but is well done. The animation quality is good as well. It's very well written and worth watching.

I went into this anime completely blind and was immediately knocked on my feet. Everything from the voice acting to the incredibly expressive art had me so drawn in. The story is beautiful and so sad that it just enchants you. The music is gorgeous and the atmosphere is unlike anything i’ve seen in recent years of watching anime. The Promised Neverland is worthy of the title masterpiece. It’s so emotional that I was overwhelmed. I really can’t describe the feeling of despair yet hope that this anime brings. Truly unique and beautiful in ever sense. 10/10

You are doing yourself an absolute disservice if you choose not to watch this. It has been a hell of a long time that a show has made me this anxious every second that it plays out.It throws you back and forth and never gives you the time to settle in and relax. I didn't know anything about the series however for the first time ever I have genuinely considered continuing the manga to find out what happens, and the best news of all is that the second season comes out next year!

Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThis show makes me smile as much as Sister Krone when she sees the kids. It also makes me destroy my toys like Sister Krone whenever an episode leaves me on cliffhangers. Amazing character development and world building. The show also has really nice animation. You can see that each character has their own kryptonite, which in my opinion every good character needs to be compelling. You see how each of these characters interact. Good show in my opinion.

This anime begins as a mystery, you are thrown into a world where you have no idea what is going on. The begging is upbeat and happy as, in my eyes showing you the perspective of a child it is innocent. However after about halfway through the first episode you realize that things might not be as you have percived them to be. You start to question why there are numbers on the childrens necks, why they aren't allowed past a certain gate, and why there is only one caretaker. Twords the end of the first episode you are thrown into this dark realization that they are just meat on a farm and that nothing that they once belived is true. Is a fabulous tale of cat and mouse, dark an light and everyting in between. This is truly a top tier anime in my eyes and I look forward to it each and every week.

Without spoilers, the original story of the Promised Neverland is an exceptional piece of writing. Filled with moments of absolute clarity, intensity and maturity, it is one piece of fiction that makes me personally proud to be a part of the anime community.The anime has already made fewer storytelling changes (ie. order of events, etc.) yet seems so faithful to the source material in its own special way. The animation is gorgeous as is the art itself. The voice acting is extraordinary as is the anime's pacing, writing and ost. Being someone who already knew what to expect I was still watching this first episode with butterflies in my chest and goosebumps throughout. That is proof that this story is strong, immersive and well directed. This already has the potential to be anime of the yearI personally am very picky when it comes to anime, yet this is a ride I am not getting off of. Be ready for a very FuN aNd HAppY TiMe :))))))

Having read the manga I came into this show it’s some pretty high expectations. And I have to say so far they have been met. The animation is fluid and the facial expressions really convey their emotions. In the beginning scene of the first episode I was really impressed with the amount of characters moving on the screen and how lively they looked.On the the direction so far I have to say that they are really doing a good job. The scenes that are supposed to be tense are tense, and the ones that are supposed to be light hearted are such. The Composition and camera angles are really done well too.So yea, so far the series is living up to the hype, well for me at least. I’m excited to continue this series.

OH HELL YEAH! The Promised Neverland has finally become an anime and oh BOY does it exceed expectations. This masterpiece is part of Shounen Jump's lineup and is about a tactics-based story with lots of lies and deceit... I recommend to jump right on in as it's enjoyed best the less you know about various plot twists and surprises!As for the anime itself, honestly so far I'm enjoying it more than the manga, which is something I never thought was even possible. The animation is top-notch quality with seamless use of 3d and 2d, very smooth and deliberate direction and loveable character designs. The music is gorgeous and in particular, memorable- the show does a wonderful job of integrating music with the tone of a particular scene.The characters are fantastic- the story primarily focuses on the main trio and how their relationships and character arcs develop throughout the story. This anime has done a fantastic job of delivering the plot so far without revealing mysteries or being too obvious with particular sequences. It's just brilliant. This is a hidden gem in the season of Winter 2019 and I highly recommend you check it out!

Never seen a anime show that's so nerve racking and on the edge of my seat each episode. Amazing up beat song for the opening and the lyrics for the song is perfect for this show.I felt like I was on a roller-coaster for my emotions, love the fact from episode 1 it just shows you what they have to face and watching them figuring out each problems as it occurs. Can't wait for season 2 if there ever is one on the way. Please ignore the 1 star review this should be a 5 star with a doubt.

I took my time to write a review, I don't do that kind of stuff, but as you must be aware by now The Promised Neverland was one of my exceptions. Down to the narrative, its amazing how much the viewer can be left in the dark of many things that have occurred chronologically even in the beginning, but still be able to maintain intrigue and suspense in the audience, evidently those behind this piece of work put much effort into the story and how its expressed.
