I do not want to hassle with evidence or any of the sort, but will acknowledge that it is intellectually engaging. The artwork, more vocatively in the anime, is as observed unique, but it is what probably has caused potential viewers to avoid, postpone or hesitate from watching it. This wasn't some choice to stand out against all the other manga/anime, but it is utilized as a versatile tool, helping to depict the initial (superficial I might add) innocence of the work, which would fool some viewers who would skim the details, and then when in comes to the grotesque elements it swoops down quickly and efficiently to show a more horrific perspective. A clarification, take a look at the faces of each character especially in the first episode, it is deceptively pure, loving and could be even be described as derpy (one of the reasons lending to discouraged viewership), but that quickly changes as the story progresses where the faces show more sinister aspects of the human emotion and motive. Now that's a beautiful use of art within print and animation, a vehicle of suspense and pathos. Now it may have seem I biasedly focused on the art, but in respect to the story, I would like to keep the plot with its twists and turns to the discretion of the reader, and this review to merely serve as encouragement to take time to watch The Promised Neverland.

As a lover of horror/creepy themed anything, I'm always on the hunt for a great piece of horror anime and am usually left disappointed with my findings. Monsters, gore, and other spooky elements aren't too hard to find in anime, but they dont necessarily invite fear into a work. The Promised Neverland brings that lacking element of fear into anime in a short span of 12 episodes. It welcomes viewers with a friendly and warm atmosphere, then quickly replaces it all with its dark elements as the characters have to survive in the very place they once considered home. Each episode is full of mystery and adrenaline pumping goodness making The Promised Neverland a must watch.

Okay I can not begin to describe how amazing this anime is. Even though the plot is somewhat dark it does not take it overboard like some times (Goblin Slayer). the characters are unique, actually have a personality, and don't say the same cliche phrases every anime has. This anime isn't predictable one bit. Just when you think you have it all figured out something happens to completely change the plot. I'd reccomend this to anyone who's used to seeing the same old anime plot with the same characters and plot.

This anime has been one of the best anime I have seen in a while. Rarely do I find anime to be a 5 star rating. The characters are so amazingly well done and I can't wait for season 2.Great development and some twists and turns added into it as well. It is pretty dark and creepy so be warned. The mc is strong and brave. She's not your "I want to help everyone but then gets in the way or just stands there" type of female protagonist. Which I appreciate.Not too gruesome and each episode had me wanting more. A chilling thriller where I didn't know what to expect next.

This show is one of the few that TRUELY deserves a five star rating if not more. Sure there are many classics and other good anime that should get 5 stars, but this anime is in a whole other league. in 12 episodes they managed to fit in the most drama, plot twists and amazing story telling I've ever seen. In the beginning I thought I could see right through the plot and guess what would happen but BOY WAS I WRONG. Every episode I was left guessing and by the end I was shocked. Fantastic anime, 5/5.

When I first watched the first episode, I was worried. It gave a lot of clunky exposition right off the bat to the point that it bothered me. But because of the shining reviews I kept watching. Quickly I got rapt up in the mind games, the tense atmosphere, the feeling of dread, and the determination of these kids. If you loved Death Note, a lot of the greatest qualities of that anime are to be found here. I truly haven't had an anime get to my emotions to this level in a LONG time, and I'm overjoyed, yet somewhat perplexed that the anime will be continuing in 2020, as I would love to see more but have no idea where the story will go from here!

If you aren't into psychological anime I would not recommend this series but if you are the dark twisted amazing story is definitely the way to go...At first I thought I wouldn't be into this show, Although it was listed as psychological. The cute look of the characters and the sweet looking story line fooled me in the beginning but with some of the cutest anime's come the darkest stories. I am very into anime that makes you think and invest a lot of my interest in anime that is categorized as psychological. The story not only makes you think because of the genius characters and the fact that they are always 10 steps ahead but also grow to love them. They show emotions towards each other and the situation which creates love able characters and a well thought out plot. I was fully invested from beginning till end and cant wait for another season because this show really deserves it.

The Promised Neverland is a perfect blend of horror, mystery, and action. These beautiful animations work together with the intense sound effects to create a beautiful byproduct that not many anime have done. The byproduct that I'm talking about is the anime's ability to make your butt clench at the scary parts and to similarly feel the relief when they overcome challenges.I think the beauty of this anime is the ability that make the watchers feel what the characters do.    Also their opening is easily the best ever.

This show was amazing. Awesome opening, animation, and tense moments. The only negative about this show imo is that the show could have done so much more with the demons/ outside world being dangerous aspect.  Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThe whole show is nothing but one big prep phase for an eventual escape, so I wish they could have escaped a lot earlier in the show so we could see more interesting stuff like the group going through hardships in the outside world, or encountering demons that capture them. Sadly, none of that is there.

Usually in anime, it takes me a good couple episodes to get invested. I have to watch maybe three or four episodes in order to feel the characters and truly get a grasp of the world they live in. But in The Promised Neverland, that slow pace of getting to know the characters and feeling iffy on the series, comes to a screaming crash at the end of episode one. Which made me audibly go "WHAT?" and click next episode without thinking. I binged the whole season last night. So here's my review, fresh in my mind.I will say some minor spoilers in this review, but anything major is hidden by a spoiler alert, so if you need a confirmed 'yes' or 'no' I stand firmly on the 'WATCH IT NOW' choice. So go on and binge! It's extremely worth while! Let's start with the cons, as I only have a single one: -Sister Krone's character design is unsettling and stereotypical. I'm not going to go on a long speech about it. All I'm saying is that it's blatantly stereotypical. Is it intentional? Probably not, but if you care about that kind of thing- then be warned. It made me a bit uneasy about the character, and I wasn't really okay with how she was portrayed, but that's my ONLY gripe about the show. Now for the positives: -Animation quality is amazing!  Both in regular 2D style and 3D CGI. Yes, I said CGI. I don't quite know if it's exactly that, but the usage of 3D animation blending in this show is perfect for a thriller/horror anime. It looks GOOD. Not cringe worthy or joke worthy. It's genuinely good animation with good use of 3D art, and you're sure to love it. Even the detail within the faces are amazing and can tell you a lot- without revealing a lot.-The story is unique and captures attention at every turn.  I went into this anime playing checkers, only to be confused when I finally realized I was supposed to be playing 4D chess while riding a roller coaster. The plot twists are plentiful, but not needless. Every twist can be traced back to an earlier point in the show. Making you go "WAIT THAT'S WHAT THAT MEANT?" or even details in the scene can hint at future events. It's a show that is smart about it's plot twists- not adding them in just because they need a shocker. This alone makes me constantly think about what's coming next, and makes me fully invested in what I'm watching. -The protagonists are likable and smart.   The whole show is a cat and mouse metaphor at least in this season. Can the mice outsmart the cat? Or will the sneaky cat with patience persevere? Both the protagonists and antagonists in this show are insanely clever and smart. Making it all the more interesting. Someone has a solution for one problem, only to be thwarted by the other character- but WAIT, they thought about that! So there's an alternative! But no, that won't work.. then how about this! The show constantly makes you think about solutions to problems, how the characters can make it out of this situation, and ultimately make you wonder- how can they truly escape? With their intense refusal to give up, you'll want to root for these characters- but also want figure out how they came up with such clever and smart ideas. -The tension and anxiety feeling is spot on.  My review is getting ultra long, so I'll make this and my last point quick. This show is a thriller. It's suspenseful. And it's anxiety inducing. It works well because of all the previous points I mentioned, and it's one of the absolute best anime in this area that I've seen to date. If you like the intense, anxiety inducing, uncertain feeling- then this is your show. -Finally, it's dark and twisted.  The show reveals to you early on that the world they live in is dark and twisted. This is the spoiler alert, so skip down if you don't want it-Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hide they find out that all the kids before them were sent out. To be eaten. By massive demon like creatures. And the first episode shows a six year old girl dead in a truck. Yeah, wow. The deaths, facial animations, dark colors, and intense story make this show dark and twisted. And the nice reality that you thought was there in episode one quickly vanishes when you realize that it's not what it seems. Can these three protagonists (and supporting cast) make it out alive? Or will they meet their end in a world filled with darkness? Watch the show to find out. This is by far one of my favorite shows in recent years, so I highly recommend it. We're guaranteed a season 2, but the ending of season 1 was still satisfying. This review was long, but if you read it all, thanks! I hope you take a chance and watch the show, because I loved every episode. I held off watching it, but I don't recommend you hold off on it. It's worth it.

The Promised Neverland is an extremely great adaptation of a horror mixed with some mystery anime. It holds many inconspicuous secrets, and they hold the horrors of the film. The tightening tension in The Promised Neverland is executed so well that I really couldn't stop watching. The thrilling feeling that someone is right behind you was almost constant for me whenever Emma, Norman and Ray were sneaking around, unravelling their life mysteries, Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideand how to escape their almost inevitable deaths due to the harvest.Throughout The Promised Neverland, the author of the story intentionally leaves out many details and aspects of various scenes, building up a big twist later in the series.It was done so well, that I found myself being surprised almost every episode, and needed to know what was going to happen next. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideA very prime example is during the 2 month period when Norman is shipped off to the demons. It seems that Emma and Ray had given up, but all of that was debunked in the closing episodes of season 1, as one huge final twist occurs and changes the plot dramatically. In The Promised Neverland, it seems that Ray had set himself on fire, and the episode continued to convince us that Ray was in fact on fire as Mum checked to see her tracking device to see if Ray was in the fire. He was. After many events, the Mother soon realises that the escape was being executed that very instant, and then was cognizant of how she was tricked to believe that Ray was in the fire when in all actuality, he wasn't. Even though that is a huge twist in itself, the author couldn't help themselves but include a very deliberate twist in the closing scenes of the series. We found out that Ray was actually the daughter of "Mum" and this was very vaguely hinted during one scene in a few previous episodes. Ray tells Emma and Norman that he knew about the harvest due to him not having infantile amnesia and hearing a sinister lullaby while only being a fetus. Just before when the reveal of Ray being mothers son, he hums a melody that brings memories back to Mother of her own childhood who heard the very same melody from a friend that she had lost to the harvest as well. This was enough evidence for me to realise that Ray was, in fact, Mother's son before ray said: Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hide"Mum, why did you give birth to me?"The Promised Neverland definitely has its promises for the upcoming seasons, and I can't wait till the next season. The excellent execution of plot twists, tightening tension, dynamic dialogue really brought this series together, making it my favourite anime I have seen to date, and on edge for 2020 when the next season comes out.All in all, The Promised Neverland holds many fantastic aspects that makes itself unique, and the outstanding storyline just adds that special sauce to it all, giving me a ride of a lifetime. I highly recommend The Promised Neverland to anyone, even if you are not a big fan of horror as I wasn't as well.

Truly an amazing concept, of which I personally have never seen before. It is only a few episodes yet I am completely invested in the characters since the first episode. Grab your tissues, blanket and relax, because you'll be in for an emotional ride. It is truly a masterpiece from the artwork, character development, the thematic music, to the innovative story line. I highly recommend anyone to watch this series. Cannot wait till season 2! Artwork: 10/10Characters: 10/10Music: 10/10Storyline: 10/10

I've never watched an anime that was so mesmerizing. The combination of deceiving character design and a plot that will make you SCREAM AND CRY is amazing. Even though I read the manga beforehand, I was still itching to see the next episode. I love this show so much.Now, onto the REAL charm of the show.Phil. For those of you who don't know, Phil is an adorable tiny kid who is too precious for this world. He was a permanent uwu face and literally is the most pure thing ever. He's really cute.If you read all of that, thanks.

I am always reluctant to talk about young animes in the greatest of all time debate because...well, they are young, and it would be a disservice to other animes that have maintained excellence for much more episodes...but I will make an exception for this one.In a year filled to the brim with action-oriented shonen anime, I was overjoyed to see an anime that did not rely on that to be effective and unique, but instead focusing on what I feel should really matter in any good media of storytelling: An outstanding story with impeccable and fleshed out characters.What makes the Promised Neverland stand out is not just the story, but man is the story impeccable. I always love animes that build up to a lasting crescendo, and TPN left me emotionally drenched by the time episode 12 of season 1 ended. The story is perfectly paced, with a draw-dropping first episode that introduces all the characters and gives you a clear definite plot. But as the storyline goes, you will realise it is anything but clear cut. The middle act is strong as well and characters like Sister Krone keep that part well fun and enjoyable. What truly makes this anime an all-time great in terms of seasonal shows or arcs is definitely the final four episodes. Everything...I mean everything you are looking for in a plot-driven show, you will find in these last episodes.The characters are also wonderfully nuanced. From the naive yet deceptively smart Emma, to the genius good soul, Norman, and of course my personal favourite, the extreme realist, Ray. The three main characters are outstanding and easy to relate with on any level. Every decision made makes sense withing the framework of the story and the world they are in. Even the supporting characters that you might not like at the beginning come through in remarkable fashion by the time the credits roll. You could not hate any character in this show, and that is a testament to the ridiculously impeccable work put in to make them vibrant both in orientation and development.I also would like to give a worthy mention to the PERFECT direction and camera work for a thriller seiken like this one. The team at Clover Works must be fans of the manga because never have I seen so much work put into camera movements and cinematography before. This is necessary for a horror anime like The Promised Neverland. And how could I forget Isabella's lullaby? Both the addictive OP song and the actual soundtrack for the anime are to die for, but it is the Promised Neverland's soundtrack that truly tugs at the heartstrings. The fact that they were able to weave it into the actual storyline and make our villain more relatable made it even more touching.I could go on and on, but I will conclude by saying The Promised Neverland also has my second best villain of ALL TIME, and is, to me, The Promised Neverland Season 1 is the best singular season ever made, usurping the first season of Tokyo Ghoul. Bravo, Clover Works...bravo.

I waited until the whole season finished to write this review. The show had me hooked from the very beginning. Every episode was captivating and well planned. In short, this season was spectacular. With beginning, middle and end well defined and very well developed, the desire to continue watching is very great and the expectation is up there for the next season. The music is a bop, and UVERworld did an amazinggg job

My mind just keeps getting continuously blown by how good this show is. Seriously. I don't even know where to begin. The animation and direction of this show is so interesting, the characters are all so incredibly fleshed out and believable. The writing is phenomenal. I love a show that can make you feel like you've got everything figured out and then it turns that thought on its head in the next scene!

This is a great anime series, it's one where every week I anxiously wait for the next episode to air. It's unlike most animes (at least most that I'm used to) which revolve around fighting; this one is more about secrets being learned, the inability to (effectively) fight, and the scramble to survive.One thing that this show has that every (good) show has is the cliffhangers where at the conclusion of each episode there is either a significant hope/plan for the protagonists or a significant setback.

This series is absolutely incredible it has a great storyline and don't even get me started in the animation. From the first episode you can see humane feelings as if it were real people and it goes straight to the point which is really great compared to other shone series which have filler episodes and don't get straight to the point. But this show goes straight to the point making the viewer hooked from the beginning and also it has huge twists which will leave you almost dumbfounded while you're watching. Because of this twists you are expecting something to come at every moment but when this twists happen it will leave you mesmerized in every way; animation, action, story and the premise. It is so good that i can refer things as the characters intelligence to Death Note, The animation to One Punch Man, the premise of this show to Erased and the heart warming characters to Ha Ji Me No Ippo. It really brings a smile to my face to see such a good anime like this changing the way we see shounen in and by itself.

Something absolutely incredible. I have never seen anything this masterfully executed in all my life. Such tension and drama are something only ever seen in movies, but this pulls it off to another level.Hopelessness, fear, terror, revenge, corrupted minds... an experience, more than anything else, this show is sure to blow minds with its incredibly dark atmosphere and constant, never-ending barrage of plot twists.Seriously, all of the people behind this, including the original writer, are masterminds of their craft. They just have this... endless bag of tricks to pull from - and each twist is better than the last.Nothing you know is true. Everything can change in an instant. This harsh reality never ceases to amaze.Due to this, however, the show is built on surprises. Just, be careful. And watch out for certain reviews...

After watching the first three episodes, I already plan on picking up the manga to find out what happens next! I am so hooked on the story and love how original and unique it is. The character design is amazing and I can already tell that there will be amazing character development from all sides in future episodes. The animation is beautiful and the music is great. So interested in seeing the demons more closely and finding out more about this dystopian world. Cannot wait for more!

This anime was absolutely phenomenal, from start to finish. And now I hear season 2 is coming in 2020, which is absolutely fantastic. The storyline actually develops more and more with each episode compared to a new story each one. The characters have dynamic personalities and aren't over the top in the slightest. It kept you on the seat of your chair with each episode. More and more despair but then BOOM it's right back in your face with something groundbreaking. This is truly my favorite anime right behind darling in the franxx.

To start you off, the visuals are so beautiful within it, and I suspect there will be even more breathtaking moments. The scenery and the style is refreshing, and pleasing to look at. However, there may be points for some people, that it will be the exact opposite.For the characters, I already feel drawn towards them. I'm loving their designs and personalities, how they act with others and how the represent themselves. I've only seen the first episode, and there will of course be more to them that I have yet to see, but I automatically loved them since the first few minutes.The story line is very interesting. Of course, there are some obvious red flags that like to appear, but it's still very inciting to see what exactly may happen. It's very cute and bubbly, and then an unexpected twist that suddenly changes the whole atmosphere within this one episode.I feel like they did an amazing job pulling in viewers, since I honestly can't wait for the next episode. I can see this show becoming big within the year of anime. However, I do know there will be a lot of competition from all of the other anime that have been released of this year. Yet, I still believe this will be the top for most people.I have very high expectations.

I have read the manga and upon hearing of this release I became the very hype. After watching this episode (since I actually watched it instead of complaining or complaining about those who are complaining), the adapting of the demon scene was very well done and had given me chills. The talent of the voice actors is great, the part where Emma was hyperventilating gave extra effect to the scene and the reality of the situation. Hoping to see more of this series.

Wow. Just wow. That's seriously all I can say about this phenomenal series. Time and time again have I gone and rewatched this show, always a complete mess afterwards. The twits and turns and methodical advances these witty characters make just lures you into the series each and every episode begging for more. The mind games Isabella and the main trio pull off is so boggling to decipher but yet always somehow leaves the viewer satisfied whether in a melancholy gloomy state of mind or not. It's fantastic!! Each character having discernible personalities all ranging from contemplative and quiet to blissful and full of life to pure evil and immorality. Seeing the innocence of Emma and Norman being ripped away at such an early stage in the show really sets the mood and tone as what's to come. It's dark, it's alluring, and it's an absolute masterpiece. Thank you so much Kaiu Shirai and Posuka Demizu for this stupendous form of entertainment. Job majorly well done

The Promised Neverland is dark, and hopeful, and driven. It is excellently developed and put into action. The world and the characters are unveiled and built upon brilliantly.  Every time this show answers one of your questions, it gives you handfuls of questions more. You will be surprised time and time again— and you will love it. I ended up canceling all my Saturday plans and binged the show in one day. 100% worth it. I cannot recommend The Promised Neverland enough, to any and all.

This series is dystopian, it's dark, intense, crazy and wildly unique. It doesn't follow any other anime as far as plot goes. It's its own thing.  The 3 main characters Norman, Ray, and Emma mostly live carefree lives in an orphanage with only one set rule: don't get near the fence or the gate at the end of the property. Mom says so. Mom is their ever-loving caretaker. One fateful night when one of the next children are up to be adopted, that child leaves the house without her cherished doll. Norman and Emma rush to the gate to deliver the doll to the girl before she leaves... only to be faced with a truth too horrifying to be put into words. When they discover the horrible reality they're living in, they decide to do everything they possibly can to escape the House and Mom, with all the children they can possibly take with them. 10/10. I haven't been so mindblown or felt so stressed in awhile when watching something. It's actually been an age since I've last seen an anime even. So I binge-watched this and wow was it an experience.

After having just finished the final episode, I can say from my own personal opinion and perspective that this anime adaptation is Genius. I will give no spoilers but know this show faces serious ethical issues in a way that is equally eloquent, harsh and inspiring. I would recommend at least watching the first 3 episodes and let me/us know what you think, this show has inspired me to become a humanitarian locally to do what I can do as a seemingly powerless human being in world of beautiful yet suffering souls. Excellent anime, 10 stars from me.

The Promside Neverland, in my opinion, would have to be one of the best animes 2019 has seen. Anime and shows today, in general, are swarmed with overused plots and stories that make you forget what true imagination can create, and this show will help you remember!This Anime embodies all the key points you want out of an amazing show, it has well-done characters, a unique and interesting plot, thrill, danger, and above all risk! Truly a show that kept me and I'm sure everyone else at the edge of their seat for every episode. The show takes twists and turns just when you thought you had everything figured out, leaving you wondering at the end of each episode "What the heck is going to happen next?" as you race to hit the button to start the next episode.The Promised Neverland has rightfully earned its place as one of my favorite animes thus far, and I am anxiously awaiting the arrival of season two!

It's decent enough and I recently saw it in comparison to some other anime I really liked so I gave it a try due to the short length. Watched it over the course of two days and found out that I wasn't really too much of a fan. I feel the premise isn't truly explored well enough and it isn't until the 12th episode that I truly felt the world building I wanted come into play and that was only in a marginal sense. I also didn't personally jive well with the art style but I can't take off points for that. Objectively, I do feel that the animation was not quite enabling the story all that well. In anime like Mob Psycho or Attack on Titan you can definitely see the animation choices adding to the storytelling but here it fell a little flat for me.I felt I could see nearly every twist coming and almost nothing surprised me, but it didn't draw from the story all too much. It just wasn't as engaging. I contemplated quitting the anime a few episodes in but the length for right now is just too short to quit on. Overall the story is fairly predictable but all around a cool premise and worth the 12 episodes of watching if you want something a little creepy. The show maintains a balance between light and heavy. The opening also SLAPS so that kept me in for the long haul.

I really didn't read any synopsis or preview of this anime before watching and I was simply looking for a sorta cutesy anime to watch in between other series, but after the first episode I was taken aback and forced to rethink what it meant for a series to be truly great. Even though it wasn't one of my favorite genres, the writing and execution was so perfect that I couldn't not watch the next episode. Even when watching filled me with pain and anguish, feeling that I couldn't help the characters, I knew I was hooked without ever realizing it. It such a masterpiece; I didn't want to love it but I had no choice. The progression of the story, the plot-twists (the oh-so-many plot twists), and even just the character depth, all of these things added-up to what in totality is a true masterpiece of an anime. I'm not shy about praising the series because it went in odd directions that I never expected and explored different avenues that I didn't think possible; overall I could never more wholeheartedly recommend a series to someone else than this one. I truly didn't want to love it; I just wanted a simple, cute series to pass the time, but I stumbled upon a gem that wouldn't let me look away. Please do yourself a favor and watch this anime!

This show deserves a five-star rating. It's emotional, dark, and one of a kind. It makes me wonder about the future, about the possibilities of waking up one day and realize we are all but a livestock to the otherworldly creatures. I just couldn't imagine myself in that situation, so I personally admire the toughness and determination of the characters in this anime despite the fact that they are 20 years younger than me. I'd probably just cower and wait for my death if that was me. I can't wait for the second season, if there is any. This anime is highly recommended to anyone who wants to watch something different other than cookie-cutter, predictable shows out there.Good job, noitamA!

Sublime.That's how I would describe this piece of art. I mainly watch animes that have a hardcore focus on story, and this is one of the best so far. If you've since Erased, this will not disappoint. Immediately, you're thrown into a dark dystopian world living a "dream" until you wake up to the harsh reality. Upon realization, you know that you need to do something or those that you care about will die. You study, work hard, and arm yourselves with the tools that you believe that will help you escape. Allies come and go. After each wall, a higher one exists. The light you saw down the dark hall glimmers a few feet always out of reach. Persist, and perhaps, you may find yourself in a Promised Neverland....The twists will keep you guessing. A cat and house game with Holmes and Moriarty is tame compared to this. Be prepared to be thrilled....

It's hard to express how well-made this show was without spoilers, but suffice it to say that it's very well-crafted. It hints at truths and then lets them simmer long enough for you to forget, or doubt, even if you noticed the clue, so that  even reveals you saw coming catch you off-guard. And there were plenty of twists that blindsided me entirely.By turns uplifting and horrifying, comedic and tragic, with an undercurrent of cosmic horror and a constant thread of interwoven mysteries - some of which it wisely chooses never to resolve - this is one of those rare shows that will pull you in and not let you go even long after you're done watching.And the scene with the long hair will hit you like a ton of bricks, especially if you've ever had kids of your own. You'll know it when it comes.

As soon as the OP music starts I have the biggest grin on my face. It was one of those animes I debated watching until there was around 5 episodes out then just went for it out of boredom and I cannot stress enough how glad I was that I did.I've never been one for sports anime, shamelessly to say it was the animu hasbando effect that drew me in the most, but I can easily say 43 episodes later that this is one of the best animes I've ever had the pleasure of watching and I'm so glad it exists.The combination of visually interesting characters, smooth animation and totally intense, compelling basketball is really what makes KnB so fantastic. I'm always left shocked with each 'power' unveiling. Even more shocked when the 20 minutes fly by in what feels like 20 seconds. It could be understandable to say that there are slight slow 'filler' periods, particularly throughout the first season, however I can't say that there's a single episode I haven't enjoyed.Anyone debating it or even skipping across it. STOP AND JUST WATCH IT.

I know what you're thinking.  Sports anime?  LAME!  It has to be boring and played out so over dramatically and did I mention LAME?!  But ALAS!  EUREKA! VOILA!  Here's your prayers of an actually captivating sports anime answered!   Go on a journey with Kuroko, the white mage of this anime!  Supporting his team with misdirection and lack of presence! LIKE A NINJA, but in basketball! Plus you get "hot" anime guys and a strong female character.  You even might learn a thing or two about basketball ;)Awesome anime, will rewatch.

I stayed up until 6AM watching every episode (1 to 13)! I even made this crunchyroll account just to write this review! Not only is the anime drawn well (and if you guys didn't notice, the basketball nets are animated not drawn), and you can't help but get pumped and cheer while watching the games, but the themes it uses are simple yet brilliant! I'm not even recommending you to watch it, I'm hyperbolically threatening you to watch it! You will be more than pleased!

You don't have to be a sports fan to enjoy this anime. I'm not into basketball. At. All. And sports/sports anime aren't my "thing." But I saw the reviews were really good, and I thought, "Eh, I'll give it a chance." I am so happy I gave it a chance after all.This is the only anime I can think of now (besides when I was like twelve or so), where I "fist pumped in the air with literal adrenaline rush" when a character I liked was victorious.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideAomine is insanely good! :D I'm now several episodes into Season 2. If you decide to watch this anime, get past the very first episode. I wasn't addicted by the first episode, but afterwards I found myself unable to stop watching. I don't know how it will be for other people, but I can say for myself, usually a non-sports-anime-fan, that I'm really enjoying it.

It took me that extra bit of willpower to start this anime, but once I clicked play on that first episode, I could not stop. Within a few episodes, I could feel the adrenaline pumping and my heart rate rising. Simply waiting for the next episode to wait was so unbearable, that I decided to camp out on my sofa and marathon all of season 1, just in time for season 2. It was this anime that truly had the power to push me through my studies because it was not your typical "Good wins every time." Seeing Seirin and its members fight through all the struggles and still lose matches really connected with me, because there are countless times I studied with my all for a test, then received a result that was terrible. I sound really silly, but thinking back to certain quotes, like Kagami's "There's no such thing as useless effort!" and Kiyoshi's "If you wanna climb a mountain, you obviously aim for the top. But you gotta enjoy the scenery too" really pushed me on.I was so stoked about this anime that I got a few friends equally excited! Twelfth grade ended a month ago, and I got a really satisfying result. One of the reasons is this anime. I truly recommend it for a roller-coaster ride of motivation and inspiration!Can't wait for season 3!

I was a bit skeptical at first, seeing as how the only anime I've watched and actually enjoyed being Free (swimming anime). But I wanted to try another sport out, and I didn't exactly hate basketball, I was neutral, but honestly after watching this show I have to admit it has become one of my favorite sports anime ever. The characters are absolutely entertaining and well done, the comedy is also a nice touch, the plot is also engaging, I can't find ONE thing I dislike about this anime. Not to mention the fundamentals are not so hard to grasp after a while of watching.I'm definitely glad I finally decided to give this anime a chance, it has definitely made me stay up late on countless nights (XD) but I don't regret a single minute of it! Can't wait for more eps, ahhhhhhhhhhhh, I'm so obsessed :')

Kuroko's Basketball is a truly unique sports Anime, that I would recommend to anyone who loves a well animated, well portrayed, well paced and overall well done Anime. (Most of its attributes have been stated in other reviews so what I aim to do is a deeper analysis on the main pros and cons people found) The CON  - UNREALISTIC GAME PLAYWith all that said some individual find or will find the game play is some what unrealistic for them and this is true to a certain extent but not entirely, How....to a person who has not played basketball in a somewhat professional manner or recognized team, it will appear unrealistic, but to those who have it is very close to reality, and this is where I bring the whole point of portrayal (or view), because professional or semi-professional Basketball players will understand that during the game when you are in the court, game-play such as dribbling seems very fast paced to you and things such as special moves appearing in slow motion, power moves and inner self dialog and analysis are going through your head and your brain views them in an extreme manner close as to what is portrayed in the Anime, but to the average onlooker outside with the untrained eye who is not under competitive pressure the game does not seem that out of the ordinary, and to them 'Kuroko's Basketball' will appear to have unrealistic game-play. Hence portrayal again comes into play, because the Anime (especially the Game play) is done through-out the eyes of a player in the field the actions appear superhuman or unrealistic to the viewers. So it all comes down to perception, the only real false attributes that are unrealistic is the Aura around the players at times and the excess sweat that seems to fly around of players like they carry around personal sprinklers but... HEY that's anime.Over all summary - The PRO'SThe anime has great character development, and has the rare story telling ability of not always having the Main character's team as the victor in each game (including the important ones), Not simply centering on one main character through each episode, which is portrayed by some episodes following characters outside of the main characters team and having a significant number of episodes where the main characters are simply spectator in the crowd and while the attention is focused on other teams playing, this aspect of the Anime helps to give a sense of realism and practicality that helps in making the Anime more appealing and close to heart as the realistic downfall, failures and success of characters makes the viewer appreciate it more. The humor is timed perfectly and is kept in check and does not appear too forceful like some anime tend to do. The anime is also not filled with too much perverted fan-service which leave it unblemished of its seriousness. Kuroko's Basket ball is truly an Anime worth watching that keeps it real to high extent but not to the max to the point of making it overly serious because...Hey...It is still Anime after all.I give it a 4.5 out of 5 Stars - or 9 out of ten points

This show.  This. Show.  Sport animes in general are so much fun because they are realistic, yet fantastic.  And by fantastic I mean that they flutter along the edge of fantasy, gleefully crossing the line into ridiculous more and more (and further and further).  This show does a fantastic job at one-upping itself just when you think you couldn't laugh any harder or getting any closer to the edge of your seat.  If a show about an athlete whose talent is essentially being ridiculously unnoticeable doesn't catch your attention, there's something wrong.  I watched this entire show in less than 3 days because I just couldn't stop.  I cannot wait for the next season!

For someone who has watched Captain Tsubasa (both versions), Slam Dunk!, Eyeshield 21, and many other great sport series, and NOT being a basketball fan at all myself, I have to say this is the best sports series I have seen. Soundtrack, characters, directing, opening and ending sequences, the animation (Production I.G). I could write for hours, but this is a series that you have to see, but most importantly, you must feel. Prepare for quite the adrenaline rush. The wait for Season 2 will be really painful. Masterful in almost every way. Masterpiece.  96/100.

This review is for both Season's of Kuroko honestly, what can I say? It's a Basketball Anime except way more exciting, since Basketball is one of my favorite Sport's I always get heavily into it, Each Generation of Miracle member has something unique about their play style in the games, and Midorima is my favorite for making his 3 shots from anywhere.. Quite frankly if you have seen Slam Dunk or just love Basketball in general you will enjoy this series. Even though there's special skills and such that can't be used in a real life Basketball game this Anime is very realistic and true to what real Basketball represents. Recommended to any sports fan and especially any Basketball Fan.

First off, take a look at the sidebar on the right, and check out how many 5 star reviews there are for this series.  Those are there for a reason, and I'll tell you why.Kuroko's Baskeball does a great job of being entertaining for people who don't necessarily enjoy sports.  This is the true sign of brilliant writing and pacing; it will become apparent as you check out the first few episodes.  All the signs of a great shonen are here - a group of dedicated and powerful individuals, lots of challenges to overcome, and light humor to break up the pace every now and then.The thing that sets this series apart for me is the main character, Kuroko himself.  It's quite rare for a shonen to designate such an enigmatic and mysterious individual as the carrier for the series, and the differences found here really start to come out in his personality.  He's a total quiet genius, without the physical aptitude to succeed in what he loves (don't we all want to be?)... and quite honestly, the wacky ways they introduce him influencing basketball despite not being built for it are fun as heck to get behind and enjoy.Long story short, give this series a couple episodes if you're interested in treading new ground.  Sports anime is always a hard sell to non-fans of the sport involved, but this one transcends easily.  And you'll love it even more if you're a basketball fan - they do include a bit of tech talk there along the way!

I use to love watching basketball in the 90's a lot. I was a Bulls fan then, and from Chicago as well. This anime brought back those feelings. You will actually jump for joy seeing the team win, and be waiting to see them play again the next season when they loose. To do a sport anime, and still make a viewer jump up and excited as I was. Is very difficult to pull off. And this one did it. It was able to get me off my seat. All I needed was a beer, and some chips, and watch Kuroko play his game. The anime director did a fantastic job of blending sports in a anime. A must see for all sports fans!

This anime is purely a great title for a sports anime. Even if you don't like basketball, or you don't know anything about it, its worth it to at least give it a shot. It can be argued that although the story doesn't shine the brightest, the characters certainly make up for that. It takes you into the eyes of a 6th man (which is the man who comes of the bench first and in reality aren't as nearly as hyped up as the starting 5) who used to play for a team full of powerhouse players. And because they are so good, they haven't become good team players. So Kuroko (the 6th man) wants to prove to his former teammates that Basketball is a teams sport. Although it is a sports anime, it is full of funny moments and some sad ones.In response to a 3 star review I read saying how "predictable" the outcome of each game the teams in the anime played was, have you not payed attention at all? The story here is how 2 players develop their skills to try and beat the top players in the nation. It's stupid for someone to say, the games were obvious to predict because in any sport, if you put a developing team vs a nationally strong one, anyone would predict the stronger one would win. So are your predictions for each game going to be right most of the time? Yeah they will especially when you see the flow during the game.For example, if I put the Miami Heat vs Charlotte Bobcats it is fair to assume the Heat would win. This is EXACTLY what is going on in this anime. A super power team full of basketball stars going against a team of hard workers.

For someone who is not sports oriented in the least bit, I am utterly hooked on this anime!  I first stumbled across this series last year.  I was bored out of my mind and decided, "Hey, why not give this one a shot."  So, I clicked on the link, not expecting much.  Man, was I in for a very pleasant surprise!  This series has everything I could wish for in a great anime!  I find myself on the edge of my seat with every episode.  The character development is great to watch and now that the new season has started I know I can expect to see great things!One episode and you will be positively hooked!...even if you're totally ignorant when it comes to sports...like me. :-)

I really have to say that I was never a fan of sport animes until I came upon Kuroko's Basketball.Each episode starts off with an introduction of the "Generation of Miracles", five middle school players from Teiko, who have extraordinary abilities in basketball that only come along every ten years. The first episode then goes on to introduce the two protagonists Kuroko Tetsuya and Kagami Taiga. Right off the bat, these two protagonists are formed by this concept of yin and yang, where Kuroko is more of the "silent" and "passive" type, while Kagami is more boisterous. However, both come together with the same goal in mind: to defeat the Generation of Miracles.Thus, the plot begins to unfold as Kuroko, Kagami and the Seirin basketball team undergo the hardships of basketball in hopes of becoming the "#1 Team in Japan". Personally, the storyline is alright considering it follows a simple "reaching our shared goal" scenario, but it makes up with the character development. Also, don't expect for each game to be completely "realistic". For example, Kuroko is superb at passing, but cannot even do a lay-up, certain characters are able to shoot 3-pointers flawlessly, etc. Keep in mind that even though the character's abilities may not be too realistic, it does not take away from the building tension that each basketball game creates.The characters in Kuroko's Basketball each have their own defining characteristics. Kuroko is shown as a physically weak (for basketball) guy who doesn't seem to have any basic fundamentals for basketball. However, when he reveals his passing skills it becomes obvious that there is more to him than meets the eye. Kagami is introduced as a tall, masculine guy who just transferred from America and becomes the team's ace player in a heartbeat. Throughout each episode, Kuroko's past slowly unwinds, which becomes the backdrop of the story. Believe me when I say the character development in this anime is done very well, and it is what makes the plot even livelier.The score is quite nice, seeing as how I.G. Productions is behind the scenes. The music's tone changes just at the right time and place, which adds to the emotional scenes and the tension of each basketball game. The animation is also done very well, so there aren't many complaints to be shared here.Overall, this anime is a nice choice for the Spring line-up of animes. Its quite rare, to say the least, to be introduced to a sport anime done as well as Kuroko's Basketball. There is no doubt that Kuroko's Basketball will be compared to Slam Dunk, which is a classic in the sport anime category. However, let me say that Kuroko's Basketball can easily stand on its own. At first, I was not very interested in sports anime, simply because I'm not an avid sports fan, but Kuroko's Basketball is much more than basketball. Kuroko's Basketball presents the concept of teamwork, overcoming obstacles that life may present (in this case basketball), and true passion. Give it a try, it won't hurt you.

i love this anime so much. the balance of the intensity in the games but having its silly moments at the same time is what i love about kuroko's basketball. the plot of the show is amazing, plays out every character very well, and the development of each character is amazing. every episode either had me at the edge of my seat, putting a smile on my face, or making me feel warm inside because of how wholesome it is. at first i thought this was just some other sports anime, but it now has become one of my favorite, if not, my favorite anime ever. i tried recommending this anime to my other friends and them responding with, "i might not like it, i'm not a sports person." just made me aggravated, i'm not a sports person either, but i still love the show. you don't have to be a sports person to love a sports anime. to sum up, if you haven't watched this anime yet, do it now. it's an amazing anime. it has numerous amounts of people rating this show with 5 stars for a reason. so go watch it ;)Rating: 10/10 - would watch again and again and again...

I found this anime after dragging myself through Eyeshield 21 (which got me hooked on NFL but it was wayyy too long)I'm 4 years behind on the hype, but, this*clap* anime *clap*.Every single episode is extremely enjoyable and the whole anime is so action packed that my love for basketball was reignited after 4 long years.To whoever is reading this right now. YOU HAVE TO WATCH IT OML ISSOGOOD!Refreshingly action-packed with every episode leaving you with an irresistible urge to click the next episode.

Kuroko no Basuke blends the line between traditional sports anime and a shounen battle anime, meanwhile sprinkling a decent side helping of characterization in that ensures even if you aren't a fan of basketball you'll still probably find yourself enjoying it. It straddles the line perfectly between legitimate sports and superpowered fantasy sports so you aren't left bored, but at the same time aren't so disconnected with reality that it stops being representative of the sport at all (looking at you Prince of Tennis). It's full of bromance, friendship power, and is guilty of the common sports anime trope of turning every single play into a mindgame of the century. But if you can get over that there's a super solid anime waiting for you both from a story and action perspective.I'm particularly fond of the antagonists they set up. Each of them is a superpowered monster that couldn't exist in the real world but more importantly they're each given very solid personalities. And it doesn't feel like "I'm egotistical just to be egotistical", each of them is given a solid backstory to cement why they've become what they are. And in a way makes them just as much a sympathetic main character as our leads, rather than where most sports manga just turn them into reprehensible monsters to be defeated. You'll actually grow to like many of them just as much as our heroes.Beyond the story the animation and music are all top notch. In particular after the success of the first season the second saw a drastic increase in animation quality and some scenes are a genuine marvel to behold. The whole thing has a truly addictive quality and more than once you'll get to the end of an episode only to find yourself saying, "Just one more"...and the next thing you know it's 6AM.In short there's something here for everyone and if you can get over some traditional sports anime tropes (superpowered antagonists, toooonsss of bromance, etc) you'll find this is one of the best examples of the genre.

This is definitely one of my favorite animes/mangas of all time. Though some of the moves are ridiculous and some parts seem impossible to apply to real life basketball, I still love it, which is rare for me. I usually don't like sport animes, and I don't often enjoy watching action animes (obviously this doesn't mean I don't like any). But, it has a combination of comedic moments and serious moments and they're played at the right time. I can't wait for the updates! I just read the manga because I couldn't wait to see what happened next and it got me even more excited to see the action in an animation! This show absolutely deserves 5 stars from me (:

-SOME MILD SPOILERS-A disclaimer: I don't give away four and five star ratings. This is a 3.5 star show, but they don't give half stars. So if you're on the fence, and you love basketball like I do, you'll find this show very quaint for a lot of reasons. It's actually a fairly neat cultural artifact, because it illustrates how basketball is simply not a dominant element of Japanese sports culture, much less mainstream culture. American viewers in particular will find this show uneven (as will any viewer who comes from a country that is basketball crazy - Filipinos, Argentines, Brazilians, Spaniards, etc.). The show portrays certain players as having supernatural powers while playing basketball. This is actually pretty cool, and the viewer will have fun watching a team try to figure out how to stop a guy who can hit 3 pointers from the other side of the court.But the people who wrote the series clearly knew very little about basketball. Weird statements about basic basketball concepts and statistics abound throughout the show, so if you're watching this and you don't know much about basketball, you won't learn anything from this show. In fact, you'll pretty much have the wrong idea.For example, there are statements like "the average player makes fifty percent of their shots." Anyone who plays basketball knows that a fifty percent field goal shooter is basically either a center taking nothing but shots next to the basket, or an absolute cold-blooded killer from outside like Ray Allen, Dirk Nowitzki, or Michael Jordan (the last one absolutely murderous from the long 2 point range, normally a very inefficient, undesirable shot that's largely available because defenders want their opponents to take bad shots). The average player in any league except the NBA and Euroleague probably shoots south of forty percent. This observation may seem pedantic, but the entire game of basketball revolves around creating mismatches, and squeezing out good shoots and forcing your opponent to take bad ones. Field goal percentage (and true shooting percentage, OBPM, etc.) is a function of that chess match between opposing teams. This show was set up to brilliantly exploit that with superhuman players.Instead, the action in the game often seems random, you don't get a sense of the back and forth between teams, there's a lot of talk about "strong" and "weak" when basketball is pretty much a skill game where speed and athleticism are the main skills of players until college and pro level play, where individual strength is important to perform well on defense, and for interior players who are rim protectors.You must be thinking "it's just an anime, dude." And that's why you should still watch the show - it's quite fun. It wouldn't be fun to be a replica of actual basketball games, but there's some basic stuff that you have to know to write a story about basketball. It seems to me the writers didn't have that. From mislabeled terms to completely illogical observations about basketball, it can throw off a viewer that either watches basketball regularly or actually played organized ball (in my case, both).A good flick, if predictable and wonky at times.Edit: The best example of how bad Kuroko gets basketball while still being entertaining occurs in the final leg of the series (well, unless there's gonna be another year of high school for these guys). Seiren up 18-15 in the first quarter, yeah? The other team gets a defensive stop on the other end, and they're trying to set up a play to score. Everyone in the crowd, players from defeated teams, all remark "if X scores now, Seiren is done. Their spirit will be crushed." *Cough* In the history of basketball, no one has said that about a game in the first quarter, much less about a team that was AHEAD, ever. I could go into why this is the case but I would dare to say that it should be self-evident to people who watch any ball at all. I'm still enjoying myself, but I cringe at the portrayal of basketball. No basic research done whatsoever about the sport by the writers.

I like how Kuroko is more of a shadow that people can easily overlooked but still let people know he's the main character without being all 'in your face' about it which isnt what you see most of the time.Kuroko brings so many light hearted comical scenes into the anime from where he'd just appear out of nowhere or disappear which blends well with Kagami's personality. Such a good anime though, rlly enjoyed it (-;

Daaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaam it!Seriously, Kuroko's Basketball is very powerful and adictive drug!Once you reach episode 4 you just can´t stop anymore.The second season is even more impressive. Everything is so over the top, the battles/matches are incredible and the characters are perfect.You just can´t dislike Kuroko, Kyoshi and so many others.You don´t even have to like sports anime to be hooked on this show but if you DO like, well, you´re in for an incredible ride!

Can you answer the question? I've never been into "Sport Animes", unless I saw a really cute boy.. then maybe I would check it out. The last one I fully enjoyed was the first and second season of, Prince of Tennis. Kuroko's Basketball makes a bigger impact when it comes to team work, and keeps you on the edge of your seat. I found myself clapping and wanting to cheer on this fictional team that slammed dunked its way into my heart. The animation is amazing, but what really brought me in was the music. It's incredible how much it impacts the anime and keeping you feeling like they have the chance of winning the game. If this anime doesn't make you want to cheer.. then all I have to say is, "you win some, and you lose some"

The plot of this show is simple, it's pretty much about a basketball team/club from Seirin High School wanting to become the best in Japan. I'm not going to go into depth with the characters or anything because so many people have already done that. What I will say is that despite its simplicity, this show has a really likeable cast of characters. The chemistry between the two key players in Seirin's basketball team, Kuroko and Kagami, is really a pleasure to behold. It's also really cool how their bond develops as the show progresses. So far I bet I'm making this show sound pretty generic though lol. What makes this show so amazing, is the level of energy that this show gives off due to the characters' passion towards basketball and simply because of how insane the basketball games get. I can't explain it but the level of tension in every one of the games sends chills down my spine because of how close some of them are. The opponents Seirin faces also become more and more intimidating as the show goes on making the show's main team always feeling like the underdog. Whenever I watch this I always just get this feeling of euphoria because it just gets me so pumped. In short, this show is simply a blast to watch. I recommend watching it if you are the least bit interested in sports anime.

I am someone who dislikes sport animes. Nor do I write reviews on animes.  However, this anime has kept me on the edge of my seat and wanting more faster than almost every anime out. This is truly an anime that doesn't disappoint.  However, I won't spoil any story for you but, the characters are well made.  The story is well made.  Also, it doesn't fall under the "ofc the main team wins" type of story.  Fillers seem to be even kept to a minimum and even with fillers it makes the story much better.  This anime has quickly become a favorite of mine. You don't even have to like sports or sport animes to enjoy this.  I've added this to my list of Anime to recommend to others when asked.

Never have I seen a better anime about the TRUE life of basketball. Kidding, the story is pretty interesting and it creates good cliff-hangers that kept me watching.At times, the show can be a bit ridiculous with the reactions. For example, someone learns a new move and all the sudden it's like they reached a whole new level of basketball never before seen in the history of them playing basketball (Only to have it get crushed, but whatever). This anime is pretty good though, and I'm going to watch it until the end.

Kuroko's basketball is an anime that will surprise you. It takes the idea of high-school basket ball and turns it into a compelling anime with great animation, even greater character, superb pacing, and episodes end on the perfect cliffhangers that will have you consuming episode faster than you can pass a basketball.The show follows Kuroko, a quiet and reserved basketball player who uses his lack of presence on the court and uses misdirection to pass to his teammates unnoticed and unobstructed. When he signs up for a high-school basketball team he meets Kagami, our other main protagonist. Born in Japan but raised and trained in America, he's a hot blooded and loud player who has a seemingly infinite amount of motivation and potential. In middle school, Kuroko was on a legendary team nicknamed "The Generation of Miracles". An unstoppable team of basketball prodigies that sent echo's through the basketball scene. Kuroko was one of these prodigies. Now their high-school years came around they all went their separate ways. When Kuroko and Kagami meet, they vow to each other to become the best team in Japan. But can they overcome The Generation of Miracles to achieve this goal?My favorite thing about this anime are the characters. The character in this anime are some of the most well written characters to be seen in a show. From their motives to their doubts. Despite their borderline impossible skill, these characters feel human. They are well developed and it's a treat seeing how they all grow and transform over the course of the show. Each have their own strength and weaknesses and they play off of each other so well. There is a character here for anyone.Pacing is done very well in this show. Interaction's and matches last just the right amount of time as to not seem to long or boring. And I don't know how but some of these episode's manage to end on some of the most perfect cliffhanger that will having  you saying "Wait...what!?  I need to know what happens next! "When this show hit you with the big moments, it hits you HARD. The animation is great when it needs to be and it will have you screaming "YES!" while fist pumping the air when the big moments happen.Long review short. This is an excellent anime with good pacing, great characters, and edge of your seat basketball. If your not a fan of sport anime's, Kuroko's basketball just might change your mind.

This series is so well done that it was able to draw me in from the very beginning despite that I had zero interest in basketball. I find the artwork to be FANTASTIC and the soundtrack to be phenomenal. The characters are a constant powerful presence and a delight to see on screen-- whether their a main character or a supporting one, which is rare in my book. Every episode is full of tension and rivalry, and I always feel pumped up and excited after I've finished watching an episode. I would recommend this anime to just about anyone, but especially people who are competitive and know what it's like to really want to win something.

I have to say that I have never shown any interest towards basketball, but I thought; "hey!  why not try it?"  I am SO glad I thought that!  This show is AMAZING!  I think what drew me to it was that its action-packed, well assorted, and extremely entertaining.  There isn't a single episode that's boring, the plot is well expressed and constant action.  There's tension and build-up to everything, and it's so addictive!  I myself, love sports, and I can influence my own sport (lacrosse) with what I picked up from watching Kuroko.  This is a defiant MUST WATCH!  You won't be disappointed.

I used to not like sports at all but this anime totally changed my mind. I never thought that I would ever try to understand basketball or any other sport in that matter. If you love basketball then I suggest this anime. If you don't like sports than I'm sure this will change your mind. I was really glad when a new season came out. I can't wait for the next episode. I am totally giving this anime 5 stars.

Sports animes are starting to become a trend in most new anime. I was surprised by how well this show was and how I couldn't stop watching. The show has comedy,drama,and good characters in general. This isn't a very fanservice show like free(i actually enjoyed free btw but there is a little not alot) I feel like that comes more from the fans itself. Also the show is really well written especially when most of the episodes are basketball games where each game gets creative where you want to watch the next episode asap. I would give this a three or four episode try if you are curious to watch it and see if it is for you. Im following the second season and can't wait to see more.

I have to admit I was a bit skeptical at first when I was about to watch this series, but once I started I simply cannot stop. I watched the whole first season in one go and just cannot stop enjoying or thinking about it for the whole time after I was done watching, the series is good in a way that is rare for anime nowadays it has a great balance between exciting heart-racing matches and original humorous moments. Overall, I really recommend watching this anime whatever your preferences in anime are, you will enjoy this series thoroughly and won't regret watching it at all!

Yea it's true some of the abilities of some characters are unrealistic but its an anime it doesn't meant to be real. The Animation are beyond beautiful, the character development are amazing better then most of the anime I've watched. What I enjoyed the most is the soundtrack, the soundtrack is flawless and each character had their unique personality. This anime taught me Basketball and inspired me to play Basketball it described the roles of each players. Each of the Generation of Miracle had their own unique abilities which describes their roles - Example such as  Midorima he was a Shooting Guard and he's abilities are full court shots. Great Anime I recommended this anime to anyone even if you don't like sports.

When it comes to making a good sports anime, Kuroko's Basketball basically does everything right. It has interesting characters, an interesting story as far as sports animes go, and an intensity that may drop your jaw a couple times. The biggest highlight of the show are the games. They are powerful and energizing to watch. Any shortcomings the anime may have, sometimes were overlooked to me just because the games were just so impressive to see. All the characters seem pretty decently balanced and few feel bland whatsoever. My only gripe is with the character Kuroko. I am not a big fan of the extreme silent and emotionless type characters. They feel to unreal to me and I can't relate to them. His partner makes up for it to a degree, but still it feels like a drag. Despite that, there is little to hate about the series and I look forward to season 2.

I came across this in the manga version first. At first, I thought it wasn't gonna be that great. Then, I saw that it had an anime adaption so I went and try it out. It was a good choice. I was hooked right after watching the 1st episode. Can't wait until Season 2. [It's good enough that I finished both the anime and the manga all in 2 days.] (If you're having doubts that this is not a good series, please give it a try. You never know how much you would like it c;)

Yes im a girl and most girls are looking for the romance i'm glad they had a few parts with it!But i love how the show is FUNNY for sure most people like comedy as do I.I'm glad i started reading the anime i was getting caught in class trying to read it on my phone!With this i super excites for the season 2 coming up.Yes they have already announced it but i hope it comes on here as soon as it does in japan i'm a big an and im glad i gave this show a chance so please take the time to watch this anime show i'm sure you will like it ^_^

Kurobasu, like Tenipuri is a typical shonen sports anime, with a cast of pretty boys, crazy moves and deep, meaningful friendships between friends (men) - making it perfect for (BL/yaoi) fangirls.  In addition, the plot is well written, with funny and serious moments, and it's supported by both good dialogue and excellent animation.  Finally, there's some great character development - and it doesn't take 100 episodes to get there (though you might be waiting till season two).

This anime was great for me, there are two main reasons.  In this series they focused on the games rather than the practices like slam dunk would on occasion.  They were fast paced and didn't drag at all.  The second is they build this anime off of a premise that I really enjoyed, the main character isn't your typical genius when it comes to basket ball and has a talent not seen in many now and days.  All and all I definitely suggest this.

I fricken love this anime. I really want to see if they'll come out with a second half to this and carry on into the other two characters they left out, well other than the brief intro in the last episode. So really hoping they carry on. Other than that I really enjoyed this anime and that's coming from someone that's not a fan of sports based animes or even shows themselves but I REALLY enjoy watching main characters build in their strengths and take on the enemy with all they've got. Even if they lose I know that they'll eventually beat them. <3 So hoping a second part to this comes out. It was a really good anime.

I'm not a sporty type of girl. I'm usually a girl that studies and sits with her best friend talking bout some academic. I came across this sport -related anime and I was not disappointed but instead surprised. Kuroko's Basketball never makes me feel bored. It made me feel so agitated and I almost pissed my pants out of anxiousness. I havent watched "Slam Dunk" but I found Kuroko's Basketball fairly great!

Kuroko no Basuke has everything a typical sports shounen manga/anime should consist of: rivalry, friendship, trials, humor, power-ups, a hint of girls, special moves, a bada$$ boss etc.... The main difference--or in this case, the twist--between Kuroko no Basuke and others is that the protagonist chooses to act like a sidekick. As the summary explains, Kuroko is portrayed not as a light but as a shadow. However, our attention never strays from Kuroko despite this; after all, we are here to read about Kuroko's Basketball (the basketball which Kuroko plays). Every character is loveable, each having their own individual personalities and traits. Kuroko's deadpan behavior or Kise's easy-to-tease personality are some examples.The anime is well executed and the music is unbelievably exciting and dramatic. I'd recommend listening to the character's songs if time permits it. Also the anime stays true to the manga.At any rate, I love the story and its characters and would definitely recommend it to any readers who are currently into sports. Especially if you are looking for something to inspire you to try or get back into, basketball; just keep in mind that Kuroko no Basuke is fictional so moves like misdirection, Hawk Eye or the bend-and-shoot that Aomine/Kise do is most likely impossible to emulate. Yeah, I know, reality sucks.

I'm not usually a fan of sports anime, but every now and then one comes along that catches my interest.  I am happy to say that Kuroko's Basketball is one of those titles.  At first I was hesitant to watch the series because of the fact that I'm not usually drawn to a sports anime.  What made me change my mind?  I remembered how much I played basketball for fun, and a year in school, and I was suddenly drawn to check out the series.  Weird I know, but sometimes childhood memories are good for getting you to check out something in which you never saw yourself watching, I guess.  I started out watching episode one, and then before I knew it I was already on the seventh episode in the same day.  Normally I try to limit myself to watching no more than five episodes a day, and so I was shocked that I had gotten so hooked on one series that it caused me to forget about my daily anime limit.  Seeing as close as I was to catching up I went ahead and finished the remaining episodes in the same day.  I figured what was another two or three episodes, and besides the show was pretty exciting to watch.  I loved every minute of each and every episode.  Watching the members of the Seirin team each match through a mix of hard work and excellent teamwork never fails to keep me cheering for each and every member of the team.  Kuroko may only have one skill, but the way he passes the ball around has proven more than once to be a huge asset to the team.  It's proof that sometimes even the so-called 'weaker' players can be a huge help.  Also it tells me to always be careful and never underestimate anyone by appearances alone.  The cast of characters is great, and I can easily find something to like about each and every one of them.  The games are intense, and I have found myself on the edge of my seat a few times already.  Animation wise it is a beautiful show to watch, with great character designs and high attention to detail.  I look forward to watching the rest of the series, and cheering for Seirin to win it all.  It made me fall in love with basketball all over again, and I never expected that to happen from watching anime.  Kuroko's Basketball is quickly growing to become one of my favorite sports anime.  The last sports series that kept my attention like this was Prince of Tennis, and only time will tell whether or not Kuroko's Basketball will prove to be better than that title or not.

Kuroko's Basketball is about the graduates of a middle school team that consisted of five very special players, known as the Generation of Miracles.  These five players have separated and went to different schools, all five chose a top school to go to.  But their schools is not what this anime is about.Open to Seirin High School, a school opened only one year before in which the basketball team had made it to the championship but were completely outclassed.  The team is looking for new members for the year and we see a tall and powerfully built American basketball player, Kagami, who joins the club, but then mysteriously they notice another form on the  table with the note "I have been here the whole time" on it.  The team captain and coach look at the letter and see that the kid must have been with the Generation of Miracles.  During practice, the coach who has a special skill at judging player's skill and potential, looks through the line of members, but do not seem to notice Kuriko standing at the end of the line...There are surprises with all the characters as you watch...So check out Kuroko's Basketball if you.- Love sports animes.- Love a great plot and story.- Love character development.

I've never been a big fan of sports anime and never really been excited when watching it. However... I absolutely love Kuroko's Basketball. I get excited each episode and every game. I never knew an anime basketball game could make you so excited. I don't even get excited during actual basketball games. So even if you aren't a fan of sports anime, you should definitely check it out. I can nearly guarantee that you will get into it. There's something happening each episode and at the end of each episode I know you'll be looking forward to more. Kuroko, one of the main male leads, is definitely a unique main character. He isn't overly strong or a powerhouse basketball player. He's weak really but his passing skills are amazing. However, his personality is awesome. He isn't snobbish or a scaredy-cat and is actually quite modest and confident without it being overdone. He's even a bit funny. He lack of facial expressions and how he expresses himself in such a monotone is pretty funny. The other main lead, Kagami, is awesome. He's a powerhouse and an amazing basketball player. When he's teamed up with Kuroko they're nearly unstoppable. He gets overly excited about basketball games against players that are believed to be stronger than himself. He actually likes playing basketball more when there's a chance he could lose. Another character I find interesting is the main girl, who is the coach. She is actually a pretty good anime female. She isn't extremely bossy nor does she blush all the time. She's more of an average girl, but with the love for basketball and good scouting skills when checking out the basketball players. I rarely like anime girls, but I don't mind her at all. The other characters all have unique personalities and distinguished attributes. On team Seiren, I'm pretty sure there wouldn't be anyone you dislike or find annoying. They're all very cool and funny in their own way. The animation and character design is very good. There's a lot of cute guys in here, that I'm sure will get plenty of girls hooked in it. The bond between Kuroko and Kagami is interesting to watch. It's a unique friendship with both of them helping each other out. I'm sure you'll enjoy watching this show as do I.

In the past month ive tried anime because of twitch prime.
