I decided on this because i like bball so id like to list things i enjoyed about it-cool characters-cool pre and post stories-i love the intense moments that are interrupted by something dumb-i love the odd skills of the GOM-the main characters didnt just instantly win they lost in the “main” tournament I didnt like-buzzerbeating dunks id prefer meteor jam because i could imagine it happening sonce a buzzer beating dunk is impossible -i dont like fan service because its weird to look at in general so i didnt enjoy any of itOverall very good show would recommend 10/10

The series starts off by showing the main character(Kuroko) in a sort of intro. Through this intro we get to see that he played for a godlike basketball team (Teiko) that was commonly called the "Generation Of Miracles". The segment at the start of every episode is sort of a prologue intro for the series.. followed by a generic anime intro that just shows of the characters.. The intro's in this series are overall pretty good. It's important to note that this story takes place in Japan. The main characters are: Kuroko Tetsuya and Kagami Taiga (The dynamic duo)If we skip forward a bit we get to see Kuroko traning with his new team; Seirin High. He surprises everyone by showing of (Or rather the opposite) his skills at passing and going by undetected. This scene is really awesome. The way they make the basketball matches seem so intense is what really makes this show stand out for me. Seeing people like Kagami and Aomine going toe to toe with eachother in a full on zone battle really gets your blood rushing.. almost like you are there witnessing it or even playing with them. Without spoiling anything im just gonna say: The animation is top notch. I love the art style. The characters feels fleshed out and not lacking in any aspects. The way they make you want to see more and more is ridiculous and the show is overall fantastic in my opinion.I highly recommend this show to any new (and old) anime fans.Link for a list of all the characters:  http://kurokonobasuke.wikia.com/wiki/Characters

Honestly, I've never been a huge fan of sports. Kuroko's Basketball hyped me up so much because I wanted them to win so bad but I also wanted the other characters to also win. It was just a huge mix of emotions and was very entertaining to watch. It's also one of the first sports anime I've watched and it's made me want to watch other sports anime that have come out or are going to come out.I also think others who aren't into sports would enjoy this show.

Kuroko no Basuke is a fun show and really hypes you up and will get you into team sports. It's fun characters and comic relief is amazing and just trust me when I say that you have to watch it to understand how amazing it is!!! I've probably rewatched this show at least 3 times and find myself laughing while enjoying its serious parts all the time!! It's incredibly fun to find out the strategies that they use to defeat the other team and how they overcome their challenges!!

The anime was a bit too cheesy to take seriously. It was hard to say whether this was an anime about talented basketball players or talented, magical basketball players. Unless there is magic involved then: you cannot see "The Zone", you cannot evaluate people's fitness by just looking at them, you do not have an "Emperor Eye" or "Eagle Eye", there is no "Zone beyond The Zone". They're good metaphors, albeit cheesy, but they aren't consistent with the reality I'm presented in this anime. Maybe if the anime had premised itself by saying there was some intuitive force moving through certain players then it would have been less cheesy.A lot of the games were predictable and recycled. I know it's hard to invent something else, but most of the games were the same old buzzer beaters, being beaten at the start but then revealing some special move to comeback and win the game. And this is repeated many episodes in a row during the Winter Cup. If there were any other teams Seirin had to beat then I would have probably stopped watching.The other thing to say is that not many of the characters were developed very well. It was a short anime and most of the characters were only developed for about 5 mins. I hardly even knew the names of some of the characters that played for Seirin. For example, Koganei wasn't developed until the last game with Rakuzan. He was on the team the whole time but I hardly knew him at all. Compared to an anime like Haikyuu which I would give a 4/5, this anime is a 3/5.This kind of anime is fine if it's the first time you've watched something like this (it might give you a few feels), but if you've watched a couple before you will realise how generic it is. The premise of the anime was interesting at first but before long I realised it was quite generic.

There are 3 seasons so far but really they just flow into one another. This show has comedy good animation and interesting characters.The 1 problem i have with this anime is that some of the characters are really good and others are meh. I don't get how a guy on the best teams is just a decoy...but hes really bad. All sports anime seem to follow and certain formula.Small player with few skills but really good at one thing. Meets an rival that makes them better, whether on the team or not they make each other better. But not good enough because the teams missing players. Thats when the upperclassman shows up and the team is now way better.That being said. I like Kuroko's. But the reason its an 8/10 is due to the dragging on DBZ affect of some of the games. Literally some of the episodes are inner player monologue for like 5 mins then shot to some else then the same thing. That can get annoying

I can't even truly express the joy I received from watching this anime. Before this my top anime was Death Note. I thought it was brilliant and well made, but I was wrong. The writing in comparison to Kuroko no Basket is light year's away in balance, strategy, attention clenching, and execution.I completely hate sports; I don't even watch them or play them even though I used to play sports. Basketball was my least favorite of all sports. So when I saw this anime I skipped over it for nearly 2 years. Watching this anime was highly rewarding.Kuroko no Basket has complex strategy which I love in anime such as Death Note. It also has outstanding art, and dynamic characters. For an anime with 70+ episodes it has done a wonderful job. It director deserves an Oscar! or His own company if he already doesn't have it. Ever episode leaves you wanting more.The pacing in the matches are done so flawlessly.The flashbacks and fillers are short and relevant everytime.The power plays and skill upgrades are realistic and invigorating.Every character is written with surmountable care and consideration.The strategy's are well throughout that even I, a strategist, only predicted 3 this whole anime.And finally this show has caused me to love basketball; I don't even view it the same. In fact I have learned more than any coach could show me just thru observation.I demand you and find it meet for those who have not watched this anime to watch it; right now. This anime is the standard we anime watchers should demand from our 日本人(Japanese) writers to imitate. This is why I watch anime and why I love it. Now stop reading this and watch it! P.s Seirin, FIGHT!

Honestly, I had been avoiding this anime like the plague after hearing of it. I mean "An anime about basketball?", I thought. "Seriously?" I assumed, like many, that it would be boring and would probably have to add some crazy supernatural element to make the anime even remotely exciting.When a friend of mine cosplayed as Kuroko at a con, I was suprised that he had watched it and I asked him about it. Even then, the brief summary he gave still didn't really excite me but I suddenly questioned my initial judgement and thought I might give it a go.And boy...did I give it a go.It was a couple of weeks ago that I watched that first episode and I just finished the first series last night and shall be starting the next tonight I'm sure. I don't know how to explain the way that the show draws you in but I think it's a combination of the sheer determination of the characters combined with the variety of skills that are actually involved in the basketball they play, without even having to add in any ridiculous supernatural powers to make it unbelievable and hard to relate to.This show is not only compelling to watch but it is genuinely inspiring and that's something that is often hard to find in anime nowadays.I am so glad I gave it a chance and I recommend you do the same.

Okay a couple of months ago i ran across this and was like ew sports anime? eh why the hell not might as well watch it bc my other shows were still on wait for the next episode.. so i start this up and was blown away at how amazing it was! A must watch one of my favorite anime and its a sports anime !! if u have any interest in basketball or great character development in an anime... then this is for u please do yourself a favor and watch this you will not regret it!!!

Basketball has always competed for my favorite sport along side baseball this anime does the sport justice.  The imposing presence of the generation of miracles is great.  The team work you get with Seirin is great.  As the series progresses you get to see the opponents of Seirin (the generation of miracles) get developed more than some of the members of Seirin it self and it gives you a great inside look on why they didn't join the same team in high school, why Kuroko is so determined to beat his old teammates, and why each of the generation of miracles players are the way they are.  Characters rule in this anime which makes a story about a under dog team climbing the latter so much better.

I'm not the best judge on this, since I haven't watched very many sports anime. In fact the only ones I've looked at briefly so far are baby steps, prince of tennis, haikyuu, yowamushi pedal, and free (yes, i know!) which of course have nothing to do with basketball. But I must say that Kuroko no basket is by far the best sports anime I have watched and to be honest my most favourite anime right now. Im not saying girls don't watch sports anime at all but I do say if you are one of those girls that are into shoujo and the other female orientated anime then this is a good show to get you into different genres as it has plenty of good looking male characters who we can take a fancy too. Also it is one of those animes where the main protagonist isn't primarily the leading role, which I love as we get to deeply explore characters who equally make the show an interesting watch and just as importantly divulge into the connections that bring all the characters together.I know that KnB might not be the best show to learn about basketball but its just a fun show that allows our minds to plunge into a fantastic world where athletes can have supernatural powers and play sports. Because, wouldn't it be awesome to be able to be the that bad-ass on a court without taking steroids!With its serious but just as prominent amusing aspects this anime is an all rounder; with its designs, story and  character personality. I recommend all you bored people to watch it because I can tell you, you'll be up all night!

I've never fallen for a show so fast or so hard before! This is the first sports anime I've ever watched - honestly I was just looking for a new show to get into, and since it had a lot of episodes I figured it had to be good to get a second and third season. I wasn't sure how I felt about it at first, but after the first few episodes I was hooked. I am obsessed with the characters - especially Kuroko-chan, squeeeee! - and find myself squealing and cheering them on for every episode. It seriously keeps you on the edge of your seat! It's the perfect combination of bromance, action, hard work, and friendship to keep you interested, and the anime itself is just beautifully put together. The cliff hangers, the build-ups, the let downs, the feels - everything blends together perfectly. I LOVE KUROKO'S BASKETBALL! ^_____^

Until recently, I'd never really watched a sports anime.  Kuroko's Basketball was among a group of anime recommended to me and I instantly fell in love.The anime was face paced enough to hold my attention, as well as great at revealing aspects of a sport that I know very little about.  It was great to see the characters grow and how basketball could be played in very different ways depending on each individual's strengths and weaknesses.  I truly look forward to seeing the next season and it has encouraged me to dive deeper into the world of sports anime.

I love basket ball and this makes me love it more! Guys and Girls can both watch this and both enjoy it equally. This isnt very cliche like them winner every single match, they have some bumps and challenges they have to go through to become the best in Japan. Although its not THAT realistic to real life people can still relate to the characters and have a 'bond' with the characters. This anime shows character development for most characters which is always cool to see. Cant wait for season 3

I love the mix of personalities, teamwork, and competition in this sports anime. It had just the right amount of humor and story-pacing too. This series hits those notes well. Well, the FIRST season does at least.The second season would be perfect except for one thing: the games are taking too long. Seriously, basketball has 48 minutes of actual game play and yet they're devoting 5+ episodes for it. That's over 125 minutes for just game play in one game, not even counting halftime or fouls and the like!! I realize this is a weakness a lot of sports anime suffer from. But still, I don't like having to sit through 25 minutes of what amounts to inner character dialog and  game play "revelations". (Have they learned nothing from Dragon Ball Z??) I don't want to wait for 3 seasons just to find out whether they win or lose the Winter Cup, but at the rate they're going that's exactly what'll happen!It's really just a shame too. If they condensed the games, the story would be a lot more interesting. But as it is, I've gotten in the habit of not watching this serious for weeks at a time just so I can skip all the "filler" episodes.

Don't get me wrong this is a great anime. Its exciting, kinda a different genre for shonen jump, and it has a variety of characters. But when it comes to basketball it can mislead a lot of non sports fans that watch this. I have played basketball since I could walk and I have became a student of the game so when I see some of the things that go on on this anime I cant help but laugh. For an example: they talk about how Kagami has only a certain amount of jumps in one game. In real life basketball there is no way that a player could tell his coach he only has 5,6, or 7 jumps left. The player would just keep jumping as if he is not tired.Another example is Kuroko's vanishing drive........ if you have never played basketball or have not played seriously, stuff like this does not exist. There is no way that players can have almost superpowers like the characters in this anime. I no I have been rambling but I still think this show is great. They way the writers made the show makes complete since because if it just showed regular real basketball it would not be as entertaining to non sports fans. OH! and my last complaint, why do the players in this show score on their defender the have a conversation with them for like 5mins while the game is supposed to be going on? Do the referees not care that the players waste at least 10 mins a game starring down each other or talking shonen jump basketball philosophy in the middle of the court?

Kuroko's Basketball change my outlook on sport animes forever! I always thought that sport animes would be boring but after hearing about Kuroko in the Crunchyroll News a few times, I finally decided to give it a shot! I was hooked after watching 3 episodes and now I'm a sport anime fan! Both Season 1 and 2 are awesome and filled with action and character development! Kuroko's Basketball is easily in my top 3 fav sport animes: 1. Kuroko's Basket, 2. Free! Iwatobi Swim Club, and 3. Yowapeda. If you aren't sure if you'll like sport anime, then you should check out Kuroko's Basketball! It will change your outlook on sport animes!

To be honest, I really hate basketball. I almost passed up this anime and didn't watch it. I'm so glad I didn't. This is one of the best anime I've ever seen. It has the super intense scenes, and the lighthearted scenes. This is one of the only anime that I actually keep up with. Seriously, why are you reading this when you are wasting precious time where you could be watching it! So glad I didn't skip over it. The games make me yell at my screen the entire time and it's great. I love watching an anime where I get super into it. In my opinion, that's a sign of a darn good anime right there.

Me being a basketball player  really enjoyed this anime. I mean the animation, the storyline, ect. is just flat out amazing. The whole idea of it is just amazing. Now some of my friends that are on my team claim the "Zone" is unrealistic but it actually is real and it does happen. Not saying the things come out of your eyes and un-natural jumping abilities but any way it does happen. Back to the review yea is amazing.

This is absolutely fantastic. The show doesn't take itself entirely too seriously and the characters are really likeable! It gives off an SOA impression but in my opinion has been started off with a much better stage for character development and improvement. I find myself actually wanting to see the characters level up and go on quests. This is going to be an amazing ride, so log on and get ready to grind...you wont be disappointed! -Wafflez

This is a definitely a neat show. I have only watched a few episodes so far (3) but I particularly adore them because I am a wizard and magic fanatic. This is a show that gives you an interesting world full of epicness and awe yet with characters who are very entertaining. It is nice to see a magic-genre show because there is so much potential creativity that can be put into it. However, it is difficult to find material like this nowadays. It is as if God came and threw this into my face--and I am thankful for it. I would absolutely recommend this show to friends. I hope season three will be in production soon because it is explosive--in a good way!

Im Updating my review after watching many episodes of this, by far this and gate are my favorite shows I look forward to every week, its set in an alternate world with rpg like characters, its more of a comedy than anything else but has some plot to it which is nice keeps it from going garbage, if you've seen a other rpg anime's you'll probably enjoy this a lot, personally after watching grimgar of fantasy and ashe for half season i wanted to shoot myself it was epic depressing, this is a good alternate to bring you back from watching that.

Just as murphy's law states, anything that could go wrong will go wrong, and that's basically what this anime entails. The main character although some may argue a visionary of some sorts spends more time going backwards than forwards. In hopes of starting anew he quickly finds the struggles to move forward, with each member similar to an anchor rather than a support system. But this anime is hilarious, and I would suggest to anybody looking for a good laugh. For people who seek plot development maybe not the best choice

Konosuba is a really interesting series, cause it has all the ingredients to be a typical generic LN adaptation (highschool protagonist, fantasy world, "harem-esque" cast), and yet it strikes a weird, wonderful balance between just that and greatness. First and foremost, Kazuma, the MC, is a total loser, even in the way he arrives in the fantasy world. Unlike your usual LN main character, he isnt cool, he isnt strong, and he certainly isnt charismatic or nice (well, hes nice sometimes but hes still a bit of a jerk). All of these traits make Kazuma a breath of fresh air concerning protagonists. I wont go too much into detail about the rest of the cast other than saying that their a bunch of idiots in the most endearing and fun way (like, literally according to the show they have low intelligence). This show is all around hilarious and endearing.Oh, also, its animated by studio Deen so naturally it doesnt have the best animation, however, dare I say, the janky animation adds to the greatness.At least give it a shot! It stands apart from the horde of terrible light novel trash.

This review comes after watching the first two episodes. This has a somewhat cliched premise but takes it in a fresh direction for the genre. It appears to be set up as a harem (as evidenced by the poster and it's common in the genre), but thus far it's not overly sexual and all of the girls don't seem to be overly impressed by every kind or heroic thing our protagonist does. The show is heavy on comedy with very nice visuals and little action. The magic/special power sequences are really cool! There is a lot of variety in character design and so far, the characters have vastly different personalities that don't rely so much on tropes. While they have some novelty to them, they don't seem too over-the-top. Our goddess isn't a total mess up and has her own adjustments to make, which sets the story up for some nice character development all across the board. They do a good job of weaving in explanations about the way the world works without the overuse of long monologues and thus far, have a pace that is somewhat slow without crawling while remaining thoroughly entertaining. This is definitely one of my top five this season! I can't wait to see what this new mc is like next week!

Very funny and enjoyable series. Come for the laughs. Not to take seriously.Speaking of not taking it seriously. You shouldn't expect fast pace plot arc either. The whole point of this show is that they don't really get anywhere and the party is mostly useless. THATS THE JOKE. Any review on here bagging on the show because the girls are stupid or the plot moves too slow/doesn't exists is completely missing the point of this show.The characters somewhat represent bad MMO players that level in foolish ways. For example a tank that cant hit anything, or a mage that levels ONLY explosion magic and cant move for 24 hours after 1 spell due to low mana pool. Anyway the whole point of this show is the characters are stupid. The struggle is funny AND THAT IS THE POINT. Probably not a very enjoyable show for most girls. But would probably make most any guy ROFL at many points.

Surrender!Surrender!...In all seriousness this anime caught me by surprise, when I saw first saw it, I at first thought "great... it's one of THOSE animes" and was about to write it off, but the surprisingly competent comedic writing pulled me in. It does have a few low points, but over all I highly recommend it if you're a long standing fan of fantasy setting anime or comedy that is actually written and timed well (a surprising rarity in anime). Is it as funny as the legendary gintama? Don't be ridiculous... You can't compare anything to that masterpiece. But it is however written in such a way that the characters truly shine and it feels more natural and less like [insert cliche here for comedic affect]. Back to the low points, it's art style is nice (if a little generic), but the actual animation suffers from Generic anime syndrome where certain frames are jarring but it overall keeps a good consistency (Not to be confused with long running shonen anime syndrome, where the quality of animation drop significantly often as time goes on). The fan service is not a constant thing in the show, but it's enough to probably put off some people and sometimes doesn't mix well with the writing. Music suffers from uninspired generic fantasy anime syndrome, where often times you could swear that this is the exact same soundtrack as some other anime, but that really doesn't matter. To wrap up, the anime has fantastic writing, the characters really shine through, but a lot of it feels generic when it comes to styling and sound design. This is honestly a very solid series that I hope improves over time, give it a chance!

This by far became one of my favorite series of all time. Kazuma is a pitiful, unfortunate guy, until he gets resurrected into a parallel world. However, unlike a lot of Isekai protagonists who are overpowered, Kazuma has to start with almost nothing (though some rightfully argue that he's partly to blame).The story is incredibly well-written. The way everything goes from A to B to C to D and back to A again is beautiful. Sometimes it takes 3 episodes to come together. You can think "why is this seemingly unrelated filler episode here?" and then "bam!" It hits you. That episode that felt like filler had a lot of important things happen. My favorite part is that Kazuma is the brains of the operation. He can't fight with brute force, or extreme powers. He has to rely on his party, who are completely unbalanced and very difficult to work with. If he gets into trouble by himself (or due to his party members), he has to use his brain and luck to get himself out of the situation. Kazuma is also sarcastic, but it's in a way that the viewer relates to him. He feels like he's in a crappy situation, and you know why he's this way. He's sarcastic, but not just because he's an asshole. It also feels like he's the kind of guy that screws around playing a tabletop RPG, but in a fun way

So I've been watching anime for around 20 years and Konosuba quickly became my absolute favorite.  At the time of writing it has 4.7 out of 5 stars on ratings, which is very high for any anime; most of the negative reviews are troll comments or the handful of people who don't get the humor.  All of the characters are terrible people; yet while they are mean to each other you can tell they truly care about one another.

I heard the hype, so I lowered my expectations. But I found the hype didn't go far enough. Konosuba was one of the most enjoyable anime series I have seen since the start of the new millenium. It does something most animes today fail at completely; it doesn't take itself too seriously. Take a bunch of goof-ball characters, throw in some madcap situations, add a dash of unpredictability and VOILA! Laugh your butt off as these characters somehow manage to inexplicably pull off the impossible. Usually despite, not because of themselves. They are all so flawed, they seem like real people and after a while I found I couldn't help myself. I had to keep rooting for them. The plot is a little thin in places, but it is there. The writing keeps things moving along well in a lighthearted vein, but there's some tension and distress to keep it real. Problems are overcome but usually not in the apparent manner you would expect. There's some good direction to keep everything pulling in the same direction and to keep the whole thing from spinning off into oblivion. One of the things that really helped this along, was the Japanese voice acting. I don't speak Japanese, but it was even apparent to me that the actors and actresses just nailed almost every episode with their work. You don't HAVE to know what the words mean to tell what's going on. But keep those subtitles handy anyway! I really, really wish I could give this 4 1/2 stars. It would be a 92/100 for me. If you are simply tired of the heavy-handedness, or the self-importance, of so many anime titles out there today, and you want a breath of fresh air, give Konosuba a try. But if you find your sides are getting a little sore from laughing at it, don't say I didn't warn you!

Do not take this isekai seriously, seriously.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hide The main character is a shut in... he dies and gets transferred over to another world, just to have a useless goddess, a low stamina magician, and a hentai warrior. But that's what makes this anime so great. You would expect this OP main character who gets transferred over to another world; to find an equally awesome party to travel to world in hopes to find world peace. RIGHT? Nopeee. Not Konosuba. Are you in for a good time? Do you want a good laugh? Do you want to watch some cute girls ruin the protagonist's life?? Watch Konosuba.

Excellent sense of humor, and peerlessly great at displaying comedic interactions and expressions between the characters. The character personalities are fleshed out and interesting, and interact in the most satisfying ways. Plot, dialogue, pacing, ALL perfect. The animation is absolutely perfect for this style of show. More people need to see this show. It''s one of my all time favorite anime. All the cleverness of Gintama with a more modern style.

To make the story small.... If you wan't to have a good time with friends, and if they like Anime. You should watch this Anime with them. Hey even if you don't like Anime, this will still make you laugh a lot. One of my friends didn't like Anime "past tense". But now he does from watching this Anime. He said he was going to watch it a sec time :P. But that's just my friend. Maybe you should show your friends, and see what will happens. Go for it lol

My friend recommended Konosuba to me and I was hooked from just watching the first episode. I shamelessly binged all 20 episodes in about a day with no regrets. The show is taking a whole new(well at least for me) approach in anime comedy. The show revolves around four main characters that each have their own comedic personality. Aqua is hilarious in her dumb moments while she gets roasted by Kazuma. I don't want to spoil too much but if you have the time watch the first episode and give this show a shot.

Hahaha I've laughed so hard watching Konosuba; this show is very brilliant, funny, and cute, if you're in for some hilariously dumb scenes (and characters of course) this would be the perfect anime for you :D, it may seem a bit slow after the first episode but it picks up after that and ahhhh there are just so many little things that are awesome about this show but I can't spoil it soooo -- can't wait for season 3!

Konosuba is a comedy/RPG Parody about a shut in guy who dies upon venturing out into the world. Upon his death he is asked by a goddess to be reincarnated into another world to help save it. He can request any one thing to being with him in order to help him with this quest. He requests the goddess herself. Hilarity ensues.The characters all have their place and very funny. First you have the protagonist, who has no special talents, is under-geared and is the type of character in an MMORPG that you would pick for a raid if you were desperate for bodies, but not if you needed anything specific. Then you have a Priestess/Healer who is highly skilled, but dumber than a rock, has no attention span at all and causes more trouble than she helps. She is the type that gets picked up instantly for a Raid, but after getting everyone killed over and over, never gets invited back. You also have a Mage/DPS who is so over focused on one skill that she has no flexibility or stamina at all. She looks good on paper and has good gear for a Raid, but because she can't Crowd Control, do light DPS or even survive a fight she also will never be asked back. Finally you have a Knight/Tank that can take one hell of a beating but can not hold agro to save her life. Another with great gear and stats, but once the fight starts she can not hit the target and she creeps the enemy out so much that they will go out of their way to avoid her. So another that would never be invited back to a Raid. Somehow they all end up together and try to make it work.This show isn't very deep, but a lot deeper than expected.  The interaction between these misfits parallels Book Smart, Over Specialized, Incompetent and Under-specialized professionals you would find in the real world. If you have played an MMO or RPG before you will find it highly entertaining.

When I first saw this series, I thought it was going to be another generic RPG anime. While I was right on most parts, I was not expecting this.Konosuba follows Kazuma, a NEET who, after being killed, is given the opportunity to be sent to another world by the goddess Aqua, along with one other thing. After mocking him for his death, Kazuma gets revenge on Aqua by having his "one thing" be her and together they are sent on a mission to defeat the world's Demon King. By the first episode, I was laughing like crazy. While this series isn't plot heavy, it makes up for it with it's outrageous comedy. Every episode had me laughing. From it's ridiculous and unexpected situations to it's hilarious dialogue. I HIGHLY recommend this series if you enjoy Comedy and Fantasy setting anime and just want to have a good time. Would avoid if you're looking for a story rich anime.

As of recent release Ep.3Highly Recommended! :)If you're a fan of DanMachi or any other series that revolves around a character which is just starting out in the very beginning of a life as an adventurer(Very similar to DanMachi or SAO but not with OP abilities).. then this is for you.The very top trait of the series for me was the Humor. Excelente! 11/10.Hope you guys give the series a try!

From what ive seen so far this is the most normal and fun of all the "RPG" animes. No overpowered MC with ultra sword skills or ultra strategy, just an average guy that got sucked into this world. So far im liking the relationship he shares with the goddess, and im fine with him having all girls with him. However if they all start to fall in love with him and he starts to act clueless and is super standoffish (like every Harem anime in existence) then im gonna burn down the writers home for ruining this beautiful animes

A fresh take on the overused fantasy (isekai) setting with 4 loveable main characters (jerk, idiot, chuuni, perv) and great side characters, the interactions are awesome, very funny and very memeable (see r/Animemes).Goddess I love this show, this is the best comedy show I have ever watched!P.S. Kazuma is the best guy in all harem, more relatable compared to rest of mostly dense/beta MC, and yearn for true gender equality too!

This show is how a comedy is supposed to be done! The whole first season is extremely funny, the whole time i laughed my ass off. This is the first comedy anime that made me want to sit down and watch it as fast as i could. Not only is it extremely funny but the fan service is pretty good, be careful though because this is not a show that you would want to watch while in a public place (just watch it in your bedroom).

I saw some memes about this show and it sparked my curiosity. By the 2nd episode I was hooked. I absolutely adore how well written these characters are, The raunchy, naughty, blunt and witty humor this anime has is endless. Every character (even the secondary ones) offer a perfect blend of interaction and help each other drive the plot (if you can even call it that) which leaves you wanting more. Its a shame theres only two seasons but I hope we can all make the movie a success so we can get a S3 and maybe S4. Theres so much more potential this anime has.  This anime isnt meant to be taken seriously. Leave your ego at the door, kick your feet back and be prepared to blush, shake your head and have some hearty laughs.

IT IS ONE OF THE BEST ANIME I'VE EVER SEEN. This show is a diamond in the rough for the Isekai genre. Usually, from what I've seen, this genre is very forced upon viewers, not only the genre itself but the aspects inside the show. The comedy in this anime is just down right funny, it is rarely forced upon the viewer and it is just unique. The character development is also on it's own level. Usually the MC of these types of shows is an over-powered, feared by all, tough-guy. The MC in this show is the complete opposite, sarcastic, misogynistic in a way, and sort of an idiot. He gives a rat's a** about his team because they are all stupid, but at the same time still cares for them, in total adding more humor into the show and more character development. Pros:1.) Very good story line, unique to the genre and many good arcs2.) A great tale about comradery and sticking together even though you all are low tier fu***.3.) Good artwork, basic animation but the expressions on their faces brings out a new form of emotion and development. The subtle hints in the character expression can bring out so much more during a scene, I haven't seen anything else like it.4.) EEEXXXPLOOSIION \Cons:1.) Need season 3 (can't wait for movie though)2.) I feel like a lot of the backstories could have been covered way better, like the whole reason why the MC is transported to a new land (IK it was covered a bit, but like why is it a thing).3.)  Where are Aqua's panties? Overall rating: 9.5/10

Overall the show is pretty darn good. It's very compelling and keeps you interested, it never lags in momentum. Unfortunately there were some parts I found myself cringing just because the writers/animators chose to add in unnecessary parts that took away from the actual story line, mostly just for shock factor. But aside from those moments I really enjoyed it. It's a very funny easy going show that allows you to just sit back and laugh.

Never mind the review title, but to explain: it was much funnier than expected and I feel content after watching it.Minor spoilers to show disdain in features. Spoilers are marked.The show is a really great anime. I saw an ad for it and was kind of curious of how it would turn out. (Ad: explains that he is resurrected into a fantasy world).The characters are really vibrant and I really liked them. Criticism: The show length is pretty good. It got two seasons, with what I consider minimal episodes to each season. Maybe they could have stretched out the seasons in order to get the viewers accustomed to the characters, but especially the world. Instead of 'Oh yeah, we met this XYZ because ABC.'(how they introduced a main/side character, or not show ability being gained) It could have been a solid half episode; with the pace this show took. As for the world, we could have gotten an idea of what the world consists of: abilities, enemies, map, and what not.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hide I seem to be more hung up on the abilities, and why protaganist seemed to be the only one that had a variety of them. They seem low level at the very beginning but somehow pass a huge power curve and have no problem with about half of the great evil leaders. Yet they still have no idea how to handle giant frogs, sprites, or tedious things. I had the show at 5/5 but even writing this review brought it to a 4/5 because of hindsight. The show seems "broken" but not to an extent where it ruins watching it, because it's one I actually really enjoyed!

I've never seen a funnier show than this, absolute comedic masterpiece!Characters are  ALL well put together, with their own funny and unique personalities!Facial animations and voice acting are the things that shine the most in this show!! Seeing all the derpy faces made me laugh in almost every episode, i would highly recommend everyone who didn't watch this yet to   GO WATCH IT IMMEDIATELY!!

This is the best comedy anime I've ever seen, and I've seen quite a bit of anime in my day.      The best part of this show by far is the characters. You've just gotta love these clueless idiots. They take all the typical Isekai tropes and flip them on their heads. The MC, Kazuma, instead of being an overpowered cool guy, is an expectant jerk who thinks things will always go his way and is a bit of a perv. He then meets Aqua, who you'd expect to be the majestic love interest, is an entitled, whiny, stupid little idiot who party's and drinks all the time, then begs her party members for money. Megumin is the cute little sister archetype, but along with that is a childish brat. The last of the MC's is Darkness, who appears to be the calm-and-collected, self-sacrificial, older sister type. But why would someone in a world as cruel as Konosuba be so willing to risk her life for others? Well, as it turns out, those 'selfless acts of heroism' are driven by very selfish masochism. In fact, she often risks her life and the lives of her party members just to satisfy her masochism.     Just reading this part of the jerk, the brat, the meme wizard, and the weirdo, you'd think you'd hate all tease characters, right? Well, the show somehow does the complete opposite. You've just gotta love these wonderful idiots. Especially the #BestWorstGirls

After dying from laughably and pathetically, Kazuma Satou is offered another chance at life in another world by a goddess known as Aqua, she grants him an omnipotent wish to take one thing with him. He chooses to take Aqua with her, too bad she actually is useless... Now Kazuma and Aqua are stuck in this awful fantasy world and are forced to live out their lives here. Along the way they meet a useless mage named Megumin who can only use explosive magic, (before fainting...) and Darkness, a crusader who is a huge masochist and can't hit the broad side of a barn, despite being incredibly strong. Together the group suffers together and in general make each other and everyone around them miserable.My god is this anime funny, and it has some of the best worst girls to date, Kazuma himself is just a big jerk too, and I love it.

For me personally, I think it can be very difficult for a show to make me laugh out loud but this anime did just that, and quite often. The characters are as funny as it gets; while some take on a realistic personality, others are completely over-exaggerated and ridiculous, making for the funniest interactions between them. Everything in this anime is on point to make its audience die of laughter: the facial expressions, voice acting, camera angles, art style, and outrageous amount of weirdness. The situations that the characters are put through are so absurd and unexpected that you can’t help but laugh at everything that’s going on. The show’s parodical moments poking fun at commonly used tropes throughout anime are hysterical and it does a great job of being wildly entertaining. Being more of a lighthearted, comedic anime, Konosuba definitely delivers when you’re looking for something fun to watch and not super serious. Overall, everything about this show just makes it the perfect slapstick adventure.

In terms of story, I don't think it has much impact overall. It's not bad but it's obvious that this isn't where all the work went. As for the music, that's not usually something I pay much attention to and admittedly, most of it went in one ear and out the other. HOWEVER!! The second season possesses not only one of the best openings I've ever heard/ seen, it possesses one of the greatest endings I've ever heard/ seen. They're nothing short of marvels.When it comes to the cast, it should be said that these are some of the most instantly likable characters I've ever seen from Aqua's complete uselessness to Darkness' masochism. Kazuma isn't particularly moral for the main hero but that's kind of why I like him so much. He's not the typical RPG fantasy anime protagonist nor is he the cliched harem boy. Honestly, he's kind of a bad person but that helps him fit in with all the other misfits in his group.The best part of this series bar none is the humor. This is straight-up one of the greatest comedy animes I've ever seen, right up there with Excel Saga and Ghost Stories. Even when the story almost vanishes entirely from season two, Konsuba simply takes the opportunity to up the humor levels to 11. I don't think this series told a single joke that I DIDN'T laugh at.Arkada of Glass Reflection named this the best anime of 2016. Hot damn, I think I can see why.

This anime is laugh out loud hilarious! In a trope filled genre like this one where things can get rather boring this anime is as subversive and refreshing as it is funny. Where these stories are a power fantasy this is rather an amazing story of crazy, selfish, moronic party who have no business doing adventuring.Each of the main characters is well written and unique in a brilliant way and how they play off each other is brilliant. The comedy is near flawless and even the weakest episodes are still amazing.I can not recommend this anime more.

As others have said this is another RPG anime but it doesn't follow the normal style (like SAO) but it is still great. I really enjoyed it a lot. It is definitely different from the more "serious story" animes that I usually watch since this one definitely doesn't take anything seriously but that is what I found refreshing.The characters are all hilarious. They all make you like them in their own special way. I am sad (at the time of this writing) there is no Season 3 announced as I would most definitely continue to watch.

Konosuba was a pleasant surprise, going into it without any context. The cast pretty make the show in my opinion. A blend of colorful and humorous characters parodying tropes yet having their own personalities provide for a lovable cast of characters. The voice acting also makes the characters and jokes. Speaking of the jokes, none are forced or dry. Even the commonly used ones got me to laugh a lot of times throughout the show. You shouldn't expect anything too serious from this show, (although it certainly did have it's heartwarming and sad scenes) but it's a really solid watch for this season.

The anime.That's basically the premise of this. However it is also so much more. It is a fun filled trip containing anime tropes and cliches, some of those which are tastefully averted, stuff that anyone that has played anything even close to D&D will appreciate, and newcomers will hopefully have been left a good impression of what the game can bring to the table.I honestly have no qualms with this anime at all, It was a great ride all the way. The 10 episode seasons also help avoid possible fillers and make it a more compact story overall, meaning you have few repeating jokes or tedious moments.8.5/10

You absolutely need to watch this if you've ever played a mmorpg or similar. There are so many gaming references but don't think this is a trapped in a game or virtual reality anime.This is a super fun mix of comedy, sexual, and gaming points. However, beware that if you really begin to enjoy this, that your heart will be crushed when you find out that they aren't making a season 3 anytime soon. Instead, it was one of those animes that were made to make you interested in the manga and buy the manga. I'd love to see future anime adaptations of the whole series. I seriously recommend this anime. The only down side is that there isn't more. There's an ova for the end of S1 you can find that isn't available on CR and there's another one releasing on the 24th of July 2017. I can't wait for this anime/manga series to explode with more content.

I usually avoid more comedy-oriented series, as the amount of wackiness I get in typical action anime is just enough for me (and often just at my level of tolerance). Still, this one was a pleasant surprise - while it's fun and obviously plays with the conventions of both RPG games and anime, it rarely goes into over-the-top, random absurdity. Rather than that, it uses its cast of dysfunctional, weird characters to build a consistent and entertaining story of overcoming challenges and finding a place for oneself in a new and often antagonistic world.Konosuba is definitely not a perfect show, but I can wholeheartedly recommend it to pretty much anyone. While primarily a parody, it doesn't go overboard in any aspect of it (including fanservice that one could expect to be unbearable, but is actually quite mild). Considering the fun I've had with this series and the consistent quality it offered, I think it deserves a 5-star rating - beside anything else, it one of the best in its genre.

I dont often write reviews. And for the longest time i was someone who mostly said i would never watch "Anime"But my god was i wrong. This show is funny, has interesting characters, and a wonderful world. Its simply just a joy to watch. it does not take itself too seriously and the comedy and enterainment just flows through the episodes to the point i could and did happily watch each season in a sitting.If you are looking for a good anime to watch i highly recommend Konosuba. I cant wait for season 3!

Note: This review is based on the first two seasons of KonosubaKonosuba was a show I stumbled on accident. I was watching a video for funniest deaths in anime, and this show happened to pop up. That caught my interest enough that I decided to watch the first season of the show. At the time, I did not write reviews, and by the time I started, they were releasing the second episodes (I feel that a show should not be reviewed while releasing episodes because of possible changes in quality). Now that the second season of Konosuba is finished, I feel that I am prepared enough to make a review. While I am not exactly a comedy specialist, this show was one of the funniest shows I have ever seen. Konosuba does so much right. It has an (annoyingly) catch and cute introduction that introduces the characters very well. The comedy is absolutely amazing. There were moments where I was laughing so hard it hurt. The characters are very well created. Between Darkness' perversion, Megumin's stage flair, Kazuma's  perversion and Aqua's plain stupidity, you are never bored around the characters. Their interactions are priceless and make the show. The animation is fluid and believable. Even the fight scenes are amazing, something you would not expect from a comedy. The plot is surprisingly well written and developed, something that can make the difference between a good and great comedy. While this might be preference, I love the bright colors the show uses. Finally, my personal favorite part is the world, more specifically how messed up and un-video-game-like it is. You will just have to watch the show to understand that part.There are only two minor problems worth mentioning, both doing with the second season. My first problem was the animation. It wasn't necessarily bad, but the switched something around. I am not exactly sure what it is, but I think they changed the dimensions of the characters. Going from the first season to the second, this took some time to shake off and it still felt slightly weird for the entire season. The second was the humor. To put it simply, I felt the second season just was not as funny as the first season. It still had its moments, but it was just overall not as funny (in my opinion, you might disagree after watching it).Overall, Konosuba is a really good show with quirky characters and great humor. I recommend this show to anyone who likes a good laugh. If you are unsure, I recommend you watch the first episode. If you don't laugh, move on and know you tried. If you laughed, give the rest of the show a shot.  Overall Rating: 9/10

Look at this point if you watch anime, you've almost certainly seen at least one of the shows the it's a normal guy transported to a fantasy world, he goes on an adventure, and so on. It's a trope that's almost been done to death with great shows, and less than great shows, and total crap. This is a parody of that trope and a fantastic one at that. It pushed the line for what jokes anime is generally willing to tell and pushes in all the right spots. It's got great writing, funny characters, an extremely popular setting and has well earned it's popularity. This is one of the best comedy anime in recent years. If not THE best anime  comedy in the last 2-3 years.But let there be no misunderstandings, this is a comedy and a parody of the genre. Don't jump into this looking for deep characters, fascinating story and moral dilemmas. This is a show you watch to laugh, relax and not care too much. It knows what it is, takes full advantage of that, and does it extremely well. Well generally great, there are some drawbacks to the animation quality at a few points, with one episode flat out feeling like a different studio did it. Also the show overall honestly took me a bit to get sucked in. By the end of season 2 I am begging for more. But at the end of season 1 I was pretty neutral about it.Pros:Excellent humorGreat choice of parodyVery entertaining charactersCons:Some animation issuesBoth seasons are very short.   Final note, I enjoyed the second season much more than the first.

The characters are unique, a dude that is almost a perverted low-life, a goddess that isn't quite as powerful as she thinks, a witch that only uses one kind of magic and a masochistic crusader. They take on challenges as you would in an RPG, though not as successful as they would like to be, and even when they are the law of unintended consequences comes back to bite them in the butt. I honestly don't know how to describe this show, but it can be very funny. I'm sad that it is over. probably won't be a 3rd season.

This anime is another RPG like story, with your basic characters trying to beat the evil of the land, and have almost perfect like characters whom are incredibly powerful, smart, and takes everything incredibly seriously.. They have nearly no flaws, and are a perfect team..... ......Now take what i just said, and completely flip it, and you get Konosuba!  This anime is one of the funniest shows i have ever seen. One moment you expect something to happen, and they do the exact opposite. You don't know what this group of..er.. special heroes will do, and how far they will go. But trust me.. It's not what you expect out of an RPG like anime.. You will enjoy this adventure, and the crazy people in it. Now go.. Go watch this... I said GO!

This anime is fantastic!  Definitely worth watching!  All of the characters have great gimmicks and every episode has a point where you can't help but laugh.  I'd call it an anti-Harem anime almost, i'm not sure what the term is when the guy is surrounded by a bunch of females that he doesn't want to be around.  Season two shows character development while still maintaining the comedic nature of the series.  Season 3 Please!

My review's on here are going to be more lax as its a five-point score system but that also means generally better-looking scores! Konosuba is an excellent series with generally good animation and music well keeping it interesting by flipping the dynamics of living in a fantasy world on its head. Haveing interesting and likable characters (if not always morally right or traditionally "good" ones) give it an interesting story with many twists and turns. Overall making it a fun, funny, and interesting adventure.

this is one of the best shows ive seen in a while.  im trying to get my friends to watch it but their not that into anime anymore. anyway, i love the comedy. at first it seems all depressing then its all happy and like"Ha you died!" then its like adventure but reality hits them in the face and they have to get a job. my honest to god faverit thing about this show is that the realm there in is kinda like a video game, but most the time their in debt. 10/10 watch please

First of all, I never actually write a review for a show so apologies if this is sloppy. KONOSUBA -God's blessing on this wonderful world! is exactly what the title says, it is a blessing on this wonderful world given to us by God! I don't remember ever watching a show that has made me laugh this much before in my life. The characters of this show are extremely weird and that in my opinion is one of the best parts of this show. Each character has their own quirk to them that makes them useless in some way to the main character which in turn brings for a good laugh and interesting character interaction. Megumin = best girl!I'm not one to judge a show based on its animation for the most part, but for some reason  KONOSUBA  has caught my eye in this part. The way the spells that are cast in this show bring some beauty in my eyes. I was especially amazed at when I first saw Megumin's cast of her explosion spell. The story of  KONOSUBA  is one of the typical gets send to another world as the introduction to the show. After that the show takes a different approach on how it interprets a RPG styled world. The characters in this show can be completely useless and it makes you wonder how they get things done.In the end, Megumin is the best thing ever to happen to me and Anime in a long time.

Nowadays is kind of hard to get any kind of emotion from me due to personal reasons however this show is keeping me laughing every new episode even after several runs on each of the episodes and writers of this show are doing amazing job in throwing these flawed characters in one pot and stirring it up a bit. Voiceacting is absolutely one of the best I have had to hear and soundtracks are a chapter for itself.Amazingly well put together show... doesn't happen oftenLittle gem of the shows

This is one of the precious few anime that carries the distinction of being able to make me laugh. In fact, not only does it make me laugh, but each and every episode makes me crack up to the point where I've probably watched the series at least 4 times.This show parodies your typical wish fulfillment harem "parallel world" anime, like SAO, and relentlessly demolishes every trope and cliche associated with those genres. The characters are all incredible in that they all have unique personalities which play off each other incredibly well, and the chemistry between the protagonist and his teammates is one of the things which elevates this show from the realm of "pretty funny" to "funniest anime in the past several years."

Konosuba is both top notch fantasy and comedy. Studio Deen really nails all the fantasy/RPG tropes that are good for poking fun at, and, they do it exceedingly well. All too commonly, Fantasy series have a strong start and fall apart at the end (SAO, Log Horizon) but Konosuba has escaped this fate thus far, as season one shines from start to finish. I found myself wishing for more episodes instead of rolling my eyes when it finished, and now Season 2 is easily my most eagerly awaited entry of the Winter 2017 season.  I definitely have a soft spot for fantasy anime but this one should be enjoyed by anyone who at least has a little bit of nerd in them (although being an RPG or MMORPG fan likely helps).Good follow up show: Outbreak Company

This anime was not revolutionary, it wasn't the most well written thing ever, there is nothing insane in this anime, but you know what this anime is. It's  FUN. This my favorite anime to come out in 2016 and it's because of how fun it was. This anime is the second anime I have ever watched that honestly made my gut hurt from laughing, the first being nichijou. The plot, while being what seems to be your everyday "guy is transported to other world in track suit" anime, takes the piss out of that exact genre and does it perfectly. The characters are all very unique and I love all of them, I found myself caring more about these characters then I cared about everyone who wasn't Rem in Re:ZERO. They all have personality just flowing from them. This is by no means some kinda view changing anime that will make you see the world differently but if you want to laugh then you have come to the right place.After the last episodes end credits I was treated to large text telling me that a second season was being confirmed and I hope that this doesn't get dropped like everything else and we get to see more of this because it was honestly the most fun I've gotten out of an anime in a long time. I give it 5 explosions out of 5.

This anime is a blast to watch and will make you laugh all the way through. Even if it is basically a parody of the other world genre, the story is still great. The best part of the show is the four main characters, each of them are original, funny and lovable (especially Megumin). The music and animation are both wonderful. This anime is certainly in my top 10, because of how good, original, funny and excellent it is. I recommend it to anyone.

Where many similar works leave me disappointed by making far too many characters overpowered or simply way too perfect, KonoSuba introduces extremely flawed and at times downright worthless characters who make the terrible mistake of forming a team.I wish every Dungeons & Dragons campaign was just like this. It's beautifully hilarious.This anime will remain a guilty pleasure of mine for a very long time. It contains incredible amounts of adversity to the point that it perfectly satires everything in similar genres that annoyed me.

I like shorter series because I actually finish them for once, but this is a show i wouldn't mind if it was longer. Animation is nice and well done.Characters and story are interesting and humorous that keep me coming back to watch episode after episode.Story is very lighthearted, funny, and enjoyable.  If you're looking for something more serious, this definitely isn't it.  If you want something fun, I recommend this show.
