Finally after almost giving up hope on 2014, this one managed to shine.Plot , character and concept are engaging and compelling , each episode gives a edge of the seat experience.This isn't for the light hearted , it certainly has a more mature theme which probably explains it's lack of popularity as it isn't like the younger more colorful anime based for the childish audience. There is some light humor and wit mainly expressed by the spock like personality of Migi who speaks only with logic and do away with all human emotions, tied to the main character who is practically the opposition.Without giving any plot away as you can simply read it on wiki, this is certainly one of those titles you may not have heard of a hidden gem and a must watch.

A heartwarming tale of ruthless murder, senseless violence, and the timeless love shared between a man and his right hand. There's an odd charm about watching a bumbling teenage protagonist suddenly sprout eyeballs on random locations over his body, or seeing a man's head suddenly morph into a dozen razor-sharp knives. Jokes aside, this show offers some poignant insights into the human condition and what it means to be alive. It's certainly entertaining all around, and a real roller-coaster of emotion.Oh, Parasyte, I can't quit you!

Actually, I was hooked after the opening 10 seconds of the show. GULP. This show is badass and is currently my favorite of the season. And thank god it's not censored to hell and back like Terraformars. So thanks for not treating us like children with this anime, Crunchyroll!This show is great with the laughs, too. The bathroom scene killed me. Literally killed me. Then I was reborn like a phoenix from ashes to sing the praises of Parasyte!

I came to this anime without any expectations- all I knew is that I wanted to see something action packed and filled with gore. Ever since season 1 of Tokyo Ghoul was over, I was hungry for more bloody body ripping action, so here I am. At first, it seemed like a very weird opening but a couple of episodes in I'm already begging for more. The true fun doesn't reach until the middle of the season, so don't give up until then. -Excellent animation-Good music-One of the best character development ever-Exciting like no other.5 Stars!

An anime as well planned out and brilliantly written such as this one is a rare thing to come across. I'm happy to say that the mere existence of this anime restores much of the dying hope I have for the industry. I won't say much in this review, but I will give a specific example in the show that proves the story for this anime was written by someone who actually knows how to write a good story. *Spoiler for episode 4 & 5 ahead*Before episode 5, I questioned the director's choice to put such a blatantly obvious spoiler into the anime's opening. Specifically, the 2 seconds where Shinichi's mum is shown having red lines run across her face (symbolic of how most parasites morph their heads). Then in episode 4, a lot of focus was put onto Shinichi's new found tension with his mother. Back story and character development was given, and the bond Shinichi has with his parents (mostly his mother) was portrayed to be quite strong.Now I knew it was to set up the emotional distress that is to come once Shinchi's mother becomes a parasite (as suggested by the opening). I thought that being given this heads up would dampen the emotional impact of this incident should it occur. I was wrong. The director put that spoiler into the opening because he/she doesn't care if people figure it out. Because he/she knows that the scene was written out so well that even people who know what will happen will still be shocked by  how it happens. Shinichi's emotional reaction, the emphasis on the mother's scar, the fact that the father survives (this is confirmed by the next episode's preview). All very heavy hitting, even for those who knew something along this line would happen.That's how good this show is. Even if you get spoiled for a huge plot twist, it will still shock you when you see it for yourself.10/10

Like super powers? -Watch ParasyteLike weird stuff? -Watch ParasyteLike psychological stuff? -Watch ParasyteLike action? - Watch ParasyteLike crazy and intense fights? -Watch ParasyteLike seeing a hero saving his waifu? -Watch ParasyteLike awsome storylines? -Watch ParasyteLike Magical Girls shows? -You should STILL watch ParasyteLike watching a never ending anime? -Watch Parasyte; less fillers.Like sad moments? -Watch ParasyteLiked watching Parasyte? -Rewatch ParasyteDislike Parasyte? -I don't know what to tell you. You are not an ordinary human being,

This first episode is the kind that will get you hooked right away. I would say give it a try. As you can see from other reviews there has to be some truth to this. The only downside people seem to have with it is the small differences from the manga. I on the other-hand think Madhouse did a great job there. The manga character designs were a bit bland and didn't stand out in the manga and some scenes were completely changed, I think for the better. For example, there is a scene where someone gropes a young woman but in the manga it is much more vulgar, very classy Madhouse It's the kind of action horror show that will keep you wondering what will happen next and keep you glued to the screen the whole time.

This is about as honest a review as you're going to see. If you haven't seen this show yet, open the first episode right now and prepare for a roller-coaster. I wish I had watched this sooner as it has zero fan service, zero filler, minor amounts of monologue, intelligent and creative writing, compelling characters with good development balanced out with very well animated intense action sequences. Honestly what else do you want? Its 24 episodes that are going to leave you wishing there was more at the end but happy you made the journey. Binge this in 2-3 days (or one if you have that kind of time, you filthy animal) because you sure as hell aren't going to watch it slowly (cliff-hanger warning). The only warning I have is for those that are not fans of animated blood, as this show has its fair share. Its not overtly gross at any point, but could cause some discomfort if that's really not your thing. That being said, I think this is a great anime for people who have never watched anime, or have been life long fans of the art form.I'll definitely be coming back a year or two from now when I've forgotten most of the minute plot details it to re-experience this thrilling story.

It's very hard to give this series justice with a short review and without spoiling anything crucial, but I'll simply state that it is one of the best I've ever seen, very intriguing, greatly paced and emotionally engaging without cheap tricks and overly done cliches.It mixes sci-fi, horror and some emotional drama pretty much perfectly, making what could otherwise be a simple excuse for some action and gore into a moving story, that keeps you at the edge of you seat much of the time and makes you care deeply about the characters. It also never overstays it's welcome, leading the intrigue in a very consistent pace and ending on a very strong note. Even the brutality always seems to serve a purpose, enhancing the grim tone and suspense of the story, rather then being there as an end in itself. While I could get into more details, there's not point in doing so IMO. You should simply watch this series yourself, it's hard for me to imagine a type of viewer who would be disappointed with it.

.I am going to keep this review short and tight.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hide Just like your sister ^_^LOL, don't read spoilers. The villains are very interesting "people" and the main characters all behave rationally, never forcing you to suspend your disbelief in order to follow the plotline (which is a problem that is endemic in anime, I've noticed). This endeared me to the show very quickly. Furthermore, the love interest of the series actually has a long history with our protagonist, and isn't some random ditzy girl with magic powers... another departure from the typical anime cliche's that helped to win me over.The fight scenes are really good, with one or two exceptions, the drama is well delivered and not too predictable, and there are no cheesy tropes to distract you from the genuinely interesting story. All in all, I would say that this is the best show I've seen on Crunchyroll, yet. Fair Warning, to those who care: There is a fair bit of gore to it, even though I never felt that it was excessive, and the show isn't shy around adult-oriented sexual themes; TLDR: it's not for kids.

Imagine an anime adaptation of "Invasion of the Body Snatchers" with a bit John Carpenter's "The Thing" for good measure, and you get Parasyte, one of the most heart pounding and suspenseful series I have ever seen! Studio MADHOUSE brings Hitoshi Iwaaki's classic seinen manga from the late 80s and adapts it to a modern setting to tell a grisly horror tale about parasitic and cannabalistic aliens who burrow into and take control of a living being's brain, where they learn to adapt and survive in their new environment while preying upon innocent people. One of these Parasytes accidentally takes over the right hand of high school student Shinichi (voiced by newcomer Nobunaga Shimazaki), forcing him and his new "friend" Migi (voiced by Haruhi Suzumiya's Aya Hirano) to work together to fight against these cannibalistic creatures, all while desperately trying to keep Shinichi's new power a secret. With superb voice acting from talent including Kana Hanazawa, Miyuki Sawashiro, and Atsuko Tanaka, highly engaging and fleshed out characters, grisly animated fight scenes courtesy of MADHOUSE, suspenseful twists and turns that leave you at the edge of your seat in every episode, and a deep and meaningful story about life and the struggle for living things to survive on Earth, Parasyte is one hell of a ride from start to finsish and should definitely not be missed! WATCH IT!

Parasyte is a good sci-fi action drama with some borderline horror and gore elements.  The story concerns a boy, Shinichi, who's body is nearly taken over by a sentient parasyte.  In order to survive Shinichi forms an alliance with the creature to protect both their lives from the other invaders.  .From a story perspective Parasyte is fascinating.  The titular parasyte is named Migi, and is as alien in persona as it is physically.  The story covers the two characters' adventures and struggles and their growth.  BOTH Shinichi and Migi have character arcs over the course of the show, though owing to their limited knowledge it's unclear how much of their growth is from the side effects of their relationship, but clearly most of it is character growth.  .The story focus is very narrow so the plot takes on a bit of a monster of the week slash mystery adventure formula.  There are other parasytes that are antagonists, and other characters that are allies and still more that are somewhere in the middle.  There are mentions of bigger picture events going on elsewhere in the world but Parasyte keeps the focus on the two main characters.  .Production wise Parasyte is a treat.  Fluid animation, interesting and dynamic character designs, exciting fight choreography, and immersive music and Foley led me to marathon the show in two nights.  My only complaint is Shinichi's VA tended to deliver his lines in the same tone and cadence a lot, which got annoying and distracting.  It's true that at that point in the story Shinichi is subdued and feeling down a lot, but I don't think that's enough to account for the VA's droning performance.  .This leads me to my only real complaints about the show, which primarily is that Shinichi tends to over think problems and situations a lot, and it gets worse closer to the end of the show.  He spends a lot of time examining philosophical problems that are superficially deep but could easily have been answered with a google search.   He will come to a conclusion in one scene, and in the very next scene take the contradictory action.  It felt unnecessary, and a lot of the time the subject matter was trying to resolve moral equivalencies with the parasytes and the other animals and plants on Earth in relation to humanity, moral equivalencies that have no basis in logic or reason.  My other complaint is the show is a bit on the predictable side.  There were some scenes and characters that were just so obviously there to check a box and wring some emotion out of the viewer.  .All in all Parasyte is a great engrossing watch.  I wanted to ding it a star for my complaints but it's really good otherwise and it has a good ending so I changed my mind.  Give it a shot!

Packed with super gory action, from start to finish.  Even though it is mostly action, there are some touching moments that pull on the heartstrings. It was a very realistic and reasonable reaction to what would happen if aliens came to earth. Also handles topics such as "what makes a human, human? ", "What is love, and how does it affect the way that we and act?", " humans are destroying the earth by themselves, would it really be better off if these aliens wiped the entire population out?" " humans exhibit altruistic behavior, even though it is entirely irrational. Why is that?" Overall, spectacular show, and definitely one of my top ten.

I'm so glad I stumbled and gave this anime a chance. It's honestly one of the best I personally ever seen. The plot is very detailed and deep, often making the viewer question humanity's decisions and their impact towards the environment. Meanwhile, it's spearheaded by a very relatable and likeable protagonist. Every experience he goes through and his reactions of them is grounded and believable, which achieves sympathy from the viewer towards him. Although not as gory or bloody as the manga, the actions scenes are well done and deliver constant high-stakes moments. I did not find a dull moment in this anime, from the dialogue, fights and highly emotional moments, it keeps one's attention from start to finish.

I normally don’t go for serious genres or “horror” and decided to try this out, I was very pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed this. It was a bit of a slow start with some characters I didn’t like at first, but it got real good and remained that way up until the very end. This was the most fun I’ve had watching anime in quite some time!Very fun alien spooky anime drama. Had good drama and mystery and actual good characters that I enjoyed seeing progress and mess up.Shinchi and Migi are best bros, this made me think of the 2018 Venom movie, this was almost like a buddy-cop at times which only added to the fun for me.Almost(definitely) cried over a right hand, would watch again.

See kids, THIS is how you take a series of silent, static images and translate them into a TV show. It's not perfect, but it faithfully nails the mood and story of the original while translating it into a new medium, which is remarkably rare to see.I'm not going to gush over it, or explain in detail how every scene manages to avoid a lot of cross-media-translational traps and cliches, but I will recommend it highly.Oh, and yes, for those of you who have heard, the Dubsteppy Wub-Wub soundtrack actually fits very well: It's energetic and dire, just as the show frequently calls for. Stop trying so hard to convince everyone you're a music critic just because you listened to a classical radio station once and you might have some fun sometime!

Nothing has made me quite as stunned as Parasyte. The series left me at a complete loss of words to describe its quality, and though I feel many more series will do this over the years, Parasyte will always be the first one that did.Whether due to my over-fascination with the blood, gore, and body horror this show introduced, or because of the amazing story telling that made me want to finish it, I felt the overwhelming urge to do so. To stay up until unholy hours of the night to finish the series, to continue after cliffhangers, to allow myself to intake all of this show's glory at once.While I must admit nothing is truly perfect, in my honest opinion, Parasyte comes extremely close to being so. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThe love subplots with Kana chasing after Shinichi and what appears to be a fragile relationship between Satomi and Shinichi never really felt forced. The blood and body horror fell in my comfort zone, and didn't disturb me in the least. Migi quickly grabbed my attention the moment he appeared, Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideand when meeting Mamoru and Jaw I was extremely happy to see a Parasyte like Migi that (probably) wouldn't die. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideReiko, despite having been an antagonist at first, actually brought tears to my eyes upon her death. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideI felt Shinichi could be killed at any moment, despite his status as the main character. Gotou/Miki felt like a breath of fresh air; A character who was seemingly indestructable, a parasyte who couldn't even be killed by multiple gunshots directly to the head. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideUpon visiting the Wiki page, you find 4 pages worth of characters. Visiting the deceased section, you will find 2. Many a character dies during Parasyte, though most of their deaths added nicely to the story and didn't seem placed simply for shock value. I probably missed many, many points, but all in all, I believe Parasyte is an amazing series that anyone with a tolerance for blood and body horror should check out.

Let me start by saying that I'm not a fan of any one genera of anime in particular, watching anything from shonen, josei, mech, romance, action, comedy, you name it.This anime is extremely well written, animated and developed. The animation is top notch, with great attention to detail and movement. The character development of the main characters and side characters leave you wanting more, and loving and understanding them on a personal level. The core values brought to play through this series are astoundingly well portrayed. The plot is sound, with many twists to keep you wanting more.I binge watched this anime, start to finish in one afternoon and night lol and now I wish I had made it last! Must watch, instant top 10 list right here.

I think the series is extremly good, because in contrast to murderers/monsters/basicially anything which kills your own kind (from your own race, nation or whatever) often portrayed as mindless barbarians, this anime portrayes these monsters/parasytes as highly intelligent and rational.The anime also discusses different viepoints and asks phylosophic questions (for example what makes humans humans and what makes themselves different from animals and even parasites).11/10 why does this not have 500 episodes?

This anime was just recommended to me in passing by a friend, but I decided to watch it mostly out of a lack of other things to do. Boy was I surprised when I stumbled across such an amazing one! Lovable and funny characters, interesting philosophy, and some really, REALLY cool action scenes. The main characters go through very interesting and ever-changing development, all of the characters' drives are understandable and...well, relatable might be a bit of a stretch considering the nature of many of the characters, but regardless a very well-done anime!

The art, the story, the music, in it's totality is BEAUTIFUL!!! All mixed together with the daunting question of, what would happen if something did to humans what we did to animals. Not to mention, the un-expected friendship between mortal entities to go on this adventure with you. I laughed, I cried. This masterpiece has it all. 5 Stars straight up. Hooked from the start to the end.

The way everything develops, the story's so fast and yet, it goes exactly in the timeline that the characters are experiencing. Everything relates on the smallest level. Even the way the character's interact is unique! Some talk metaphorically, others simply, and sometimes its a jumbled mess you don't understand! Watching Parasyte is like watching a live action. It makes you want to stay in bed and hide and go out and kick some butt! The ignorance of some characters; how every single one had relatable flaws. Every single line makes you want to scream in agony, cry in defeat, it makes you want to re-evaluate being a human as a whole! Watching Parasyte, listening, the amount of emotion throughout everything is stunning! The development of everyone, the music. Everything! Watching Parasyte is like watching an old friend grow old, through their good and bad. Even when it's over, even when they're dead. You rethink everything.

Parasyte... Where do I begin. It's so unbelievably wonderful and so inimitable in the perfection of it's composition....Parasyte has it all:Romance: 10/10; the romance in this show is certainly prominent and relevant to the story, and develops nicely over the course of the series, yet it doesn't control the show nor the characters, and serves it's role perfectly.Action: 10/10; this show has INSANE action sequences that keep you on your seat, because every single one is both life-threatening and crucial. The fights are always lighting quick and precise, and the animators did a superb job getting it all together. This show is a good 1/5 action, and it is in perfect doses.Horror: 10/10; if I hadn't already given out several 10's earlier, this section would be the only ten. Parasyte excels at creating dread and horror. Particularly in the earlier parts, when much is still unknown, it really hits you hard. AN ACTUAL PLOT: 10/10; this show is a slow burner in the best sense. The episodes are fast paced and convey a lot of information without being expository, but it also takes it's time weaving together the threads of the world. If you want to be glued to your screen every step of the way, this is the show for you. Animation and Sound: 10/10; the animation is always crisp, and I never came across a single frame out of place or lazily done. Through and through, the animation is top-notch. The fights are made all the better by such excellent animation. Sound and music are the highlights of this show because the sound is so well mixed and applied that it amplifies all the emotions you're seeing without ever forcing the feelings upon you. It's the kind of music that makes you feel emotional when you listen to it after the show. The voice actors are all top quality as well, and convey all the perfect amounts (or lack, thereof) of emotion needed to set the tones of the scenes.I cannot recommend this show enough. PLEASE WATCH IT.

The plot of this anime revolves around Shinichi Izumi, a 17 years old boy who right hand was taken over by a parasyte which is later called "Migi". the parasyte tried to take control of the Shinichi's brain while he was sleeping and eventually matured in this right hand and the story continues with them coexisting and fighting other man-eating parasytes that took over a human host's brain. My thoughts and opinions: Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideWhen I first started watching this anime, I thought is was disgusting because not to the point where I wasn't interested in the anime anymore because it great cliffhangers that always made me want to see what happens next. When Shinichi Izumi began to change and evolve that when I started to really like this anime. When his mum died and the wanted to protect his father while trying to self discover and make sense of parasyte and human, I was caught. After watching it for a  while, I started to realised there are a lot of biological and psychological theories mixed into this anime, Like when Reiko Tamura protects the baby even she says she has no emotions towards the child and only gave birth to run test on her human child. Even her kinds is more logical and centered in their own lives  nevertheless she die trying to save her child. And a long time ago while I was studying biology I heard the developing theory that human may not be considered at mammals but as parasytes because we are the only organisms on Earth that destroys our surroundings as we moved other than parasites. Because as we discover new land, we tend to destroy it for civilization and we humans are the most evolved and intelligent species that will forever remain on the top of the food chain. I really broke my heart watching the part when Yamagishi and his squad tried to kill the parasyte but killed innocent humans just to achieve the goal. We called parasytes, monsters because they were killing humans for food source because Yamagishi and his squad killed innocent individuals to destroy parasytes for self-protection. How can we call them monster for killing our kind when we are also killing them and our own kind. This anime has somewhat made me to started questions humanity and whether we are parasites in disguise and what is means to be human. Or maybe humans and parasytes are one family and one species.

By far my favourite anime. It's just dark enough, the music is phenomenal, perfectly complementing the rest of the sound design. I can't say I understand spoken Japanese (no matter how much I wish I did), but the cast is good enough that I don't really need to. And that can be hard. The animation in this anime is incredible, designs are just as creepy and dark yet thought provoking simulataneously. I guess that's what you get when you convert a manga. Parasyte is actually an older manga, and -the maxim- modernises just the right places. The first time I watched this anime was when it was being simulcast. Man, the week-long wait was painful. The cliffhangars are in the perfect spot, and the main theme captures the feelings you have so well. There's only repeating in the intro when it's required, which is really nice because I hate hearing the same thing as it ended on every single episode (which many shows do!). I can't really describe it, but when I watched it the first time, I was almost in a depressed state, terrified of the final destination of the anime. Would it end okay? Going through it a second time, and seeing everything I missed the first time, whilst I had been focused on the main content, honestly, it makes me sincerely happy. If you haven't seen this anime yet, I highly, highly recommend it. This second time probably won't be the last time I come back to it.

I'm not a big anime watcher at all. I don't like a lot of the popular anime's. however this anime is different, there is an underline message that is objective so anyone can relate to it. The anime art style is very good i like the way it looks. There are no overly complex characters so its easy to follow them as they grow and develop. There is always an element of mystery with the parasytes even after watching the entire series there is still much to learn about them. Something as simple as there origin is unknown. With a story line that focuses on character development, understand and compromise it teaches you about the balance between human interest and the consequences of them.  Humans fear what they dont understand and parasytes feel humans are weak. however the parasytes learn that's not the case so they learn to compromise. Wish i could say more but the longer i write the harder it gets to not spoil so check it out for yourself.

I came into this series quite skeptical, but within the first few episodes I was attached. Given the name, it's obvious this show is about a parasite of mysterious origin, the hosts being human. It's inevitable given that outline that the boundaries and relationships between these two sentient beings will be explored, as they are with Shinichi, the protagonist, and his parasite, Migi. Parasyte is littered with brutality, psychological trauma, loss, and the aftermath of grief. It's a good insight into the adaptability and will of humans. You'd think the lines between butchers of the human race and their prey would be black and white, but this series will prove you otherwise.

SPOILERS!at the beginning of this show i was really excited to see how they would show the progression of humanity in migi as he developed as a character, but in fact, the total opposite happened.  as the show progressed it was thrilling to see the main character fall further and further away from humanity.  the only thing i want out of this anime is more.  but unfortunately that's not gonna happen

This is a really Awesome animes i loved it because of how intense it makes it. This animes gives me a mix of bursting feelings and they are both negative and good for exaple when someone dies in the animes and when someone lives or helps someone else i enjoyed watching it. I would love to see a season 2!! This animes is really good i suggest watching it its easy to finish it wont take that long but even if it does who cares its worth it Good luck if you do watch it.

The premise is clever, the show rotates around a solid theme, and the animation is good. But, I really feel like the pacing of the show jerked and lurched through its 24 episodes. Sometimes a character would evolve suddenly, unexplainably adapting to their new reality with little discussion.  Sometimes they would resist basic knowledge in ways that seemed implausible. Small details get explained in great detail, while sweeping and important events occur between lines of exposition. It's fun, the fight scenes are cool, and the show's point about humanity's arrogant and self-important view of itself at the top of nature is important, but I think a few more episodes and some better scriptwriting would've made this work really sing.

Parasyte is definitely on my top 10 list of favorite animes. This anime will take you on a roller coaster of emotions. +Engaging story line always keeping you hooked with perfect cliff hangers, and very excellent plot line. +Interesting characters that are lovable. This anime also has amazing character development and the pace of it is great. Even the antagonists are interesting.+incredible animations, very modern, it sets a standard for what animation should be like. +contains lots of tense and thrilling moments5/5 "ITS A MASTER PIECE"-Dunkey

I'm truly sad that this is only one season long. I truly am. But I cannot complain. This anime opened my eyes to horror and sci-fi anime. I watched every episode of this as soon as they were released. Could not get enough of it! Just enough gore, romance, and suspense. It's really a masterpiece. And the word of the live-action movie based on it has made me even more excited. A really wonderful concept, executed beautifully. Good-job to whoever made this anime possible.

Easily one of my favorites since Attack on Titian.  The only way I could see it improving is if it were more horror rather than action.  Parasites make an excellent monster when you normally get rehashes of Zombies, Vampires, or Werewolves parasites are original intimidating and you can make them anything.  Unfortunately through out the series I was never scared which means to me it fails at horror.  But succeeds in every other area.

From the metal intro to the secretive murder investigations, this show gives off a strong Death Note vibe without appearing like a knockoff or clone. The protagonist Shinichi pared with the antihero parasyte Migi make a really interesting and lovable pair. Key points:Plot: 10/10Character Development: Shinichi Izumi: 10/10Migi: 7/10Satomi Murano (love interest): 4/10Kana Kimishima (other possible love interest): 6/10Reiko Tamura (antagonist): 9/10Gotou (antagonist): 8/10Miki (antagonist): 3/10Artwork: 8/10Voice Acting: 10/10Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideAbility to end practically every episode other than the last two with extreme cliffhangers: 100/10

This anime called Parasyte the maxim, is in my opinion an amazing production because of the action the drama the horror and even a love story are in a next level. Migi is a parasite that didn't succeed at going to the head of his victim. Migi and Izimi have to face many other parasites not so friendly that devour people to survive.This Anime is a must watch to people that loves from everything a little.This anime got me and i enjoyed watching it One Love _ Jose Moreno

I might like this more than Death Note... which says a lot because Death Note was my favorite anime. So far it's going great (hasn't ended yet | new episodes still airing) and every new episode has been unique and unpredictable. This is a very logical and thought proving anime that delves a little into philosophy.The whole parasyte concept is really interesting because they're so mysterious, you aren't given much information on how the parasites came to be (so far). The parasites need to kill in order to remain alive so you can't really blame them and dismiss them as evil because their killing isn't frivolous but sometimes it is, like any human there are good and bad people or in this case parasites. Just watch the first episode and you'll be hooked.

I've only been watching anime for 2 years.But if I had to say which one was my favorite....well, I think you can guess (the reason I'm writing this review :D). This show just appealed to me. The setting, the humor, the characters, the bad>ss parasytes, the gore, the feels...seriously not even AToT was this good (brace the fandom). Really though, watch this. If visceral, brutal action, shape-shifting aliens, and romance  aren't your cup of tea, then...I dunno, watch it anyway. Parasyte: the maxim is that awesome.

I thought the character development was a bit slow in the beginning but ohhhh mannnn it got so intense!!! The episodes now feel like 2 min long, Its over and it feels like I just started it! I watch A LOT OF ANIME, I have a problem in a good way Im recommending this because it stands out and is obviously among the best. I even wrote a review on it. I don't usually write review... another thing, it has a great opening and ending song and amazing soundtrack.

This anime is seriously stunning! Amazing visuals, gorgeous animations, exquisite gore and a super captivativing storyline! This is definitely a MUST watch! If you have a light stomach or have slight problems with gore then this anime is a little bit off the chart. But don't let that stop you! Aside from gore this anime has a beautifully writen storyline and has alot of epic moments that will leave you shocked!

Those five stars don't come easy.  We see the protagonist develop from a bookworm wimp into a beast of a fighting machine, all the while the challenges he faces continue proving ever more difficult to win against.  There are game-changing revelations that completely change the power dynamics and battle tactics, for better or worse.  Expect weekly cliff hangers in this show, leaving eager anticipation for next weeks' episode.  There is never a dull episode in this series.

Imagine one day at night a bug crawls into your body and tries to take over you brain?Now what if it only partially succeeds?You wonder what's going on with this guy? Watch as he is shaped and molded by his own decisions, his interactions with multiple characters, and huge life altering events.Drama, Action, Comedy, Sci Fi, and so much more. Well balanced and not desperate for your attention. This show will keep your interests with each passing episode.

When i saw the start of this anime i was admittedly a bit skeptical. As the first two episodes progressed However it became a bit more interesting.  Episode one to me was filled with a much softer lighter touch with it's comedic bits. As the first episode finished I admit I wasn't overly convinced so I started to watch the second episode. The second episode started to delve more into character development and a bit of plot development than just character introduction like the first seemed to be which i was pleased to see. It was also nice to see that we got to see some plot development forming in this episode. After that buckle up, because the emotional roller coaster is starting up and it looks like it's going to keep going as long as the series does! As the cover art shows you have your action, and of course like in the first episode you have bits of comedy in there that will make you laugh. It also has that lovely air of mystery as things progress leading the viewer wondering just what's going to happen next (ahh properly done cliffhangers). As a girl I loved the romance that develops in it (don't worry everyone you see the makings of it in the first couple episodes). And OMG the sad parts!!! yes.. there are sad parts.. there are plenty of moments that will tug at your heart strings, and some that will make you want to reach into your screen or tv and bash a person in the face. (like i said emotional roller coaster). Overall I must say I am thoroughly hooked and looking forward to sticking along for the ride. This girls not going anywhere.

I hadn't heard of Parasyte before stumbling across it on Crunchyroll, but I'm glad I found it, because it's hands down one of the best shows on the site, and probably one of the top 3 animes of 2014/2015.The animation and art style are well done, and the main characters are fleshed out and developed. The shows are paced very well and most of the episodes have few, if any lulls or dull spots. That's not to say it's overly action heavy, but that even the milder or tame conversation areas seem interesting and draw you into the show more.I'd try to compare it to a similar show to say 'If you liked X you'll like Parasyte', but there really isn't another series like it. There are aspects that are similar to Guyver, Xam'd or other alien animes, but they're just genre similarities and Parasyte stands on it's own. Definitely in the quality range of a Cowboy Bebop, Macross Plus, Code Geass or similar shows.

Unlike most other anime series the last couple of seasons, this one is actually enjoyable to watch. It has it's own style and belongs to a smaller and more interesting genre, not like the other cliché mecha/harem bullshit ripoffs that Japan has been barfing out lately. Parasyte also manages to pull of the gore without making it feel like a desperate attempt to cover a dull story. I was about to give up on anime for a while but Parasyte brought me back in.

When I picked up the show at 2 episodes released I was a little skeptical about it, but it drew me in quickly, and is now the anime i most look forward to releasing each week. The horror/action/thriller theme isn't usually what I go for, but it works out really well. The main character develops quickly out of the whiny phase (thank god), unlike most other similar shows, and the character development in general is frankly amazing all around. The show starts to make you question what being human means, and how we deal with atrocities that happen. For the sake of his survival, the main character has to lose some of what makes him human, while others seem to gain it throughout the series. Frankly this is one of my top 5 by far, and it's not over yet. There's only one downside: This show is amazingly good at cliffhangers. Literally every episode. Prepare yourself!

I've been reading the manga, so I have a bit of insight on this. I read a lot of Isekai, and this ranks higher on the list than most. I'll try and avoid any spoilers.MC is a very relatable character and his decisions make sense. He's not a depraved pervert, but he's not naive either. He attracts some younger companions, but as he says in the first episodes, is not a lolicon. He's more of a father figure and prefers taking advantage of brothels and tavern wenches to touching his companions. He's also intelligent and curious about magic.The world isn't such a nice place. Racial discrimination and human trafficking, which can provide a greater sense of realism. Magic is powerful but not so commonplace that everyone can use it. There is plenty of exploration in the story. The MC is not so weak that he has to grind or stick around any one place. This is a good series if you like adventure. Author is good a paying attention to the detailsLooking at the anime specifically, I personally like the pacing so far. Design is a bit different from the manga, but the animation quality is top notch. I'm looking forward to future episodes.

I feel like I spent most of this anime waiting for something to happen. I am one of the fools who love Isekai. It is one of my favorite genres. This one just bores me. Feels like each time something exciting is going to happen and the plot is going to start, they go shopping and eat all of the wonderful meats. Yea meat! I love meat as much as the next guy, but I need more than watching children eating meat in my anime. Then they top it off with discussing a play or telling a character's backstory and I am stuck thinking, "I wish I was watching that anime." At this point, I am more "hate-watching" the anime. The animation is fine, I think the world has interesting potential. Just wish the main character was more interesting or something, anything, for the love of God anything, was happening.

the biggest problem in this anime, same as it is in the manga, is that the main character is the least interesting character in the story. I get the concept, but it's an over saturated market in which all this has to offer is a slightly different kind of harm.The big problem is that because the MC can master any skill as it shows up, any dramatic event that happens is going to be moot. He is a demi-god, were little to nobody can actually challenge him, yet the story acts like your normal fantasy.The strong points of this story is going to be the supporting cast, as we will get to see them grow as characters, in which the MC acts like a mentor. the setting as well is a good aspect of the story, mainly relaxed with short spurts of action, all around fun.Overall this is a power fantasy anime, and one where you can find it done better elsewhere.

Despite basically bringing nothing new to the table, this anime is likely to do well because it does a loved concept in a way that doesn't scare anyone off. You probably won't find a moving story, characters with depth, or any sort of realism, but strangely that seems to be a strength of the show. There is so little going on that you can kinda turn your brain off and just watch things happen. The constant acquisition of titles, items, and skills is strangely relaxing and enjoyable. The writer pays attention to detail, so you actually get to experience how the skills and items he acquires affect the experience. While I appreciate the casual atmosphere this creates, I'm still not going to call this show anything better than average though. This show would be made better by either focusing on being casual and relaxing or wish-fulfilling, rather than trying to be both. These paper-thin plots get in the way of just watching someone gathering skills and friends. For example, did anyone at all care about the demon lord? It was more entertaining to watch the protagonist level up his NPC companions. For example, does the protagonist's obsession with not being found at as OP conducive to wish fulfillment. These elements get in the way of each other because this anime is unfocused, which prevents me from giving 4 stars. So, final verdict, it doesn't do anything extremely wrong, but you will definitely feel like you've seen this one before. I recommend not taking it too seriously as active thought will probably ruin the fun. 3 stars.

I genuinely liked the slow pacing of this anime for the most part. No overarching plot, no desperate mission to save the world, no grand mission. He's just a normal person, not a hero but still with the basic morals of our world. The rather aimless nature of each episode actually drew me into the world even more. I must admit the harem-but-not-a-harem is a bit weird at first but the show really stresses how he feels protective of them and doesn't want to lay a finger on them. All in all, a relaxing anime centred around taking things slow and as they come.

I expected an over the top wish-fulfillment anime going into it and that's what I got.It had enjoyable elements and promising plot points but as its gone on its devolved, for me, into a-harem-that's-not-a-harem-but-totally-is far too quickly.I feel they introduced too many characters who seem to be there just to check a box on the harem list instead of being actually meaningful in anyway. There are too many characters to divided development on and its detrimental to every character and the plot at once.Also the animation and art quality fluctuates and has dropped more and more as the series goes on.I had to drop it.

In the age of anime we live in where everything has to have some deep philosophy behind it or be some kind of new revolutionary idea for the medium I think people are getting a little too tight ass about shows lately. I avoided this specifically for all the hate it had but I doubt any of them sat past the first 2 episodes. I'm glad I just got bored today and decided to binge this. I'm not saying this show is something amazing I just think it's not as bad and a "disgrace to the industry" some of these Anime youtubers say it is. That being said if you get your information and taste of anime from these people who quite frankly have sticks up their ass and don't watch enough stuff in general to be experts on anything than you have some other issues to work out. I simply enjoyed the watch and would honestly not mind a season 2. People compare this character to kirito but there are some fairly drastic differences in personalities. Also while people consider this a harem it's really not considering the main character see's them as an extended family and treats them as such. He literally mentions it multiple times he is their guardian and does not make advances. Not to mention the girls aren't really in love with him ( except one obviously lmao ) they are all young and pretty much look to him like a father figure. In fact, the MC literally goes out to get laid multiple times in the show at brothels lmao and is not even remotely ashamed about it. I think it was a refreshing take on the genre ( although he MMO aspects were weak ) and wouldn't mind more. From what I hear anyway the source material is actually quite good the anime was just fast-paced and shaved off a lot of detail. That's not really their fault it's just how seasonal shows work now.

After finishing the season, I have to modify my stance a bit. While I've found most of the series enjoyable, especially the opening episodes, the later down the line it became much more stale and fanservice'y, going only slightly above In Another World With my Smartphone. In general:+ The RPG setting and gamey touches were consistently fun and creative.+ The adventure/exploration stuff was humorous and fun to watch throughout the season.But...- The slave harem was becoming progressively more creepy (and simply too big - no place for character development in such a crowd).- The protagonist's heroics killed his neutral stance from the beginning of the series and pretty much ripped any interesting grow potential out of him.- The ending was very much a sequel-bait and didn't even start developing the main intrigue/challenge.In general, I think the show devolved into being very generic after a fine start, but was still something I very much enjoyed watching. If you're looking for something borderline dumb, but well-produced and relaxing, you can count on this series to deliver - just don't expect action.------------------------------------So, this show gets a lot of extreme reactions, so I will offer my stance on it, mostly referring to things people dislike about it and why I disagree with their assessments. Before that I will just say that I don't think this is a super high-quality show, but I will argue that it's an immensely enjoyable power fantasy that makes great use of its (very literal) RPG setting - it's an adventure within a video game and a very relaxing/fun one at that. So, to the people's complains:1. The protagonist is absurdly OP: Yes, he's basically a cheater within a game. A demi-god of sorts. However, he's not someone who wants to be a hero or a villain - having escaped his previous, miserable life, he looks for adventure, opportunity to explore and enjoy the new world that opened to him. It's a casual, "boring" motivation, but one that I personally really enjoy.2. The protagonist have slaves and don't free them, and the show paints him as the good guy: Yes, the protagonist has a "slave harem" of sorts and don't even consider freeing any of them at this point. Is it wrong? Probably. Does it go against how the protagonist is portrayed here? Not really. He, in the end, acts for selfish reasons. He has nearly unlimited power and will help people when he has an opportunity (as it costs him nothing), but if having slaves benefits him, he'll keep them. If he thinks they're better off with him then on their own, he won't give another thought about the moral implications of it all. After all, he's not a hero. He's a guy that wants to build a life for himself in a foreign world and will take full advantage of the opportunities that lie before him.3. Action is poor/there's not much action: Yes, but that's not the point of the show. This show is about exploring a new world and adventure. That part, in my opinion, is very enjoyable. But if you're looking for action-packed fantasy series, it's simply not for you.4. It was done so many times, is there even a point to it?: That's a valid point. This series got a lot of heat for being iterative and it's hard to really argue with that - its only advantages over utter trash such as In Another World with my Smartphone are better writing and very extensive, consistent references to game mechanics and the artificial nature of its world (I think it's done better here than any other isekai show I've seen so far). But it's enough for me. In the end, it's a pretty subjective thing. But I definitely believe the harshest criticisms this show gets are misguided. For me, it's an absolute blast, even if I'm very well-aware of its questionable elements and shortcomings.

I thouroughly enjoyed the beginning up until the dragon-thing appeared that was attacking the city. When that happened I was like "oh boy, something interesting is about to happen!", but nothing did happen. I really wanted to see the protagonist use his O.P. skills to overcome a great evil or struggle... or at least fight some more monsters.... Instead he uses them to make a harem of slave girls .  I liked the opening so much that I gave it a chance, but it was just so boring! I felt like I was always waiting for something to happen, and for the paper-thin plot to thicken. However, rather than that happening, the anime got worse. Instead it attempts to fuse three genres in a terribly unsuccessful way laying waste to the plot. If you like harem anime or slice of life, this  is mediocre at best. If you like action and plot, don't bother watching past episode one or two.

If you are looking for an anime with lots of in depth plot, this is NOT it. If you don't like harems same deal, steer clear.Personally, I would almost call this a fantasy slice of life, with a few episodes of action mixed in. Overall the anime is forgettable but enjoyable. watching this weekly, it was not an anime I was waiting to the minute for; instead, this was an anime I would just relax and turn off the ol'thinker to watch. That's not saying you have to or you should, but you can.Without giving spoilers, this is an anime that sees the standard in many anime and just meets it without going over or under. watching it some times gave me a chuckle, some times gave me a "oh that's neat" or "that's cool I guess" but it was never broke course or the mould (not necessarily a bad thing)Should you watch and Finish it?If you like a relaxed anime, watch it and see how you feel. no need to finish it if you don't want.

Boring, poorly-executed cookie-cutter isekai harem show with bland characters and no plot to speak of. The protagonist is 29, but gets shoved into the body of a teenager so that it's somehow okay when he talks about how big a 13 year old girl's breasts are (don't worry, folks, there's an entire scene in the first episode dedicated to how much he's totally not a lolicon). He literally buys some of the harem girls as slaves, and doesn't set them free, because apparently Satou thinks slavery is just fine as long as it's happening to children who will later try to seduce him.The art is bad and low-budget. The character designs are boring, with Satou looking completely identical to every other protagonist in the entire genre. The music is bad, when there's music at all. The plot has absolutely no stakes or tension, because Satou is so unbelievably overpowered that no possible situation can cause him any problems that he won't resolve in seconds with his godly skills. The game mechanics in the setting make absolutely no sense. The OP is a badly-sung song over a cheaply-made animation. It's a harem show where five of out the seven or eight girls are actual, literal children. The setting is visually ugly, conceptually boring, filled with overdone cliches, and revealed almost entirely through dull exposition. None of the characters have any personalities, instead just wandering around smiling blankly and going shopping while insinuating that they all have crushes on the equally boring protagonist.I genuinely can't think of a single positive to put in here, even in the interest of fairness. This is the worst show of the season, please don't waste your time with it.

I really wanted to like this show... but it ended up being just another utterly boring harem anime. While I love the isekai genre, this show does nothing to move the genre forward. Instead it follows the same formulaic system: start off OP, doesn't do much with it, collect girls, wander around aimlessly. Yawn. The MC is as dull as a stack of concrete blocks. For someone who starts off extremely OP and with the mind of a 29-year old, would it be so incredulous to believe that he'd just start off slaying some serious mobs and getting stuff done, like freeing slave girls? I don't. And god, it's sooooo boring!! This show is so boring! Slice of life shows have better plots and more excitement than this crap.

I loved the show. The pacing was nice. Its and rpg setting. So it's more about exploration then action which I fully enjoyed. the harem didnt bother me because it's not really a harem, not that I havnt watched or harem or have a problem with them. He has all these women  but to him they are family like sisters or daughters which I really like because it kinda changes it up a little bit. The Mc is overpowered but he isn't focused on anything but exploration, he dont care about making a name for himself. Also the Mc is relatable he helps because he wants to, but will take advantage of what he can within his moral reasoning. I really hope they make another season soon. I have watched this show twice over and still love it. Hopefully they next season will be longer. Also to those who dont like the show, that's totally cool if it's not your thing, but please dont ruin and slander something that we all like. The point on anime is to escape from the norm and enjoy something new. So please dont make bad reviews

I'm really not a fan of the magic and swords type anime. Even though I did enjoy SAO and some of the offshoots. This gets 5 stars for being unique. I can't tell you how often I find myself yelling at the TV "NO YOU IDIOT, DON'T DO IT" and then later, frustrated when the characters are surprised by whatever outcome became of the foolish action.That said, there was none of that in this show!!! The MC was very likable. He's slightly older which is a nice stab at the "life ends after high school" mindset of most animes. And with his age he expressed an enduring level of self control and wisdom in his actions. Instead of being hormone driven and constantly bewildered by circumstances, he goes through a logical process of thought while selflessly considering his companions. Extremely refreshing, very enjoyable, thoroughly entertaining and great artwork and plot. I'll probably end up watching it again. (which I rarely do)I'd like to see more MC like this one.

like the title says, i feels like one giant prologue to a show that is trying to get off the ground, but didnt get enough episodes to fully tell the story it wants to tell. not to say it doesn't deserve it, because i really believe this show is unique from a lot of other anime i've seen. the protagonist feels like a genuine character (with actual morals) and the characters that follow him around feel less like a harem and more like an evergrowing family (to me anyway)i really don't understand why this show has a harem tag because this really doesn't feel like a harem anime at all, which feels like a dis-service to label this show so, when it's actual so much more than that.in short i hope this show gets a second season because i would really like to see what the story is capable of doing after it's first 10 episodes of setup.

Just one star seems a bit low, but two is more than I would like to give it, let say I give it 1.5 stars.Concept seemed at least enjoyable at the start, the first episode having some funny moments, but the slow pacing crept up real fast and drag the show down to its knees.Now we see the protagonist doing sweet nothing, while he meets new lolis/waifus every other episode or so and then recruits them in his own personal loli crew. There is so many different loli/waifu types, it's like he's trying to become the pokémon master of lolis/waifus. He got some furry lolis, a slave loli, an elf loli, a sexual deviant loli and a zombie waifu, not counting the warrior waifu which will inevitably join him at one point or another. They waste so much time on the lolis, they finally just got the cart they have on the promo picture on episode nine.And a "Death March" my ass. They have been standing in the same city since the second episode. A better title would be "Death Layover".Also the creator of this has absolutely no idea how to design a game. There's way to many different skills, he probably has a skill to master before he can wipe his ass properly.I don't even know why I am still watching at this point. I sincerely hate this show. I just don't know how much worse it can get, but this is the only thing the show deserves every time, at least.

Please Note This first three episode only cover the prologue and up the introduction of the Seiyruu City arc as well as the introduction of the labyrinth exploration in Seiyruu city in the first Light Novel ( PACING PICKS UP IN EPISODE THREE A LOT COMPARED TO SOURCE MATERIAL) Having read the first three Light Novels I didn't know what to expect with the first episode going into this and I was really surprised.Everything in terms of the animation was excellent to the opening/ending which seem to suit the show really well for those looking for something a bit different in the isekai genre this really is not a normal copy paste isekai. The first two episodes have done an excellent job taking the source material ( the light novels/web novels ) and adapting them into the show though they did cut out the Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hidebath scene for those into fan service. the next couple episodes will be leading into the introduction of the slaves that were briefly shown in the market each of which have an adorable personality whilst depending on how much is adapted the girl who had the exiled princess title may be making her appearance as well later.

This anime had so much potential but they throw it out the window and make it a harem anime. This story is stupid. This was made to appeal to lonely losers who can't get a girlfriend. They could of made this into anime like log horizon. Anytime something awesome and exciting is about to happen, they writer was like "Nope! Meaningful story or actions are overrated. We need more harem, where the main character can't make up his mind of what girl he want to be with". Any meaningful plot or event in this anime that actually happen, it is only there to introduce a new love interest and it feels very lazy. They created an awesome world but don't know what to put into it. Just give me the writer's job and I can write a story thirty times better than this mess.
This was short lived, need alot more please. dkjfnvowjfvn9iqn

Nothing at all new or groundbreaking here, but in the case of Death March to the Parallel World Rhapsody, that doesn't end up being an enormous negative. Everything about this series, from the art to the character design, is very well done. There isn't a ton of action, so that might turn some people off, but I found each episode to be very nice and relaxing. DMttPWR doesn't try to be anything more than a pleasant escape to a fantasy world, and in that regard, it serves admirably.

This was kind of a bummer for me. I was excited to see this was getting an anime originally but the obvious lack of money/quality and excessive lightening of the story made this pretty rough to watch. The light novel was already extremely light because of how crazy op the mc was and, unfortunately, they still went ahead and turned this mc into some boring af saint here. In the LN/WN he was insanely OP but still admitted he wan't able to save everyone, even to the point of being apathetic at times (didn't want to spend his ever waking moment saving people so he actually allow quite a bit of death to happen around him). He was also generally pessimistic and a frequent patron of brothels. Honestly, I don't think they could have made this story or these characters any more bland than they did in this anime. - 2.2/5

To get it out of the way, yes this is yet another transported to another world where the hero is overpowered show.  That being said, I really enjoyed this one. In particular, the heroes interaction with the world through the menu.  It connected the character to the game world in a way that a lot of shows miss.  It also served as a creative plot device throughout the series.  The action is pretty minimal and rather anticlimactic, but that seems to be its intent.  It is closer to a slice of life anime with isekai overtones.I hope they continue the anime, but it doesn't look like there is a lot of hope.

As a reader of the the web novel this adaption falls far short in comparison. It's like they changed it so that nothing bad could possibly happen so that Satou would be more perfect as if he wasn't completely willing to go to certain establishments in the web novel but seemed to feel guilty about it in the show. I understand that this was adapted from the manga that was adapted from the light novel, which itself was adapted from the web novel and that is bound to change how the story plays out to some degree. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideBut it removes all death from the early parts rejecting the concept that satou can't possibly NOT save everyone. On top of all that, much of the slower parts seemed to be excessively dragged out while many of the fight scenes or other important parts seemed to be glossed or made to be so short as to be completely anticlimactic. I understand that as a level 310 being his fights should be over with quickly,  but it seemed short none the less. Finally, I understand that it's a cooking anime, but the enjoyable parts of cooking shows are never people eating the food (except maybe food wars if you're into that kind of thing), but rather making it something that was again changed from the web novel. the show seems to spend an inordinate amount of time on how he thinks unimportant dishes are made.  In short as a huge fan of the story I was hugely disappointed by the anime adaption that I probably wouldn't have finished if it weren't for the fact that I was a fan. That said I'm hopeful for a season 2 as the best arcs in the story are still yet to come.

Taken on its own, this is a standard enough isekai OP MC. If you liked smartphone, this is a lot like that.As someone who's read the (translated) web novel, though, it feels like a step down? In the WN, the protag is generally clever, and efficient, and wins in a lot of cases through taking the initiative and making a decisive early move from the shadows. Here it seems like he spends a bunch of time dealing with the actions of shitty people, not the other way around. In general, it seems like his character in anime got eviscerated, prob to show off how strong he is because he can just brute force problems (and yeah ok that demonstrates how powerful you are, but it isn't exactly interesting) or to emphasize how ridiculous his harem is (true in WN too but with text you can just skip the parts that get boring to read).Dunno, feels less compelling following an MC who isn't smart in addition to powerful. If anime MC was real I'm not sure he deserves his power, in the WN he does (...mostly).

The first episode gave me the impression that this would be a show where the MC goes on great adventures. Instead, he ends up with an ever-growing underage harem, and for some reason still manages to get into trouble and fight some monsters.They at least tried to give some of the cast a bit of character and backstory. I guess if you're into Moe you'll have a good time watching this. For me this was a bit too much and it started to annoy me.If you want to watch a show without ever worrying for the main character (except maybe how he's going to feed and clothe so many growing girls), this fits the bill.

Our main character Ichirou Suzuki, a 29 year old programmer, is on a death march to make the release date on War World”a rpg game. After working nonstop for awhile, he  then falls asleep at his desk and finds himself in the world of the game, alone in a wasteland under attack by an army of typical video game lizard men. He then realizes he is a very high level and takes them out no problem at all. He decides its best to hide his level from players and attempt to live peacefully. Unfortunately things do not turn out the way he planed, as the games overall story catches up to him. This anime gives me feeling of nostalgia for sword art online, I love the character dynamics reminds me of the best of that series with its own spin on the platform it draws from being a fantasy world. Do give this a try if you are into fantasy anime you might be pleasantly surprised how refreshing this show is compared to those who came before it. It really comes down to this simple fact you ether like it or don't, I loved the first episode and what it set up for us for future episodes. Look forward to a full in depth review once the series comes to a full close, but for now this did entertain me. Episode 1: 8/10

I had been sitting on this one as it didn't seem all that interesting after watching the first episode. Harem anime are not my thing, and, when this premiered, I was a little tired of the Isekai genre. Now, almost 2 years since it premiered, I took the time to watch it and found it quite enjoyable.Less of a harem and more of a gaggle of girls collected over time. Each adds a little bit to the group and make it very homey feeling (Even if a couple of them really want to 'get down' with the MC, who stops them at each opportunity).Story is interesting for the most part, has a few slowdowns.Definitely needs a second season. While this first season was a nice taste into the world and the characters, a second season could flush out characters more and continue/complete the story, making this a more rounded out anime, instead of an unfinished piece of work.Would give this a 3.5/5 if CR did half stars.

I some knowledge of the series as I have read the manga and most of the WN and the only thing I can think of that would have made this show better is if they extended it to a two cour show.In most cases, people say that this show lack action and also it feels as if it was leading to something and just ends and they aren’t wrong. This show feels as if it was cut off since the show ends with the protagonist, Satou, finally starting his new journey and really not accomplishing much. In term of the whole story, this section of the story really only is the intro to the show. If I was to use the anime naruto as an analogy, the show ends on the journey to the land of wavers and this is before they run into the two ninjas that think they killed Kakashi and before naruto make the vow to never turn back and hesitate. Where the two cours would help the show is the fact that, just like the naruto analogy, the story really starts with the next arc. The story up to then was just the intro and from then on the actions and the story really picks up. It’s the fact that the story is still in the introduction of the story that makes it an average rated show.At least these are my thoughts of what would have made this show so much better.Even so, this is still one of the shows that I find my self watching multiple times as it is short and enjoyable.This is an isekai where protagonists is OP when compared to the average adventurer (even demon lords). The world he is put into is a familiar one as it is the world of games he has worked on except there are changes as he finds out that the world he is now in isn’t as fictional as the games he makes. Satou also finds himself building a harem of young girls( even though he isn’t a loli) and trying to find way to enjoy his time in the new world he is in.

So, i am going to star with saying that i am a fan of the isekai genre and i pretty much watched every isekai anime that is out there. This anime is very good, it has good animations and an interesting concept as such as the companions, but the MC is straight up  trash, he is too soft and his voice in my opinion ticks me off. If the MC was a little bit tougher and if he had another voice actor then this anime would've been 10/10

Death March to the Parallel World Rhapsody was a surprisingly entertaining show which had me binge watching it due to its likable characters and relaxing tone.  While not genre redefining in any way, this show is a casual fantasy trip/wish fulfillment adventure with a main character who is self aware and funny enough to not be insufferable.  The surrounding harem is full of sweet and easy to root for individuals that covers the spectrum of archetypes.  Most of these harem members are actually treated with a lot more respect and platonic love than I was expecting from a show in this genre, and I would say that overall the harem at hand is a lot more wholesome.  Most of the dynamics in the group are rooted in admiration, adoration, and appreciation, rather than raunchy sex appeal.  There isn't eye popping levels of action or animation in this show, but I don't think that was this series's intention from the get go.  In my opinion, DMttPWR set out to be an easy to watch, low stress, give-you-a-fuzzy-feeling style retread of a common setting with lovable characters and a relatable MC who uses his powers to please his underprivileged harem members, rather than be an OP edge lord.  As someone who consumes a lot of shows in this sub-genre of anime, I'm glad that I got around to watching this show, and I can see myself returning to this series in the future when I'm in need of something to decompress with in between more intense and emotionally/mentally draining titles.

I was not going to review this anime, but as I found myself at the end I could'nt help but want to full-heartedly recommend this anime. Its plot is familiar within the whole magically transported into a game genre yet it pleasantly separates itself from becoming a cliche on the genre. The characters are easily loveable and the protagonist, while seemingly like so many Hero-esque anime characters, also gives a different offering on his persona and demeanor. If you like Magic, Medieval and RPG type animes youll enjoy this one.

It's a cute series with cute characters but ultimately I feel like it's kinda just a meh take on Isekai. There are some good things, but ultimately it's just an okay one so far, at least for me. Still I hope there will be a season 2 with more things happening, although I didn't mind that much it's peaceful and slower pace. Overall I'd give it a 7/10 or a 3.5/5. Cute but a bit bland. Also at least it's not Isekai Cheat Magician, so that's a plus.

It's an Isekai so you should know the premise already and this is also a harem anime as our hero saves many girls from slavery and befriends others. I really enjoyed this and it was fun to watch can only hope theirs more to come. It does have a bit of teaser fan service the English dub is real good and has interesting characters and magic powers. I'm giving a low 5 on here an a 8 on a 10 scale. I'd recommend it.

It's pretty standard when it comes to isekai, but the plotlines are relatively believable, the characters make reasonable decisions, the animation isn't too bad, and while the action sequences tend to lack emotion, it's the interactions between the characters that really make this anime what it is. The entire point of this anime is to have something to go "Awwwww" to every time you pull it up. It's just cute for cuteness' sake and a good show to unwind to.

Honestly, really awful. Not that I was looking for something with a particularly 'deep' philosophical meaning, just something that made sense. Half of the story lines are randomly introduced and not fully satisfied. There's extremely little development for anything going on. The 'romance' is lukewarm and seems like a throw in, which I honestly could have done without entirely. Also, the MC is supposedly overpowered but does VERY little to live up to that. I know he's trying to keep it under wraps and doesn't want to stand out, but for the level he is at compared to those he faces, seems like he has way too difficult of a time.

Anime has tons of Potential and i really am looking forward to a season 2! If they try making a season 2 they will blow up harder then sao. I love how he was so kind but the only downside is there wasn't too much action. Also even tho his meteor strike power is strong he only used it once which was at the start of the show which i got pretty upset about. Also another flaw was in the last episode when Satou said go find the guys who put those wood sticks in front of the driver so all the potions would spill. Later on when they meet back they completely skipped that part

The only thing that subtracted from this anime was the main character. This mc was a living non playable character. No personality, no interesting quirks, no mischievous side, no overwhelming sense of JUSTICE, and no personal struggles other than being over-worked as a game developer when he was in the real world. But with that last tie to anything allowing us to invest in this guy gone we just have the equivalent of a very powerful sea urchin who is surrounded by women he will never get in any "trouble" with.He's a paper bag with the only layers to him being yet another paper bag. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideHe even sleeps with a prostitute with no volition on his part. Like he wasn't busy so he didn't mind sleeping with her. He bought everyone's food and drink  in the bar to stop a quarrel and impressed, the woman took him by the arm and lead him upstairs like she was carrying up groceries and he doesn't say a word. Honestly, that prostitute was more of a player character than this mc. And seriously, he hadn't even touched his love interest in that way or any of his slaves which served to dampen or kill any tension that was meant build up because of these master-slave relationships.It was almost like watching an NPC navigate his way in a world full of real people - people that seem a whole lot more lively than him.Good points - everything and everyone else. Very lively medieval dungeon crawler mmorpg setting. A diverse array of slaves each with their own personalities, back stories, and circumstances that led them to work for the mc. Love interest who fights demons with the local army and with a couple of the mc's slaves build up and carry the tension on the mc's behalf. And lastly, a series of threats orchestrated by a demonic groups apposed to the Kingdom in which the mc is currently staying.There was still a story, progression, and many funny moments throughout. I also enjoyed how light this anime was.

Some of the haters obviously didn’t get that this show is quite beautiful. The protagonist is a humble yet strong MC that shows respect and sincerity through his actions and interactions throughout the anime and manga. Satou is industrious and pragmatic. His overpowering stats are used more for protection and safety and he keeps them well hidden towards most everyone.This show is really about enjoying life and helping those in need. This is not a typical harem and there is minimal fan service. In truth the manga which is still ongoing is much better but the anime is worth multiple seasons.

This show has almost no internal character development, he plot is generic, and it is a harem of fan service. If you want some family love interactions then maybe you can enjoy this anime. Overall it is pretty abysmal. It is basically a lazier version than Sword Art Online. If you have an overpowered protagonist, you have to create a plot that shows growth and/or change in them. This show fails to do that.

This story is a simple power-trip in a fantasy world. An overall light-hearted mood, and a MC who doesn't struggle much with anything. Some fights here and there, a few puzzles to solve at other times. It falls just short of being boring actually. A few things here and there keep raising the interest just - barely - over total boredom.Also, the pseudo-harem tends to drag things down. It brings nothing to the story, particularly when the character can instantly learn nearly any skill that catches his interest. This is not quite, but nearly as bad the "smartphone" guy from that other anime.

The plot of this anime is a guy gets transported into a game, he kills a bunch of stuff and gets upped to a really insanely high level. Then he is perfect and goes around without a care in the world collecting women like it was the original pokemon. When I say "flawless" I mean he is perfect, at no point did I feel any tension for the main character because he was perfect. Since he is such a high level he gets unlimited skill points, and whenever he does ANYTHING he gets to level up that thing he just did so he's perfect at it. So if he say... Talks to someone, he is now perfect at talking to someone. If he deceives someone he is perfect at deceiving. If he runs he is now perfect at running. See where the problem is? He can instantly get perfect at anything, therefore whenever he or another character gets in trouble, my reaction always is "Oh he'll get out of this" instead of "  I WONDER how he's going to get out of this." Because he never fails, he never gets a single scratch. Since he is perfect I don't even bother wondering how he's going to get out of it. So you have a character that is perfect at fighting, at talking, at everything. And there are no threats to any of the characters. It's basically a kid's tv show with more fanservice. Actually, kids shows tend to have a problem they need to solve, and you're wondering how they're going to solve it... So this show is worse than the plot of most kids shows.

Sometimes long reviews are unnecessary I've sometimes found and a bore to read.
