One of these lives belonged to Ed and Al's mother. Heartbroken and desperate, the boys commit an unforgivable sin: they attempt to bring their mom back from the dead using alchemy. As the equivalent exchange for committing such heinous crime, Ed loses his right arm and left leg while Al loses his entire body. The boys spend the entirety of Fullmetal Alchemist Brotherhood searching for a philosopher's stone in order to use it to get their bodies back. There are many twists and turns throughout the story, which really work well and leave the viewers on the edges of their seats. The characters all work well together and really bring life to the show. This show is capable of bringing out all emotions from you. It is definitely worth a watch, I'd say.

Art is something that evokes an emotional reaction, whether it be excitement, sadness, anger, or anything else. Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood's incredible fight scenes make it easy to evoke excitement from fans, but what truly sets it apart is it's ability to evoke such a powerful emotional response on a deeper level at the same time. This story resonates with people on a primordial level through the love and bonds between family. It's an incredible roller coaster ride of action, love, and despair.FMA: Brotherhood will change the way you think about anime.

Fullmetal Alchemist brotherhood is one of my favorite anime series to date, and will always will be. I have rewatched this at least 7 times and even went on to buy my very first anime blueray.I'm first going to shortly state why I think brotherhood is better than the previous animated series of Fullmetal Alchemist. The first series had a rather unsatisfactory ending, and when put side by side to the ending of brotherhood, it shouldn't even be comapred. Brotherhood has some of the same concepts or events that occur in the original series, but with both branching off into its own main story line and endings. For me, the storyline for brotherhood is extremely enriching, and even more so when approaching the final to this series. The conclusion to Brotherhood is one of the best I've ever seen, and is one of the reasons I continue to rewatch this anime multiple times. The amount of emotions Brotherhood takes you through is absolutely insane, yet wonderful at the same time. Every single character seems meaningful to both the story and how it impacts the main characters, while having great character development. The character development makes you emotionally attached to every single character that is in the anime and you won't forget a single one. I also love the physical growth of the characters throughout the timeframe of the anime, which is paced excellently to show their maturation. This anime is great for anyone, and will be enjoyable to all those who watch it, and become one of your favorites as it became mine.There are only a few issues I have with this series, mainly the attempts to be humorous which almost all viewers of fullmetal alchemist agree is overboard. Besides this, I personally don't like the introduction and would have preferred a setting starting their early lives, but besides that the journey these characters go through together is just amazing.I watched the sub at first, which was years ago and I cannot recall, but most of my rewatches I watched dub and it was great. This is a journey between two brothers who will grow not only together, but along with you as make you feel the same emotions they feel and the same regrets have. Enjoy.

Two of my greatest pet peeves when it comes to shows is 1. Inconsistent characters and 2. Dragging on the plot unnecessarily. This show does neither of those. The whole plot is extremely well thought out with close attention to detail. There are no plot holes and every event that is shown is necessary to the overall theme of the show. They don't drag it out or add in dumb fillers to make the show longer than it needs to be. All of the characters are three dimensional and well written, as well as not doing things that seem too far out of character for them. Overall my favorite show.

This is my favorite anime. I don't want to sound bias but... This anime is so well written. *applause* My boyfriend first watched this anime by himself and I didn't give two cents about it. The art didn't catch my eyes. I know... stupid me. I finally got around to watching it and every episode was a rideee. It's funny, eventful, emotional, touching, loving, and... what else do they say when a film wins an oscar. It's just AMAZING.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hide I was balling my eyes out when Hohenheim went to his wife's grave to apologize. Snots and boogers EVERYWHERE. Just watch it. It really is, wonderful.

(I’m speaking for both Brotherhood and 2003) I don't even know where to begin with this one; there are so many positive things to say about it that I wouldn't be afraid to even say it's flawless. It has some of the best character development and really connects you to the characters emotionally. It’s almost impossible to hate any character in this show, even the villains (speaking of which, some of the villains are my favorite characters) and the protagonists are memorable and in a sense, relatable. Their struggle throughout the show keeps you thoroughly engaged and excited to see what happens next. This show has everything you would want in a good series and keeps you hooked for every episode. Its action scenes are not to be missed and the animation for the fight scenes is so fun to watch. The emotional impact of this show is substantial and the lessons it teaches about love and sacrifice really speak to the heart. The story progresses while keeping the same end goal consistent throughout the whole series without diverting away from the characters’ objectives. The action and adventure is thrilling and prevents you from looking away. The soundtrack is memorable, characters are sensational, story is remarkable, and animation is clean and smooth. You can zip right through this anime without even realizing it, that’s how enjoyable it is. Also, never have I come across a more original story than this one; the plot is so unique that you have to give kudos to the creator. This is, in my opinion, the best anime; it is everything that an anime should strive to be and more. It’s fun, surprising, exciting, heartfelt, hilarious, and heart wrenching to say the least. This anime has set an unreachable bar for others, proudly claiming its spot at the top. Not an anime fan? Watch it anyway; it’s worth your time- if you haven’t watched this anime, then you’re really missing out.

I used to not like anime. At all. I thought it was the silliest shit ever. I saw people buying these huge pillows and figures all dedicated to anime and I never got it (to some degree I still don't get it). But then I was recommended FMA and FMA Brotherhood on Netflix and I decided 'what the heck' why not give it an episode. Within 5 days I watched everything. FMA and Brotherhood (in this case Crunchyroll only has Brotherhood but this applies to both) the series taught me about what an anime can bring to the table as a serious medium to convey a serious story with plenty of great themes. It's been 2 years and I go for a rewatch of it every single year. In short watch this, if you haven't already, you're in for a ride.

Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood is an anime that looks appealing to the eye right when you start watching it. This anime shows the bond between siblings as they go through hardships and hurt. These brothers stick by each others side no matter what. They've never really doubted each other. After losing their mother they try there best to get her back, but that ended up as a disaster. They confided in each other for help. Also there are a lot of really cute relationships, that is so hard not to ship. And you'll fall in love with every character. It's also very action packed and very funny at times. Especially when someone comments about Ed's height or them wanting him to drink milk. It's so full of emotion. I will have to say I've cried and laughed and screamed while watching it. These characters have left a large mark on my heart and I'll never forget them. I was devastated when it ended. I'll watch it over and over and never get tired of this anime masterpiece.  This anime deserves more than a 5 star.

Everyone who watches anime will at least have seen this once. The reason being that the plot is so unique, and hits close to home. It may seem fast-paced at first simply because this was basically a patch to a poorly ended "Full Metal Alchemist". The differences between the endings is not even comparable. This show makes you laugh, cry, make you angry, and make you think about what it means to be a person. Highly recommend.

i liked it, its ending was nice and satisfying for a 64 episode show i might have a couple grievances but its all well and good. the thing i disliked was that (extreme spoilers literally last episode stuff) Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hidethat edward didnt accept the stone to bring back his brother instead getting rid of all alchemy in his life, sure the promise and so on but even mustang accepted it only edward didnt want it anyways good show

Before I write my review I just gotta say...WATCH IT, JUST DO ITThat out of the way, let us continue...I watched this spectacular anime a year or so ago. It was one of those experiences where you wish to forgot about just so you can go back and watch it all over again with no prior knowledge. I cannot stress enough how good this show is. Here's just a few reasons why it's amazing:- Deep, unique and loveable characters.- An intricate and interesting plot that keeps you entertained and curious. - Considering it has over 60 episodes, the animation is beautiful, especially when it amps up (then you're in for a treat).- Stunning OST's (I love the music so much).- 5 Absolutely Killer Openings (If you obsess over openings like I do you will love FMAB's).- So many memorable moments. Happy, Sad, Epic, etc. It has em all.- I personally love the themes this show explores, many philosophical and ethical themes shown. To me this creates an experience you can't find very often.- It has so much to it, it has the action, the emotional moments, the cliffhangers, the head-scratchers, the jaw to the floor moments, and so on. Put simply, MANY AMAZING MOMENTS.I could go on for so much longer (if I did I might end up spoiling things so I will stop here while I can xD). It is my favourite anime so of course I have a bias, I will definitely admit that, but it's my No.1 for a reason. Even if you are just slightly interested I would suggest giving it a go, you will not regret it. Well, I guess that's my review. I really hope this helps you decide to watch this marvellous show.Sincerely, An Anime Weeb Who Is Slightly Obsessed With FMAB :)

The story and characters are all amazing, even though this is said to be the best anime of all time. I simply have to agree the plot of the main story is very interesting a few kids learn alchemy to save there dead mother, which you will learn later on what they had made, I will not say just to avoid spoilers. Great story and the characters are well developed unlike most of the anime now. My rating would be a solid 10 and probably won't change.

I remember watching the original show back in the day and wondering what happened when it kind of just stopped. It had become a mess and things weren't really making sense. Of course the reason is the original source material wasn't finished so the showrunners were just kind of winging it.  Then, THEN, Brotherhood happened. Everything is great, the show looks good, the story lines are varied and interesting, and the show takes time to be serious and lighthearted. Oh and the show isn't a damn mess! The source material is done, so the show knew what to do and when to do it the entire time, and It's pretty badass! Check it out!

I used this show to get my older sister started on anime. She hasn't looked back since :)Characters and story are exceptionally well-developed, and why I recommend this show to just about anyone who hasn't seen it. Romance (what little there is, and that's not a bad thing) is also very believable, and sometimes quite subtle.Animation is very good.Overall near perfect, though the beginning of this remake of the original feels a little rushed. Other than that, it's a great entry for others into anime, simply because it's the cream of the cream. One of the best.

If you haven't seen this series yet, you're missing out. A defining series in the genre, these two brothers will take you on an epic journey that is full of drama, action and some pretty dark times.The bad guys are bad. The good guys are good...but the lines that separate the two are sometimes blurred, which adds to the drama. The action is great. The story is well written. The character development is strong. And the animation is strong. If you haven't seen this series yet, you should really add it to your queue and prepare to binge watch like there's no tomorrow.

Every episode is full of purpose. Every character leaves a lasting impression. The humor is witty, the drama is sharp, the action is frantic and forceful. Filler isn't a word ever found in a single minute of the show's 64 episode run time. Every moment seems to be put there for a reason, and you will be hard pressed to find a show that can do as much as Fullmetal Alchemist can do in 64. It leaves you wanting more, but satisfies you with a complete, well rounded tale. It'll make you laugh, cry, gasp, cheer.You don't need anymore proof than this small paragraph. Go watch it

There's a good reason so many people consider this the absolute zenith of anime--and no, that reason is not faithfulness to the source material. Seriously, if that was a valid criterion, there'd be no art in the world at all, just a bunch of endlessly repeated knock-offs of bacteria, viruses, and other microbes. No, that reason is simply "it's just that magnificent a work of art." The story twists and turns as necessary but keeps the end goal consistent; the cast is massive and colorful and each of the characters have unique quirks, levels of depth, and niches all over the moral and emotional spectra; the action keeps you riveted from start to finish; and the jokes are so well timed and paced that they seem to never get old. Plus, the music and animation are crisp, clean, fluid, and simply spectacular.Bottom line: if you're only going to watch one anime in your lifetime, let this be it.

Fma Brotherhood is a amazing series. It was one of the animes that got the newer generation into our anime world. Its got a amazing heartfelt story that follows the Elric brothers as they search for a way to get there bodys back..  Now im gonna out right say this the original series i hate. Yes its good but it ruined  by a bad lack luster ending.  See The manga writer, Hiromu Arakawa,  was working on the manga while the original series was also being released. However bout halfway through the anime they got ahead instead of just waiting for the manga to get caught up they decided to make stuff up and completely change the series. So it was a complete shock when fma brotherhood was released but then it was stated that it would follow manga and i was skeptical but as i watched it i was shocked. The Animation is top quality and theres always something moving and flowing. The music  is amazing and will get stuck in your head long after the episode ends. anyway im gonna stop gushing on how amazing this anime is and just tell you... GO WATCH IT!!!!!

FullMetal Alchemist Brotherhood.Its hard to be fair in a review for an anime with so much to it. I feel a need to post a review, but at the same time you just can't be fair to such a great anime without spoiling it all. A few things about it: Its quite long. Completely original. No fillers. Great characters. Great story. Memorable music. Great OPs. Moments of goosebump epicness.Its one of the few animes I own hardcopies of because its also rewatchable.Its an adventure. It has everything one can ask for as the anime covers all the bases at one point or another. It doesn't limit itself to one term or genre.Whats more to say? Go try it. Go watch it. Its one of the greatest animes of all time for a reason. That reason being it is really damn good from the start and only gets better by the finish.

Only trying to help solidify the 5 starness of FMA Brotherhood. Whether this is the anime that got you hooked on anime or whether you fell in love with it early on in your anime career, this is one of very few MUST watch animes. For a while I thought Death Note and Code Geass were the must watch animes, but then I watched FMA Brotherhood. This show needs no reviews. Alchemy, drama, action, plot, and everything you want out of a show is packed into this perfect series.

I love everything about this anime. It is everything an anime should strive to be and more. It is heartfelt, hilarious, and heart-wrenching. The action is amazing. I loved the original, too, but the ending kind of ruined it for me. This, on the other hand, leaves no loose ends, and I could not ask for a better ending. A satisfying ending is a surprisingly hard thing to find in most anime, but this one does it perfectly. If you have yet to experience this masterpiece, then strap in and prepare for an unforgettable journey.

Fullmetal Alchemist Brotherhood does something very great in it's anime and it's pacing of the story, building relationships between the characters, art style but the biggest one imo is that no one ever feels useless in the series and that to me is quite amazing! So far I'm almost finished with the series and man it's reputation does hold up and I'm very impressed. I also feel like I can rewatch this series because it is that good and I do love this show! Colonel Mustang is my favorite.

This is easily one of the greatest anime I’ve seen. Everything about it - the characters, the worldbuilding, the themes, the magic system - is all carefully coordinated and structured together to make a thrilling, visceral story. It serves as a perfect example of how combining standard anime tropes with traditional Aristotalian storytelling produces a deep, complex, and extraordinarily entertaining work of art. I can’t recommend this anime highly enough.Plot: 5/5The plot moves forward in a consistent, engaging way that makes full use of all the characters in the story, intertwining their individual and collective arcs together in an elegant and creative manner. I frequently find myself disappointed when it comes to endings in anime, but this was far from the case with FMA; the ending resolved every plot point, character arc, and thematic development in a concise and satisfying way.Characters: 5/5Every character in this story felt unique and integral to the plot. They all had powerful motivations which compelled them to action, making the circumstances move forward in a dynamic and exciting way. I was especially impressed with the character development on the sides of both the heroes and the villains. Edward and Alphonse's change in perspective on objective truth and scientific dogma was handled extremely well, as well as the redemptive arcs of previous villains like Greed and Scar. Conflict: 5/5Since each character had such a clear and pervasive motivation, the conflict that arose between them felt natural in it’s instigation and development. For a show that is often very deep and philosophical, it also had extremely stunning fight scenes. The creation of Alchemy on Arakawa’s part was pure genius, as it enabled a wide variety of creative battles, all while retaining the integrity of a magic system that is so hard in it’s rules, restrictions, and costs that it can almost be considered science-fiction.Setting: 5/5The amount of detail that went into the world building of the FMA universe is beyond impressive. Arakawa clearly did her research, and it is expressed in the early-industrial German aesthetics which were incorporated seamlessly into the vivid world she created. The attention to detail regarding history, religion, climate, topography, and mythology is simply fascinating. This was evident in how other cultures interacted with Amestris, like when Lin, Foo, and Lan Fan emigrated there from Xing, and the civil war flashback with Ishval.Themes: 5/5Probably the greatest part of this series are the themes and philosophies present all throughout the narrative. Starting with the simple question of “what is the human soul?”, the story evolved into a complex and in-depth exploration of faith, scientism, nationalism, and human value. The concept of a human soul being reduced to a scientific element which can be extracted and weaponized is a truly inspired and original idea, which was fleshed out and explored in so many unique ways.

Let me just say, there is not a single thing that I would change about this anime if I could. The plot is amazing with a truly compelling story and characters who you really sympathize with. The animation is great and the voice acting in both English and Japanese are amazing. In fact this is one of the few anime I would recommend watching dubbed. Naruto got me into anime so it gets my number 1 spot, but FMAB is a really close second.

Honestly, one of the best anime out there. They don't destroy the content of the show with fan service, the plot is great, the pacing is great, the action is great, the relationships are great, it's all great. It will leave you pondering and feeling things you normally wouldn't in an anime. Just a stellar example of what the anime community should use as it's gold standard for a good quality animated series. It's is absolutely a must watch.

I've personally watched a lot of anime (around 80+ Anime).But out of all those 80+ animes, Fullmetal Alchemist Brotherhood holds my personal title of #1. (Although Attack on Titan might change that????).FMA Brotherhood is similar to that of ATLA, many episodes with the protagonist and other characters all develop as the story slowly progresses, then finally ends in a beautifully written showdown with the main antagonist. All to that just make you take a step back and admire how far the characters have gone.I cannot stress how good this anime is when you watch it for the first time.But I believe that once you've watched this anime you MUST understand it, it is easy for one to glance over the deeper meanings and themes after the first watch. But once you understand what makes the characters tick and the symbolism of the show, it will blow your mind! Overall FMAB is a 10/10, must watch and a MUST TO UNDERSTAND in order to really enjoy it. The main theme to understand: the relationship between science and religion.

A broken family; A burnt down home; a brother without flesh, and blood to call his own an older brother to follow, and chase to reclaim his brothers face! so our story begins dark, and only gets more intense as they search for the philosopher stone, which is full of blood, and sorrow literally, and furthermore it's a story full of brotherly bonds, and a dark twisted government secret that only Edward, and Al can bring to light to save the world from a greater evil! Full of action, adventure, comedy, drama, and tad touch of romance the show has it all! Take it from me who has seen it 7 times!

I feel this anime does a perfect job of telling it's very creative story that's completely unique to anything I've seen before it. The animation is great, the characters are all fun and the world building is incredibly immersive. I honestly couldn't point out a single flaw with this anime without having to look for something to nitpick about. If you like anything, you should enjoy this even if you're not an anime fan.

I cannot explain in words how much I love this anime. It really has everything. My favorite characters ever, my favorite themes ever, one of my favorite plots ever, the list continues. This is my favorite anime  ever . period. end of story. Seriously, this show is that good. It's laugh out loud funny when it can be, but sob your heart out sad at times. This show really is a roller-coaster of emotions and I cannot recommend it enough. If you are even slightly thinking about watching this show then watch it. If you aren't then start thinking about it. It really is amazing.

Fullmetal Alchemist Brotherhood is an amazing show that is extremely entertaining and engaging throughout the entire show. Be warned though, Brotherhood expects you to have watched the original Fullmetal Alchemist first. You can watch this show without watching the original but you will be missing out on a few details. This show came out after the manga was finished the original ended up getting ahead of the manga and branches off into its own story. Though the two shows have different endings the first few episodes are extremely similar. Since  Brotherhood came out years after the original finished most people who were ready for Brotherhood had already watched the original in its entirety. Because of this Brotherhood leaves out details or entire sub plots because it doesn’t want to repeat itself when it’s unnecessary or unrelated. One example of a plot left out is when Ed liberated the coal town which brotherhood briefly explains in about a 30 second segment. They expected the people who were watching Brotherhood to have already seen the coal town plot in the original and didn’t want to waste an entire episode on the plot which was already known. Regardless of this I still think this anime is amazing especially if you have watched the original beforehand. Both anime in my eyes are great and it’s very interesting to look at the similarities and differences between the two. In my eyes Brotherhood is the better anime. Some people talk about how both anime have their flaws and I agree that they do, but to me that’s only if you don’t watch both of them. Since both are completed shows it’s best if you binge watch both of them one after the other, so that you don’t have to worry about missing some details are forgetting things in between if you take a break between the two. In conclusion I would watch the original Fullmetal Alchemist first and then come to Brotherhood, but if you only want to take the time for one then Brotherhood is the way to go.

I watched this show for the first time in 2013. Other than some random episodes of various shows that I'd caught on TV but never paid attention to, this was the first time I'd ever seen an anime.Oh my god. It was a literal life-changing experience.This show is one of the greatest achievements of storytelling I've ever encountered. The characters are real - genuine, emotional, flawed in unique ways, and deeply compelling. The story is incredible, and will amaze you with the scale of its ambition. There's also a streak of deep philosophy that runs through every arc in the show that really lends a sense of gravity to the decisions that are made. I've watched dozens of shows since I first saw FMA Brotherhood. I've enjoyed many of them, but this show is still in a tier of its own for me. I've watched it probably a half dozen times, and every time just reinforces that this is the best anime I've ever seen. I keep looking for new anime because I hope that I'll find something that's as good or better, but I don't think such a show exists yet. If you haven't watched it, drop everything and start right now. You won't regret it.

Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood is one of the absolute best anime of all time. If not the best anime of all time. It has, since its creation, made itself stand out among the greatest anime to ever hit the market and has become a household name along with other legendary titles such as Dragon Ball Z and others of that caliber. Surpurb storytelling, Beautiful, thoughtful and immensely detailed characters create a world that sucks you into it without trying and has you at the edge of your seat for every battle. It is an emotional rollercoaster as you follow these young men in their quest to get their bodies back and rectify their mistakes of the past. Brotherhood is critically acclaimed and has stood the test of time. Its animation is still amazing, despite its semi-dated animation quality and is stunning to watch in its entirety. 10/10 every single time. It does not fail. In the end, you will have a heart made full metal.

If one wishes to obtain something, something of equal value must be given, that is the law of equivalent exchange, the basis of all alchemy, the law that governs the world of Fullmetal Alchemist Brotherhood.Yes you can't beat the Elric Brothers.I almost think this sets the standard for an episodic series.It has the full emotional spectrum of the human experience.(and Homunculi)I am watching this for the fourth time and I learn more each time.

sure it might not have cool banki power up like bleach or cool team work and casts like naruto but its the closest you'll ever get if it was to happen in real life. amazing story amazing plots and twist amazing music background and real fight . Good all the way from the first opening sence to the last ending.the only series that made me feel connected to these two brothers specially Edward. i feel like i was him chasing and looking for the philosopher's stone to save his brother. i too also lost my brother in real life.please edward if you find out the truth about the philosopher's stone/tree of life and the illuminati, let me know and finish the story.

The only problem I have with this gold mine of euphoria is this was one of the very first animes I watched. With the exception of Steins;Gate, not many other  will gently, and violently when needed, pull the strings of your heart the same way this will. It will break you down when you're excited, and build you up when you're broken. Then in the end you too will realize one truth: Nothing else will EVER compare.

I really enjoyed this series. It touched on some interesting philosophical themes like God, what is truth, alchemist rules, nature vs. nurture, man vs self, if killing is the right thing to do, and etc. I also enjoyed how side characters had dreams and goals that contribute to the overarching theme in FMA: Brotherhood. Roy Mustang (one of the awesome characters) wanted to change the government from a very military-dominant one to a more democratic one. Not to spoil too much, but it was an enjoyable series overall.

My favorite anime of all time and has been since I first started watching anime when I was just a wee thirteen-year-old lass. Honestly one of the best anime ever made and one of the best English dubs of all time, in my opinion. Well-written story, amazing characters, intense fight scenes, a bit of comedy here and there, and some drama as well, what more could you ask for?Wholeheartedly Recommend to just about anyone, especially if you're new to anime and don't know where to start.

Fullmetal Alchemist Brotherhood stands out as one of the best-crafted series I have ever seen. Everything about the show is brilliantly balanced, leaving the viewer utterly satisfied when they finish, and completely hooked until they reach the end. The story maintains a delicate balance of somber, dark, and serious, while still maintaining a charming heart, endearing characters, and the perfect dose of random humor. The story itself is extremely well executed, with basically no episodes being spent as "filler", and early episodes coming back, again and again, to impact the characters and drive their growth. One of the most stunning aspects of FMAB is the careful attention given to nearly every major character when it comes to their growth in the story. Though the major arcs focus on the brothers Ed and Al, less prominent characters get stunning moments in the spotlight. It is an incredible feat of story writing, well-paced action, a gorgeous score, and characters that will make you stand and cheer or quietly weep...This is a show that everyone should watch. It truly is one of the best stories I've seen.

"In order for something to be obtained, something of equal value must be lost."A world filled with the wonders of alchemy at users fingertips, for Elric brothers it is a dangerous and questionable one. After a failed attempt of committing human transmutation, a forbidden act of alchemy, the brothers now search for a way to return one of them back into a human body, instead of living forever as an anthropomorphism suit of armor. Their quest pushes them forward to look for a mythical relic, the philosopher's stone.Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood, does everything and anything you can think of right, any issues with the anime are going to come down to personal tastes or wish fulfillment. This is one for the history books, and one you won't regret adding to your library, even if your like me and it isn't one of your personal favorite anime, it is still worth the watch for anyone who wishes to see the best that anime has to offer.

Fullmetal Alchemist is Fantasy done right! The plot was beautifully done, The characters were original, and The endless amounts of beautiful opening and ending themes were consistent. 99.95% of anime don't even come close to this masterpiece, this work of art! Dragon Ball Z, Fullmetal Alchemist, and Deathnote are at the top for a reason and That is cause they have some of the best fanbases while having the credibility of being as good as people say it is. Which is why I rate this anime a 5 out of 5 *s

When I think of classic anime series, Fullmetal Alchemist Brotherhood is one of the first that comes to mind. Although not as long as other famous anime such as One Piece, Naruto, Dragon Ball, and Bleach, it holds up just as well if not better than the anime previously mentioned. It remains faithful to its source pretty much to a tee and is a series that will be just as good ten to fifteen years down the road as it was eight years ago when it first aired.

No insane fillers, no long flashbacks, no common anime tropes. The storyline is altogether amazing and heartbreaking. I this my favorite anime because of how well-written this was, though, the exposition could've been better executed. Overall, this is the starter anime for all those new to anime. It has action, romance (not to the point where you get annoyed), a well-thought story, good voice actors, characters that you root for, characters that you hate. FMAB get's straight into it, no cushioning.

This anime is by far one of the best I have ever watched it was great from the very beginning and never had an episode where I felt bored. The plot grew and strengthened itself with every episode and every major event that happened had me trying to guess what would happen next but always being amazed at the events that would transpire. The characters themselves all added to the story as well with everyone playing a part and never being forgotten through the massive story development every character had. The ending as well fits perfectly with the whole story and tied it all in at the very in to wrap up one of the most amazing adventures ive ever watched. Overall the attention to detail and the amazing story is what makes this anime an easy 5/5 for me.

Fullmetal Alchemist Brotherhood is a top tier Action/Adventure anime, a must watch for any anime fan of the genre. I've seen a lot of action/adventure anime, and FMAB is one of the best that I have seen. There is a very good cast of characters and relationships, engaging storyline, great music, and entertaining animation. I'm not going into any deep detail for this review because the show speaks for itself. If you watch it, you will not be disappointed.

There's a reason this show has such high praise. The story arc is one of the best I've ever seen and will leave you hooked throughout the entire show. The characters are well developed and you really get a sense of wanting the Elric brothers to find their peace. This show also has some of the best antagonists I've ever seen in an anime. I enjoyed every aspect of this show and it will leave you laughing, crying, and everything in between as you follow the Elric brothers through their journey.

This is probably the one anime that I would recommend to people regardless of their age, gender, ethnicity or social status.  This isn't just an anime, it's entertainment.  I don't think I've ever seen such a complex storyline woven so intricately over time to have all of its loose ends tied up so cleanly.  I'm talking about television shows, movies, books, etc.  Little things that appear here and there early on and in the middle stages set up perfectly the rising action and the climax, resolved very satisfyingly in the denouement and resolution.I would actually show this to my friends or parents, and if they didn't like it, instead of being embarassed I would be dumfounded.  There are few cringey anime tropes, fanservice is few and far in between, and the focus is the unraveling of a genius web of storytelling.  This should be a classic that everyone in the world should watch.  I've only watched a few animes, but if there's an anime out there that could gain the respect of those who make fun of anime *cough* it's this one.I'm just so impressed.P.S. I almost forgot to say how amazing the soundtracks in this anime are.  Like holy **** some of them give me goosebumps.

I was so impressed by this show. The first few episodes give plenty of background and set up the characters as likeable, but with their flaws and back stories. Then we have this big mystery that unfolds slowly, and it ends with what was admittedly a very drawn-out final battle. I was really and truly shocked by the ending, and so interested in seeing more of Ed and Al's adventures that I went back and watched the 2003 FMA. I am SO glad that I watched this one first (and used up all my data for that month doing it...) If you're choosing between them, start with the first 15 or so episodes of 2003's FMA, which explains the confusing plot holes in the early episodes of FMAB, since they kind of compressed those adventures for the latter series. (In particular, Yoki isn't even mentioned until halfway through FMAB, and then you ask who the heck he is if you haven't seen the 2003 series...) Then watch FMAB (all of it) and don't go back to the other one, because this one is so superior from that point onwards. I wound up watching it for the second time less than a year later (and I hardly ever rewatch shows), because I had enjoyed it so much originally (and I was waiting for new Case Closed episodes, LOL).Overall, this show has everything you could want: adventure, action, romance, and even a moral struggle (a deeper theme not present in many anime, or at least the ones I've seen). I find it similar in some ways to InuYasha - an overarching journey that eventually leads to some really tough choices, and an incredibly powerful "stone" that is the object being sought out. But this show is shorter and deeper, and definitely worth watching, especially if you've seen the 2003 series and were unsatisfied with the ending.EDIT: I totally forgot to mention how much I love the music! Especially the first and the third or fourth (the one that starts with their fingers tracing out a circle on the ground) openings.

Fantastic show with lots of great writing, outstanding characters, and awesome animation, all supported by a wonderfully expressive Japanese cast. (I won't speak for the dub since it's a sort of love it or hate it sort of thing, and let's just say I was not on the "love it" side! I found it a little ridiculous and it almost made me laugh a few times, even when I wasn't supposed to be laughing...) Lots of emotion, which I love, and also tons of amazing action. Planning a rewatch already!

Characters: 10/10Character Development: 10/10Pacing: 9.5/10Plot: 10/10Music: 9/10Animation: 10/10I watch Fullmetal Alchemist, then Brotherhood afterwards. This one is more condensed and gets to the point quicker. If you're looking for a weekend binge, I'd recommend this one. It's got heart, soul, and the body to hold it altogether. It also has a lot of action without being overly gore-y. This is an anime all ages will appreciate because of the underlying themes and fast-moving plot. You'll laugh, you'll cry, and you'll be happy you saw this all time great.

I'll keep it short and sweet: Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood is the best anime of all time. I know superlatives like that probably will deter some from watching it or judging it as such, but in my opinion it's just the total package. It has stellar character development, not just for the central 2 or 3 characters but from the supporting cast as well as the villains. It has a plot that hooks you from the start and continues to evolve through 64 episodes, with great pacing. It has a setting that was clearly created with great detail and intricacy, and that serves as the perfect backdrop to the story. It has themes that manifest beautifully in the characters and that can be tracked throughout the entire series. It's also the only anime that I actually prefer the english dub to subtitles. Unlike the 2003 adaptation of Fullmetal Alchemist, FMAB follows the manga religiously (save for the first episode, which is an entertaining way to start the series and works as a great introduction to the world but still is technically filler). Just... do yourself a favor and watch the first 3 or 4 episodes. If you've already seen it, watch it again.

I'm not going to leave a long, in-depth review, since others have done so and said anything I could better, but I will say this:I hate this genre of anime, this quasi-fantasy-setting-with-superpowers-because-superpowers-let-us-fight-more-better kind of crap, but I thoroughly love this show because the characters and septicemic are all very, very well written and every moment feels meaningful.Could reel that awful grunt-and-gasping back a bit, but that's also a universal complaint. Still, this show has a few too many shocked reaction shots, the kind where time stops long enough for the character to twitch and go 'ge-heh' like no human ever has in real life, ever, in the entire history of man...That is all!

I fully recommend this anime to anyone, young or old. It is without a doubt a captivating tale that will keep you enthralled and constantly wanting more. It is a roller coaster ride of emotion that will keep you pinned in your seat, with its insurmountable highs and its heart shattering lows. Once you reach the end, you will fully understand, and walk away with something that will stay fondly in your memory. Give it a shot! You won't regret it.

I'm serious if you havent seen it... why not? Binge watch it this weekend or better yet just watch it right now! It just has everything there great action, drama, comedy, and will have you crying like baby in no time. Oh and if your wondering if you should watch this one or the normal fullmetal alchemist well Brotherhood is just better. It has a way darker tone then the other one. It is closer to the manga too if I remember it correctly.

Everyone has an anime they started which got them into anime itself, for me it was Naruto however I wish it was this one. This is probably one of the best anime whether it be a gateway anime or something you watch later in your life. The story, the art, the characters are just amazingly well done. This is one of the few anime where dub is also great, I have seen the original FMA and of course that one was alright while this is just pure epic. Although you should watch the original FMA you don't truly need to. If you just watch this you should be able to figure out the idea and story itself for the most case.To top it all off Winry is best girl.

I'm so excited to find this!  I'd only heard of If It's for My Daughter, I'd Even Defeat a Demon Lord as a light novel series, so I'm incredibly happy to be able to watch and enjoy this beautiful story (although I do wish the animation itself were better).  Dale, a young (just 18!) adventurer, is finishing up a job when he finds a small demon girl in the forest.  Unwilling to leave a child in such straights, he brings her back into town with him and eventually accepts the challenge of instant fatherhood--lucky for him that he has some good, supportive friends in the married couple from whom he rents his room!  (Maybe even luckier for the young demon Latina!)  Dale is a loving and dedicated (if sometimes clueless) parent, but his and Latina's newly made family remains under some shadow: who was the dead demon with whom she had previously traveled?  And why was one of her horns broken off (a sign of punishment or of being made outcast amongst demons)?  But don't worry--in fact, rest assured that before Latina's past can even try to catch up to her, her ad hoc human family will ferociously protect her.  Like 2016's Sweetness and Lightning, this show is a love letter to familial love and to those who celebrate it; also like that anime, so let yourself be swept away.

Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideIt will go full Usagi Drop on you. Of course, if your into that sort of thing, that's up to you. If you want to try it, just be warned that if your parents or partner find out they will likely never look at you the same, and also that you will likely have to shed all your attachments to personal dignity and human decency. The Buddah said the root of all suffering is attachment, if you need an excuse. Of course, if you enjoy stuff like Eromanga sensei because of just how hilarious it is to watch how degenerate humans can get, you will probably also enjoy this as it gets further into the plot. I think I will probably keep watching,  but well see if it becomes a dumpster fire as big and enjoyable to watch as Eromanga sensei or Domestic Girlfriend(the really really REALLY spicy one) or All You Need Is a Little Sister or Oremio or whether or not it's just a small trashcan on fire that's not enjoyable to watch. Also, if you dont mind this direction, I can highly recommend you watch Domestic Girlfriend,  the level of spice is astronomical,  its beyond what can logically be conceived by the human mind, on an entirely new dimension of ecchi spice, and it hilarious to think about what you just watched after every episode and just how ridiculous it is. It's also surprisingly well written

Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThey end up together, get married.  She says she has never once seen him as a father figure and it will be something Dale kind of has to take his time to really accept since obviously he has seen himself as a father figure to her most of her life.  However, he does come to accept her feelings and they get married.  So, for anyone who wanted to know that answer, there you go.  If you can watch this with the mindset of she NEVER saw him as a father figure and not be weirded out then it is a cute anime of a girl meeting this nice guy. Seriously, going on JUST the anime alone and not knowing the end game to this the girl is cute.  The characters are pretty funny, though Dale can get annoying at times with how much he obsesses over her when he isn't by her side instead of like..focusing on his missions and stuff.  It has its funny cute moments. The arts nice, just before you get fully invested have the spoiler in mind. If not you're going to be in for a shock and it might ruin things for you.  It might not, you might have seen it coming (like i did) because I do think there were hints.  Though the title is misleading...  Personally for me It wasn't the kind of anime I want to invest my time in knowing the true end, but if you're okay with the true end and thats what you want then you'll probably enjoy the anime.It is NOT like "Sweetness and Lightning"Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideIf you want to watch something with a actual father and daughter relationship that does not end with the two of them getting married with each other or loving each other in THAT manner then I do recommend "Sweetness and Lightning".   Honestly this anime is about a girl by herself who meets a nice guy with no family connections to her whatsoever who both end up becoming important parts in the others lives.  I am also just giving it three stars because before I found out how this would all go down I was enjoying the anime, but knowing the ending makes me dissapointed and made me have to drop this.  I am not going to give this a one star however just for the ending that's not even happened yet in this anime, because like I said I had been enjoying the show before learning all this information.  If you can overlook that detail then go ahead and enjoy this anime. Personally I just can not.

Synopsis~"Dale is a well-known and highly skilled adventurer despite being so young. One day, he's on a quest and goes deep into the woods and finds a little devil girl named Latina, who is just skin and bones. Latina is branded with the mark of a sinner, but Dale decides he can't just leave Latina there and decides to become her guardian. Thinking to himself, "Latina is too cute, I don't want to work," he ends up doting over her before he even realizes it."Honest Review~  It started with such an amazing, adorable and cute episode, however with all these cuteness and loving scenes where are we gonna be heading to? They absolutely nailed the introduction, animation, bgm, op & ed, art & design, I truly loved it.   It would be awesome to keep it isekai/father and daughter/adventure/cuteness identity and abandon the "romance/taboo" for a future reference. I can see "Usagi Drop" as a very close resemblance to this show. For now she's just a daughter, the author seems to have the intention of moving on to the next level as time progress, through romance + taboo.  In my honest opinion, it would be far more interesting if the author avoids the typical "finds a lost child, make a strong bond, time passes and marries that child" taboo thing and approach it differently. Thank you for reading! <3

If you don't mind watching a show for a season or two before it gets ruined by the ultimate in cringe (with lots of hints along the way), skip this spoiler. If you want to know why I one-starred the show, open it:Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideApparently the MC marries his adopted daughter in the light novels. One star for yeah, no, gross. I read a review on another site that basically said "don't get hung up on one spoiler." Well, sorry, that spoiler just spoils the whole darned thing. Even if the early chapters of this show were 10x as good as they are, that ending would be a huge turn off. ***This is a fantasy world slice-of-life with a large and perilous setting. We get just enough hints about the world to have a sense of danger and intrigue, but it stays vague enough that it provides setting without driving the story. Instead, we're mostly learning about the world as Latina (the titular 'daughter') experiences it, which is good.The good: it's a good fantasy world, good characters, just enough action/magic to break up the cooking scenes. A general feel-good slice-of-life with magic and intrigue.The bad: You know what would be cool? A fantasy world Yotsuba&! You know what you get? A lot of cringe, some of it bordering on creepy. Like getting one bite of candy versus eating the whole bag, there is an overload of super-saccharine moments and they just aren't as fun after a while. There's also way too much screaming and wailing hysterics from the MC; misplaced theatrics that are shoehorned in and just get tiresome. And my biggest gripe of all: Latina's voice. Don't get me wrong, I'm sure the voice actress is a fantastic performer in other contexts, but this casting/direction is downright bad. An obviously grown women speaking in a breathy and squeaky toddler voice gets so old, so fast. There are SO MANY good shows that have kids of all ages and both sexes that are voiced well; there's simply no excuse.Final tally (for the season so far, not the source material): average is 3/5Art: 3/5, on par for this season but not specialStory/Characters/Concept: 4/5, love me some slice of life, especially with a twistWriting/Execution: 2/5, too much cringe and Latina's voice drives me nuts.

"Wow," you say, "I can't believe it's not isekai!"Yep. This is a stand-alone fantasy world. No one is sucked into a toilet, stuck in a neuro-reality helmet, or just finds themselves in a land with magic and fantasy.Before we go on, let me explain the title. This is based on an LN series wherein Dale, the male protag, saves, raises, and eventually marries Latina once she has grown into an adult. Yeah, a little squicky. I'm not spoiler-tagging this because it has nothing to do with the events in the anime.The anime (at time of this writing) is only one season, and said season ends when she's still a child. Given how low the chances of a show like this getting a sequel series, it's entirely possible to watch the anime and be overwhelmed by its innate cuteness w/o having to deal with the discomforting future presented in the LNs.Which brings us to the main point. This is slice of life. If CR would allow it, I'd insert a "This is SPARTA!!!" GIF here to emphasize that. This has some monster-hacking, yes, but that was maybe 5% of the show, and that's a generous estimate. The near-entirety of this show is Latina growing up, growing wise, andSpoiler Alert! Click to show or hideIn the last episode, experience feelings of possessive jealousy when Dale has to work with a former and well-endowed flame. Slice of life can take many forms. This one is of the "unbearably cute" variety. Aside from the first scene in which we're introduced to her, she's always wearing adorbs dresses. Even when she's working (Yes, child labor in a fantasy setting. Whodathunk?) and dressed in more practical garb, her twintails still poke out from under the kerchief.And, in case you don't get the idea that she's cuteCuteCUTE, just about every character in the show says so. Even if you're forced into watching this show (say, by a rabid fan-significant-other) you will be brainwashed into saying she's cute at the end of 12 episodes.LN aside and just taking these 12 episodes as they are, Demon Lord shows a child developing into a pre-adolescent quite believably. (Dammit, Jim) I'm not a child psychologist, so I can't say whether it is realistic or not, but it is certainly believable. As a parent, I'll say to the non-parents out there that it skip over all of the messy and draining parts of raising a kid, save the crushing void you feel when you have to leave for work.For all that I've rambled about Dale and Latina, this show has a reasonably large set of characters. Some are walk-ons, others are present only for a story arc, but they all feel like they have lives, like they have their own goals and plot arcs that just happened to intersect with that of our protags. So, I'd give it a B+ for characterization.The music is ... okay. As if you didn't get the memo, the OP and ED are bouncy, happy songs. The BGM in-show is quite acceptable, but nothing memorable. It gets a B, but's because I can hum the Totoro opening to myself for hours and not go nuts. Animation quality is low-to-middling. It's acceptable for a low-budget show, and it doesn't use obviously CGed "sprites". It doesn't try for novelty in how it lays out the shots, so you don't see things such as "arrow POV". It's a solid C. It's good, not great, but not poor, either.With all this "it's only so-so", why did I give it five stars? It personally sang to me. The plot is very incomplete (and many people prefer that to how the LN goes), and it has a host of other flaws. However, the love these two characters feel for one another is compelling. That alone, the feels, is enough for me to give it five stars.

So sweet it gave me diabetes. So far so good, I like this anime. Latina (the little girl) is cute and I just want to sqeeze and hug her.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideBut after reading the rewiews (since I didn't read the novel), I'm not sure how to feel with where the story is going/with what's going to happen between the two main characters. I mean, it's cute how they want to be together forever and don't like the idea of the other one getting married one day. But to know that they're going to be lovers... He is her father! Ok, adoptive father, but still!

I had seen the manga for this in my local anime shop before I even knew that it was going to be an anime. When I saw it come up in the new shows listing I thought I'd give it a shot. What I quickly discovered was that it was a pretty middle-of-the-road anime. Nothing happened that blew me away, and while there were things that other people found to be a bit triggering, I didn't see anything that aggressively pushed me away.This is where I'd normally do a deconstruction, of what I liked and didn't like, but really all I can tell you is that a few episodes in I just kind of fell off of this anime. It wasn't that it did anything wrong, it was just that it seemed content to just exist. It's just a standard slice-of-life anime. A few times in what I watched it acted like it was going to go into something else, but it always just slipped back into the same sort of thing.It's kind of like Kobiyashi's Dragon Maid, except in a few months when this is over I'll still think back fondly to Dragon Maid, and I'll likely never think about this show again.

It's not very original as everyone is making it out to be, only originality so far is the main character becoming the step father of the other main character.. which IS cute and original, and I've never seen this in anime before, as far as I'm concerned, but theres not much to build on, 5 stars is too much due to production, animations are just basic and not that great, story is pretty bland and unexciting.. best case scenario, they add some fights and action to the story, and have latino become a badass along side her dad ????????‍♂️ but for now, its bland and unexciting..

Adorable, Slice of Life with an underlying plot that keeps things moving but also doesn't ruin the Slice of Life.If you don't want to wait for another season of the anime for the conclusion I suggest buying a copy of the lightnovel and reading from were the anime leaves off as they are I believe the same.https://j-novel.club/s/if-it-s-for-my-daughter-i-d-even-defeat-a-demon-lord/

I do have to admit this one pulled good on my heartstrings. Its one of a few anime that legitimately got an emotional reaction from me, so it is along the lines of Angel Beats, Heavens Lost Property, and the golden age arc of Berserk despite how different all of these anime are in their respective regards. For that reason alone I cannot give it 5 stars as the stars are meant to be a recommendation and this series is clearly not meant for everybody. That said, of your already neck deep in anime like 90% of this site I doubt you will regret watching this series in any way other than the fact that you will need another season or two to satiate your hunger.

This show brought a new take on a fantasy/magical setting, and they did it wonderfully. Whether it's the wholesome interactions between Dale and Latina, or seeing an adventurer turned father dote over his adopted daughter. While the show primarily focuses on nice lighthearted adventures with Dale and Latina, it still knows how to have some more serious moments. The ending is a bit abrupt though, leaving a definitive yearning for a second season, if not more. Overall, this show was a nice break especially after watching shows like Goblin Slayer and Rising of the Shield Hero.

Imagine this, you've spent all day at work getting yelled at by your manager and just absolutely slammed with bullshit work. You're tired and want to just come home and relax. You open the door and your cute adopted daughter greets you with a big smile on her face, a hot meal, and an ice cold beer. This anime is that feeling in 12, 20 minute episodes but set in a fantasy world.Story 4/5: Finally, we have the fantasy world version of Usagi Drop, Aishiteruze Baby, Papa no Iukoto wo Kikinasai. An adventurer on a quest stumbles upon an orphaned devil girl who just lost her dad so he decides to take her with him and adopt her. She ends up helping around the house, going to school, and goes with him on an adventure to visit his hometown. I'm not a fan of the reverse Hikaru Genji tropes, which this anime unfortunately has, but overall, it's cute enough for me to watch the whole thing.Characters 3/5: Characters are fairly standard in their usual tropes. No one especially stands out or deviates from what you expect out of this anime but that doesn't mean I don't like the characters. Dale is an over-protective caring father. Latina is a cute caring young girl who always tries her best. The inn owners are a caring loving couple. And the inn patrons are rough looking on the outside but have a soft spot. Everyone is just so likable.Art/Animation 3/5: Fairly standard animation quality. Nothing looks particularly amazing but its not bad. This anime does have a slight case of weirdly large eyes but I'll chalk that up more to how its trying to emphasize how cute Latina is.Sound 4/5: I'm actually a big fan of how the soundtrack blends elements found in usual fantasy isekai, ie old school violins and classical music and the cute, simplistic music found in the slice of life, raising a child anime. It does a good job of using sound to fit the mood and themes of the anime.Enjoyment 5/5: This anime is like if you took a bunch of warm honey and poured it over a fantasy world. It's so cute. It's heartwarming. It's gonna put a smile on your face no matter how shitty of a day you've had.Overall 4/5: It's so heart warming. If you've had a hard day, just put this on and your troubles will melt away. My only complaint is that I hate the reverse Hikaru Genji tropes. This anime would be so much better without it. In a way, that trope ruins the warm pure honey that is this anime. Regardless, I would still recommend watching it.

Let's just say when she calls him daddy she don't mean father. The notion that you would RAISE a child like your own only to marry them is absolutely disgusting. I'm pretty sure it's illegal, too. Child grooming, look it up. Now, this is not shown in the anime, at least not yet, but supporting the story itselt is kinda screwed up if you ask me, especially knowing how much cred the author is getting out of this whole deal. How about we stop sexualizing children?

Such an adorably sweet anime with such a beautiful and innocent relationship between the demon girl (Latina) and the adventurer (Dale) who rescued her. It’s such a filling and heartfelt series as you see both character develop and grow in maturity. I’d love to see the series get a darker plot somewhere along the road as Dale continues to find out more about Latina’s roots with her. This is definitely worth the watch if you want something to liven up or make you feel better about your day.

Dale, is Colonel Hughes level of dedicated to a girl, Latina, he found and adopted. Doting, spoiling, and willing to do whatever it takes for Latina to be happy and safe. This show is just as sweet and wholesome as Sweetness and Lightning. You'll grow attached so quickly it's hard to stop watching. If you love wholesome family anime, watch this show. If you hate feelings, don't watch this. It gives you all of the feels.Edit: Relating to other reviewsSpoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThey all mention how Dale and Latina get married. I understand how some people find that a problem. However, they are not related, at all. Yes, he did raise her, which that part makes it kinda weird. Unless there's a season 2 or ova, I wouldn't worry about it. Doesn't change my opinion of the show. It was fun to watch. Isn't that what really matters?

Most of the bad reviews for this are from people who have read or glanced at the manga, but have not watched the anime. Ignore them.The series itself is an adorable slice of life. Latina is the cutest little girl ever, Dale is the best dad and the rest of the cast of characters are funny and interesting.The artwork is beautiful, the music is upbeat and happy and, if you're looking for a light-hearted anime that is entertaining and will make you feel good, this one is it.All in all, a very good slice of life. I thoroughly enjoyed it.

this was a really cute show. i watched it with my little brother and we sat there every thursday to check when a new episode was out. 10/10 recommended for family bondingtw for spoiler: grooming(?)Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideHOWEVER! this ended up so much more different than i was expecting. i started reading the novel right after and... hoo boy. i did not expect dale to end up getting engaged to latina. surprised me a lot. please be careful if you find this type of stuff triggering and plan to read the light novel!!!

TBH, where it left of is good and I really hope that they keep going as its a love story between a man and a little girl he is looking over for a dead man, its just a story where she see dale as someone more. which i have no problem with like what Rita says in the latest episode is that she is a girl and she can love who ever she wants. So hopefully we do get a season 2 as it looks like it she is in her teens now or maybe not i'm not sure.

This is a very heartwarming series. It goes into Latina (not a good name) being a devil girl and her acceptance. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideI was expecting Latina to go full White Mage on him. It happens only once. About the title, series spoiler followsSpoiler Alert! Click to show or hideFrom the title, you do expect a battle with a demon lord, but it never happensThere's so much potential for a season 2. It has the curse of being an origin story anime. It's still a very beautiful story

Despite the title making one imagine this to be somewhat of an 'adventure' focused entry, this is actually more focused on the relationship of the guardian and the ward.In regards to this relationship, it does a fairly good job introducing you to the main character and the eventual girl he comes across and adopts - their interaction with the world around them and where they stand.The above said though, there is perhaps a lack of information given on the world itself - you only get a minor glimpse of what might be there, but there isn't anything concrete to tell you how the world works.I would say that this is a fairly perfect anime for what it is, but I find that it comes up lacking when really determining where things might be going. The greatest strength of this anime is its focus on the guardian/ward relationship, but that is also its weakness as another season is sorely needed to help cement this as a great anime.

The story of Latina, a young girl rescued and adopted by an adventurer.  He takes her home, cleans her up, and begins raising her.  The story is mostly told from Latina's perspective, which is that of a young child moving to a new country and meeting new people and learning the language and going to elementary school.  As such, it's pretty boring, not much happens, and there's not much drama that isn't almost instantly resolved.  Dale her adopted father dotes on her excessively and gushes about how cute she is to the point of being annoying.  It's supposed to be funny, but it isn't, it's very annoying.  There are a bunch of interesting things that are hinted at that take place in the background, but we get to see almost none of it.  .This show is cute, mostly inoffensive, and a definite change of pace from the average anime fare.  If that's what you are looking for give it a shot.  The light novels are still on going and apparently as Latina grows older she pursues Dale romantically, there are subtle hints to that end in this show especially near the end, but it's nothing that couldn't be attributed to a little girl's love for her father.  If we get more seasons that might not always be the case.  It's not technically incest but some people may be uncomfortable so this is fair warning.

The little girl Latina will steal your heart before you know it. If you are looking for a feel good, pick me up story this is it!   I kept waiting for the story to go dark and it never did. It kept foreshadowing things that would go that route but it just didn't happen. Don't get me wrong I love the show because it's cute and heartwarming but it could be so much more. Perhaps if there is a season 2 it will explore the darker side of Latina's past and future. There are some parts of the story that haven't been told yet that I'd really like to know.

I started watching this around the first 2 episodes that arrived and I fell in love with it. I hated to see it end, but I am hoping there will be more to come. The show is cute itself, especially with Latina starting out as a toddler and seeing her grow up throughout the episodes. I was hoping to see her grown up in later episodes but she was still a kid which was kind of a let down because I wanted to see how the future would end up for her. However, I still enjoyed myself watching this and hope for another season come.

Young adventurer meets small demon girl in woods after said girls father died. Result? Most wholesome anime of summer season of 2019. From first moments of first episode you can tell its going to be something special and rest of season kept getting better and better. Story:Dont expect much action, but plenty of great and wholesome moments. I do like it doesnt shy away from darker side as well from time to time, yet it manages to do it so that it doesnt ruin shows tone. And it actually does manage to paint out larger picture of world as well. Essentially, i'd say viewers point of view and knowledge of said world is quite similar to Latina's (the little demon girl), of course with few advantages, such as seeing her guardian Dale (the adventurer) at work. So worldbuilding is actually better than it might first appear and is very well doneCharacters:This is where this show truly shines. Pretty much every character is fleshed out and even one-off characters (which there are remarkably few of) have something, anything that gives them some level of depth. And of course main cast grows a lot. This shows truly how much care is put into this.Voice actors also put effort in what they do and it shows.Art & animation:Art is just beautiful and animation is on most part good as well. The world of this anime is colorful and vibrant, yet it also pulls of darker tones such as rain or forest at night off superbly as well. It really makes it all feel alive.Only complaint about this show is, however, in here as combat animation doesnt hold up for the rest and there can be bit too much "talking heads" bits (nowhere near the level of death note though), but it doesnt take away from this showOverall: if you want to feel good, definite reccommendation.

This anime is wholesome. The manga gets a little weird, but the show focuses on a abandoned devil child fitting into a new life of working at an inn for adventurers. There is some level of intrigue about her past that helps the storyline progress from "look at how adorable this child is" to "Maybe she has the potential to explode a civilization," but for the most part, this is a slice of life anime with adventuring on the side.

NO GOD!! NO GOD PLEASE NO!! NO!! NO!! NOOOO!!!!!Cute show about a good person adopting an orphan to raise as his daughter, right? Ha, if only Japan could do that. No, this is just Usagi Drop, but in a fantasy world, and with EVERYTHING that description entails. Read on if you want more of an explanation about why this series is garbage.I'm not even a remotely well adjusted individual. Most people would find my brain a disturbing place they'd want to get out of because of how cynically and bleakly it sees the world. In some circles I'd be called an incel, for example, and I'm hardly a "good" person even in my eyes. Series like this awaken me to the fact that I may not be so bad. Watching this seriously disturbed me.I'd say I'm ashamed of Crunchyroll, but I am more so just amazed. I know that the audience here is weird, but I'm impressed they were able to look at this and say "yeah, greenlight it, we've got enough people who are interested in watching some guy raised up a girl just so that he can  Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hidemarry and **** her. "Yeah, wow.

Honestly, I found the main characters annoying. Neither of them are particularly believable, and it feels like the show is trying WAY too hard to make Latina cute and adorable. They basically make her the perfect little girl, well-behaved and quick-learning, who has almost 0 attachment to her biological dad and latches onto the MC super fast.The show has no depth. Dale is irritating with how much he obsesses over Latina, and you can tell that the show is trying to get Latina to hit all of the kawaii buttons she can. I tried watching it because I liked the premise, but at the end of the day it just ended up being way too boring and superficial. I'm not expecting award winning anime or anything, but there are anime out there that can be superficial AND entertaining. Superficial and boring makes it a hard pass.

When I first started watching this anime, I thought it was going to be one of my all-time favorites. It was sweet, the artwork was beautiful, and the character interactions were heartwarming and adorable.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThen, I looked up the original light novel and found out that Dale and Latina end up getting married. The level of my heartbreak and revulsion was hard to describe. I've read some people argue that Latina never saw Dale as a father figure, but was in love with him even beginning at 7 years old. However, even if that were the case, on Dale's part he would have to go full 180 degrees in his heart to now see the daughter that he raised as a romantic/sexual partner. It is, in other words, emotional incest. Honestly, I am quite concerned for this series' author, wondering what kind of trauma they may have endured in their life to make them think that this is okay? That being said, if the anime chooses to end its story before all of that comes to pass, then it would definitely be worth watching.

This is a feel-good father daughter type of anime.  It is set in another world where adventurers and demons exist.  It is really cute and doesn't leave much to be desired aside from maybe a little more character definition.  Most of the characters are a bit bland and are a bit 2-dimensional but it doesn't really take away from the story.   Overall really enjoyable.  I wish that the anime about going to another world with your mother had been more like this.

This is a tale about a single parent overcoming obstacles along with raising a young girl of another race. Has many good parts and tends to be very cute. I highly recommend you only watch the first season, and also read only the first couple volumes of the manga. Here is the Reason that includes some (a lot) of Spoilers Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideTheir relationship goes full Bunny Drop in the novel, another anime with the same premise except in a modern setting. And their relationship will go another level from child and parent, to husband and wife. *dry heaves*

Just reading the synopsis hell even the title alone can make anyone's heart melt!The animation style is crisp and beautiful which adds to the vibrancy of the show and really gives it that calming atmosphere while watching which is really good for Slice Of Life! The CV's for the characters are also amazing with each voice actor seemingly perfect for the roles which adds even more depth to how well this show is perfectly embodying Slice Of Life. Going to enjoy this!

Dale our m.c. encounters a little demon girl while on an adventure named Latina she's had a rough life up to this point and has no family he takes her in his life and decides to raise her himself and the result is one of the cutest and most well behaved little girls i've seen in any anime the relationship between her and all the people at the restaurant they live above is very entertaining and wholesome. Latina is very intelligent and learns quickly and that includes magic ability and making friends with other Kids this so far has been a very good slice of life series and I hope it gets a another season. I'm giving a low 5 on here and an 8.5 on a 10 scale of course theirs no fan service and so far very little violence I'd recommend it.   I reviewed what this anime is at this point not what occurs further along in the manga (which i haven't read and don't intend too) if this series does continue doesn't mean that'll happen in this anime.

You like Bakugo? You like little children? You like overprotective parents willing to kill for their younglings? YOU WILL LIKE THIS ANIME. The main character shares the same voice actor as Bakugo Katsuki from Boku no Hero Academia. Now, this isn't the reason why I gave this anime 5 stars, and to be honest, I am only super hyped about the anime due to my enjoyment of the manga series, and am in no way looking at it from a critical point of view. Latina is precious, the art is cute, and who doesn't like cute tiny demon children who only want to belong

An enjoyable excursion into a world of adventurers where top ranking adventurer Dale, becomes guardian to the recently orphaned Latina. The series is set in the land of Laband which is settled by humans and demi-humans. Adjacent to Laband are the lands such as Vassilios - ruled by the First Demon Lord and settled by demons (sometimes they are called devils)... not forgetting The Third Demon Lord who is Demon Lord of the Sea. Demons differ from humans by being much better in magic Magical beings / beasts can be dangerous to humans which is where adventurers come in. Dale very quickly learns Latina is demon born but, taken in by her innocent helplessness, he quickly moves from being rescuer to becoming her guardian. Dale is based in the city of Kreuz and so they head there to his lodgings at the inn, the Dancing Tabby Cat. In between excursions into how inn-life functions, Latina gets to grip with how human society works. The Dancing Tabby Cat is frequented by adventurers. Latina may seem too innocent to some but in remembering my youth, her lack of guile and the reactions of those about her feels right. Her disposition is endearing and the reaction of the adventurers to her rings true. As the series progresses, hints are dropped that suggest a larger (and darker) story - we discover more of Dale's background but despite some clues, Latina remains a mystery.. Just as there is conflict between humans and demons, there is internecine human conflict. It is plain to me that aspects of the larger story arc must revolve around this. The keen eyed will pick up the hints but I won't spoil this for those who haven't watched. Having watched up to episode 10 I am left in no doubt that the story tellers will not flinch if future episodes call for darker deeds to be portrayed and the later episodes leave no doubt of the ability to carry this off. Most anime suffers from 'next episode we must have a bigger and better disaster' syndrome; http://www.crunchyroll.com/if-its-for-my-daughter-id-even-defeat-a-demon-lord isn't one. This show strays from familiar MMORPG gamer territory into 'Hey this has a realistic feel' and 'Heroes with a human side... actually I like it'. Will suit those who prefer a softer, more human side to adventuring and its heroes.Glitches: tighten up on the translation (Demon or Devil?), have snappier episode titles  e.g. 'The Little Girl' and 'The Young Man' are largely superfluous after the opening episode.
