Language Japanese, English sub-titlesStyle AnimeRating: * * * * (rather) good

Most of this story could take place in modern day Japan, or US or The Netherlands. It revolves around the relationship between an orphan and her adopted single parent. Despite being in a fantasy setting, the script and voice acting for the child are the hardest to believe and digest. I'll believe magic and dragons before I believe a young girl with these lines. Honestly, you have to be a special kind of lonely single wannabe parent to appreciate this series.

A moe version of the familiar magical empire at war SoL story. The show tends to avoid actual fight/action scenes so if you're expecting that stop reading and find another show. The show is all about the charm and warmth of raising a child and all the great and scary moments that come with. Despite the genre tags you might be looking at, the show is about character interactions, so it's heavy in dialogue and that's where the best moments are found. If I had to say something good about the show it would be setting. A vast and detailed city gives you the feeling that the town is alive, with a realistic feel to the great big adventure that is exploring it. The pacing is quite solid, creating a slow-paced feel of daily life every episode. If I had to say something bad about the show it would be the lines. Repetitive, bland conversations wear off rather quickly, turning the show into one of the most predictable shows you might see all year. Art is far below expectations with common use of "background crowd" faces and mediocre backgrounds. Voice acting is a problem, you'll quickly learn your least favorite characters before you find your favorites. Characters are generic as can possibly be, with a cast straight out of your stereotypical RPG. Music is quite mellow and lowkey, the kind you won't even notice or will forget ever hearing.Overall, it delivers on the premise of being a wholesome SoL but fails virtually everywhere else. There doesn't appear to be any effort put into making this anything but a heart warming drama, so the elements outside of the main story feel like a complete waste of effort. The mixing of some violence makes me caution people from thinking this is a children's show even though it has a moral undertone to the plot.If you want a story in the moe genre I think you'll enjoy, but for serious anime fans looking for a deep story you need to avoid this one. I give it a 6/10.TL;DR Version: Wholesome moe SoL that will brighten your day. Weaknesses may overpower the strengths. Extremely generic and predictable.

Exactly as the title says. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideAnime might start off innocently enough, but it's based off a manga where the child, raised as his DAUGHTER, marries him. Literally glorified incest. Every season there's at least one, with most of them centering around sibling. Now this one is focusing on the infinitely more creepy version of a daughter wanting to eventually bang her adopted father, and said father eventually agreeing to it.

Long day? Feeling stressed? Just sick of it all? This is the show for you. Honestly, I went into this not knowing at all what to expect, but I was immediately hooked on the first episode. Not in a 'I have to know what happens next' kind of way, but in a 'I want to unwind and smile for a while' kind of way. It's full of heart and cuteness, and the relationships among the characters I find to be overall really charming. There's not really any overall arc of a story so far, though I'm only on ep. 6 at the moment, but I definitely think it's worth a go if you're looking for something to unwind and feel good about with on an episode by episode basis. I'm definitely curious as to where they'll take it, but frankly, I don't seem to particularly care, as long as they keep up the aesthetic they have going.

This show started out very entertaining.  I love the slice of life genre and after watching the first episode It felt more like a slice of life.  The girl is obviously the star who’s cuteness will capture your heart.  The first few episodes we see her trying to adjust to her new life and you can’t help but cheer her on.  The adventure was a little annoying when he first meets her but the show started with a balance between his abnormal over protected and jealousy and her cuteness.  That changed after the 4th episode and our adventurer, instead of adapting to being a father got even more jealous and overprotected to the point where it feels very creepy.  The 5th episode took it way over the top.  I ended up dropping this series.  I would rather watch the girl continue to grow and adapt than this “father” get creepier.

So far, it's a very scattered plot with the name not making sense. It gives off Dales devotion and care for Latina, but otherwise doesn't make sense. It's a very nice, feelsgood cute show so far. Bonus points for it because usually when there's a young character they make at least one creepy joke about it. Which so far, it hasn't done.If you're looking for a story, wrong show. If you're looking for something sweet and innocent give it a watch.

I don't really ever go through the effort of writing reviews, but it's worth it just for the rating.This show brings joy to my heart and healing to my soul. It's not about the action, it's about the relationship between a man and his adopted daughter.The wholesome relationship between a young man and this young girl as he becomes overly attached and goes through so many emotions really speak to me. Goosebumps rise, emotions surge, this show does so much for me amidst all the other anime coming out right now that I watch.It's a refreshing breeze of fresh air after shows like Goblin Slayer, Promised Neverland, and Rise of the Shield Hero. It's also a nice break from all the shounen I find myself stuck in. I can't say I've enjoyed a seasonal release this much since Charlotte, or Restaurant to Another world.I knew nothing about this and just gave it a try based off the description and the name, and I must say I couldn't be happier that I did. Definitely won't be disappointed by this, and I look forward to continuing on this journey.

To begin with, if you are easily offended, this may not be the show for you. If the premise or content of this show triggers you I would recommend watching: Steven Universe, Legend of Korra, the weather channel, or paint drying. I personally guarantee they are more your speed. Now, onto this show, it was different enough from the rest of the pack to keep me watching past the first ten minutes, then it hooked me in with some solid world building and foreshadowing. The main character is likable and seems to have some depth and the cute devil girl will surely have some cool back story. Overall another must watch for the summer lineup.

The pacing is bad the "dad" character is badly done. I don't know if there is a huge difference between the Manga and the Anime but the anime is badly done. How could you fuck up the pacing from making him look more like a good person and a overprotective dad to a overprotective annoying fuck up dad. They really really destroyed what seemed like a good character.The child is waay waaaaaaay cuter in the manga than in the anime. They have taken the meat but forgotten the bones. This is my opinion of this and you may disagree but I don't think this is worth watching after reading the manga.

I know what's coming and I suppose i'm prepared for it if it is done right. That's the key thing here. Though I am disappointed I more or less got spoiled the ending in these reviews (to which I warn ANYONE who looks through the reviews to not click those red spoiler boxes no matter how appealing it may be because they expose some serious things about the ending of the story), still, I like the way the story is written so far.I think i'll be sticking around for the long run even knowing what direction it'll take so long as again it is written right. Right now, I think the story is at a good point. I love wholesome stories and events - don't get to say enough of them in today's anime and just in general really aside from cute videos on Youtube. And I commend the authors for this. I hope they keep up the good work! I look forward to the rest of what the series entails, even despite knowing how it'll end! It's all about the journey, you know?

When I saw the poster for the anime, I became suspicious that this anime would be a show that attracts an audience that has ... a questioning view of "little girls". And thus avoided it.But after hearing that the fantasy part of the show was good, I tried to watch the first episode.The person who gave this a star mentioned, among other things, that the girl's reaction to her father being dead, and that she was ejected from her village, was unrealistic. And I agree. To a degree.But when we saw the body from the dead father, the body was long gone, I would say months. So the girl, yes, was a little too happy when she met the main character at that team was so emotionally degraded that her first instincts were to survive. I can look over this.Next is the animation, no it's not perfect but it doesn't get too bad so my eyes start to bleed. Which in my book always good;)Which makes me think that this show is actually trying (sometimes fails, ex the pause pictures -.-) not to sexualize the girl. The show tries to give a picture of a girl (perhaps a little unrealistic at times) who tries with life and its adversities. Heck, the guy mentions that "I don't want to be from her because then I miss the moments when she understands a problem!" For me, that is textbook one O one parents / teachers / people who want to help childern to grow. As a future kindergarten teacher, I saw this girl as one of my children. She wants to help out in the pub, learn how to cook and help with what she can. When she tries to hold the tray and make sure the food doesn't spill on the ground made me just say "AWWWW <33333"And that is why i gave this show a 5 star Sorry for my long review ^^ '

Spoilers for the first half of ep 1Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThere's very little depth to the show. It relies on you finding the girl cute and getting emotionally attached to her. The trouble is nothing about her is believable. She doesn't even react much to the death and burial of her father, the creators seem scared that people might find her crying annoying or something.I don't believe she exists. From the way she daintily eats her fish after wandering in the wilderness without eating for who knows how long to her being all smiles and wonder when they reach the town after burying her father. This is not the way a child acts, let alone the way one acts after being banished from her home and having her father die. This is what people *want* children to be like. Uncomplicated and cute.The only good moment was when you realize the reason her dad made her leave him was because he was going to die and he knew scavengers would be drawn to his body. I also like that the language of magic is the same language of Oni and the language barrier.The scene that made me realize it wasn't getting any better was when it was the middle of the night and he realized she needed to go to the bathroom. That would have been a great moment for some comedy. Since he only knows her language for magic, it'd make a lot of sense he wouldn't know the words for bathroom, pee, toilet, any of that. But nah, instead of having some comedy that would be natural in that setting, they just don't and it's a boring, nothing scene. I guess now we know she poops.Just don't bother unless you don't know any children or you want some escapism from the ones you do know.

About 80% of the show so far has been panning shots, with stills, stiffly moving characters and a TON of lip flaps. The action that does happen is so laughably done, the monsters barely move, the violence is also toned heavily down.The series is great, but this anime does so poorly, you'd get way more out of just reading the manga instead.This feels like this series was just scraps for an incompetent or extremely inexperienced studio to take on, which gives you a less than satisfactory outcome.

I love this anime so far Latina is so cute!!! And Dale is trying his hardest to be a stand in father.... I can’t wait to see what happens next hopefully Latina starts going on adventures with Dale to practice her healing magic P.S.: Ignore the one and two star comments, they are obviously comparing this anime way to much to with real life.  This is stupider to be a whole sum experience between daughter and father, but there always some idiot who has to think pervertedly and blowing things out of proportion. ~_~

Most of the complaints seem to be about a lack of plot. It seems these people don't understand the concept of slice of life. While this is a fantasy series it is also 100% a slice of life story without some grand story arc in the background. I know some people can't be bothered to read the source material of shows but should at least do some minimal research into something so they don't look ignorant when bashing a show for being the way it is intended to be. I personally love the manga.

I was so stoked when I found out they were making an anime out of this! I just recently bought the book  as one of those "okay, sounds interesting, whatever" purchases and it instantly became one of my favorite additions to my library! The touching story of a father simply living life and learning to raise the daughter he never knew he wanted, but can't stop doting on while the whole "demon lord" plot from the title really takes a back burner is a breath of fresh air in a day and age where even the school days, slice of life animes usually have some kind of central problem. Latina is absolutely adorable and Dale's character is completely relatable. Overall, I'd give this series all the stars.

Too many people have said it to be ignored: This, one of the most wholesome animes I've seen, will do a complete 180. The episode 8 already implies it.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideDale, the adult male mc, finds a little demon girl named Latina (equal to 5 y/o human girl) in the forest, and adopts her. He starts to raise her, and acts like a overprotective father.It is clear to everyone that he considers himself as Latina's father.So, here's the thing. Apparently, in the light novel, he MARRIES HIS OWN DAUGHTER! WTF?!? DALE, YOU SICK F!I actually felt it in my stomach when I found out about this. I can't remember when that happened the last time.This betrayal came as a complete surprise.Avoid this show at all cost!

I'm just going to go straight to the point, this anime is really good! It a good change of pace from all the mainstream animes. This anime has really played with my heart strings and I just can't get enough of it. An awesome adventurer adopts a little devil girl who lost her parents and was cast out from her race. In all honesty it is a little corny, but its a good kind of corny, like dad jokes, kinda. This anime is just soo adorable! However, there are some down sides, most of the animation quality is not great, some close up shots of characters do have better quality but nothing to special. Yet, just like with video games, it not all about the graphics, so the quality does not take away from what to expect when watching this anime. Also, it does seem to be rushing through, taking away from some deep character development, there is character development but I wish it could go deeper. However, since it being based from a light novel, i can see this anime only lasting 12 episodes but hey their are only 5 episodes in so far and maybe I could be wrong and it lasts longer, I sure hope so. Yet, in the end I do think this is anime that you must watch if you like a nice "slice of life" anime to watch. If you like some cornyness and overwhelming adorableness than watch this anime!!!!

So I read most of the 3- ratings, and while they arent not justified, take those reviews with a grain of salt from what seem like Animation and story plot aficionados (people who are "knowledgeable" and albeit picky about their passion and hobbies). The story itself is cute, and while the animation/fight scenes aren't anything terribly spectacular, this story does a decent job showing how children can change a person. I agree with some that the plot is not super thorough in its world-building or storytelling thus far to Ep 4, but this is more of a general slice of life featuring a kid character and touches a little on racial inequality. This is a fun little slice of life anime that actually has some somewhat deeper points to it, however, I feel due to the episode count and funding possibilities, lots of content is cut so I would recommend reading the manga first which you can find here...(contains added spaces)https://mangakakalot. com/manga /for_my_daughter_i_might_even_be_able_to_defeat_the_demon_king

IT'S SO CUTE I'M GONNA DIE!!!!!.......yeah, that basically sums it up :)It says a need a longer review than that, sooooooo....KAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAWWWWWWWWWWWWWWAAAAAAAAAAAIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIThere, I did the thing

After having watched the first three episodes, it' shard to say whether or not I'm going to come back to this series. On one hand it's nice to see something like this and get a small laugh here and there; but on the other hand, which I'm leaning to mostly, it's a series that isn't worth watching or putting my time into investing.Overall, I have other shows to watch and that more interesting and I might, highly unlikely, come back to finish the series later down the line.

The main character is an adventurer that stumbles upon a devil child in a forest all by herself and seeing that she is actually kind and innocent, he takes her to his hometown. Being there, many father-daughter vibe interactions occur between the two and thus a loving bond is formed between the two. I can't get enough of these slice of life animes, it's nice to see that even though they are different and don't understand each other at first, they still show each other the fundamental and most vital expression of feeling which is love.

Then you already know that your daughter doesn't even need to try to tug at your heart string. Especially, if your daughter is the only girl. Watching this is great! I am already overwhelmed with nostalgia for when my daughter was young. It is truly great given the positive environment she is placed in. If you dont have a child, this show should illuminate what a loving parent feels for a child, even if they are adopted!!

So usually I watch shows that are either full of action or occasionally drama/romance stuff mixed in but this show has neither so far. It is pure untapped adorableness and I love it. I was not sure what to expect with this show but one episode is enough to tell me I'm gonna watch this one weekly. I love the idea of a young skilled adventurer making time to raise this kid he's just found and they are so damn cute together. I cannot wait to see the fun father-daughter adventures they go on together and I am fully on this ride for all of it.

I understand why some people are displeased with this anime but honestly i have enjoyed it so far. Dale (male main character) is kind and protective of Latina (female main character). He helped her when she is in need, provides for her however he can and worries about her. Latina is very cute and i can't wait to see how this anime ends.I don't understand why people are hating on it though.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideI have read the spoilers about how he ends up marrying her and people think that's incest, but really i think jumping straight to incest it's a bit overboard as they aren't related in the slightest. He is a human and she is a demon. It's closer to being beastiality than incest. Lets just remember this is an anime not a reality TV show.

I have no familiarity with the original work what so ever, never even heard of it. But god damn, this has to be one of the best first episodes of an anime I've seen in ages. It's so brutally simple, cartoonishly elite student counsel president and VP are in love with each other, but both are ridiculously prideful so instead of communicating or indeed expressing their affection in any normal way, shape, or form; they're trying to get the other to declare their love to them. The declarer's image of an independent, powerful, sophisticated, and aloof titan of world commerce and society will be ruined and they will forever be the overly-emotional, beta in the relationship while the other gets to bask in ultimate victory in their hard fought war of love.It's essentially a two tsunderes fall in love but won't admit it story line with the pride elevated to an utterly absurd level. The goofy mishaps of other romcoms are gone, replaced with calculated and precise strategies of two genius masterminds giving their all to gain the upper hand. The show plays heavily on the tropes of gambling anime (as evidenced by all those playing cards in the intro and on the poster) and almost comes off as some intoxicating hybrid of Kaiji and Toradora. Indeed, it does an amazing job of selling Love as a War and shows us a pair of extremely likable and impressive combatants. Likewise, the supporting character/collateral of the first episode is a true idiot savant, waltzing through this battlefield without a care in the world and suffering not so much as a scratch.The animation and art direction on this show are amazing. The OP blew me away with it's slick Bondian style and the rest of the episode likewise carried over that high level of production. The show, like many gambling anime (among other genres) uses overt visuals to lend a sense of grandeur equal to the intellect being thrown around. The animation was beautifully smooth and direction and "camera" work amazing for anime. The expressions also really stood out, while not as overt as say Hinamatsuri or Ashobi Ashobase, they are so effective and so perfectly timed to the comedy I was blown away.The soundtrack was fun (once again, the OP is gold) and the mixing was good. VAs did stellar work but I couldn't help wishing I was watching a good dub of this, between the amazing animation and rapid pace of some dialogue I was struggling to keep up.I'll admit, I'm getting bad about reviewing shows before they've really had a chance to prove themselves. But I honestly can't see this show going bad. It's base off of what I understand to be a really good manga, its shown it has amazing characters in an amazing premise and was executed damn near perfectly. Sort of a complete and total breakdown of Darling in the Franxx proportions, I can't see this show being anything less than a god tier romcom.I was concerned 2019 wasn't going to be able to follow up 2018's act but this show is making that fear look redundant.

Coming into this I was really excited and coming out of it I was just as excited. Honestly this Show surpassed my expections and I this show did what anime is supposed to do; enhance the manga’s experience. And boy did it do that.Two things that really impressed me was the animation and the direction. The shots that they had were really smooth and lively. And overall made watching this show a blast.Overall I’m really happy with this adaptation, and look forward to continue watching this.

...this show is freaking incredible. The MCs are two of the biggest narcissists ever portrayed in an anime. Every minor interaction between them plays out like an episode of Death Note, only instead of one of them being L they're both Light. After graduation they're probably going to enter the Supervillain track in college. The interplay between them and the rest of the cast are pure comedy gold. I was a little dubious about the narration at first but it turns out watching acts of truly breathtaking passive aggression called out play-by-play like a sports match is pure joy. I'm literally dying waiting for the next episode.Legit 10/10. If you give this one a pass you're missing out on what is easily one of the best shows of the season, possibly THE best depending on how Promised Neverland turns out.

Original manga reader here, and I cannot stress how well done this adaptation (currently Episode 1) was.The staff could have just adapted the story panel-by-panel and the voicework, soundtrack, and animation quality alone would've brought a decent result. But that's not what we got.Instead, we got lots of details added in that weren't originally there, such as small animations added where there was none, certain sound effects, camera angles, and classic Shaft style. They didn't have to do that, but they did. And this fact tells me one thing; this was a product of love, and the staff wanted to adapt the story so that it took advantage of its new medium and make it the best product they could.

This masterpiece evokes every emotion I want to feel from a romantic comedy. The story and how it conveys are very outstanding, it makes me laugh and makes my heart flutter. *How cute*. If you want to watch a show where two tsundere tries to outwit one another, in hopes that the OTHER person would confess; LOOK NO FURTHER. KAGUYA-SAMA IS HERE. No seriously, watch it. Plus, that opening *muah*; and that ep. 3 ending, omeegahh

An intellectual elite, and a super-rich athlete develop feelings for each other. However, their sense of status and inflated sense of pride prevent either of them to confessing their feelings. Both have set for themselves the personal goal of getting the other to confess to them. The result is Machiavellian chess match. The artwork is good, the premise is well executed, and it's entertaining. Plenty of humor is involved, and by the end I wanted both of them to succeed. But will they? You'll have to watch.

As my title suggest, this show is all about rom-com yet mostly about pride. Their war is not about typical couple wars but rather simple pride war. They wanna outsmart the other and make him/her confess "first". Some people may not like the animation as it is quite unique. Some others would probably be disturbed by the narrator's full existence throughout the show, but not me. I truly loved the 1st episode. I definitely want more! The opening is very catchy and the ending is pretty good. Characters are both messed up but you will accept them for who they are TL;DR It is highly recommended. Please do watch and support the series. Go ahead and try Episode 1.

They* have brought the characters on the pages to life with the brilliant VAs animation, and soundtrack!  I really like the intense music haha. Thanks for bringing this wonderful series here Crunchyroll! Fasten your seat belts, this War between geniuses has just begun! Who are you voting for!? Koga Aoi, Furukawa Makoto, and Kohara Konomi have have done an outstanding job with Shinomiya, Shirogane, and Fujiwara! I look forward to seeing how they act out the most memorable moments in the manga! *Thank you Magic Capsule, Shueisha, Aniplex of America, A-1 Pictures, Mamoru Hatakeyama, Yasuhiro Nakanishi, Yuuko Yahiro, Jin Aketagawa, Kei Haneoka, Ihara Rikka, Halca, and the VAs for bringing this manga to life!And of course, thank you Aka Akasaka for creating such a marvelous series!

So I'm here to write a deserving 5 star review and also make a long story short for anyone who's thinking about giving this one a shot. My roommates in college all hated anime. I slowly greased them up by showing them Kill la Kill and Parasyte but they all either lost interest or stopped wanting to sit down on the couch with me while I conducted my routine "anime hour". I was berated for weeks for hogging the couch, called a weeb, among other insults I wouldn't sully this review with. All of that changed the moment I forced them down on a new anime I was trying to watch called Kaguya Sama Love is War. Me and my roommate CJ, who NEVER liked anime to begin with, got insanely addicted to this show after the first episode. We bonded heavily over the episodes that were to follow... and boy were they just incredible. The narrator, who just randomly narrates over the funniest and most extravagantly thought out scenes I've ever seen in an anime of this style, was definitely his favorite part about the show while I was obsessed with the art style and amazing voice acting. With Kaguya Sama, I actually managed to convert someone into an anime watcher. He would come down the stairs every time a new episode came out and would beg me to open Crunchyroll so we could see that sweet 1080p. There are laughs, cringe, and especially lots of memorable moments in this show. If you want to get someone into anime, I would start with Love is War.

I usually watch shonen or any anime with a lot of action in it, so this show isn't what I normally watch, that doesn't stop it from being spectacular though. I find myself dying of laughter at least once per episode. Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideFrom Kaguya learning what "first time" really means. To Ishigami wanting to die every second he is onscreen. The jokes in this show come out of nowhere and hit you hard. And this show likes to mess with your expectations with the gags. Sometimes it goes exactly how you expected it too, while other times it is completely unexpected. I have never laughed so hard at any anime before (well except maybe Mob Psycho 100/One punch man) But it's not just the comedy that makes this show what it is. It's the characters as well. Kaguya and Shigone are written in such a way that their secret love for one another feels real and genuine, like they are made for one another (even if it's going to take 1,000,000 episodes just for them to hold hands lol). Additionally characters seem to have no more than a one off gag are implied to have a deeper history.  Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideIn the latest episode we see a younger less depressed Ishigami so even he has a reason for becoming the way he is and the way he talks to Kaguya about staying away from him further makes it seem that way All in all this is a great show you should watch even if it doesn't appeal to you genre wise.

I became a huge fan of the series since the manga began and the anime does it justice. The OP sounds like it's straight out of an 80's bond film and it's one of the first I haven't skipped through to get to the anime. The anime itself is very good with great animation and the voices given to the characters sound exactly how I would imagine them to. It's definitely going on my list for best Rom-coms of 2019 and possibly all-time.

My quest for a good romantic anime has led me to Kaguya-Sama Love Is War. It wasn’t anything what I was expecting but everything I didn’t know I wanted. Kaguya-Sama Love is War is a romantic comedy, will they won’t they story but with a psychological element to it that sets it apart from others in the genre. The story centers around the relationship of Kaguya Shinomiya and Miyuki Shirogane. They’re apart of the student council of the most prestigious high school in Japan. They’re the most popular students in the school and both are geniuses. It seemed like it was only a matter of time before they got together but as time passed neither wanted to make the first move. This introduces the psychological element to the series, getting the other to admit they have feelings for the other. Instead of the standard romance anime theme of building up the courage to confess their love, this show states there is a winner and a loser of love. The one who confesses their love is the loser of the relationship, the one with no power. With that mindset they turn everyday social situations into a battle of wits every episode in order to get the other to confess.The one thing that bothers me is how short series is. With only 12 episodes we don’t get enough character development. Sure, we’ll get to know Chika Fugiwara a little and Yu Ishigama gets an episode around him but its just enough to build around the finale. Yu and Miyuki would act like really great friends but we didn’t get to see just the two of them together often. It feels like advertisement for the manga which is currently ongoing. This is just me nitpicking so don’t let it defer you. The animation is great, the voice acting is the best I’ve experienced in an anime, characters are all great, soundtrack is great and overall it’s just hilarious.I do plan on getting the manga to see how the story progresses.

- Character development --> 4 Stars- Writing                           --> 5 stars- Animation                      --> 5 starsThis slice of life anime hooked me from the very first episode, introducing the character complex love dynamic between the two main characters. During the end of the anime, we see that the two main characters are different from when we first met them. This is the type of slice of -life anime that get you addicted to every character and their story.

I feel somewhat torn on Kaguya-sama. For the first half of the season, I was ready to call this one of my favorite shows of the year so far. Now, I'd just call it... "good". The premise, one with two strategic powerhouses finding themselves in love with one another and going to extreme lengths to make the other confess first, is a strong one. I loved watching plans get made, only to be countered by deeper layers of planning heretofore unseen, then more often than not getting foiled at the last minute by a pink-haired space cadet. Tension, humor, and a few little bittersweet moments when sometimes, things just worked out for some characters to be happy together.Then... the second half of the season happens. Dramatic swerve into paint-by-numbers romance tropes. Frantically pedaling a bike searching for someone late at night? Check. Delirious admissions while having a Japanese style "stood in the rain fever"? Check. Uncaring parents dashing hopes of happiness? Check. Romantic fireworks scene? Check. No schemes. No cunning. No wit. Just grabbing heart strings and yanking as hard as they can to see if they can get a reaction. Then quid pro quo, reset to starting positions, try to throw in a couple of gags like everything is back to normal, roll credits. Nevermind trying to sell itself as a serious romantic drama there for a second. Just critically misunderstand one line of dialogue and pretend that's enough to throw all of that emotional development out the window.I'd still love a second season, mind. I just hope it continues with the brilliant pace of the first half.

I was just looking through animes to watch and then I remembered about people saying that this is anime is awesome and worth the attention. At first I was quite skeptical about watching this anime because I'm not really a fan of romcom although I do end up watching it sometimes lol, but this anime just seemed so much fun. In the start I wasn't too sure about it but the more I continued watching it the more fun it got and I just loved all the characters and their different and unique personalities. If you haven't watched it yet or stopped watching it, JUST GO WATCH IT lol. trust me you will enjoy the shit out of this one XD

It is really amazing, i loved it! i laughed a lot, and the last episodes made me cry, the voice actors were amazing, i simply loved this series! hope it gets second season! <3the work A-1 Pictures made here is astonishing, this is a high quality show that deserves to be watched just for how well the animation is done, if you add the great characters and their development to the formula you get this, one of the gems of this season!

At the time of writing this I see one person gave this three stars and I say to that person SHAME!!  How dare they write a poor review.  This show was awesome.  It's very light hearted and short and to the point.  Very fun to watch, makes you yell at them, yell with them, laugh and cry through out each episode.  So very well done, I appreciate the writer and the creator of the anime.  Please give this one a shot, you will enjoy it!

I was expecting a time waster and it ended up becoming my favourite anime. So much so that I'm actually reading the manga, which is something I rarely do. The characters are well written and show a lot of development, the "battles" (segments of each episode) are well written and the vast majority have made me laugh or given me the feels, yet it doesn't get overdone or worn out and it doesn't feel like they're dragging it on at all. The main characters are especially believable and are genuinely smart in comparison to a lot of protagonists in animes with similar plots. All in all, I'd be down to rewatch it 3 times in a row if I wasn't worried I'd wear it out for myself.

have you ever wondered what it was like to play a game of 72 dimensional chess with basically your naruto shadow clone but in female form? pretty hot? darn tootin it is. i cant believe how good this show was the setting was literally like two places but i sat down in my pathetic dorm room and watched every episode with my baked self laughing at everything they said, lemme tell you a thing about wieners, i mean i cant spoilers and all that, and maybe a sexual assault case if this site has some underaged viewers, honestly from these reviews i cant believe im not banned yet, but at least ive actually seen this show, i wouldve prefered if it took a more steven universe vibe and had all of them fat though. not for any plot or anything but because i fell insecure when i get on an elevator with other people and take up all the room and if this show wanted to truely relate to us all then kagayua would at least by hangin at least another 170. imma be real that whole chika dance wouldve been pretty hard to pull off with some thick drumsticks for arms so youd hit a comedy factor there too. 5/5 because im a trend follower and the show was cool too. im tony and im high

Pure Enjoyment Value: 5/5Anamtion Style: 4.5/5 Character Developement: 4/5 Jokes: 5/5 Overall Experience: 5/5 For being a title that was just recommended to me and suddenly appeared on Crunchyroll, I expected a cliche hodge-podge that was going to be boring.But after watching the entire 12 episodes and getting to enjoy the characters, It was an overall great experience.Throughout the show it had it's ups and downs when it came story development or cliches being used, but it was still great.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideSo the ending was ok. It was kinda boring and really misleading one what was gonna happen. Even though it is a rom-com, and I expected them to leave on a cliffhanger where they don't kiss at all, I was still hoping this show wasn't going to that cliche. Oh well. Hoping for a Season 2 where they confess or at least become more open to one another. Definitely needs one. Probably going to read the manga in the meantime and see what goes on afterward. Hopefully, that one doesn't end as badly.

There's something interesting about the way Shinomiya and Shirogane start off the show with dramatic tension over what we would see as trivial middle-school love. But it isn't just that - it escalates into an absolute bombshell of storytelling, wit, and wholesomeness. I have never been more invested in such hilarity until this anime.The dynamic relationship between Shinomiya and Shirogane stems from what initially seems like pride. But as each episode progresses, we see them coming closer together. With Ishigami and Fujiwara being great sidekicks and great additional support cast members, the 4 characters create such a fluent and great dynamic with one another with their personalities.But the kicker of them all is just the pure adrenaline of each intensifying moment in the beginning of the show as it skewers through the thinking processes between our hero and heroine - and the drastic measure they go through in order to achieve love. This becomes toned down later on and doesn't overstay its welcome (WHICH IS GOOD BY THE WAY). I'm always excited to see what kind of crazy each episode will bring.But that's not all the goodies you get from this. You also get the wholesome bits and the backstory bits. Although the story really centers around the love power disparity between Shinomiya and Shirogane; it also shows that progress you're dying to see. Every wholesome conclusion makes you know that the two were meant to be together. It really makes it feel like progress has been made (LOOKING AT YOU ERO MANGA SENSEI.)So all in all. Yeah. Two Tsunderes in a room, what are you gonna do about it?

I can't see this show losing any ratings from now on, so after three years of watching anime on an almost daily basis, I have decided to write my first review. (As of this writing there are 6 episodes available on Crunchyroll.) So far this show has been an extremely fresh take on the romance comedy genre. The animation is top-notch, and the inclusion of VHS filters and other visually appealing shading techniques have made this show extremely enjoyable to watch. The scenes are the right length for letting off and picking up mid-episode, and the jokes seem to last for the perfect amount of time. The many anime tropes you may see often get turned on their heads multiple times. This show has a great contrast of the two main characters acting like their lives depend on their actions, but the show knows exactly how seriously to take itself. I don't find myself laughing at many jokes in other comedy anime, but this one has jokes that caught me off-guard many, many times. The show introduces Kaguya Shinomiya with a very over the top montage of her achievements, which caused me to dislike what I knew about her character from the beginning. At first I also had a similar feeling towards Miyuki Shirogane, the student council president. After watching the first few segments, I began to associate with Shirogane and found myself wanting things to work in his favor. Further into the show I realized that Shinomiya wasn't the stuck-up wealth abusing character I thought she would be. I have reached episode 6 and I'm not rooting for one side or the other, I just enjoy seeing how the interactions play out.

I love this anime personally. It is a comedic and dramatic way to show a misunderstanding between two people in love. Misunderstandings can sometimes be annoying in some terms but this show softens that annoyance by showing the perspective of both of the characters. In the relatable area, this can also appear in real life or by the average person, saying that that person might like someone but can't tell if they like them back. Also, trying to make them make the first move or thinking to go in first.

Two elite students, at an elite school, prideful, scheming, and calculated, the president and vice president of the student council. They've got status, fame, and respect, but what they haven't got is the guts to tell each other that they're in love! All's fair in love and war right? And to confess your love first is to LOSE that war. Which one of them will come out on top in this slice of life comedy masterpiece?

Looking to be my favorite anime of the season. Dry humor, Cute characters, Stylish animation that isn't too distracting and best of all a coherent plot and strong personalities.The story beats remind me of baka test but this time instead of an ensemble, we have 2 main protagonists with a limited supporting cast. The episodes essentially breakdown into what amount as contests of wit which inevitably leads to hilarity and wacky situations thanks to the wrench that is the supporting cast and their well defined idiosyncratic relationship to the two mains.

I absolutely adored this series about them trying to not confess their love for each other. Even though there were some cliche moments and predictable scenes, it was one to remember for sure. However, the ending wasn't satisfying enough for me. But I mean everyone is different I suppose. I hope there will be another season or something!  Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideI just wanted them to actually have a satisfying ending to them confessing to eachother like a kiss scene or something .

If you're someone like me who is typically far more action and adventure prone when it comes to your anime, you may be hesitant to watch this. But you have to believe me when I say that this anime is absolutely hilarious and so full of cute fluff that it will make you squeal for an hour after every cute moment that this show has.The two main characters, Kaguya Shinomiya and Miyuki Shirogane, are hopelessly in love with each other, but their pride would never permit them to be the first to admit it. So their school year turns into one of competing to get the other to admit their love first. Its a game of intellect, each trying to gain the upper hand by slyly avoiding their opponent's attacks and returning the blow, using all their knowledge to turn the conversation into something that would force the other into admitting defeat by confessing their love. The supporting cast is excellent, with the main supporter, Chica Fujiwara, being your stereotypical air-head who doesn't know what is going on except. She ends up playing a key role in the MCs' plans, either breaking it apart or taking it over the top to victory. The other member of the supporting cast, Yu Ishigami, tends to have the opposite effect, rarely being included in the plans yet still managing to play some part. For me, this psychological fight for dominance makes it extremely intriguing, with lovable characters and a solid romance-centered story pushing it onward, the comedy making it excel even further. Then if you consider everything else, such as the masterpiece of an OP and some amazing camerawork and facial expressions, this anime soars to the top as one of the best ROMCOMs that you will be able to watch.

Going into this anime, I expect it to be a classic romcom with a fun twist and while it doesn't stray far from the usual tropes, it does do a great job at refining those tropes to near perfection. Story 3/5: The plot is fairly standard: the student council president is the smartest guy in school, getting top marks since forever. The vice president is a beautiful girl, also incredibly successful and her family is super rich. They like each other but can't say it. Its like they took a handful of classic romcom tropes and put them into a blender. While the general plot itself does not surprise much, how the anime refines those tropes and provides an interesting narrative and does push it above average.Characters 4/5: The characters and their interactions are what make this anime good. While the characters don't really break out of their tropes, they are all refined to such an extent that you really get a feel for each characters inner dialogue and mental state. Additionally, there is some real character development as the main protagonists push each other towards confession. Art/Animation 4/5: Characters are beautifully animated, their movements are precise and give life into the character. One notable scene is one of the ending songs where Fujiwara Chika is singing and dancing. The animators beautifully captured each frame  and her dance is very smooth.Sound 4/5: Songs in this anime have a huge dynamic range where it can at one moment sound like an epic battle of wits while in the next cutting in with a cute romantic tune. The opening song is particularly catchy and the soundtrack songs have a slight funk theme to them which ties nicely to the opening.Enjoyment 5/5: This anime is hilarious. The internal dialogue, the narration, and the individual character traits and interactions work perfectly together. It's cute, it's funny, it has its heartfelt moments and its tragic sadness. It's a very easy watch that can at times grab your attention with its humor and wit.Overall 4/5: Kaguya-Sama: Love is War is very nicely refined anime that is an incredibly enjoyable and entertaining watch. It is fairly standard as far as romcom's but the refined character tropes and humor push it to be above average and one that I would highly recommend watching.

I was very bored one day and i decided to give this anime a shot - this is usually not my genre of anime but i am so happy that i did. This show instantly took off. It was absolutely hilarious from start to finish. The plot is very unique, not to mention the layout of the episodes along with the narration. If you want to chill and cry from laughing while being able to relate to the MCs; do yourself a favor and watch this anime. Go on, give it a shot. Youll love it. This anime is in my top 3 all time favorite anime series now. 5 STARS all the way.

Love is War is really funny show with modern jokes that most rom-coms don't seem to have! I really reccommend that you check out the manga if you can too, it has even more hilarious references and scenes. I sure hope they make another season about the later part of the manga.TL;DR: Love is war is a great show that subverts expectations, and the manga is really worth checking out! Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideIshigami's ark is what I hope to see in the future of this show.

While ToRaDoRa! is always going to stand out as the gold standard for Romantic Comedy shows for me, Kaguya-Sama is a romantic comedy that really delivers on the comedy.The Plot: This show has a fun premise that it spells out to you in the first couple of minutes. Everything after that is completely dedicated to revelling in the ridiculousness of the scenario that it has set up. The jokes that it drops are actually pretty funny, which makes the few moments that it pulls at your heartstrings that much more impressive. The schemes and plans that our main characters go through are all ridiculously over-thought, and all the more hilarious for it.The Characters: The characters are all flawed in extreme and hilarious ways in service of the humour and jokes, but none of their broken personality traits are grating or annoying. It would be easy for this show to slip up and make you hate how a character acted for a goof, but instead their flaws just seem all the more charming.Final Thoughts: While it's likely never going to be the first show I suggest to someone who asks me what a good romantic comedy anime is, if someone asked me for a comedy about romance, Kaguya-Sama would probably be the one.

It may seem like a typical comedy with recycled characters.  But after watching one episode I was convinced that there is meat in this one.  The characters are not really at war of each other, and they are actually adorable.  And there is a punchline at the end of each short story.  It is so fun to watch I binge watched several episodes in one shot.  The romantic elements become more apparent in later episodes.  This is one rom-com show that should not be missed.

Honestly, one of the best anime I've ever seen. The things that make this show really enjoyable for me was the character's interactions with each other and the very concept of this show which makes it pretty interesting. I've seen shows that show how two characters fall in love, but this is the first time I've seen one focus on making one force the other to confess their love because the writers made it easy to see that they both like each other.

Kaguya-Sama: Love is War is nothing completely out of the ordinary, however the approach the show goes to in showing both sides fighting for the same thing in the same way is rather unique. This insight allows for some really great and well executed jokes, plus the supporting cast is fantastic in helping to proliferate these moments of comedic gold. Not to mention the chain of events that do occur help to endear both characters so when things seem to almost get to a big payoff you the viewer are also invested in their efforts just as much as they are. From a technical standpoint this show is fantastic on the animation and the gags, the only downside to this show is it's only twelve episodes long.

It happens once in a while when there is an unexpected hit in the season.When i started Kaguya-Sama: Love Is War it was already at 3rd episode,and the first episode was enough to get me attached to the show.You will simply love this show for its comedy and silly romance, there is no Drama at all so if you are looking for some light anime with great romantic storyline and comedy please consider this one.You will also fall in love with the characters Especially Chika.10/10

A long time ago, I lost my interest in anime. I stumbled across a clip from this anime at that time and laughed. I found it here and started watching it. I finished watching it in 2 days, and I gotta say this is my #1 favorite anime. I have started watching anime again. THIS IS A MASTERPIECE. There needs to be a second season.  Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThat ending will make me look for a season two every day

This has to be the best anime I've ever seen, and I haven't even read the manga yet. Every single episode is so entertaining that it seems almost impossible to move your sight away from the screen. The animations, the voice acting, the narrative, and the characters... everything blends together to be one of the best romantic comedies there is. There are not enough stars to give to this great show, and there are no words to properly convey how much I enjoyed it. Absolutely recommendable to any anime fan, since it's a light series enjoyable by everyone, especially for those of you who are mostly into light comedy and slice of life genres.

Just wanted to give the show 5 stars because I want people to watch it. Don't have anything to add, CR just made me put something here. Okay and now apparently I need to submit a  longer review, because of course I would. So hopefully this is enough. And now I just noticed that little blurb at the bottom that would have shown me how many more characters I needed to add and I feel like a full retard. Thanks CR

If you are looking for a romantic comedy this is one of the best.The romance is simple and sweet, sprinkled throughout the series and a prevalent aspect of character development. There is more humor and comedy than romance but what little there is, is heartwarming and gooey.Comedy is slapsticky and fueled by wonderfully quirky characters. The style and presentation of romance and it's 'war' aspects adds the the humorous appeal of the show.

I'm going to hit a few points about the show and state how I feel about how the show did in said regards.Music - The soundtrack is one of the best I've heard. The best for the romance genre that I can think of off of the top of my head. I'd probably only hold a few shows in totality higher in regard for music, but even then I have to drive the point home that the music is amazing. I still can't get enough of the opening "Love Dramatic feat. Rikka Ihara by Masayuki Suzuki"Plot - Or should I say substance? While the plot itself isn't anything complex or intricate, it definitely feels original. Each episode is two to three mini stories that involve the Student Council members and build up the relationship between the characters. While they are mini-stories they don't fall into the same trap other shows with a similar structure do, which is fail to connect the stories. Each and every episode has meaning. Callbacks are made quite frequently to events that happened earlier in the show and character development is made quite clear in the show. I'd say the only problem I have with character development is it feels over-exaggerated. Although with how the show carries itself, it doesn't seem out of place, it may even be a positive thing when taking into account its story structure.Character Design - Definitely the weakest part of the show. I will put my own bias here however and state that since the show is following the manga very well I don't doubt that the show will also dive into the character's backstories deeper than the show has currently. So I do have to say this is a negative, but honestly the trope problem doesn't really feel like a problem just due to how the show carries itself.My Thoughts - Obviously the most important part because some random dude on the internet is definitely a "flawless critic" eh? I didn't really touch on many points because there aren't many points to hit on in this show. It's just a really good show. A very lighthearted rom-com with no NTR, love triangles, ect. (Honestly the zero live triangles is probably enough reason to rate an anime highly these days). There's more I'd like to talk about the show. Like how the "Love is War" trope starts to fall apart late in the anime and will continue to do so following the manga. It becomes less about convincing the other to act on their emotions and more about the fact that they personally cannot act on their emotions so there is a lot more hope about confession rather than tactics. I think it's actually a nice development because it shows the irrationality that is love. Although I'm going to just end my review here and give it a rating.I wish you could give half stars because while I really loved this show, I don't think it's a full 5/5. I'd definitely say a solid 4.5/5, and I'd really think the only thing stopping it from being a perfect show in my books is it does become tropy and slightly repetitive although not nearly enough to turn someone away from the show in my opinion.

I realy and truly, loved and adored this show.just has so many amazing qualities and elements to it! The best part of the this show was how the characters change and evolve throughout the few 12 episodes there are in it. The animation is top notch and so is the music in fact, some of my favorite songs to listen to.Highly recommend watching this anime! Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hidePlease put the manga on Crunchyroll. The characters are a lot more charming and at episode 12 than episode 1.

Not only is the source material for Kaguya-sama fantastic in its own right, this adaptation knocks it out of the park! The voice actors, animators, directors, and everyone else involved in the production has done an amazing job in bringing this series to life. The show itself is a hysterical romp through the daily "battles" between two of the most lovable genius-level idiots in an anime. Even if you aren't a fan of romantic comedies, you will be doing yourself a disservice by passing this show up. And do yourself a favor and also read the manga, you won't regret it!

To start off, this anime was truly one of my favorite anime's of all time due to every aspect it held in every episode. It was, without a doubt, one of the best anime's I've viewed in my 2+ years of watching all sorts of shows. Crunchyroll, thank you for spreading the gift of anime to different countries for many viewers, such as me, to enjoy. This show has everything I'd ever want with an amazing opening, closing, characters, development, and more. I can't wait to read the manga of this series as I truly do look forward to doing so. Hopefully Kaguya-sama gets a 2nd season but time will tell. Thanks for reading this but for anyone reading the reviews before watching the show, watch it, it is more than worth while and the ending will have you wanting more.

The me in the not so distant past might not have given this show the time of day. Rom-coms? For this stone hearted man? Please... But the memes on the internet kept popping up and it's popularity kept rising so I thought to myself, " Okay, maybe I'll check it out a little bit to see what the fuss is". I am now addicted to rom-com animes.Everything about this anime was just... perfect. The characters were funny and loveable and the voice actors did an amazing job. The pacing of the show was fantastic with its short stories following up to a 2 or 3 episode long arc. The humor had me giggling like I was a school girl. And the animation was flawless.The last episode of this season left me wanting more and I pray that it gets a second season. If you are looking for a new rom-com to watch or if you're looking to get into the genre, this is a must watch.

My heart is light and fluffy and full of sweet memories now. I don't know how the show writer's managed to do it, but every single episode felt like 3 in one, so much happened in one afternoon. I laughed so much, it was too hilarious! They were so wholesome but so freaking ridiculous about their feelings! This is one of those shows that anyone can thoroughly enjoy regardless of your usual aesthetic! Shirogane Miyuki is best girl!

I was originally introduced to this show because of seeing a snippet of  Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideIshigami getting wrecked by Chika with a DIY fan.  It gave me a good chuckle, and wanting to take a break from stuff like MHA and JoJo, I decided to give this show a try.This show is a masterpiece. The first episode gave a strong foundation, introducing the our leads, and made me chuckle a couple of times. Growing up with Death Note, I love the mind game aspects from both Kaguya and Miyuki, even though I know they're both being incredibly stupid. It's absolutely hilarious seeing them come up with these crazy ideas, almost succeed, until either Chika or Ishigami come in and everything starts crumbling down in the most hysterical way possibleI also love that when it's not funny, it can get real, and I like that. Not saying other romcoms don't do that, but there's something that feels actually real about this.I'd say that this is probably at least top 3 of one of my favorite animes of all time.

You know an anime is incredible when after an episode concludes, you’re heart is aflutter and you’re thinking about so many trailing ‘what-ifs’. Kaguya-sama: Love is War, beautifully captures the obsessive idealization and awkwardness that seems to define every adolescent introverts first romantic excursions. With rich character interactions that are seldom wasteful, frequent comedic excursions down a winding rabbit hole of opportunistic conjecture, the plot is all wrapped up in the familiar school setting that serves as a backdrop for Shriogane and Kaguya’s greater theatrical romantic escapades. Far too often supporting characters exist exclusively to further the plot. By this I mean, if you cannot imagine a character on there own outside of the overarching story, then they have had weak character development. Fujiwara and Ishigami, the two main heroes of this story (for having to put up with the always at-odds love birds), are superbly fleshed out, and it’s easy to grin as one enters into a scene, because we know that their unique qualities will set an already turbulent mood aflame. Fujiwara is so strong a character we actually saw an entire, random scene dedicated to her in a ramen shop, and the entire subplot was both natural and welcome. The fact that any of us found a ‘filler’ scene enjoyable was thanks in due part to Fujiwara’s incredible backstory. Kaguya and Shriogane are both such frustratingly adorable characters. Their plight is so reminiscent of most folks romantic experiences back in high school. Due to their extreme stubbornness and really poor self-esteem (as supported by Shriogane’s reoccurring thought of  ‘so cute’, which reached a crescendo in the season’s finale), they are both engaged in a strategic game of mental chess to force the other into submission to get the other to proclaim their love. Seriously though, Kaguya literally planned to corner Shirogane on a rainy day when the trains are shut down in order to get him to offer her his umbrella, and when the train schedule resumed, so Shirogane wouldn’t know, she swapped out his phone battery with a dead one she kept stored in the club room. A little creepy AF, but in a loving way, you know? Kaguya for waifu 2019?These characters definitely imparted onto me the true pleasure they felt. I found myself smiling at my TV (undoubtedly giving it mixed signals), at the end of most episodes. It was clear to me that the happiness I felt at those moments was the same as the character’s whom I watched, serving to deepen my adoration and support for their cause, and bringing me back week after to week to continue on the journey with them.

Kaguya-sama: Love is War is a battle of the brains, where the first one to confess loses!It is by far one of the best romantic comedy anime I have seen to date, with a ridiculously smart way of using the will they won't they trope. Instead of having two characters that are obviously madly in love with each other, forcing the audience to wait or sometimes never get a romantic resolution. Love is War creates a much more absurd but ultimately devilishly impressive solution. The lovebirds simply have unreasonable levels of pride and an intense inferiority complex. Most romcom dilemmas that create stagnation revolve around the "do they like me or do they not like me" question, however our two leads Kaguya Shinomiya and Miyuki Shirogane are instead SO convinced the other is in love with them and is about to confess. This in turn creates the doubts in the first place about whether the other likes them, a byproduct of the mind games, psychological warfare and impatient attempts to have the other confess sooner, or at the very least give in a little. A fascinating execution for romcom dilemmas if I say so myself, especially since that same pride and inferiority complex I mentioned is likely to be what brought them together in the first place.All that on it's own is pretty solid for a romcom premise, but Love is War doesn't stop there, cause I haven't even mentioned a pink haired little joker in our deck of cards yet. The side characters of this anime have just as strong as a performance as our two leads, Ai Hayasaka, Yuu Ishigami, and even the presence of a fantastic narrator put on a great supporting performance. Ah yes, and then there's the joker of this deck, Chika Fujiwara, at first a she is seemingly nothing more than a ditsy girl who gets in the way of Kaguya and Miyuki, causing their plans to crumble spectacularly with maximum hilarity. In truth however she is a well-adjusted and competent enough girl to read the situations surrounding Kaguya and Miyuki, assisting them and driving them forward towards more reasonable approaches to solving their shortcomings. She still is unpredictable and a great comedy relief character, with on point reactions and comedic timing that made pretty much 100% of the jokes land.Kaguya-sama Love is War is hands down my favorite anime to come out of 2019 so far. There's not a single thing this romcom doesn't do right, from it's comedy, characters, production value, script, voice acting, scene composition, YOU NAME IT! A damn near flawlessly executed romcom that should force all other future romcoms to take notes, and my first contender for best anime of 2019!

You have two people, both like the other, both believe the other person is supposed to make the first move both take this idea, like everything they do, way too seriously. Throw in quirky supporting characters, an over the top setting and one of the best narrators ever in an anime, and you get this show. Very little about this romantic comedy is standard fair for the genre in terms of style and substance and that's what makes it stand out.Throw in an absolutely awesome opening theme and you have a solid 5 star anime. It's not gonna be everyone's cup of tea, but for those with a taste for this sort of thing, they are going to be very satisfied! Pros:Atypical storytelling.Stellar opening theme.Fun characters.Cons:It's still a romantic comedy.Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThe story doesn't end and another season is not confirmed.

This is quite possibly the best romcom I've ever scene, up there alongside Monthly Girls' Nozaki-kun in the category of "So freaking good I don't think I could really rank them."Everything about the show, from the intro/outro to the music to the voices, is all superbly done.  I'm a pretty critical person, it's rare when I legitimately can't find a failing or disappointing aspect about something.  At the moment, the only disappointment I have in the show is that it was only twelve episodes.It was consistently quality and never failed to get a laugh out of me for its entire run.  My weekends will be duller for it's absence.

This anime doesn't pull punches. It has love able characters, hilarious jokes, tension, and top of the line animation. I honestly can't think of a better Rom-Com than this. My previous favorite Rom-Com used to be Zero no Tsukaima or Clannad, but I can't put those shows on the same pedestal as Kaguya-Sama: Love is War. It's like comparing an Applebee's steak to Gordan Ramsey or Bobby Flay. It's a must watch for anyone.

I watched the first episode when it was released because I thought it sounded original and interesting. I was blown away by the quality in just the first couple of episodes. Fantastic and funny writing, characters, voice actors and amazing animation and each episode just gets better and better. I binged the manga after the first couple of episodes and the source material is fantastic as well (and still ongoing so let's hope for at least 1 more season) but you can tell the creators of the anime really but their hearts into this one.Hilarious, beautiful, and enticing I whole heatedly recommend this show. 10/10

Literally nothing new, but thats ok, its something to watch.Over powered protagonist - checkRandom cute girls - checkMostly female cast - checkBland protagonist - checktransported to a different world - checkThe list keeps going, but i think you get the point, the show so far isn't inherently bad, its just nothing new. Sure theres better anime, but theres also worse, the humor is funny, not busting any stitches, but i cracked a smile. The action is copy paste action, but this is not the first show to do that, and probably not the last. The story will most likely end up where the rest of them do, nothing really happens for most of the show, then a "problem" occurs toward the end, and the protagonist saves the day some how. I will update the review if anything unexpected happens.

The other reviews have pretty much captured the essence of this show.It's pretty generic, the animation is lazier than I hoped it would be, and the story was never that great.I've been following the WN of this for over a year now, and this is pretty much what I thought we would be getting when I heard about an anime release. I don't know about the author's original intent, but this is the sort of show you need to go into treating it as more of a slice-of-life comedy without any deep story beyond that.Having said that, this show is the definition of a guilty pleasure for me, and I'll definitely be watching through the whole season regardless of how good (or not) it will be. I won't excuse any of its flaws, but I'll indulge out of an irrational affection anyway. And really, that's all you need to keep in mind when deciding whether or not to watch this anime.

I was excited about this because I wanted to see how the adaptation fared against the LN. I'm actually kind of disappointed, the animation quality doesn't seem to be where I had hoped and as of EP 2 they cut out some details I was hoping to actually see. (EX: Yae's fight with her fathers former student.)Also, they down play a lot or out-right remove when Touya actually uses his phone for things, which makes it seems like it has become instantly useless from the start after he learns magic.All in all, it's ok, but they seems to be going out of their way to make it as generic as possible.

What did I just watch?What just happened?It was like watching a fairy tale where nothing goes wrong for the protagonist. I watched this and... I have no idea what I should rate it. I love seeing overpowered people, even if it's done badly, but what the heck is this. It was over before I knew it and it felt as if the progress the protagonist made with all the new spells was for nothing. Geez.

I consider myself a verbose man, yet even I do not have the linguistic skill necessary to properly ward people off this absolute tragedy of an anime. Plenty of people defending this show are talking about those who dislike it being 'anime snobs'. Hopefully, this review debunks that, if only slightly.MC is godly powerful. That's fine, I like godly MCs when they get executed correctly. With someone so powerful that winning every combat is a given the only place left to go is character development and world building. Right? Wrong. The anime builds its world decently through the vessel of characters you couldn't care about if you were their parent.Other people have hit this, but I'm letting you know it's true. MC is a nice guy who is always nice and everything always goes nicely nice. It's tragic how little depth these characters have considering the art direction of this anime was actually decent. Wanna have a good time with this anime? Get your buddies together and take a shot every time the MC is polite. You'll be dead by episode three, which if you're watching this will feel like a mercy. I'd be willing to play Russian roulette if the terms were to pull the trigger every time the MC showed personality. I'd have a zero percent chance of death!I could keep going, but this anime isn't worth the time. If you want a blandly nice MC who gets all the girls because he's polite and strong then be my guest. Be aware there are zero stakes in this show, nothing matters, and you never feel like the characters are in danger. You never feel like the characters are suffering. The characters never grow. Static characters in a boring bout of isekai wish fulfillment. GetMeOut

I really want to like this show, it makes a decent attempt at comedy, characters at least at first seem likable enough and ultimately I feel a vast majority of it falls flat. The stories narrative elements never truly drove me. Each character felt like a trope more than an actual person, there personalities and dialogues falling very closely to lines already drawn many times before by successor shows. Unfortunately this didn't improve much as the show went on. The cute narrative gimmicky element was a nice add on at times, and provided a bit of thought as to how a smartphone would work in a world where their were no cell phone towers but magic, however this was largely hand waved with the power of god. Previous anime have also showed us how fun it can be to follow around an overpowered protagonist, for example, One punch man, The Devil is a Part timer, MOB psycho, Overlord and Death March, just to name a couple. However, this show doesn't deliver on that same sense of satisfaction once a battle is one, or comedic elements of what it means to be the best.This show feels like it tried to bite off more than it could chew, throwing together too many elements and characters in addition to the plot gimmicks that forced each individual element to feel a little shallow, preventing this story from truly shining.

If you ever played a video game, and used cheat codes to give yourself godmode, unlimited money, and every other possible buff the game allows, that's this anime.This isn't a slice of life anime, which you might expect to not have any real conflict. It's an adventure story with no real adventure - because nothing can actually go wrong.It's like a child's story that stars himself, which you would naturally expect would feature him as the center of the world, with unreasonable powers and abilities, loved by all.If you watch this, you'll quickly find that while there's no real reason not to watch it, there's no real reason to keep going either. You won't be left wondering what will happen the next episode, because you already know - the protagonist will solve any problem with little to no effort. As each episode passes you will find yourself wondering when the main plot will start, until you realize there's not going to be a struggle to overcome. It's just more of this. If you just want an anime where you can fawn over waifu's without having any angst about what will happen next, this may be the anime for you.

This anime is not 5 outta 5 stars type of anime, but it's good enough to pass the time and to possibly make ya wanna read the light novel (I know I ended up reading it). In any case, I think it's overall pretty good but it doesn't make you think or ponder stuff like Overlord, Re:Zero or Konosuba and so on.So, grab some drinks, food and prepare yourself for a little more than average show to pass the season. :)P.S.: Don't listen (unless you want to) to the anime snobs cuz they hate that everything that isn't pure diamond or gorey.

Summary:Boy accidentally gets killed because God is clumsy. He feels bad for boy so he sends him to a fantasy world with all the fighting skill and knowledge on all the magic he could ever ask for. Boy stumbles into two girls in distress. Boy saves girls and thus he starts his harem adventures.Review: If you're going into this series expecting a grand story to unfold, then you'd be better off watching something that won't waste your time because in this series there is nothing to look forward to. There is no goal, no motivations, no conflict. Each episode is just this guy living out his own fantasy and having all the girls he meets fall in love with him, because why not. The characters are your typical archetypes, and trust me when I say they made the females in this series dumber than a bag of rocks and it's the male lead that shines because he can never do no wrong. The animation is very generic, but the art is vibrant and pleasant to look at, yet I wouldn't say it's anything special. The music is forgetable, despite the tracks do carry a tone throughout the series. The voice acting ain't bad just average all round. So overall I didn't find this series to be fun to watch as there is nothing that kept me invested. So if I were you I'd avoid watching this show and instead go watch Konosuba or go watch Re: Zero which have similar premise, and they're entertaining to watch.

This is the most poorly written hunk of junk I have ever watched. All the characters essentially have no personality, including the main character. There is no sense of drama or anxiety, no challenge what so ever. the entire plot can be summed up as 1) problem exists 2) MC can solve it instantly and with ease 3) stuff and 4) MC solves it instantly and with ease, and everybody loves him.In short, this show is a complete pandering sellout piece of trash. And that is being kind.

Summary: Essentially, the beginning is what would happen in every light novel that starts the story with challenges, obstacles, and emotion were to be on their last episode. The character gets everything they could ever want, in the first episode. If you want a character who doesn't develop, and will remain the same guy as he was in episode one, you've found the 12 episode series for you. Complaints: If you're going to have a character be so deadpan, and unrealistically react to situations, then I'm glad you continued that style with the harem he's in. Our MC has the same reaction to his harem that any other unrealistically virgin male would have, he completely ignores them and doesn't want anything psychical with them. He sometimes has perverted thoughts, but when you're a god with every power in the universe and perfect mind and body(and then some) You'll know that it really is better to keep your thoughts to yourself, and that you don't deserve the love of those around you. His relationships essentially turn into minor perversions in his head, with nothing but a range of pandering girl archetypes.
