The MC is overpowered, but not in a funny way, the show takes the problems very seriously. You can tell it's serious with the lack of prevailing conflict. A character who was less serious would get cocky, and leave the problem to fester. This MC prefers to end all problems right away, before they have a chance to grow uncontro- Oh my bad, nothing unfixable. Our MC is both the plot-armor and plot-sword. If there's a problem, it only happens to other people. If those other people know of our MC, they won't have a problem after he waives his hand. Like a real magician, he made that problem disappear. Oh, was that a joke, this show doesn't have those. It's a 24/7 serious fluff show. Everything that happens doesn't have any effect on our MC, even a new girl joining his harem isn't an event. As I've stated before, none of the relationships ever move. Some of them have time limits, but those don't matter, because the time-skips are negligible, and rarely skip to an interesting moment. Last but not least, combat. The combat scenes are often every person doing a move to finish off the enemies. Everyone contributes some aspect of their abilities to the end result, which is them winning every time. Usually a battle starts with something that seems pretty serious, or a mission they have to complete, or perhaps a godlike figure. In the end, if his team of chicks can't win, MC will pull out his plot armor and plot sword, and end the battle. Afterwards, the MC is showered in praise, money, and influence. You're probably wondering, what does all of this have to do with a smart phone? Very little. He doesn't spend very much time on it, and the times he does are the ex-machina for specific situations, or to have a short chat with God.I had these same complaints when I read the light novel, after a friend recommended it to me. There's more to the light novel, but the results are the same.

The MC is not interesting of a character, and all the side characters act like they're in Japan even though they're in a different world (i.e "no stealing, no misusing your powers!!!").  The MC's smartphone is not relied upon much (which is fine), but his granted powers pretty much make him a god in the new world, but he doesn't do anything about it because he is boring.  Literately, that's the reason, he is boring.      The magic system is cool but why did they have to explain everything about magic when the MC can do whatever he wants because he technically can do anything!     Honestly, this series could have been much better.  I feel like this show would be great if it explored how someone with a smartphone could change a less developed world, akin to Log Horizon.  But nope, just a useless MC with god power gimmicks and stereotypical girl side characters going on generic adventures. Sigh

The worse kind of power fantasy by Japanese otakus. Even with the garbage premise in the title the writers had to make it so that he is physically unbeatable and magically super powerful. The main character is disinterested in his story. He shows zero emotion and when God talks to him he just sounds like "Oh that's right, all average bland guys like me deserve to be cool and get a harem of magical girls."The female characters are stereotypical and look like they werecopy pasted from other animes, The twins even look like the twins from Clannad. There is nothing to look forward to and the comedy just falls through and disappearsjust as quickly as how I got bored by the time time the intro started.This anime is where creative ideas go to die. God would watch this and realize that anime was a mistake.

The premise was good at the start.  Stuck in another world with a smartphone which still has internet access.  Can a normal human with the internet succeed in a fantasy setting with the knowledge of mankind at his fingertips!Then they go and make him into a Mary Sue.  Good at all magic (Magicians in the setting are normally only good at one, two at the most), physically powerful, photographic memory, able to learn all magic at a glance, large manapool, etc, etc, etc.Oh, and then add a harem with cardboard cutout personalities, boring combat sequences, etc, etc.

cliff notes: it sucks, don't watch it. long review:After fully completing the season all. If you are looking for a wish fulfillment or a show that's a great learning example for how not to tell a story, this is the show for you. Or if you are versed in the mystic arts of "turning off your brain" then i guess it really doesn't matter what youre watching, so this is for you too by default. But for everyone else, i cant (even a little) recommend watching this show over all the other great "sekai" shows out there. Anime like konosuba and re:zero really explore some interesting themes and perspectives (though on complete opposed ends of the spectrum). Where as with this show there is nothing of interest explored throughout the entire 12 episodes of this show. Every single encounter (with maybe one exception to the last fight) is completely weightless and devoid of any real significance or meaning. If their intent was "here is why abusing cheat codes is bad" then sure, i guess the narrative delivered because its outright cringe worthy otherwise. As for characters, they don't develop them much. In the end, i honestly only cared a little about one of them and don't really have much to say about anyone else. Especially the protagonist. I don't think its possible to make a more unrelatable character. Heck i've related more to a literal square (as in the shape) character than i did this dude. Now that i think back on it, I don't think dude was human after he went to the other world. I don't even think he was a robot/android either because at least programs have some sort of bugs (i.e. flaws). Here they present protagonist_1 as this perfect individual who can do basically anything because, literally, deus ex machina.As for cinematography and music... it was ok most of the time but there were moments when the obnoxiously long fan service scenes and intrusive sound track's completely destroyed the immersion (and mind you, i really enjoyed keijo and girls bravo. let that sink in). In the end, it does some things right but does a lot of things wrong. And by wrong i mean things that effect suspension of disbelief. Things that get us to care about characters. ANYTHING to anchor us into the world. as an example... spoilers btw (i do rant a bit lol. that's your warning)Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideHe shows up into the world. Oh darn i don't have any money. Conveniently someone shows up, likes his suit and wants to buy it. Dont worry about cloths, he is a tailor and can make you some. So, he traded the shirt off of his back for another, free, shirt, a free ride into town, and a scrooge mcduck style bag of gold.What happens after that? maybe it would be difficult to find his way around town? Nope. dont worry he has google maps for that. wouldn't want him to have any kind of hardships after being ripped from his world and thrown into a completely unfamiliar and strange land. That might boarder on the lines of being interesting. Later on he meets up with two chicks doing some sort of a drug deal for this crystal they found in what i can only imagine is the raspiest looking alleyway the city had to offer. And of course he ended up saving the day and adds two new waifu to his party. They learn shortly afterwords that he cant read. Having him not able to read would be problematic so naturally this gets resolved in about 2 minutes. honestly, at this point i think gate did a much better job of covering that aspect of it where you could see an honest effort and struggle... but i digress...anyways, i hope this helps give an idea of what kind of disappointment waits for you ahead in this show because it most certainly doesn't get any better. side note: what i was mentioning before about the one fight scene that has some weight to it. its the one where this dude lost. i mean, he still got his +2 waifu's added to the harem but at least we got to see him in some form of a vulnerable state. anyways, i hope this long rant helped you come to a resolution one way or the other. And to that i say have an excellent rest of your day.

edit: after 11 eps of watching. it's not as bad as i made it out to be. i just really prefer the read material for this type of series i guess. it got better around episode 3-5 or somewhere. hell it's a series that can't be explained why you like it. no stakes in ANYTHING AT ALL. which is nice if you just want to chill and read... or watch in this case.Read up to vol. 3 of the light novel. normally hate stuff where the main character is crazy op. but this one i like for some reason. I just look at him as a red mage from Final Fantasy 11. (permanent regen of mana, can use up to a certain spells and sword skills of everything. cannot use advanced spells or sword play). but the light novels had a charm where there was zero tension on if the character will survive in the world and how much pain he'll go through to get anywhere in that world. the LNs just followed his life in this new world. for an isekai series it's just fun. so avoid this series if you hate the following... if you don't like over powered characters, don't touch this anime. once he has use of his smart phone with magic don't expect him to be hurt easily. also don't watch this if you hate harem anime.edit:  I watched the first two episodes and it feels... to fast paced and the world building is not there. which to me, was a huge point of the light novel. events are done out of order (not really a problem for most people.) also, the animation is not very good... I recommend the light novel instead of the anime. also if you didn't know the author writes the entire series on his smartphone. which i believe is the reason he made it about a smartphone.

3 eps in and this show still doesn't seem to have any direction.     Gimmick is MC has a smartphone in an another world, and is OP, and his friends are OP. OK. That's ok Slime made it work so it could work here, right?     No. MC is a push over with no apparent wants of his own. At least non that I know of. Or I have forgotten about it already because nothing interesting happens. Main group just appears to wander around without any bigger ambitions.     My main gripe is that he has a fricking smartphone in an issekai and all he does is mundane things. OP powers are really unnecessary when he comes to effectively medieval world with this level of technology. He could make hand over fist mad dosh by copying maps from his phone. He could be crazy siege engineer. But this devolves into basic bitch boring issekai and it really feels like I'm wasting time watching this.

I read some of the reviews, and I'm seeing titles like "It's not really that bad", which has 5 stars.If you need to preface it that it's not bad, then it's also not good. I'm trying to get through the 1st season, and it's tough. By episode 8, I don't know why the girls are there, except for service. He doesn't struggle for anything, and everything comes easy. If he can use every magic possible, then why have other magic users: he should be able to learn every spell, and adventure on his own.The jokes are meh. The adventure is meh. He's overpowered, His personality is so stunning that everyone loves him.Anyone who is his adversary evaporates after one scene, maybe two.At least the service isn't over the top.

This show is just things happening. Everything happens just because with rhyme or reason. Ex. Protaganist can use all magic. Why? Because God said so. Protaganist meets someone to give him gold because plot demanded he have money. Protagist meets cute girls because plot demaded waifus. See where I'm going with this? It's not offensive or anything, just not something to watch if you want a good story. It's... Like an anime of all filler. Nothing really has any consequences and that's fine. Just don't expect it to be as interesting as something like Overlord, Konosuba, or Rising of the Shield Hero. It's just lazy junk food anime and that's ok every once and a while. Still doesn't make it good.

This show is a very bland isekai with very little to no plot at all. It's more of a show to pass time as the main character is op and there is no plot or character development. The harem style of the anime is also very predictable from the beginning. I would recommend this show to people who need anime to watch if they have nothing else or just want another isekai. Do not watch this show expecting something big. It won't happen.

This anime doesn't pretend to be anything than it actually is. It has an overpowered MC that can resolve any problem pretty much immediately, it has a harem aspect with some fan service, and it has a happy-go-lucky feel to it. Lots of reviews on here are pretty negative but if you're coming to this anime for a brief fun vibe, then you're in the right place. If you're here for a full blown out plot line with twists and turns and suspense...you should probably look else where. I'd give it 4 stars usually, only giving it 5 to try and average out it's overall reviews with the super negative ones

This is a cool & quirky anime. Glad it exist, glad I watched it. Premises is simple enough, dude dies, gods like "My bad son, I'll fix this" he does... & our character has one heck of a time. But its got a cliche kinda harem going on.. where our main character sees the ladies in, what's the word? "A delicate state?".. & then they hurt him, a lot.My main review was the one liner above. But the site wouldn't let me post unless I added unnecessary gibberish.

This is a tough show to review.  I had very low expectations going into the show, having watched it a season late.  It's not a top-notch show by any means, even within its own specific sub-genre.  But for some reason, I did enjoy watching it.  If you're going to watch this show, it's best to go in with the clear understanding that this is about the most blatant, ridiculous, over-the-top adolescent male power fantasy you'll ever see.  MC doesn't just enter the world with his smartphone.  In fact, he's more or less turned invincible by God as an "oh, by the way" moment, and time after time, he simply relies on these enhanced abilities rather than his smartphone.  You wonder if the author realized after the premise was established that only having a working smartphone would be a pretty lame "superpower" in a fantasy world, and said "screw it, I'll just make him invincible."  Oh, and all the girls fall in love with him, naturally enough.  Yeah, that type of show.I suppose if you can get past this, and just enjoy the show for the lighthearted romp through a generic fantasy land (and it doesn't really try to even take itself seriously), then you'll probably have fun watching.  Think of it more like Dog Days, where you don't really want to see anyone (important) getting killed, or even seriously hurt.3/5 stars because while it's not great, it's not terrible, and actually kept me entertained.

This work definitely brags about its 2 very cliché themes in animes - teleporting into other worlds, OP protagonists and lots of girls. It does not have much in it to squeeze out, even compared to the already light LN. I edited this and changed the review, since it is definitely a relaxing work, especially after finishing relatively heavier titles such as Black Lagoon, or the heartbreaking ending of WorldEnd with the sweet, sweet Scarborough Fair that forced me into tears even after having read the LN. Not good if you are expecting another great title like Zero, or being a hardcore or even snobby viewer all the time, but definitely a light and relaxing work to watch for chilling, that does not require much attention from the viewer.

It's a cliche harem anime, it is very entertaining and fulfills many of the cliches of a harem anime or even just fantasy anime in general. The story itself is not very deep or original, but it is very entertaining to watch if you just want to take your mind off of things. I enjoyed it just based on the general happy tone of the anime and positive upbeat attitudes of the main characters. It's definitely fun to watch (minus some of the more socially taboo scenes), but if you are looking for an anime that is deep you won't find it here.

This is one of the dumbest, most unoriginal anime I've ever seen - it takes a recently overused premise of "being transported to another world" and pretty much uses it to replicate every predictable cliche of fantasy harem shows. It also adds a ridiculously overpowered, literally invulnerable protagonist that overcomes every challenge without breaking a sweat, eliminating any possibility of tension or uncertainty from the story. With flat characters (maybe with slight exceptions of Yumina [best girl <3] and Leen), simplistic plot and lack of any real stakes, it might challenge the slowest slice-of-life high school shows in pointlessness. What saves it a bit (but not that much) is the fact that it's completely aware of its trashiness and embraces it to the fullest. It also does it in a more timid, approachable fashion than for example HighschoolDxD (only the last three episodes of the first season go hard on the "ecchi" factor). If you don't try to take it seriously at any point, you can find some decent humour and relaxing, mindless fun in it, especially in the opening episodes. Also, it somehow manages to lead harem scenario to it's logical conclusion, with proper confession scenes and protagonist being forced to realize his situation and react in some tangible ways - that was actually quite unusual and amusing.In Another World With My Smartphone is a dirty pleasure at best, but on a cloudy afternoon, when you just want to turn your brain off and have a laugh at the sheer ridiculousness of it, it might just be the right thing.

I binged the entire season. It wasn't the most 'epic' of series with plot twists, dark areas, or asking in the matter of philosophical concepts. Instead, it's a harem where connection meets the best of two worlds: the harem comes together, and the comedy is common-sense. -1 Star for not keeping certain aspects of the harem interesting. Everyone knows they can brainstorm better on it.You have humor, predictability, common-sense, practicality, a harem THAT ACTUALLY HAS A FUTURE, and the capability to take the story literally wherever the animators want to go. So don't mess up; I'm waiting to see the second season. Keep it twisting and interesting. Don't press too hard on the 'God mode" but don't ultimately take it away. Keep it sensible and reasonable, and everything will come together. Do not slack on character development (this is the most important--and hopefully I noticed it started to build). Good luck and give the show a run! It's good and funny!

Okay, so I originally avoided this show because I'm not into harem shows aimed at boys since a lot of them have ecchi.But after seeing Gigguk's video featuring this, I just had to see for myself how bad it is, so I watched the first episode and said..."... Shoot. I actually like this."So now I'm an avid follower of this show and am probably(Definitely) going to buy the series if it ever hits iTunes for digital download.Heck, I'm even writing a fan fiction about this show by inserting a 5 year old OC that I created just for this purpose. Of course, it's more for my own enjoyment than something I would actually post to the internet or show anyone. (Just so you know, I love inserting OCs into shows I really like, just so I can create different situations for the characters to be in)I'm even re-watching this series as I'm waiting for episode 9, and I am still enjoying it for some odd reason.This show is not that good. But to me it's a great one to just watch and feel happy. It's not terrible, it's not revolutionary, and it's not unpredictable.It's just... Fun to watch for some reason.However, if there is one thing I have to highlight about this series, it's the fact that I can't tell what direction its going in at times.Sure, it's not unpredictable, but there is a sense of vague surprise at some of the solutions, as well as situations, that the characters work through. For a happy go lucky show, there is a bit of thinking going on that I didn't expect. Episodes 3 and 4 are a good example of this.The main character(Touya) may be a bit bland, but at the same time he's got a slight personality to him. It may be because I don't watch a lot of harem anime, but I find his character pleasing.Yes, this show has flaws, but for some strange reason, I don't mind them enough to see them completely. It's either that or I haven't seen enough shows to actually be able to point them out.Well, that's all I have to say......Well, except one thing...For some reason... I feel like the show is foreshadowing something that doesn't fit the atmosphere of the show at the moment. Sure, everyone is happy now, but something feels off, and the first hint is in the show's description. It says the Touya "inherits the legacy of an ancient civilization." However... Well... Keep this in mind when you're watching episodes 3 and 8. Sure, it says that Touya has "carefree travels," but I can't help but wonder if that's going to be true for the whole series.If I'm wrong about this hunch, feel free to laugh at me for overthinking things.Anyway! Thank you for reading this! Have a wonderful day!

In Another World With My Smartphone? That could be fun. Conquering a harsh world with only information as his weapon... Oh, he's also super strong.He can use quirky Null element magic? That could be fun. Using creativity and overcoming power with guile... Oh, he's also a genius in all six other elements.He's a foreigner who can't read? That could be fun. He could use a translation app on his PHONE, you know, the one in the title... Oh, he learned to read off-camera in the first episode.This show is baffling. The MC is the stewiest Gary Stu that ever existed and the plot is blander than plain oatmeal, but every once in a while you think it could do something interesting, only to miss so bad it must be intentional. Are they trolling us?The title is misleading. There are none of the fish-out-of-water elements you expect from an Isekai ("another world", which has become a full genre), and the smartphone is the least interesting of his myriad superpowers. It's Isekai used as an excuse for undeserved strength and female interest in the most boring character imaginable, a guy who literally didn't care that he had died.

To ALL THE HATERS HERE'S WHY YOU ARE WRONG!Have you ever beaten a game and realized you can start again but with all your gear, spells and knowledge This will make it for a super easy to play game that you can breeze through right? Well... this is exactly that, the main character can do everything, has all the powers all the gear and the ability to gain all the knowledge, there is no challenge is to difficult and no anime girl to unreachable.overall is really entreating to watch an anime where everything goes RIGHT!

It might not be as deep/dark/edgy as some other shows, but it's by no means bad. If anything this is a welcome breath of fresh air to enjoy every week. Silly and fun and all around very enjoyable. It's true many things come off too easy, playing to the very Mary Sue nature of the show. But in this case it doesn't really bother me at all. The only true complaint I have so far is that I feel they could do a lot more with the smartphone itself, there's so many ways to use it in this world that they barely even tap into. All in all the show has it's flaws, but I enjoy it tremendously never the less because it's not trying to be too serious like so many others.

It's boring.  I can't relate to the main character.  the decision to keep the iPhone was stupid and no where NEAR what any real human being would have asked for (like maybe money or magic powers) but of course he gets those anyway.  The animation is crap and the fight choreography is cheap.  I honestly can't think of a good point for the show because not even the idea is a good one considering how over done it is.  How did this get made?When you write yourself into a story, it can be very hard to determine how you actually react to the various scenarios that appear in said story.  What usually happens is you create a surreal, "objective" type of character who responds to every situation w/o flinching or slipping up.In spite of the fact that (in real life) you DON'T make friends with a group of the most attractive, talented, fun people around, your MC manages to do so instantly.  Despite the fact that (in real life) you only have a few talents, your MC gets every magical power, including, no, ESPECIALLY the super extra-special-AWESOME power that NO ONE has.  I feel like that's what this story was.

This show man. It didn't have to be this bad. Sure the premise is overdone and uninspired but I was looking forward to at least something mildly entertaining... distracting even. But this is too painful. I haven't actually heard anyone talk about what they like in this show so I'll be specific. The character designs are terrible, the animation is flip book quality, the character personalities are vapid, the script is bland and uninspired, and the direction bland and thoughtless. The comedy is also non-existent. Maybe the God conversation at the beginning would have made me laugh more if I hadn't already seen it done better a year ago. Even A Centaur's Life has some production value. I felt like I had to watch at least the first episode all the way through for this review but nothing would have changed if I stopped 8 minutes in. I was constantly checking the timeline to see how close the episode was to ending. Of the 15+ new shows I've checked out this season, this was probably the hardest to watch.I've read now a couple of the reviews crying "ripoff" and yeah, those reviews are pretty  and poorly written. Besides that's the LEAST of this shows actual problems. Also, it's not like the "this show is uninspired/ripping off other shows" argument is unfounded or unhelpful. Basically, it tells you "why  your time with this show when there are days worth of much better content that does the same exact thing in other shows". It also explains the reviewer's reasons for disliking it. Was it my fault that I watched KonoSuba and therefore already got a better version of the same joke? Speaking of which want a good isekai comedy/parody? Watch Konosuba, both seasons, then watch them again, because watching the same good show a second time would still be more productive than watching this... "thing" once. Knight's & Magic of this year isn't a comedy nor is it great but it's world and characters ain't half bad. Watch that! Or Restaurant in another World (could be written better but it looks and feels nice).I have a real hard time believe as many casual anime viewers are enjoying this as much as they are. It doesn't even have that cute of girls, like Eromanga, to elevate it above its dumb characters. I don't mean to rain on their parade but I'm just saying I've seen enough anime to understand that given the standard level of quality that anime as a whole has to offer this is on the low level of quality side. The show's director has a talent for making bad scene transitions, lifeless character performances, uninspired editing, bad scene composition... the complaints truly do go beyond cries of "ripoff". And just because it's a silly pleasant show DO NOT THINK that excuses the show of being bad or underwhelming in these areas. When I watch my dumb distracting anime shows I still expect a base level of direction out of it.I guess it also doesn't do anything particularly offensive (aside from the animation and character design) but the fact that it does nothing new or original in an ocean of nothing and unoriginal anime is reason enough for me. Not saying reinvent the wheel with the genre, just don't s*** the bed with it.

Dude, so I only watched a couple episodes of both this and Konosuba. Although it is a little different, and the main character in Konosuba is of course the goddess, Konosuba (at first) and I guess Megumin? I looked it up because I don't fully know, all I know was she was introduced later on in the story.. Anyway, the main character in this is the dude with a phone. Either way, they both take place where a character dies and meets a god and reincarnates into a new self. I don't fully know which episode he thinks of them in slime, but its quite similar to KonoSuba, because I recall them having like the same episode. If you start to like this and have never watched KonoSuba, I recommend Konosuba first.. I feel as if KonoSuba just does a better job with animation and bits of their story.

This had the premise of being something cool but it turned super generic.He ends up in another world with only his smartphone and his clothes.  Has literally godlevel magic power and can ignore the normal limitations for null magic that applies to everyone.  God tells him polygamy is accepted in this world and he still doesn't understand all these women around him.  I use women lightly because one was like 12 and the others are probably around his age of 16.  Once he finds a way to interject himself into a woman's life they just cling to him.  Plans and ambitions were practically none existent after encountering him.  At one point he gets a big place, because it's a harem anime and you need somewhere to live with all your women, and he makes the decision for them to live with him.  The line was something along the lines of, "This place is good for the 5 of us."  They don't even question it or think for themselves.  First reaction was basically, "Do you really mean it? Yay!"  Once it got to that point I gave up.  Especially since they were trying to establish him starting his harem with the 12 year old as the main wife.

Spoiler free!Review or TLDR at the end: The show is another generic taken to another world fantasy but it isn't bad. There is no real plot so it relies on it's polygamy accepting culture which allows MC to start a Harem and actually get somewhere with them! Not just be a teaser. Animation is what you would expect, shoddy lower end but it isn't bad, just really is not the focus. MC has his smartphone which he uses to take advantage of our modern science and understanding to do anything he wants. He is your average MC who is a total child with hormones and girls that are not sketchy but your FBI agent might shake his head. The pacing is wacky, plot points work but are just to keep the show going forward, yes it has a beach episode to be filler content, etc. Summary/ TLDR: Generic yet again, plot is laughable, harem, polygamy is A-Okay and the MC actually might get somewhere unlike other shows. And in some ways he does! Animation is eh. MC overpowered. Some humor is actually pretty good though. You got spare time to blow go ahead, just don't be too excited.

...and then you reach the last two episodes and realize that they pretty much just stuffed a full season's worth of fanservice into two episodes. *sigh*It started with some bland, easy to enjoy tropes which was okay due to the lack of overpowering sexuality. The protagonist is nice, clever, and interesting things happened. Then the last two episodes have the progression stop so that his harem can just force themselves on him while nothing of any meaning happens. It's super frustrating to see it end like that.

It's that but bad. The main character is a Mary Sue and I really don't like using that term. The Smartphone is more for a catchy title to the anime more than anything else. No one wants the title of their anime to be "That Time I Got Reincarnated Overpowered and I Brought my Smartphone." Slime gets away for comedic reason and because he has more personality than a brick. Buildings in Detroit get more development than this typical harem protagonist.EDITS:Also to people calling other Snobs because they think this isn't good, who's the real snob here? I'm not the one berating others for not liking something.I decided to go through another episode since I thought I was being a bit unfair and increased from 1 to 2 stars. The phone does manage to stay relevant. I think my biggest problem is that this main character is too much of a messiah. He can basically save anyone. He's powerful, can heal fatal wounds, blindness, teleport, trace assassins, probably cure cancer. Perhaps it's less so that he's overpowered but that he can do any and everything. Interesting characters' have flaws, it makes them more human. Saitama is constantly bored , possibly depressed, and very stupid. Ainz ironically has little human compassion and approaches life like a series of experiments. Speaking on Ainz he also has a full cabinet of pretty intelligent servants. Mob is physically weak, doesn't know how to make friends, and too kind for his own good(also a flaw to Vash from Trigun). This guy is lecherous at worst. Too perfect, too perfect.

It's a lighthearted show with no stakes, no drama, just literally a dude with god as his buddy walking over the world picking up a harem. It's inoffensive, and clearly doesn't want much thought put into it, however, it is entertaining, and that's what really matters. I think if people were to judge this from purely a formalist point of view, of course, it's a bad show. However, that doesn't mean it's unenjoyable, and for the most part, it's incredibly enjoyable if you're into this OP main isekai harem subgenre that's popped up.

I'm only giving this three stars even though my personal opinion is higher. Isekai in general are a guilty pleasure of mine.My favorite analogy for these type of shows is it's like cake. Cake is sweet and fun, but is not particularly nutritious and it's richness is artificially filling. It would be bad for you to eat excessive amounts of cake. If you eat too much cake you'll probably lose your taste for it. But despite all that, dang it all, sometimes you just want some cake.I do have one criticism. For a society that is supposedly pretty pro polygamy, why is the MC and his harem literally the only (potentially) polygamist relationship shown? Major plot hole there. Answer me that and stay fashionable.

while writing this review i'm on my 6th run of the anime and i still enjoy it very much it's simple in some areas but it's done so nicely i really hope for more seasons.  Over powered protagonist - checkRandom cute girls - checkMostly female cast - checktransported to a different world - checkThe list keeps going, but i think you get the point, the show so far isn't inherently bad, its just nothing new. Sure theres better anime, but theres also worse, the humor is amazing for what it is there is always a point i'll laugh at.

The protagonist is the classic harem lead: heart of a saint, power of a god, intuition of a gnat and unable to allow himself to fall for any one girl. I love the story idea of using a smartphone in another world but I really wish they had actually invested into it rather than use it as a new idea for yet another harem anime with extra focus on "harem." Whenever there is fighting the overpowered hero shuts it down in an instant but if there is typical, say, "romantic mischief" then emphasis on that with a dose of "[Hero], you pervert!" and "I-I-I-It's not what you think!" and the unspoken "It IS what I think no matter what you or the truth says!"So if you can't get enough harem animes and their clichés, dive right in. If you want a show with a little more story than just clichés, keep looking.

There is not a lot of originality to it and while that's fine there also really isn't anything in particular to this anime that makes it shine over other "Other World" animes. With other animes in the genre like slime, konosuba, overlord etc. All of them have something unique that stands out, something you can go to your buds and say "watch this anime for this reason". So if you need something to binge as long as it's an anime, this would satisfy you but if you are looking for something to make you want to watch this anime i don't believe you are going to find it.

Overall, not terrible, but it does feel like this show was pieced together to make a quick buck in some sense. Yet, I still mostly enjoyed it for what it was.The animation isn't that great, but it isn't the worse I have ever seen in a show. The music is the same way pretty much just meh. Although, I will say that the opening song is rather catchy, The characters in this show feel as generic as tofu in some ways, but they are cute, so it does make it that much more enjoyable.The thing that is the weirdest about this show is that it feels like it was designed to be specifically enjoyed in western homes like in USA, Canada, Europe, and Australia (you know what I mean). I normally never think about this when it comes to pretty much every other anime I have watched in the past. Now, I don’t know if this is true. There are certain aspects to the show though that make it feel like a studio in Japan just wanted to do a quick cash grab to western audiences as they knew they know that we would eat it up. Does this mean it’s the worst show ever? No, it isn’t. Sure, it is lacking a major story, and some of the stuff is as generic as I do in my own home, but it keeps you interested in it as there are some interesting aspects to the show. There are only 12 episodes and trust me that is enough for this show. I doubt they will ever do a second season as I wouldn’t think there would be enough people interested in it to begin with. If you do decide to give it a watch, don’t feel bad if you don’t like it because this show definitely isn’t for everyone. Overall, could be worse, but also, could be better.

Absolutely loved this series. can see why a lot of people dislike it because everything goes very conviniently for the MC, but this is an almost perfect embodiment of what I like in books and in anime. Instead of the second hand embarassment I felt from watching Subaru mess up in RE:Zero, which by the way I loved too, it genuinely felt good when things went right for the MC. The story is not very deep but the show is really easy to sit down and watch.

I'm not sure exactly what is wrong with me, but I really enjoyed this show. It's your typical isekai with an absurdly powerful MC and a harem. There's barely any conflict, the world is a bit underdeveloped, there's no deep messages or meaning to be found, but it's just so damn lovable I can't help but want to watch it again and again. Perhaps it's just that the Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideHarem Ending is so rare and brings me such joy, and I'll admit I'm a bit of a simple man when it comes to liking the things I like. The entire show was comfy fun from start to finish, and I desperately need to see another 60 episodes immediately, though I do hope that if the show continues we will see the world itself fleshed out a lot better. That being said, it seems pretty likely that the MC is Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hidedead dead and the entire story is his Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hide Heaven, which gives the whole thing a darker vibe that also makes more sense cognitively. Either way, I adored this show, especially as a palate-cleanser after watching something heavier (Goblin Slayer before this myself). Furthermore, while I'd love more episodes, the ending of what we have so far satisfied me almost completely, which is an incredibly rare feat for any anime, especially a 12-episode one.

This show is a mess. But it is a mess in all the right ways! It is a total self-insert fantasy. If you can set aside any desire to take this show seriously, you'll have a lot of fun. Just ignore the absurdity and enjoy it for what it is. Someone's fantasy life. The MC is basically a god, he has his harem, every super power imaginable, the real god on speed dial and cute girls everywhere. Thankfully his harem isn't a bunch of mindless drones and all fairly distinct, if one dimensional, characters who can hold their own in their own rights. And an OP main character is always better than a useless one, especially in a harem. If you are bored, there are certainly worse ways to waste some time.Pros:Crazy over the top godly MCLots of cute girlsFun to watch Cons:The story is full of plot holesEverything is way to silly to every take seriously

It's a nice change to the anime's that try to hard to be taken seriously it has a pretty ok story (though to get all of it you need to read the novels) that needs a few more episodes for you to get why the protagonist is as powerful as he is. (there is a good reason but it's not touched on in the anime.)it's pretty light hearted with a sense of humor that seems to not take anything seriously even itself. it's a nice anime to watch if you just want something less serious to watch after a serious or grim dark anime and it's the lighter side to some other in another world anime. And like i said it in no way takes it self serious and i think it works for this anime in particular. it was fun to sit and laugh at at the very least.

Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hideThis anime has no feeling like other anime, I mean it is not that bad anime. I only recommend this anime if you have nothing to watch, if you feel so bored in the holidays and have nothing to watch.What I think watching this anime,Spoiler Alert! Click to show or hide I think this is funny for the first part, but after this anime gets so stupid. for example a normal person would get freaked out if they got thrown to another world with no idea what kind of world it is.I found the title so funny that is why I stared to watch this anime, and if you don't have anything to spend time with, would recommend you watching this anime.

This anime's pretty much pure garbage. The title says "In Another World with my Smartphone," but really, the smart phone hardly plays a role outside of a convenient plot device.It's basically wish fulfillment to its core -- Nothing's a challenge, everything falls into the MC's lap, and he's able to solve any problem. Case in point: He comes across a coat that comes with some huge resistances, but the downside is that it doubles the damage taken by magic types the wearer can't use. The solution? Oh wait, he uses ALL types LOL. And that's not even the worst example.People will say "Oh, the MC's OP, this is like One Punch Man!" No, don't compare this to One Punch Man. Saitama's got more personality than this MC, and some could argue that One Punch Man is partially about the world and the other heroes as well (who are each far more interesting than the bland series of walking tropes this anime calls a "harem")."Oh, but this anime's like Konosuba!" Please, get out of here with that. Konosuba's got a FAR better premise, MUCH more interesting characters, superior animation... I don't get how people even make the comparison. It's like taking a McDonald's hamburger and comparing it to a fillet mignon from Ruth Chris on basis that they're both "beef."This anime/"story" was essentially a bunch of people sitting around and taking the most generic parts of isekai/harem storylines, putting them together, then making it extremely convenient so that everything gets solved at a moment's notice. It's lazy to the point of being disgusting.

This is one of the worse isekai anime I have suffered through.  Up (or is it down) there with death march to the parallel world rhapsody or Master of Ragnarock.  Lack of effort from the story, I mean .. it appears to be a work written by a committee, who was pulling ideas out of a hat.. harem with characters drawn to look ten, check,  special powers contained in a smartphone (cause the internet knows all).Nothing special about the characters.. just tropes.  Lead character with no personality. Only reason it doesn’t deserve a 1, is that it is pretty unoffensive compared to what it could have been.

The premise seemed silly, the main is quickly shown to be op op, there is an amount of "fan-service".It's enjoyable though, don't know why but after I started the first episode I felt an urge to get to know what happened next. I hope there's a next season.Animation: 8/10 - Sometimes things look a bit flat, the frame-rate feels a bit low sometimes (mostly during action sequences). The style is pleasant. Story: 8/10 - It's a decent story so far, pleasant if not a bit weird at times.Sound: 9/10 - Some voices don't quite fit their characters, other than that, it's decent.

Okay so I watched this show as the episodes were coming last year, and to be completely honest, I loved this show for what it is. At the time, this show seemed really decent and I knew that it may be too stereotypical or not much plot involved, but it kind of gave me a slice of life vibe. It's a type of show that would be great to pick up if you want something that's light and not too emotion heavy or impactful, just for the enjoyment/laughter!! Also Kohaku (the white tiger/cat) is so adorable and the voice for her is too cute!

I have watched this anime and have read the web novels since it first came out.  I think it is amazing and has a bit of everything that a reader could like. The anime is only the tip of the iceberg to so many great plots and arcs that you could easily create another 3 seasons for this show.  I truly hope this isn't just another good anime that got its 12 episodes and and then moved on. Please try to continue it if possible.

Now its no 5 star anime but it isn't terrible, if you're a person who hold characters as the defining moment i think you'll like this anime. It should be labled a Slice of Life because thats all it is, if you go into this expecting some fantastic story then ignore that, it simply Mary Sue gets a Harem The Anime. The main character is a nice guy and the girls like him for that, hes incredibly OP basically if you put god into a 15 year old's body, thats what he is in this world. So basically dont watch this if you care about a:StoryAmazing PlotPacingClever WritingBecause it doesnt existWatch this if you:Like characters more than anythingLike EcchiLike HaremLike Magic Fantasy WorldsDont care about storyLove slice of life

This first 10 minutes of the episode pretty much perfectly explains the premise of the show. Main character is brought to another world blessed with enhanced abilities due to divine intervention/mistakes. The twist in this one is it's one of the first animes to have the main character keep his smartphone as well. Magicially enchanted as well of course.Overall... it's easy to see why a majority of people love it or at least enjoyed it. Clean animation, a decent flow in dialogue and decent if not some strong moments of Voice Acting with some okay action or at least some nice payoff moments. The characters are likable though they are the standard fair of the harem genre. Very much by the book and general hits more then misses. Decent VA work even if the writing itself is a bit bland at parts.Why the series sits at a bit average or why some people didn't enjoy it probably lies in the writing, noticeable moments of poor animation and the lost in direction after episodes 4 or 5. The series does start of pretty strong in building the world and fleshing out its characters. It also ends on some pretty strong notes too. Probably the thing that hurts the series is the middle part. Unfortunately the character development stalls out for a good chunk of the series as the focus seems to be more on the group's growth in size rather then as people and a weird mix of slice of life but story elements to something grander. After shaping out our main protag as the OP character that he is, it just stops for him. The show even stops with harem premise for a while and it really does feel like the main character just happens to run into girls a lot rather then there being some level of attachment between the characters outside of "oh, the main character is really nice". The girls do get a bit more development during the middle episodes but for the most part, the character development just gets lost as does the story as it just goes through the motion even though it's not sure where its trying to go. Animation also starts to stagnant a bit. It remains very clean throughout but can be pretty stiff and uninteresting at times. In some of the action moments is where this is most noticeable. Rushed sequences, stiff animations, poor flow, and just some uninteresting camera work and angles. The last couple of episodes is where the series seems to find itself again. The harem and girls' character develop get fleshed out more and the main character starts having signs of a personality. But it feels a bit abrupt and forced since there was such a void in the character development until the last 3 or so episodes. At times it feels like the series was shying away from falling into its genre's troupe but then after discovering it didn't know where to go from there, went back into its roots and found itself at the end. The series sits at point where you feel the studio and team learned a lot and you're kind of excited if they can do better with a season 2 but at the same time, you aren't surprised it still hasn't gotten a 2nd season yet if it will at all.

bad show is bad. bad development, shitty waifus, incoherent story, no conflict, op blank canvas protagonist. another bland isekai sandwich on white bread with mayo. Honestly i dont know why i continue to watch isekais anymore. I mean i dont even like anime. I have watched so much bullshit that i am jaded to all of it. yes i watched through all of it, yes i was most likely drunk, yes this show is bad. not funny not entertaining. id rather watch soa again. season 2.

Like danmachi, I saw it and slept on it. Looking through shows to watch I decided to give this anime a shot. While at times some cringe moments, very much enjoyed the series and will be looking forward to another season hopefully. Animation was good, some good laughs aswell with a main character who is honestly abit generic but still a worthwhile watch if you're bored and have nothing else to watch.

I really enjoyed this even if it's pretty basic. Guy jumps into new world, bumps into a girl in trouble (in this case he started with 2), helps them out, ends up saving a kingdom, repeat. Originally I had planned not to watch it but I had hopes it was a prequel to another anime. After the first episode I realized my mistake. This is more suited for teenage girls and wishful thinking boys. The art style was very good and the ecchi stuff that seemed to be more demanding towards the end of the season was a good laugh but obvious fan service.

The overall plot isn't that good with most of the focus of the anime being on the relationships the main character builds. While the plot isn't that strong the theme of the anime is pretty standard for a over powered main character anime while still being unique in it's own right. The overall rating of this show wouldn't be higher than a 4 star because the plot is just lacking too much, there is a sense of what's going to happen in the future but it just seems like a sidebar thing.

This is a fairly entertaining harem anime. Overall, it does what it tries to accomplish. It is one of the better harems I have seen. It isn't really an action filled anime, but rather, a lighthearted anime with magic and other adventure elements that will entertain you for a while. My only gripe is that Touya is way too overpowered. In my opinion, Konosuba is a bit better at this concept, but this is a good harem anime overall.

Seriously, it gets worse as time goes on. In the beginning, you don't expect to get the whole thing. But around episode 5, I realised that there was no real conflict. Everything was so easy, and to quote the main character himself, "Wow. That's convenient."Also, there are at least 3 plot lines that are never cleaned up. It makes me think there was originally going to be more episodes, but the executives had to cut some out.

Main character is blatantly, boringly overpowered.  The harem and fan service is a bit overdone.  There isn't much of a plot.  The part about God is wildly insulting.  The smartphone part is almost tacked on instead of being an important part of the series.And yet, I watched all of first season, so I didn't hate it completely.  But on the other hand, I only watched it because I had nothing else to watch.
